hash.name: CAB Abstracts

meta.more-info:
Many topics in the sciences basic to these activities are also covered, including the physiology, biochemistry, ecology, genetics, and biosystematics of the plants, animals, and microorganisms that are indexed as domesticated organisms, genetic resources, pests, pathogens, hosts, or potential economic resources. In human health and medicine, the emphasis is on: human nutrition, community and public health, tropical diseases, communicable diseases including AIDS, medical mycology, entomology, and parasitology. CABI = Centre for Agriculture and Biosciences International.

Also includes full text from a number of journals, conference proceedings, and review articles.

hash.title: CAB Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
CAB Abstracts (1910 to the present) includes international coverage of all aspects of agriculture, horticulture, animal production and forestry including: crop production, plant protection and breeding; forestry and forest products; soil science, land use and water management; animal husbandry, health, breeding, nutrition and parasitology; dairy science and technology, agricultural engineering; economics; rural development, sociology and education; leisure, recreation and tourism.
Many topics in the sciences basic to these activities are also covered, including the physiology, biochemistry, ecology, genetics, and biosystematics of the plants, animals, and microorganisms that are indexed as domesticated organisms, genetic resources, pests, pathogens, hosts, or potential economic resources. In human health and medicine, the emphasis is on: human nutrition, community and public health, tropical diseases, communicable diseases including AIDS, medical mycology, entomology, and parasitology. CABI = Centre for Agriculture and Biosciences International.

Also includes full text from a number of journals, conference proceedings, and review articles.

hash.name: Advances in Polymer Science
hash.title: Advances in Polymer Science
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext of electronically published titles from Springer's Advances in Polymer Science series.

hash.name: America: History and Life with Full Text
hash.title: America: History and Life with Full Text
hash.databasedescription: America: History and Life with Full Text covers all aspects of the history of Canada and the United States from prehistorical times to the present. Coverage is very broad and takes in many areas including: popular culture, anthropology, folklore, sociology, cultural studies, business, the arts, law, education and genealogy. Published since 1964.

hash.name: Archives Search
hash.title: Archives Search
hash.databasedescription: Archives Search is the National Archives of Canada's online research and consultation tool. It provides information about and collections of the National Archives.

hash.name: Bibliography of Native North Americans
hash.title: Bibliography of Native North Americans
hash.databasedescription: The Bibliography of Native North Americans, from Human Relations Area Files (HRAF), is an electronic publication that contains the citations from the cumulative eight volumes of the Ethnographic Bibliography of North America as well as additional new citations.

hash.name: Canadiana

meta.more-info: Canadiana Discovery Portal enables users to search across the valuable and diverse digital collections of Canada�s libraries, museums, and archives.

hash.title: Canadiana
hash.databasedescription:
Early Canadiana Online is a full text online collection of books, pamphlets, and periodicals documenting Canadian history from the first European contact to the late 19th century. The collection is particularly strong in literature, women's history, native studies, travel and exploration, and the history of French Canada. The collection includes books published up to 1940 and periodicals published up to 1920.


Canadiana Discovery Portal enables users to search across the valuable and diverse digital collections of Canada�s libraries, museums, and archives.

hash.name: CPI.Q. (Canadian Periodicals Index)
hash.title: CPI.Q. (Canadian Periodicals Index)
hash.databasedescription: CPI.Q. indexes more than 400 titles (covering 1988 to present) with full text articles from over 160 of these periodicals (covering 1995 to present) as well as Gale Research reference data and the full text of selected sections of The Globe and Mail. CPI.Q. indexes Canadian and International journals, magazines, newspapers, and other references covering a broad range of topics, from current affairs and technology to arts and culture, geography, history,business and more.

hash.name: First Nations Periodical Index
hash.title: First Nations Periodical Index
hash.databasedescription: Searchable index of 20 Aboriginal newspapers, journals, and magazines, of mainly Canadian Native content. A joint project of the Saskatchewan Indian Federated College, Saskatoon Campus, the Saskatchewan Indian Cultural Centre and the Library Services for Saskatchewan Aboriginal Peoples committee.

hash.name: Hospitality & Tourism Complete
hash.title: Hospitality & Tourism Complete
hash.databasedescription: Covers scholarly research and industry news relating to all areas of hospitality and tourism, with coverage going back to the early 1960s. Combines the records of three renowned collections: Cornell University?s former Hospitality database, Articles in Hospitality and Tourism (AHT), formerly co-produced by the Universities of Surrey and Oxford Brookes, and the Lodging, Restaurant & Tourism Index (LRTI), formerly produced by Purdue University. Also contains full text for selected publications.

hash.name: Physical Education Index
hash.title: Physical Education Index
hash.databasedescription: Covers peer-reviewed journals, report literature, conference proceedings, trade magazines, patents, articles from the popular press, and many other publications in the field of Physical Education.

hash.name: Sociological Abstracts
hash.title: Sociological Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
Sociological Abstracts (1952 to the present) provides access to the
world's literature in sociology and related disciplines, including social
welfare, social planning, social policy and development. It covers articles from
over 2,000 journals, conference papers, dissertations, book reviews and selected
sociology books. It covers both the theoretical and applied aspects of sociology.

hash.name: SPORT Discus with Full Text
hash.title: SPORT Discus with Full Text
hash.databasedescription:
SPORT Discus with Full Text (1975 to the present) is an international database
containing information on sports medicine, exercise physiology, biomechanics,
psychology, training techniques, coaching, physical education, physical fitness,
active living, recreation, history, and facilities and equipment. SPORTDiscus with Full Text contains citations for articles back to 1975, and full text of articles from selected journals as far back as 1985.

hash.name: The Canadian Encyclopedia Online
hash.title: The Canadian Encyclopedia Online
hash.databasedescription: Online version of The Canadian Encyclopedia

hash.name: Accounting Research Manager
hash.title: Accounting Research Manager
hash.databasedescription: Accounting Research Manager contains accounting standards and interpretation info from AICPA, FASB, EITF, IASB and the SEC.

hash.name: Business Source Complete

meta.more-info:
Business Source Complete Online Help

The following are brief video tutorials that address some of the most common Business Source Complete questions:

  • Finding a SWOT Analysis Using Business Source Complete (1 min, 2 sec)
  • How to Find Canadian Company Strategy (3 min, 23 sec)

hash.title: Business Source Complete
hash.databasedescription:
Provides full text for a large collection of business journals and peer-reviewed business publications. Coverage includes virtually all subject areas related to business. Indexing and abstracts for the most important scholarly business journals (back to 1886 or the first issue published for that journal) are included.

Business Source Complete Online Help

The following are brief video tutorials that address some of the most common Business Source Complete questions:

  • Finding a SWOT Analysis Using Business Source Complete (1 min, 2 sec)
  • How to Find Canadian Company Strategy (3 min, 23 sec)

hash.name: CCH Online

meta.more-info: Individual information resources can be seen by clicking on the folder and expanding the contents list for each resource package, i.e., CCH Tax, CCH Law, CCH Business.

hash.title: CCH Online
hash.databasedescription:
Includes CCH Tax, CCH Legal and CCH Business resource packages provide a series of individually searchable information resources that provide access to Canadian federal and provincial legislation, case law, and commentary on a number of topical areas in law. These include taxation (GST, federal income, and provincial taxes), family law, estate administration, labour law, commercial and securities law, real estate law, and others.
Individual information resources can be seen by clicking on the folder and expanding the contents list for each resource package, i.e., CCH Tax, CCH Law, CCH Business.

hash.name: Knotia.ca
hash.title: Knotia.ca
hash.databasedescription:
Current Canadian Accounting (including GAAP) and
Assurance/Auditing standards.




Normes canadiennes courantes des domaines de la comptabilité (y compris les PCGR) et de la vérification d'attestation de la qualité.

hash.name: ProQuest Business Collection Complete
hash.title: ProQuest Business Collection Complete
hash.databasedescription: Includes full-text of scholarly journals, trade publications, dissertations, working papers, market reports, newspapers, and other relevant sources in business and the social sciences. Includes content from other ProQuest Databases such as ABI/INFORM Complete, Accounting & Tax, Asian Business & Reference, Banking Information Source, Entrepreneurship, and the International Bibliography of the Social Sciences.

hash.name: TaxFind
hash.title: TaxFind
hash.databasedescription: TaxFind is produced by the Canadian Tax Foundation and includes a wide range of information and materials on Canadian tax. The Canadian Tax Journal and Canadian Tax Highlights are also available through this product.

hash.name: Taxnet Pro
hash.title: Taxnet Pro
hash.databasedescription: This research service offers full coverage of all Canadian taxes including income tax, the GST (goods and services tax) and the provincially administered taxes. Along with all the primary legislation and government documents, taxnet.pro also offers a comprehensive database of case law related to Canadian tax. It also offers authoritative and comprehensive commentary from leading experts including commentary related to income tax and the GST.

hash.name: Thomson ONE

meta.more-info:
Thomson One Help


The following are brief video tutorials that address some of the most common Thomson One questions:


  • Finding an Analyst or Initiating Coverage Report (1 min, 54 sec)
  • Finding Analyst's Reports in Thomson One For Companies That Are No Longer Public (1 min, 48 sec)
  • Finding Comparables Reports in Thomson One (University of Alberta: 1 min, 7 sec)

hash.title: Thomson ONE
hash.databasedescription:
Thomson ONE delivers the critical information and analysis tools investment banking professionals need-via one complete and intuitive interface.

Thomson ONE provides access to relevant real-time global market data, news, and authoritative content from industry-leading sources.


Thomson One Help


The following are brief video tutorials that address some of the most common Thomson One questions:


  • Finding an Analyst or Initiating Coverage Report (1 min, 54 sec)
  • Finding Analyst's Reports in Thomson One For Companies That Are No Longer Public (1 min, 48 sec)
  • Finding Comparables Reports in Thomson One (University of Alberta: 1 min, 7 sec)
  • Finding Financials for a Public Information Book (PIB) in the Thomson One Database (3 min, 51 sec)
  • Finding First Research Reports in Thomson One (2 min, 18 sec)
  • How to Find Canadian Convertible Debt Offerings For a Specific Time Period (2 min, 54 sec)

hash.name: Words Analytics
hash.title: Words Analytics
hash.databasedescription:
WordsAnalytics
enables textual analysis of SEC Filings (back to 2001) Each paragraph of an SEC filing is treated as a separate document, enabling one to quickly search by keyword or phrase or other criteria. There are more than 1,000 pre-programmed search strings. One may also search a current filing of a company and use a "Compare" or "Finding similar paragraphs" tool to learn of revisions from the previous filing.

hash.title: PsycINFO
hash.databasedescription: PsycINFO covers the international literature in psychology. Topics include: applied psychology, communication systems, developmental psychology, education psychology, experimental psychology, personality, physical and psychological disorders, physiological psychology, psychometrics, social psychology and sports psychology. Formats covered by this database are: journal articles, book chapters, dissertations and technical reports.

hash.title: Academic Search Complete
hash.databasedescription: Academic Search Complete provides indexing and abstracts for a large number of scholarly journals in a variety of disciplines, and full text for a subset of these journals.

hash.name: Ad$pender
hash.title: Ad$pender
hash.databasedescription: Ad$pender provides a summary of the multi-media advertising marketplace including: TV, radio, magazines, newspapers, outdoor, and Internet. Coverage also includes 5 years of national spending trends and provides information by industry, parent company, subsidiaries, advertisers, products and brands. Data can be exported in spreadsheet, ASCII, or PDF.

hash.name: CARDOnline
hash.title: CARDOnline
hash.databasedescription: CARDOnline provides Canadian advertising rates, data and media planning information. The database is updated daily, includes media listings, and allows for calculations for magazine CPM. CARDOnline is useful for advertising, marketing and media planning.

hash.name: CBCA Complete
hash.title: CBCA Complete
hash.databasedescription: Provides indexing and full text of Canadian material. CBCA Complete combines full text and indexed content from CBCA Business, CBCA Current Events, CBCA Education, and CBCA Reference.

hash.name: Communication & Mass Media Complete
hash.title: Communication & Mass Media Complete
hash.databasedescription: Covers communication and mass media. Originated with the merging of CommSearch (formerly produced by the National Communication Association (NCA)), and Mass Media Articles Index (formerly produced by Pennsylvania State University).

hash.name: eMarketer
hash.title: eMarketer
hash.databasedescription: eMarketer provides market research information related to the Internet, e-business, online marketing and emerging technologies. eMarketer aggregates and analyzes e-business research from over 1,700 sources, and produces analyst reports, daily research articles and e-business and online marketing statistics.

hash.name: MarketResearch.com Academic

meta.more-info: NOTE: Not all MarketResearch.com products are available in MarketResearch.com Academic. The academic subscription contains a subset of reports from the commercial Marketresearch.com database. Content providers include Kalorama Information, Packaged Facts, SBI and Simba.

hash.title: MarketResearch.com Academic
hash.databasedescription:
MarketResearch.com Academic provides access to over 500 market research reports that cover a variety of sectors such as beverages, food, office supplies, personal care and telecommunications. The reports are detailed and international in scope and application. The database features daily updates, charts and graphs.
NOTE: Not all MarketResearch.com products are available in MarketResearch.com Academic. The academic subscription contains a subset of reports from the commercial Marketresearch.com database. Content providers include Kalorama Information, Packaged Facts, SBI and Simba.

hash.name: Mintel Reports
hash.title: Mintel Reports
hash.databasedescription: Mintel offers market research reports covering US and International marketplaces. Each report combines data & analysis of the competitive landscape, market-share analysis and consumer profiles. Complex demographic issues are broken into easy-to-understand sections, explaining consumer behavior and demonstrating the structure of the market.Mintel offers market research reports covering US and International marketplaces. Each report combines data & analysis of the competitive landscape, market-share analysis and consumer profiles. Complex demographic issues are broken into easy-to-understand sections, explaining consumer behavior and demonstrating the structure of the market.

hash.name: PMB (Print Measurement Bureau)
hash.title: PMB (Print Measurement Bureau)
hash.databasedescription: The PMB (Print Measurement Bureau) is a Canadian syndicated media service. The single source study provides annual data on Canadian consumer preferences, print and non-print media preferences, product usage and consumer lifestyles.

hash.name: SimplyMap

meta.more-info:
Guides:


  • Quick Reference Guide

Tutorials:


  • How to Use SimplyMap to Create a Map That Shows Income Areas for Edmonton (or any other city) (3 min, 45 sec)
  • Advanced SimplyMap: How to Create a Location Analysis Report and Map (4 min, 45 sec)


The University's subscription provides access to the following Environics Analytics Group Data Packages: Adjusted Census Data from the year 2006, Current Estimates and Five Year Projections, the 2011 Household Expenditure Potential (HEP) and well as the PRIZM C2 segmentation system. Data is available for all units of geography including dissemination areas, census tracts, census subdivisions, census metropolitan areas, census subdivisions, census divisions, Province/Territory and all of Canada.


SimplyMap includes market segmentation information from Environics, which allows the analysis of customers lifestyles and trends. The analysis and definitions are included in PRIZM Marketer's Handbook.


Adjusted Census Data: The Adjusted 2006 Census provides clients with a new alternative to the 2006 Census that adjusts for the effects of random rounding and suppression while maintaining a strong relationship to the Statistics Canada data. This unique product reduces the amount of missing data through proprietary interpolation procedures. In any Census release, random rounding is applied to the data as one of several privacy protection measures that, while important, results in variable summations that do not match published totals and percentages that range around 100. The Adjusted Census ensures that variable categories are internally consistent, thereby allowing the creation of realistic percentages.

Demographic Estimates and Projections (DEP): In conjunction with experts at The Centre for Spatial Economics, Environics Analytics has created Demographic Estimates & Projections (DEP) of an extensive set of demographic variables at the small area level. The 2011 current year estimates and projections for 2016 are created using a combination of traditional demographic methods combined with cutting edge macroeconomic modeling, advanced spatial trend analysis, and exclusive databases. The Demographic Estimates and Projections 2011 & 2016 incorporate the following:


  • Population by Age
  • Population by Sex and Age
  • Population 15 Years or Over by Marital Status
  • Census Families by Family Structure
  • Total Children At Home by Age
  • Occupied Private Dwellings by Period of Construction
  • Occupied Private Dwellings by Structure Type
  • Households by Size of Household
  • Households by Household Type
  • Households by Maintainer Age
  • Household Income
  • Population 15 Years or Over by Educational Attainment
  • Household Population by Mother Tongue
  • Household Population by Immigration Status
  • Household Population by Visible Minority Status
  • Household Population 15 Years or over by Labour Force Activity
  • Labour Force by Occupation
  • Labour Force by Method of Travel to Work
  • Household Population by Senior Care and Sex
  • Household Population by Child Care and Sex


Household Expenditure Potential (HEP): The Environics Analytics Household Expenditure Potential (HEP) is based upon Statistics Canada's Survey of Household Spending for 2007. More than 24,000 private households across all Provinces and Territories were asked detailed questions on their spending patterns. A variety of statistical methods were utilized to model average number of dollars spent by category for each Dissemination Area. This product is used to estimate spending behavior of Canadians at any geographic level, from Canada down to a local trade area. Total dollars and average dollars can be investigated. HEP is provided at the Dissemination Area (DA) level. For each DA, estimated average dollar values are provided for average household income, average household expenditure and 271 categories of expenditure. In addition, total estimated households for 2011 are provided. The Household Expenditure Potential (HEP) incorporates the following:


  • Food
  • Shelter
  • Household Operation
  • Household Furnishings and Equipment
  • Clothing
  • Transportation
  • Health Care
  • Personal Care
  • Recreation and Entertainment
  • Reading Materials
  • Education
  • Alcohol and Tobacco
  • Games of Chance
  • Misc Expenditures
  • Personal Taxes
  • Insurance and Pension
  • Gifts of Money
  • Homeowner repairs and renovations

PRIZM C2 is the latest release of the pioneering segmentation system from Environics Analytics that classifies Canada's neighbourhoods into 66 unique lifestyle types. It's the first system of its type to incorporate psychographics providing insights into the behaviour and mindset of consumers. It's been updated with the 2006 Census, newly released Social Values from Environics Research and EA's current year Demographic Estimates and Projections. And it reflects Canada's growing diversity, with 15 francophone segments and 13 segments that are home to visible minorities, new immigrants and those who speak a language other than French or English. Because it's linked to many important marketing surveys and databases, it helps marketers create the most complete picture available of their customer segments. The PRIZM C2 incorporates the following data:


  • Urban Elite
  • Exurban Elite
  • Urban Upscale Ethnic
  • Urban Young
  • Exurban Midscale
  • Exurban Francophone
  • Suburban Midscale
  • Rural Midscale
  • Town Midscale
  • Urban Mix
  • Town/Rural Francophone
  • Urban Downscale Ethnic
  • Suburban Francophone
  • Rural Downscale
  • Urban Francophone
  • Urban Downscale


The Canadian D&B's Business Directory incorporates over 1.4 million Canadian businesses with the following data fields:


  • Legal name
  • Business name
  • NAIC codes & SIC Code
  • Address
  • Telephone number
  • Web address
  • General description.

hash.name: SuperDemographics
hash.title: SuperDemographics
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to Canadian demographic information at the postal code level and includes information on income, occupation, lifestyle, education, ethnicity and household expenditure.

hash.name: The International Plant Names Index

meta.more-info: Conditions:Use of this product is restricted to members of the University of Alberta community and to users of the Library's physical facilities. It is the responsibility of each user to ensure that he or she uses this product for individual, non-commercial educational or research purposes only, and does not systematically download or retain substantial portions of information.

hash.title: The International Plant Names Index
hash.databasedescription:
The International Plant Names Index (IPNI) is a database of the names and associated basic bibliographical details of seed plants, ferns and fern allies. Its goal is to eliminate the need for repeated reference to primary sources for basic bibliographic information about plant names. The data are freely available and are gradually being standardized and checked. IPNI will be a dynamic resource, depending on direct contributions by all members of the botanical community.
Conditions:Use of this product is restricted to members of the University of Alberta community and to users of the Library's physical facilities. It is the responsibility of each user to ensure that he or she uses this product for individual, non-commercial educational or research purposes only, and does not systematically download or retain substantial portions of information.

hash.name: AgEcon Search : Research in Agricultural and Applied Economics
hash.title: AgEcon Search : Research in Agricultural and Applied Economics
hash.databasedescription: Provides indexing to over 3000 full-text reports in agricultural economics. The reports include working-paper series from many U.S. and some international departments of agrucultural economics at major universities. Also included are conference papers and papers from international agricultural organizations.

hash.name: Environment Complete
hash.title: Environment Complete
hash.databasedescription: Covers applicable areas of agriculture, ecosystem ecology, energy, natural resources, marine & freshwater science, geography, pollution & waste management, environmental technology, environmental law, public policy, social impacts, and urban planning. Contains records from domestic and international journals going back to the 1950s as well as from selected monographs. Features an in-depth thesaurus, and author profiles. Also includes full text from a number of publications.

hash.name: Forestry Compendium
hash.title: Forestry Compendium
hash.databasedescription: The Forestry Compendium is a multimedia tool for identification, learning about and selecting a specific tree species. Drawing on maps, pictures and other information sources it provides a full species picture.

hash.name: FS Info
hash.title: FS Info
hash.databasedescription: The FS (Forest Service) Database includes over 180,000 records of natural resources literature, with over 4,500 links to full-text publications. There are over 55,000 records and links to U.S. Forest Service Research publications dating back to 1904 as well as including access to publications from current U.S. Research Stations.

hash.name: GreenFILE

meta.more-info: Topics covered include global warming, green building, pollution, sustainable agriculture, renewable energy, recycling, and more. GreenFILE is multidisciplinary by nature and draws on the connections between the environment and a variety of disciplines such as agriculture, education, law, health and technology.

hash.title: GreenFILE
hash.databasedescription:
GreenFILE offers covers all aspects of human impact on the environment. Its collection of scholarly, government and general-interest titles include content on the environmental effects of individuals, corporations and local/national governments, and what can be done on each level to minimize negative impact.
Topics covered include global warming, green building, pollution, sustainable agriculture, renewable energy, recycling, and more. GreenFILE is multidisciplinary by nature and draws on the connections between the environment and a variety of disciplines such as agriculture, education, law, health and technology.

hash.name: Pollution Abstracts

meta.more-info:
Aspects covered include measuring and monitoring techniques, statistics, treatment and control,
recovery and recycling, standards and criteria, economic, social, and legal
aspects, and the effects of contaminants on animal and plant species in nature
and in controlled laboratory experiments.

hash.title: Pollution Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
Pollution Abstracts (1982 to the present) covers air pollution, marine
and freshwater pollution, sewage and wastewater treatment, waste management,
toxicology and health, noise pollution, radiation, land pollution, and
environment policies, programs, legislation and education.
Aspects covered include measuring and monitoring techniques, statistics, treatment and control,
recovery and recycling, standards and criteria, economic, social, and legal
aspects, and the effects of contaminants on animal and plant species in nature
and in controlled laboratory experiments.

hash.name: Sustainability Science Abstracts

meta.more-info: Coverage includes relevant papers, reports, books and reviews from standard peer-reviewed scientific journals. Material from conference proceedings and gray literature has also been summarized.

hash.title: Sustainability Science Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
Explores all aspects of sustainable development, human population and demography topics, as well as societal issues involving natural resource management. Also covered are the topics of conservation of natural resources, ensuring the attainment and continued satisfaction of human needs in the present as well as maintaining the potential to meet the needs and aspirations of future generations.
Coverage includes relevant papers, reports, books and reviews from standard peer-reviewed scientific journals. Material from conference proceedings and gray literature has also been summarized.

hash.name: Water Resources Abstracts

meta.more-info:
This database provides comprehensive coverage of water planning (including demand, economics and cost allocations), the water cycle including precipitation, snow, groundwater, lakes and erosion), and water quality (including pollution and wastewater treatment). Related legal and engineering issues are also examined. Abridged contents: climatology, conservation, ground and surface water hydrology, industrial wastes, international law and policy, methods of increasing water supplies, metropolitan water resources, public health, recreational aspects, remote sensing, water pollution, water recycling.

Covers 1960-present.

hash.title: Water Resources Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
Water Resources Abstracts covers the characteristics, conservation,
control, use and management of water resources with references spanning the life
and physical sciences.
This database provides comprehensive coverage of water planning (including demand, economics and cost allocations), the water cycle including precipitation, snow, groundwater, lakes and erosion), and water quality (including pollution and wastewater treatment). Related legal and engineering issues are also examined. Abridged contents: climatology, conservation, ground and surface water hydrology, industrial wastes, international law and policy, methods of increasing water supplies, metropolitan water resources, public health, recreational aspects, remote sensing, water pollution, water recycling.

Covers 1960-present.

hash.name: Agricola

meta.more-info: It consists of over 3.3 milion citations to journal articles, monographs, theses, patents, and technical reports. Subject areas include: agricultural economics and rural sociology, agricultural production, animal sciences, chemistry, entomology, food and human nutrition, forestry, natural resources, pesticides, plant science, soils and fertilizers, and water resources. Also includes related areas such as biology and biotechnology, botany, ecology, and natural history. Agricola corresponds to the Bibliography of Agriculture

hash.title: Agricola
hash.databasedescription:
Agricola (1970 to the present) covers U.S. agricultural and life sciences information.
It consists of over 3.3 milion citations to journal articles, monographs, theses, patents, and technical reports. Subject areas include: agricultural economics and rural sociology, agricultural production, animal sciences, chemistry, entomology, food and human nutrition, forestry, natural resources, pesticides, plant science, soils and fertilizers, and water resources. Also includes related areas such as biology and biotechnology, botany, ecology, and natural history. Agricola corresponds to the Bibliography of Agriculture

hash.name: MEDLINE

meta.more-info: Other aspects of medicine covered by the database are: public health, health promotion, bioethics, medical education, legal aspects of medical practice, the nature of health science professions, etc. MEDLINE also contains a nursing subset and a dentistry subset, each of which indexes the major journals in these areas.

hash.title: MEDLINE
hash.databasedescription:
MEDLINE (1946 to the present) covers the world's biomedical and health sciences journal literature. The type of information contained in MEDLINE ranges from the basic biomedical sciences like anatomy, physiology, biochemistry to clinical information outlining the nature and course of disease or injury, as well as its treatment.
Other aspects of medicine covered by the database are: public health, health promotion, bioethics, medical education, legal aspects of medical practice, the nature of health science professions, etc. MEDLINE also contains a nursing subset and a dentistry subset, each of which indexes the major journals in these areas.

hash.name: PubMed

meta.more-info: The type of information contained in PubMed ranges from the basic biomedical sciences like anatomy, physiology, biochemistry to clinical information outlining the nature and course of disease or injury, as well as its treatment. Other aspects of medicine covered by the database are: public health, health promotion, bioethics, medical education, legal aspects of medical practice, the nature of health science professions, etc. PubMed also contains a nursing subset and a dentistry subset, each of which indexes the major journals in these areas.

hash.title: PubMed
hash.databasedescription:
PubMed (1946 to the present) covers the world's biomedical and health sciences journal literature.
The type of information contained in PubMed ranges from the basic biomedical sciences like anatomy, physiology, biochemistry to clinical information outlining the nature and course of disease or injury, as well as its treatment. Other aspects of medicine covered by the database are: public health, health promotion, bioethics, medical education, legal aspects of medical practice, the nature of health science professions, etc. PubMed also contains a nursing subset and a dentistry subset, each of which indexes the major journals in these areas.

hash.name: CINAHL Plus with Full Text

meta.more-info: Topics covered by this database include patient care, health promotion, professional issues for health care workers, patient education, rehabilitation, and other related subjects. Those with little or no health science background may be able to find useful articles on the more common disease and injury conditions, as well as other health topics, because CINAHL does include some consumer health information. CINAHL Plus with Full Text also contains searchable cited references for more than 1,100 journals and provides full text for hundreds of journals, plus legal cases, clinical innovations, critical paths, drug records, research instruments and clinical trials. PDF backfiles to 1937 are also included.

hash.title: CINAHL Plus with Full Text
hash.databasedescription:
CINAHL Plus with Full Text (1937 to the present) provides indexing for the major English language journals in the areas of nursing, occupational therapy, physical therapy and other allied health fields such as respiratory technology, x-ray technology, etc.
Topics covered by this database include patient care, health promotion, professional issues for health care workers, patient education, rehabilitation, and other related subjects. Those with little or no health science background may be able to find useful articles on the more common disease and injury conditions, as well as other health topics, because CINAHL does include some consumer health information. CINAHL Plus with Full Text also contains searchable cited references for more than 1,100 journals and provides full text for hundreds of journals, plus legal cases, clinical innovations, critical paths, drug records, research instruments and clinical trials. PDF backfiles to 1937 are also included.

hash.name: EMBASE
hash.title: EMBASE
hash.databasedescription: EMBASE (1974 to the present) is a medical database which covers a wide range of journals in the biomedical sciences. EMBASE is particularly useful for location drug information, as it indexes many drug journals not covered by MEDLINE.

hash.name: Scopus
hash.title: Scopus
hash.databasedescription: Provides indexing, abstracting of and citation linking to journals in science, technology, medicine, and the social sciences.

hash.name: BIOSIS Previews
hash.title: BIOSIS Previews
hash.databasedescription: BIOSIS Citation Index adds citation analysis functionality to BIOSIS Previews. This analysis is more specific in focus than that provided within the BIOSIS Previews database, and useful for researchers who wish to limit citation analysis to Life Sciences publications. BIOSIS Previews combines the content from Biological Abstracts® (Journals) and Biological Abstracts/RRM® (Reports, Reviews, and Meetings).

hash.name: SciFinder
hash.title: SciFinder
hash.databasedescription: SciFinder provides access to the online version of Chemical Abstracts.

hash.name: BIOSIS Citation Index
hash.title: BIOSIS Citation Index
hash.databasedescription: BIOSIS Citation Index adds citation analysis functionality to BIOSIS Previews. This analysis is more specific in focus than that provided within the BIOSIS Previews database, and useful for researchers who wish to limit citation analysis to Life Sciences publications. BIOSIS Previews combines the content from Biological Abstracts® (Journals) and Biological Abstracts/RRM® (Reports, Reviews, and Meetings).

hash.name: AGRICULTUREnetBASE
hash.title: AGRICULTUREnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Online, full-text handbooks covering topics in agriculture.

hash.name: AGRIS : International Information System for the Agricultural Sciences and Technology

meta.more-info: To date, 240 national, international and intergovernmental centres participate. The AGRIS repository is continuously updated and currently contains over 2.3 million bibliographi references.

hash.title: AGRIS : International Information System for the Agricultural Sciences and Technology
hash.databasedescription:
AGRIS was created in 1974 to facilitate information exchange and to bring together world literature dealing with all aspects of agriculture. AGRIS is a cooperative system in which participating countries input references to the literature produced within their boundaries and, in return, draw on the information provided by the other participants.
To date, 240 national, international and intergovernmental centres participate. The AGRIS repository is continuously updated and currently contains over 2.3 million bibliographi references.

hash.name: Animal Health and Production Compendium
hash.title: Animal Health and Production Compendium
hash.databasedescription: The Animal Health and Production Compendium draws together scientific information on all aspects of animal health and production. It includes information on diseases, breeds, nutrition, husbandry and treatment of livestock and poultry.

hash.name: Arctic and Antarctic Regions

meta.more-info:
Materials indexed include scientific periodicals, monographs,
proceedings of conferences and symposia, government reports, theses,
dissertations, and native and northern newspapers.

Polar databases included in Arctic and Antarctic Regions include:

  • ASTIS - Arctic Institute of North America
  • Cold Regions Bibliography - U.S. Library of Congress
  • CRREL - U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Cold Regions Research and Engineering
    Laboratory
  • Antarctic Bibliography - U.S.National Science Foundation
  • C-CORE - Centre for Cold Ocean Resources Engineering
  • WDC-A - World Data Center A for Glaciology [Snow and Ice]
  • SPRI - Scott Polar Research Institute.
  • SPRI Polar Periodicals - Scott Polar Research Institute
  • USBGN Antarctic Place Names - U.S. Board on Geological Names
  • BOREAL - Canadian Circumpolar Library
  • BNT - BOREAL Northern Titles Canadian Circumpolar Library
  • Yukon Bibliography - Canadian Circumpolar Library
  • INAC - Department of Indian and Northern Affarirs

hash.title: Arctic and Antarctic Regions
hash.databasedescription:
Arctic and Antarctic Regions is the world's largest collection of
international polar databases. Citations cover a time period from the mid 1800's
to present. It is interdisciplinary covering all aspects of the life, social
arts, physical engineering, and the earth sciences in the world's coldest
regions.
Materials indexed include scientific periodicals, monographs,
proceedings of conferences and symposia, government reports, theses,
dissertations, and native and northern newspapers.

Polar databases included in Arctic and Antarctic Regions include:

  • ASTIS - Arctic Institute of North America
  • Cold Regions Bibliography - U.S. Library of Congress
  • CRREL - U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Cold Regions Research and Engineering
    Laboratory
  • Antarctic Bibliography - U.S.National Science Foundation
  • C-CORE - Centre for Cold Ocean Resources Engineering
  • WDC-A - World Data Center A for Glaciology [Snow and Ice]
  • SPRI - Scott Polar Research Institute.
  • SPRI Polar Periodicals - Scott Polar Research Institute
  • USBGN Antarctic Place Names - U.S. Board on Geological Names
  • BOREAL - Canadian Circumpolar Library
  • BNT - BOREAL Northern Titles Canadian Circumpolar Library
  • Yukon Bibliography - Canadian Circumpolar Library
  • INAC - Department of Indian and Northern Affarirs

hash.name: CAB eBOOKs
hash.title: CAB eBOOKs
hash.databasedescription: CAB eBOOKs (2000 to the present) includes over 600 titles published by CABi(formerly Commonwealth Agricultural Bureau. Topics include agriculture, animal and veterinary science, plant science, environmental science, human health and nutrition, and leisure and tourism.

hash.name: CAB Reviews: Perspectives in Agriculture, Veterinary Science, Nutrition and Natural Resources
hash.title: CAB Reviews: Perspectives in Agriculture, Veterinary Science, Nutrition and Natural Resources
hash.databasedescription: CAB Reviews compliments the subject coverage of CAB Abstracts, and provides review articles focusing on animal science, veterinary medicine, applied plant sciences, agriculture, nutrition and food science, natural resources and environmental sciences.

hash.name: CHEMINDEX
hash.title: CHEMINDEX
hash.databasedescription: Guide to information resources on over 200,000 chemicals. Each CHEMINDEX record contains identification information on a unique substance, including Chemical names and synonyms, Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) registry numbers, a listing of the CCOHS databases that contain information on that substance.

hash.name: CHEMnetBASE
hash.title: CHEMnetBASE
hash.databasedescription:
CHEMnetBASE provides access to the following products:

  1. Combined Chemical Dictionary, which includes: Dictionary of Commonly Cited Compounds, Dictionary of Drugs, Dictionary of Inorganic and Organometallic Compounds, Dictionary of Natural Products, and Dictionary of Organic Compounds.
  2. The Handbook of Chemistry and Physics
  3. Polymers: A Property Database
  4. Properties of Organic Compounds

hash.name: Compendex (Engineering Index)

meta.more-info: Fields covered include: aeronautics; applied physics; bioengineering and medical equipment; chemical engineering; polymers and food technology; computers and robotics; civil, structural, control, electrical, electronics, and environmental engineering; energy technology and petroleum engineering; industrial engineering; information science; light and optical technology; marine engineering; mechanical, mining, and metallurgic engineering; materials science; nuclear engineering; and transportation.

hash.title: Compendex (Engineering Index)
hash.databasedescription:
Ei Compendex (1884 to the present) provides international coverage of all fields of engineering including related areas of applied science, management, and energy.
Fields covered include: aeronautics; applied physics; bioengineering and medical equipment; chemical engineering; polymers and food technology; computers and robotics; civil, structural, control, electrical, electronics, and environmental engineering; energy technology and petroleum engineering; industrial engineering; information science; light and optical technology; marine engineering; mechanical, mining, and metallurgic engineering; materials science; nuclear engineering; and transportation.

hash.name: Crop Protection Compendium
hash.title: Crop Protection Compendium
hash.databasedescription: The Crop Protection Compendium draws together scientific information on all aspects of crop protection. It includes information on pests, diseases and weeds and their natural enemies, the crops that are their hosts, and the countries in which they occur.

hash.name: Dissertations & Theses @ University of Alberta
hash.title: Dissertations & Theses @ University of Alberta
hash.databasedescription:
Dissertations & Theses @ University of Alberta, a subset of the Dissertation
Abstracts database, indexes and abstracts University of Alberta
dissertations and provides the full-text of dissertations published after 1996.
The University of Alberta also subscribes to the full Dissertation Abstracts
database.

hash.name: Electronic Journals Library (Elektronische Zeitschriftenbibliothek)

meta.more-info: This service has been developed at the Universitätsbibliothek Regensburg (University Library of Regensburg) in cooperation with the Universitätsbibliothek der Technischen Universität München (University Library of the Technical University of Munich).

hash.title: Electronic Journals Library (Elektronische Zeitschriftenbibliothek)
hash.databasedescription:
The Elektronische Zeitschriftenbibliothek EZB (Electronic Journals Library) lists over 20,000 scientific and academic journals publishing full text articles in the internet. Almost half of these journals can be read free-of-charge. Free full text accessibility is shown by means of dots in different colors, red, yellow and green. Green indicates free access.
This service has been developed at the Universitätsbibliothek Regensburg (University Library of Regensburg) in cooperation with the Universitätsbibliothek der Technischen Universität München (University Library of the Technical University of Munich).

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Food Microbiology
hash.title: Encyclopedia of Food Microbiology
hash.databasedescription: The Encyclopedia of Food Microbiology covers all areas of microbiology as it relates to food and food preparation.

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Human Nutrition
hash.title: Encyclopedia of Human Nutrition
hash.databasedescription:
The Encyclopedia of Human Nutrition provides a comprehensive coverage of
all aspects of human nutrition, including clinical applications.

hash.name: FAOSTAT (Food and Agricultural Organization)
hash.title: FAOSTAT (Food and Agricultural Organization)
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to a number of FAO statistical databases.

hash.name: Food Science and Technology Abstracts (FSTA)
hash.title: Food Science and Technology Abstracts (FSTA)
hash.databasedescription:
Food Science and Technology Abstracts (FSTA) (1969 to the present) is an
international bibliographic database covering every aspect of food science,
technology and human nutrition. Includes topics such as biotechnology,
economics, manufacturing, legislation and commodity packaging. FSTA also
includes related topics such as additives, beverages, cereals, dairy products,
and other food products.

hash.name: FOODnetBASE
hash.title: FOODnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Online, full-text handbooks covering topics in food science.

hash.name: Freedonia Focus Industry Market Research Portal
hash.title: Freedonia Focus Industry Market Research Portal
hash.databasedescription: Includes the Freedonia Group's focus collection of industry market research covering 18 industry sectors.

hash.name: NUTRITIONnetBASE
hash.title: NUTRITIONnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Online, full-text handbooks covering topics in nutrition.

hash.name: Passport
hash.title: Passport
hash.databasedescription: This database is an amalgamation of three complementary sources: World Marketing Data and Statistics provides demographic, economic, and marketing profiles of 207 countries. World Marketing Forecasts covers consumer market growth predictions for 330 consumer products over 52 countries. Consumer Lifestyles provides information on the purchasing habits of consumers in 60 countries.

hash.name: PEN: Practice-based Evidence in Nutrition

meta.more-info: Topics in PEN address the broad spectrum of practice in nutrition and dietetics including institutional care, primary health care, public/community health, consulting/private practice, food service management, professional education, food and the pharmaceutical industry and government. Recognized authorities on each topic or Knowledge Pathway addressed in PEN contribute to the identification of relevant literature from filtered and original sources and critically appraise, grade and synthesize that literature into key practice points or answers to practice questions. Additionally, best practice client and professional resources and other tools that are congruent with the evidence are included in PEN to support practice, along with standard Knowledge Pathway tools including backgrounds, evidence summaries and practice guidance summaries. As new science emerges, components of a Knowledge Pathway are updated in a timely way to ensure practice guidance always keeps in-step with change. Each Knowledge Pathway undergoes a complete review at regular intervals.

hash.title: PEN: Practice-based Evidence in Nutrition
hash.databasedescription:
PEN:Practice-based Evidence in Nutrition(R), developed by Dietitians of Canada, utilizes search tools and ?Knowledge Pathway? format deliver evidence-based guidance.
Topics in PEN address the broad spectrum of practice in nutrition and dietetics including institutional care, primary health care, public/community health, consulting/private practice, food service management, professional education, food and the pharmaceutical industry and government. Recognized authorities on each topic or Knowledge Pathway addressed in PEN contribute to the identification of relevant literature from filtered and original sources and critically appraise, grade and synthesize that literature into key practice points or answers to practice questions. Additionally, best practice client and professional resources and other tools that are congruent with the evidence are included in PEN to support practice, along with standard Knowledge Pathway tools including backgrounds, evidence summaries and practice guidance summaries. As new science emerges, components of a Knowledge Pathway are updated in a timely way to ensure practice guidance always keeps in-step with change. Each Knowledge Pathway undergoes a complete review at regular intervals.

hash.name: PubChem
hash.title: PubChem
hash.databasedescription: PubChem contains the chemical structures of small organic molecules and information on their biological activities.

hash.name: PubMed Central
hash.title: PubMed Central
hash.databasedescription: PubMed Central is a digital archive of life sciences journal literature managed by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) at the U.S. National Library of Medicine (NLM).

hash.name: PubMed Central Canada
hash.title: PubMed Central Canada
hash.databasedescription: PubMed Central Canada (PMC Canada) is a freely accessible, Canada-based archive of biomedical and health research findings. It builds on PubMed Central (PMC), the U.S. National Institutes of Health (NIH) free digital archive of biomedical and life sciences journal literature and is a member of the broader PMC International (PMCI) network of e-repositories.

hash.name: PubMed dietary supplement subset
hash.title: PubMed dietary supplement subset
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to bibliographic citations and abstracts from published, international, scientific literature on dietary supplements. Succeeds the International Bibliographic Information on Dietary Supplements (IBIDS) database which was a collaboration between the ODS and the U.S. Department of Agriculture National Agricultural Library.

hash.name: Theses Canada Portal
hash.title: Theses Canada Portal
hash.databasedescription: Search bibliographic records for all theses in the National Library of Canada theses collection (established 1965). Provides free access to the full text electronic versions of Canadian theses and dissertations published from the beginning of 1998 to August 31, 2002.

hash.name: UC SAREP Cover Crop Database
hash.title: UC SAREP Cover Crop Database
hash.databasedescription: The cover crop database contains over 40 crop species that can be used as cover crops. Each crop description consists of up to 50 different subject categories. When you query the database every subject category in the database is searched. If a match is found a link will be returned to the specific crop subject category that was matched, as well as link to the full description of the crop (which contains the entire listing of information about the crop).

hash.name: Web of Science Core Collection

meta.more-info:
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation databases:
  • Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
  • Science Citation Index Expanded(TM)
    (1899-present)
  • Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.title: Web of Science Core Collection
hash.databasedescription:
Click on "more" below for the brief description of Web of Science.
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation databases:
  • Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
  • Science Citation Index Expanded(TM)
    (1899-present)
  • Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.name: Wiley Online Library
hash.title: Wiley Online Library
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to the fulltext of journals and selected e-books from John Wiley & Sons.

hash.name: SpringerLink
hash.title: SpringerLink
hash.databasedescription: SpringerLink provides access to the fulltext of books and journals from Springer-Verlag and associated publishers. SpringerLink publications cover life sciences, chemical sciences, geosciences, computer science, mathematics, medicine, physics & astronomy, engineering, environmental sciences, law, and economics.

hash.name: EconLit with Full Text
hash.title: EconLit with Full Text
hash.databasedescription: EconLit (1969 to the present) covers the world's economic literature. It indexes over 400 major journals as well as articles in collective volumes (essays, proceedings, etc.), books, book reviews, dissertations, and working papers. Abstracts were added starting in 1987.

hash.name: Proquest Dissertations and Theses Global

meta.more-info:
The doctoral theses published from 1980 forward also include 350-word abstracts, written by the author. Citations for the master's theses from 1988 forward include 150-word abstracts.

Most dissertations published since November 1996, as well as some with earlier publication dates, are available in PDF format to University of Alberta users. There are some exceptions - authors retain the rights to their original works, and some have chosen to not make these works available electronically. Other examples are titles that contain previously copyrighted material that has not been cleared for electronic re-publication, or titles that include multi-media that can't be distributed electronically.

Those theses not available in PDF format can be ordered in other formats for a fee. Ordering information is available once you are connected to Dissertation Abstracts. Dissertations can also be requested through Interlibrary Loan/Document Delivery.

hash.title: Proquest Dissertations and Theses Global
hash.databasedescription:
The Dissertation Abstracts database of doctoral and masters theses represents the work of authors from over 1,000 North American graduate schools and European universities. The database includes citations for materials ranging from the first U.S. dissertation accepted in 1861 to those accepted last semester.
The doctoral theses published from 1980 forward also include 350-word abstracts, written by the author. Citations for the master's theses from 1988 forward include 150-word abstracts.

Most dissertations published since November 1996, as well as some with earlier publication dates, are available in PDF format to University of Alberta users. There are some exceptions - authors retain the rights to their original works, and some have chosen to not make these works available electronically. Other examples are titles that contain previously copyrighted material that has not been cleared for electronic re-publication, or titles that include multi-media that can't be distributed electronically.

Those theses not available in PDF format can be ordered in other formats for a fee. Ordering information is available once you are connected to Dissertation Abstracts. Dissertations can also be requested through Interlibrary Loan/Document Delivery.

hash.name: Index to Theses

meta.more-info: Over 115,000 British doctoral theses are available from the British Library Document Supply Centre (BLDSC) for a fee. Items available from BLDSC have (BL) after the title. See the Frequently Asked Questions page of the Index to Theses for more information about this service. Theses can also be requested through the Interlibrary Loan/Document Delivery Service of the University of Alberta Library.

hash.title: Index to Theses
hash.databasedescription:
The Index to Theses database covers doctoral and masters theses accepted by universitites of Great Britain and Ireland from 1716.
Over 115,000 British doctoral theses are available from the British Library Document Supply Centre (BLDSC) for a fee. Items available from BLDSC have (BL) after the title. See the Frequently Asked Questions page of the Index to Theses for more information about this service. Theses can also be requested through the Interlibrary Loan/Document Delivery Service of the University of Alberta Library.

hash.name: Grey Source
hash.title: Grey Source
hash.databasedescription: GreySource lists web-based resources that explicitly refer to the term grey literature (or its equivalent in any language) and provides links to these resources. It is hosted by GreyNet, the Grey Literature Network Service. GreyText, an in-house archive of e-documents in the field grey Literature, can also be accessed through this site.

hash.name: ASABE Technical Library
hash.title: ASABE Technical Library
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext of technical documents published by the American Society of Agricultural and Biological Engineers.

hash.name: Canadian poisonous plants information system
hash.title: Canadian poisonous plants information system
hash.databasedescription: Includes plant nomenclature (common and scientific names), distribution by province and territory, cultivated and food plants of concern, toxic plant parts, toxic chemicals, descriptive information, references and links to important Web sites.

hash.title: DOAJ: Directory of Open Access Journals
hash.databasedescription: Covers free, full text, quality controlled scientific and scholarly open access journals in all subjects and languages - open access journals use a funding model that does not charge readers or their institutions for access. Provides the ability to search journal titles and journal articles.

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Life Sciences
hash.title: Encyclopedia of Life Sciences
hash.databasedescription: The Nature Encyclopedia of Life Sciences is a work in progress. When complete in 2001 it will comprise over 12 million words, 4,000 articles, 7,500 illustrations, 180,000 index entries and 26,000 links. It will be constantly updated online

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Life Support Systems

meta.more-info: It also deals with interdisciplinary subjects, like earth and atmospheric sciences and environmental economics as well as the most effective approaches for managing natural resources like renewable and non-renewable energy, biodiversity, ecology, hydrology, health and agriculture.

hash.title: Encyclopedia of Life Support Systems
hash.databasedescription:
The Encyclopedia of Life Support Systems (EOLSS) takes an interdisciplinary approach to the Earth’s life support systems. EOLSS encompasses fields such as: the natural sciences (like chemistry and biology); social sciences (such as history, economics, law, psychology, archeology, etc.); humanities (literature, civilizations, etc); engineering, and technology.
It also deals with interdisciplinary subjects, like earth and atmospheric sciences and environmental economics as well as the most effective approaches for managing natural resources like renewable and non-renewable energy, biodiversity, ecology, hydrology, health and agriculture.

hash.name: Energy Citations Database

meta.more-info: Energy Citations contains bibliographic records for energy and energy-related scientific and technical information from the Department of Energy (DOE) and its predecessor agencies, the Energy Research & Development Administration (ERDA) and the Atomic Energy Commission (AEC). The Database provides access to DOE publicly available citations from 1948 through the present, with continued growth through regular updates. Energy Citations includes bibliographic records of literature in disciplines of interest to DOE such as chemistry, physics, materials, environmental science, geology, engineering, mathematics, climatology, oceanography, computer science and related disciplines. It includes citations to report literature, conference papers, journal articles, books, dissertations, and patents.

hash.title: Energy Citations Database
hash.databasedescription:
The Energy Citations Database (ECD) coverage is from 1948 – Present. The database is designed and developed by the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Scientific and Technical Information (OSTI) with the science-attentive citizen in mind. Its creation is consistent with OSTI's objective to provide easier and faster access to the Department's scientific and technical information. Energy Citations is publicly available without charge to users.
Energy Citations contains bibliographic records for energy and energy-related scientific and technical information from the Department of Energy (DOE) and its predecessor agencies, the Energy Research & Development Administration (ERDA) and the Atomic Energy Commission (AEC). The Database provides access to DOE publicly available citations from 1948 through the present, with continued growth through regular updates. Energy Citations includes bibliographic records of literature in disciplines of interest to DOE such as chemistry, physics, materials, environmental science, geology, engineering, mathematics, climatology, oceanography, computer science and related disciplines. It includes citations to report literature, conference papers, journal articles, books, dissertations, and patents.

hash.name: Forestry On-line Bibliographies - University of Minnesota

meta.more-info:
Four databases produced by the Forestry Library of the University of Minnesota:
1) Social Sciences in Forestry Bibliography; 1985 - present
Subjects indexed include legislation, policy and planning, management,
economic development, etc., as applied to general forestry, forest management, forest industries, forest goods and services.

2) Trail Planning, Construction and Maintenance: A Bibliography; 1984 - present Indexes publications relating to the planning, design, construction, and maintenance of all types of trails. Includes trail use studies.

3) Tropical Forest Conservation and Development: A Bibliography; 1992 - present Subjects indexed include: Tropical forest resources; deforestation; conservation; indigenous peoples; management; policy; trade and industrial development; nontimber forest products; research, education, and training; and history.

4) Urban Forestry Bibliography; 1982 - present
Indexes publications relating to the history of urban forestry; urban forest
legislation; the benefits of urban forests; selection and planting of trees;
maintenance of the urban forest; planning and management; and urban forestry programs.

hash.title: Forestry On-line Bibliographies - University of Minnesota
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for brief description about it.
Four databases produced by the Forestry Library of the University of Minnesota:
1) Social Sciences in Forestry Bibliography; 1985 - present
Subjects indexed include legislation, policy and planning, management,

2) Trail Planning, Construction and Maintenance: A Bibliography; 1984 - present Indexes publications relating to the planning, design, construction, and maintenance of all types of trails. Includes trail use studies.

3) Tropical Forest Conservation and Development: A Bibliography; 1992 - present Subjects indexed include: Tropical forest resources; deforestation; conservation; indigenous peoples; management; policy; trade and industrial development; nontimber forest products; research, education, and training; and history.
