Indexes publications relating to the history of urban forestry; urban forest
legislation; the benefits of urban forests; selection and planting of trees;
maintenance of the urban forest; planning and management; and urban forestry programs.

hash.name: GENE-TOX: Genetic Toxicology

meta.more-info: GENE-TOX program was established to select assay systems for evaluation, review data in the scientific literature,recommend proper testing protocols and evaluation procedures for these systems.

hash.title: GENE-TOX: Genetic Toxicology
hash.databasedescription:
GENE-TOX is a toxicology data file of the National Library of Medicine's (NLM) Toxicology Data Network (TOXNET®). It is created by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and contains genetic toxicology (mutagenicity) test data, resulting from expert peer review of the open scientific literature, on some 3000 chemicals.
GENE-TOX program was established to select assay systems for evaluation, review data in the scientific literature,recommend proper testing protocols and evaluation procedures for these systems.

hash.name: GEOSCAN
hash.title: GEOSCAN
hash.databasedescription: GEOSCAN is a bibliographic database containing more than 40,000 records covering all the publications of the Geological Survey of Canada. Contributions by GSC staff to external publications have been included since 1986.

hash.name: InCites Journal Citation Reports (JCR)
hash.title: InCites Journal Citation Reports (JCR)
hash.databasedescription:
Journal Citation Reports (JCR) provides citation data for journals in the
science, technology, and social sciences.

hash.name: Kew Bibliographic Databases

meta.more-info: There is no charge for using the KBD and you may carry out a simple search, retrieving a limited number of references, without registering. Registered users can access a much larger number of records at a time, search just the data sets they are interested in, download selected records, save searches for repeated use and perform more complex searches.

hash.title: Kew Bibliographic Databases
hash.databasedescription:
The Kew Bibliographic Databases is a combined searching tool giving you access to three bibliographic databases: KR - The Kew Record of Taxonomic Literature, PMBD - the Plant Micromorphological Bibliographic Database and EBBD - the Economic Botany Bibliographic Database.


There is no charge for using the KBD and you may carry out a simple search, retrieving a limited number of references, without registering. Registered users can access a much larger number of records at a time, search just the data sets they are interested in, download selected records, save searches for repeated use and perform more complex searches.

hash.name: National Ag Safety Database
hash.title: National Ag Safety Database
hash.databasedescription: NASD is an information clearinghouse for agricultural safety related documents. It is a collection of publications about agricultural safety and helath. NASD contains many kinds of informational materials, including fact sheets, training materials, PowerPoint presentations, video references, and complete online videos.

hash.name: Northern Contaminants Publications Database
hash.title: Northern Contaminants Publications Database
hash.databasedescription: Publications dealing with contaminants in traditionally harvested foods in northern Canada

hash.name: Oxford English Dictionary (OED)
hash.title: Oxford English Dictionary (OED)
hash.databasedescription: The electronic version of the Oxford English Dictionary.

hash.name: Plants Database [USDA]
hash.title: Plants Database [USDA]
hash.databasedescription: Provides standardized information about the vascular plants, mosses, liverworts, hornworts, and lichens of the U.S. and its territories.

hash.name: PlantSCIENCEnetBASE
hash.title: PlantSCIENCEnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Full-text handbooks, and texts on agriculture & agronomy, botany & plant science, crop science, entomology, evolution & natural history, microbiology, and soil science.

hash.name: PolarInfo

meta.more-info:
This database is particularly strong in the history of northern exploration and current topics such as native landclaims, native health and educational issues, mining, and the environmental impacts of development in the north.


Types of materials indexed include articles from journals, northern newspapers, native newspapers, newsletters, selected conference proceedings, selected annual and government reports, and other grey literature.

This index is best searched by Keyword.

PolarInfo includes materials published from January 1996 to to June 2004. To access older materials (back to 1972) or more recent materials (July 2004-) use the

Arctic and Antarctic regions database

hash.title: PolarInfo
hash.databasedescription:
PolarInfo (1996 to to June 2004) is a multidisciplinary collection of references to northern and native subjects. All subject areas are covered including health, education, law, business, political science, geology, cold regions engineering, vegetation, and wildlife.
This database is particularly strong in the history of northern exploration and current topics such as native landclaims, native health and educational issues, mining, and the environmental impacts of development in the north.


Types of materials indexed include articles from journals, northern newspapers, native newspapers, newsletters, selected conference proceedings, selected annual and government reports, and other grey literature.

This index is best searched by Keyword.

PolarInfo includes materials published from January 1996 to to June 2004. To access older materials (back to 1972) or more recent materials (July 2004-) use the

Arctic and Antarctic regions database

hash.name: Science.gov
hash.title: Science.gov
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to scientific information provided by the U.S. government.

hash.name: ScienceDirect
hash.title: ScienceDirect
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to the fulltext of journals from Elsevier.

hash.name: SIRIC (Soybean Insect Research Information Center)
hash.title: SIRIC (Soybean Insect Research Information Center)
hash.databasedescription: SIRIC (Soybean Insect Research Information Center) collects and indexes the world's research literature on soybean-related arthropods.

hash.name: The William C. Wonders Map Collection Database

meta.more-info:
Atlases, gazetteers and other cartographic reference materials are catalogued in The NEOS Libraries' Catalogue. Post-1994 monographic maps and new series in print or electronic format are catalogued in The NEOS Libraries' Catalogue. Some pre-1995 maps may also appear in the NEOS Libraries' Catalogue.

The airphoto collection of over one million items is not included in this database.

hash.title: The William C. Wonders Map Collection Database
hash.databasedescription:
The William C. Wonders Map Collection Database is an electronic index to the pre-1995 maps in the William C. Wonders Map Collection. Begun as an electronic version of the catalogue records in 26 historical handwritten binders located in the William C. Wonders Map Collection on the fourth floor of Cameron Library, Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, it continues to be augmented by recently acquired and processed pre-1995 maps.


Atlases, gazetteers and other cartographic reference materials are catalogued in The NEOS Libraries' Catalogue. Post-1994 monographic maps and new series in print or electronic format are catalogued in The NEOS Libraries' Catalogue. Some pre-1995 maps may also appear in the NEOS Libraries' Catalogue.

The airphoto collection of over one million items is not included in this database.

hash.name: United Nations Environment Programme databases

meta.more-info:
Databases include:
  1. UNEP.net - search portal to over 150 databases of environmental information, including case studies, conference proceedings, maps, policy documents, data sets, and State of the Environment reports.
  2. UNEP-WCMC Species Databases
  3. Protected Areas - information by country
  4. GEO Data Portal - holds more than 400 different variables, as national, subregional, regional and global statistics or as geospatial data sets (maps), covering themes like Freshwater, Population, Forests, Emissions, Climate, Disasters, Health and GDP. Display them on-the-fly as maps, graphs, raw values or download the data in different formats.

hash.title: United Nations Environment Programme databases
hash.databasedescription:
Click on "more" below for brief description about United Nations Environment Programme's databases.
Databases include:
  1. UNEP.net - search portal to over 150 databases of environmental information, including case studies, conference proceedings, maps, policy documents, data sets, and State of the Environment reports.
  2. UNEP-WCMC Species Databases
  3. Protected Areas - information by country
  4. GEO Data Portal - holds more than 400 different variables, as national, subregional, regional and global statistics or as geospatial data sets (maps), covering themes like Freshwater, Population, Forests, Emissions, Climate, Disasters, Health and GDP. Display them on-the-fly as maps, graphs, raw values or download the data in different formats.

hash.name: CBCA Reference and Current Events
hash.title: CBCA Reference and Current Events
hash.databasedescription: Indexes and includes selected full-text from Canadian academic and general interest Canadian periodicals, ranging from academic titles to special interest publications to general magazines. The academic titles include the most prominent journals from the social sciences, humanities, and sciences. Other magazines focus on opinion, public policy, children/youth, lifestyles, arts and culture, health, regional concerns, etc.

hash.name: DOE Information Bridge
hash.title: DOE Information Bridge
hash.databasedescription: The DOE Information Bridge provides access to full-text and bibliographic records of Department of Energy (DOE) research and development reports in physics, chemistry, materials, biology, environmental sciences, energy technologies, engineering, computer and information science, renewable energy, and other topics.

hash.name: ENGnetBASE - Engineering Database Online
hash.title: ENGnetBASE - Engineering Database Online
hash.databasedescription: Full-text engineering handbooks. Coverage includes: aerospace, biomedical, chemical, civil, computer, electrical, electronics, industrial and manufacturing, lasers & optics, materials, mechanical, nanoscience & nanotech, operations research, packaging and systems engineering.

hash.name: ENVIROnetBASE
hash.title: ENVIROnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Full-text handbook database covering ecology and natural history, environmental modelling and systems analysis, environmental and ecological risk assessment, environmental and occupational health and safety, environmental chemistry and toxicology, environmental engineering, environmental law, management and compliance, landscape ecology, remote sensing, GIS, and mapping, resource management and sustainability, turfgrass science and engineering, water science, technology and engineering.

hash.name: IBSS: International Bibliography of the Social Sciences
hash.title: IBSS: International Bibliography of the Social Sciences
hash.databasedescription: The International Bibliography of the Social Sciences (IBSS) includes bibliographic references to journal articles and to books, reviews and selected chapters dating back to 1951. It includes broad coverage of international material and incorporates over 100 languages and countries. Over 2,700 journals are regularly indexed and some 7,000 books are included each year. Abstracts are provided for half of all current journal articles.

hash.name: National Pollutant Release Inventory (NPRI)

meta.more-info: In addition, the NPRI supports a number of environmental initiatives by providing information that assists governments and others in identifying priorities for action, encourages industry to take voluntary measures to reduce releases, allows for tracking of progress in the reduction of releases, and supports a number of regulatory initiatives across Canada.

hash.title: National Pollutant Release Inventory (NPRI)
hash.databasedescription:
The National Pollutant Release Inventory (NPRI) of Environment Canada is the only legislated, nation-wide, publicly-accessible inventory of its type in Canada. The NPRI provides Canadians with access to pollutant release information for facilities located in their communities.
In addition, the NPRI supports a number of environmental initiatives by providing information that assists governments and others in identifying priorities for action, encourages industry to take voluntary measures to reduce releases, allows for tracking of progress in the reduction of releases, and supports a number of regulatory initiatives across Canada.

hash.name: Repère

meta.more-info: Repère also provides full-text of approximately 9,000 articles from 40 periodicals, since 1993. Acess to fulltext and currency varies on a title by title basis.

hash.title: Repère
hash.databasedescription:
Repère (1980 to the present) is a bibliographic database produced in Montreal. This database indexes more than 519 periodicals published in the French language, and it covers all subject fields: art, current news, literature, politics, social sciences, etc. The periodicals indexed come mainly from Quebec, but also from other parts of Canada, France, Belgium, and Switzerland.


Repère also provides full-text of approximately 9,000 articles from 40 periodicals, since 1993. Acess to fulltext and currency varies on a title by title basis.

hash.name: 2006 Community Profiles

meta.more-info: Census tracts are small, relatively stable geographic areas that usually have a population of 2,500 to 8,000 and are located in census metropolitan areas (CMAs) and larger census agglomerations (CAs). Also see 2001 Community Profiles at http://www.library.ualberta.ca/databases/databaseinfo/index.cfm

hash.title: 2006 Community Profiles
hash.databasedescription:
2006 Community Profiles contains statistical data from the 2006 Canadian Census of Population conducted by Statistics Canada. Statistical profiles of Canadian communities are presented, highlighting education, income, work, families, dwellings, and general population demographics. New for 2006: Census Tract (CT) Profiles provide 2006 Census data for census tracts.
Census tracts are small, relatively stable geographic areas that usually have a population of 2,500 to 8,000 and are located in census metropolitan areas (CMAs) and larger census agglomerations (CAs). Also see 2001 Community Profiles at http://www.library.ualberta.ca/databases/databaseinfo/index.cfm

hash.name: Canada NewsWire
hash.title: Canada NewsWire
hash.databasedescription: Full text news releases (available in English and French) are searchable by keyword, date, organizations, stock symbols, industries, categories and subjects. Includes current year plus 24 months past.

hash.name: Canadian Business Patterns

meta.more-info: Since the December 1998 reference period, these data are also presented using the North American Industry Classification System (tables at the 2, 3, 4 and 6-digit level). A concordance table showing the relationships between both classification systems is included with the product.

hash.title: Canadian Business Patterns
hash.databasedescription:
Canadian Business Patterns contains data that reflect counts of business establishments by: 9 employment size ranges, including "indeterminate" (as of December 1997); geography groupings: province/territory, census division, census subdivision, census metropolitan area and census agglomeration; and Standard Industrial Classification which classifies each establishment in Canada into a specific industry (tables at the 1, 2, 3 and 4-digit level).
Since the December 1998 reference period, these data are also presented using the North American Industry Classification System (tables at the 2, 3, 4 and 6-digit level). A concordance table showing the relationships between both classification systems is included with the product.

hash.title: Canadian Newsstand Complete
hash.databasedescription:
Canadian Newsstand indexes and provides fulltext access to major Canadian newspapers. Full text is available for the articles and transcripts but graphical material (photos, illustrations, graphs, etc.) is excluded. Classified ads, advertisements, and stock market reports are also excluded.

Coverage extends to a large number of newspapers, including the following:

hash.name: Canadian Research Index (Microlog)
hash.title: Canadian Research Index (Microlog)
hash.databasedescription:
Canadian Research Index (1982 to the present) provides access to Canadian government publications at the municipal, provincial and federal levels. It includes policy papers, scientific and technical reports, statistical reports, annual reports, etc.



The Microlog number can be used to locate the documents, which are available in the Microlog microfiche collection. The Microlog microfiche collection is located on the 2nd floor of Rutherford Library North.

hash.name: Census of Canada, 2006
hash.title: Census of Canada, 2006
hash.databasedescription: Contains demographic socio-economic statistics from the 2006 Census of Population conducted by Statistics Canada. A profile of Canadians is presented, providing general population information as well as statistics on education, income, work, families, dwellings, and much more. The 2006 Census publication is in continuous process; data will become available as they are officially released by Statistics Canada.

hash.name: E-Library (Conference Board of Canada)
hash.title: E-Library (Conference Board of Canada)
hash.databasedescription: Includes all Conference Board of Canada research documents dating back to 1998.

hash.name: Economist Intelligence Unit
hash.title: Economist Intelligence Unit
hash.databasedescription:
The databases provides access to:

  • Economist.com - current and past issues of The Economist
  • Analysis of risk factors in 150 countries
  • Country analysis - economic, political and business analysis

hash.name: Factiva

meta.more-info: It also provides American congressional committee hearings, publications of selected U.S. government departments and agencies,The Federal Register and state laws and regulations, publications of U.S. government watchdog organizations, and selected international government publications.

hash.title: Factiva
hash.databasedescription:
Factiva includes full text of newspapers from around the world in addition to Canadian and American newspapers, Dow Jones & Reuters newswires, business journals, market research reports, analyst reports and web sites.
It also provides American congressional committee hearings, publications of selected U.S. government departments and agencies,The Federal Register and state laws and regulations, publications of U.S. government watchdog organizations, and selected international government publications.

hash.name: FinancialPost.com

meta.more-info:
The FP Advisor module provides access to the following products:

  • Analyzer Search - retrieve, manipulate and analyze fundamental data for over 1400 Canadian companies.
  • Company Snapshots - BEST PLACE to start. Each snapshot provides an overview of the company including directors, intercorporate ownership, industry news and articles from the National Post, in addition to links to all databases listed below.
  • Corporate Surveys - corporate information on Canadian publicly-traded companies.
  • Dividends - up to 3 years of dividend history for Canadian companies.
  • Historical Reports - in-depth information on operations, capital expenditures, price ranges, etc. for the top 450 Canadian companies.
  • Industry Reports - analysis of 30+ industries including industry ratios, quarterly results of included companies and industry recommendations.
  • Investor Reports - profiles and investment assessments for Canada's leading 700+ public companies.
  • Mergers & Acquisitions - Financial Post Crosbie Mergers & Acquisitions in Canada contains daily updated information on mergers, acquisitions and divestitures involving Canadian companies. Data goes back to 1994.
  • New Issues - overview of the IPO and new issues activities of Canadian companies, governments and agencies back to 1993.
  • Predecessor & Defunct - information on name changes, amalgamations, takeovers, acquisitions and dissolutions of publicly-traded companies, dating back to 1929.
  • Financial Post Directory of Directors - a searchable directory of Canadian directors and executives of Canadian companies who reside in Canada.

The sources listed below are accessible via the Additional Databases option:

  • ProFile Canada - information on Canada’s largest 35,000+ public and private companies.
  • Owen Media Partner’s Canadian Trade Index - information on Canada’s largest 25,000 manufacturers.
  • Canadian Federal Corporations & Directors - information on 400,000+ federally incorporated companies.
  • Canadian Corporate Names - summary information relating to federally incorporated companies included in the Canadian Federal Incorporations & Directors database.
  • Equifax Commercial Law Record - public information on commercial legal suits and judgements from Canadian courts.

hash.name: Globe Unlimited
hash.title: Globe Unlimited
hash.databasedescription:
Globe Unlimited provides complete access to the Globe & Mail web content. This includes:

  • Unlimited access to hundreds of stories a day that do not appear in print
  • Continuously updated
  • Exclusive subscriber-only content such as Streetwise, Inside The Market, World Insider, and Politics Insider
  • Monitor stocks and markets using our suite of investor tools and reports
  • More than 1,000 videos every month
  • Delivered on all platforms: Web, smartphone and tablet

meta.more-info: For Statistics Canada publications that are available directly from the Statistics Canada website, please see Statistics Canada Free Internet Publications

hash.title: Statistics Canada Downloadable Publications
hash.databasedescription:
Statistics Canada Downloadable Publications provides links to Statistics Canada publications that are available through the government of Canada Depository Services Program on the Internet. The publications include a wide variety of statistics, such as demographics, employment, trade, crime, economic indicators, retail sales, communications and much more.
For Statistics Canada publications that are available directly from the Statistics Canada website, please see Statistics Canada Free Internet Publications

hash.name: WCID-Winspear Canadian Industry Database

meta.more-info:
Coverage has been limited to:
  1. The sources held in the Winspear Business Reference Library and the Science
    and Technology Library, University of Alberta, Edmonton, Alberta.
  2. Selected relevant internet sites;
  3. Specific trade associations;
  4. Various government documents, predominantly Statistics Canada or Industry
    Canada sources, held either in the Rutherford Library, the University of Alberta
    or on government websites.

The database is not meant to be a comprehensive index to all industry sectors
within Canada, nor is it meant to provide geographic coverage for all of Canada.
Its focus has always been to address the research needs of the University of
Alberta's students and faculty.

hash.title: WCID-Winspear Canadian Industry Database
hash.databasedescription:
The scope of the database is to cover sources of information pertaining to
Canada and the Province of Alberta industry sectors.
Coverage has been limited to:
  1. The sources held in the Winspear Business Reference Library and the Science
    and Technology Library, University of Alberta, Edmonton, Alberta.
  2. Selected relevant internet sites;
  3. Specific trade associations;
  4. Various government documents, predominantly Statistics Canada or Industry
    Canada sources, held either in the Rutherford Library, the University of Alberta
    or on government websites.

The database is not meant to be a comprehensive index to all industry sectors
within Canada, nor is it meant to provide geographic coverage for all of Canada.
Its focus has always been to address the research needs of the University of
Alberta's students and faculty.

hash.name: CGSB Textile Test Methods
hash.title: CGSB Textile Test Methods
hash.databasedescription: CGSB Textile Test Methods is a set of standard methods for the technical analysis, determination, and testing of characteristics of textiles, fabrics, yarns, wool, threads, and related fibres and materials. The Methods are approved by the Canadian General Standards Board.

hash.name: ClinicalKey

meta.more-info:
All of the topic summaries from the FirstConsult point of care tool are included, as are references to articles indexed in Medline, and clinical practice guidelines.

  • You must be signed on to a free ClinicalKey account (information on acccounts is available here) in order to download PDF versions of book chapters.
  • First Consult for iPhone - To access the full content of First Consult, you need to register for a free ClinicalKey account. Information on this can be found here.
  • User Guide - Available here.

hash.title: ClinicalKey
hash.databasedescription:
Clinical Key integrates much of Elsevier's medical and surgical content into one online resource, giving physicians access to large numbers of books, journals (including the Clinics series), videos and images.
All of the topic summaries from the FirstConsult point of care tool are included, as are references to articles indexed in Medline, and clinical practice guidelines.

  • You must be signed on to a free ClinicalKey account (information on acccounts is available here) in order to download PDF versions of book chapters.
  • First Consult for iPhone - To access the full content of First Consult, you need to register for a free ClinicalKey account. Information on this can be found here.
  • User Guide - Available here.

hash.name: Entrez, the Life Sciences Search Engine

meta.more-info: It also cross-searches following NCBI databses: the structurally-oriented databases, Structures, the Conserved Domain Database, 3D-Domains; the NCBI Taxonomy, Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO), Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs), Population Sets, Genomes, Sequence Tagged Sites, UniGene, Gene-centered information & the NCBI Website

hash.title: Entrez, the Life Sciences Search Engine
hash.databasedescription:
The Entrez search and retrieval system cross-searches the following NCBI (National Center for Biotechnical Information )databases: Nucleotide and Protein; the literature databases, such as PubMed®, PMC, Books, OMIM™, Journals, and MeSH.
It also cross-searches following NCBI databses: the structurally-oriented databases, Structures, the Conserved Domain Database, 3D-Domains; the NCBI Taxonomy, Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO), Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs), Population Sets, Genomes, Sequence Tagged Sites, UniGene, Gene-centered information & the NCBI Website

hash.name: Images.MD
hash.title: Images.MD
hash.databasedescription: Please Note: The Library's subscription to Images.MD ceased December 31, 2006. For other sources of images, please see the Guide to Medical Images and Illustrations.

hash.name: The Medical Algorithms Project
hash.title: The Medical Algorithms Project
hash.databasedescription: Contains thousands of medical algorithms. A Medical Algorithm is any computation, formula, survey, or look-up table, useful in healthcare.

hash.name: National Guideline Clearinghouse (US)
hash.title: National Guideline Clearinghouse (US)

hash.name: TRIP: Turning Research Into Practice
hash.title: TRIP: Turning Research Into Practice
hash.databasedescription: Centre for Research Support, Wales; provides "an amalgamation of 26 databases of hyperlinks from �Evidence-based� sites around the world.

hash.name: AccessMedicine
hash.title: AccessMedicine
hash.databasedescription: E-books in clinical medicine and basic science, including Harrison's Online, Hurst's The Heart, Current Medical Diagnosis and Treatment, Metabolic and Molecular Bases of Inherited Disease (MMBID) and other major texts, with updates and a drug index.

hash.name: Books@Ovid
hash.title: Books@Ovid
hash.databasedescription: Books@Ovid provides cross-searchable and browseable access to the full text of a wide array of medical, nursing, pharmacy and health sciences text books.

hash.name: Canadian Medical Association CPG Infobase
hash.title: Canadian Medical Association CPG Infobase

hash.name: Cochrane Library

meta.more-info:
The Cochrane Library includes:

  • The Cochrane Controlled Trials Register - Bibliographic information on controlled trials
  • The Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews - Regularly updated reviews of the effects of health care
  • Cochrane Methodology Register - Database of studies relevant to the methods of systematic reviews of healthcare and social interventions.
  • Database of Abstracts of Reviews of Effectiveness - Critical assessments and structured abstracts of good systematic reviews published elsewhere
  • Economic Evaluation Database - Contains summaries of economic evaluations of healthcare interventions.
  • Health Technology Assessment Database - Contains summaries of completed and ongoing health technology assessments from around the world

In addition, there are links to the Cochrane
Collaboration and detailed resources essential to the preparation of systematic reviews, to a critical understanding of clinical literature, and to understanding the concepts behind evidence-based health care.

  • Quick Start Guide

hash.title: Cochrane Library
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for brief description about Cochrane Library
The Cochrane Library includes:

  • The Cochrane Controlled Trials Register - Bibliographic information on controlled trials
  • The Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews - Regularly updated reviews of the effects of health care

  • Database of Abstracts of Reviews of Effectiveness - Critical assessments and structured abstracts of good systematic reviews published elsewhere
  • Economic Evaluation Database - Contains summaries of economic evaluations of healthcare interventions.

In addition, there are links to the Cochrane
Collaboration and detailed resources essential to the preparation of systematic reviews, to a critical understanding of clinical literature, and to understanding the concepts behind evidence-based health care.

  • Quick Start Guide

hash.name: DARE: Database of Abstracts of Reviews of Effects (NHS CRD)
hash.title: DARE: Database of Abstracts of Reviews of Effects (NHS CRD)
hash.databasedescription: From the National Health Service in Britain, a database of systematic reviews of the effectiveness of health care interventions.

hash.name: E-medicine
hash.title: E-medicine
hash.databasedescription: Free access to reference articles and medical texts in emergency medicine, and many other specialities via the Specialties tab. Please note that access to images and multimedia materials requires registration and payment.

hash.name: RxTx

meta.more-info: RxTx (formerly e-Therapeutics+) integrates content from CPhA's Therapeutic Choices and e-CPS(online version of Compendium of Pharmaceuticals and Specialties or CPS). It is augmented by a wide and continuously growing range of external references to create a centralized drug resource for drug therapy information.

hash.title: RxTx
hash.databasedescription:
NOTE: Please click on "Log Out" when finished.
NOTE: Downloads to handheld devices are not available
RxTx (formerly e-Therapeutics+) integrates content from CPhA's Therapeutic Choices and e-CPS(online version of Compendium of Pharmaceuticals and Specialties or CPS). It is augmented by a wide and continuously growing range of external references to create a centralized drug resource for drug therapy information.

hash.name: EBMR: Evidence Based Medicine Reviews (OVID)
hash.title: EBMR: Evidence Based Medicine Reviews (OVID)
hash.databasedescription:
OVID's Evidence-Based Medicine Reviews (EBMR) collection provides evidence-based information on clinical topics for health
professionals.

hash.name: MedicinesComplete
hash.title: MedicinesComplete
hash.databasedescription:
Online version of major pharmacy handbooks:

  • AHFS
  • British National Formulary
  • Clarke's analysis of drugs and poisons
  • Dietary supplements
  • Herbal medicines
  • Martindale, the complete drug reference
  • Stockley's drug interactions

hash.name: TOXNET
hash.title: TOXNET
hash.databasedescription: Toxnet is the U.S. National Library of Medicine cluster of databases on toxicology, hazardous materials, and related topics.

hash.name: Annual Bibliography of English Language and Literature
hash.title: Annual Bibliography of English Language and Literature
hash.databasedescription: Contains over 830,000 records covering monographs, periodical articles, critical editions of literary works, book reviews, collections of essays and doctoral dissertations published anywhere in the world from 1920 onwards.

hash.name: Le grand dictionnaire terminologique

meta.more-info:
GDT is mostly an electronic dictionary English-French, French-English, that is presented in three sections:
  1. Banque de terminologie: More than 800,000 terms available in all fields, but especially in industry and technology. 85% of these terms are bilingual (English-French/French-English). It is the most used section of GDT.
  2. Banque documentaire: Gives access to more than 13,000 publications on terminology.
  3. Français au bureau: Office de la langue française’s publication (latest edition) is available full-text.One can find rules of business correspondance in French, and telephone protocol.

hash.title: Le grand dictionnaire terminologique
hash.databasedescription:
Le grand dictionnaire terminologique (GDT) is produced by the Office de la langue française of the government of Quebec.
GDT is mostly an electronic dictionary English-French, French-English, that is presented in three sections:
  1. Banque de terminologie: More than 800,000 terms available in all fields, but especially in industry and technology. 85% of these terms are bilingual (English-French/French-English). It is the most used section of GDT.
  2. Banque documentaire: Gives access to more than 13,000 publications on terminology.
  3. Français au bureau: Office de la langue française’s publication (latest edition) is available full-text.One can find rules of business correspondance in French, and telephone protocol.

hash.name: Literature Online

meta.more-info:
This collection includes:
  • 20th Century African-American Poetry - A database of modern and contemporary African-American poetry from the early twentieth century to the present. Features 10,000 poems by around 70 of the most important African-American poets of the last century.
  • 20th Century American Poetry - Includes 52,000 poems drawn from 750 volumes by over 300 poets, including Adrienne Rich, Andrei Codrescu, Ezra Pound, William Carlos Williams, Denise Levertov, Wallace Stevens, Langston Hughes, Lucille Clifton, and Cathy Song.
  • 20th Century English Poetry - A collection of 598 volumes of poetry by 283 poets from 1900 to the present day, including W. B. Yeats, Rudyard Kipling, Robert Graves, A. E. Housman, John Betjeman, Fleur Adcock, Tony Harrison, Benjamin Zephaniah and Carol Ann Duffy, and incorporating the poets in The Faber Poetry Library.
  • African-American Poetry (1750-1900) - Nearly 3,000 poems written by African-American poets in the late eighteenth and nineteenth centuries.
  • American Poetry (1600-1900) - Over 40,000 poems by more than 200 American poets from the Colonial Period to the early twentieth century.
  • American Drama (1714-1915) - Contains more than 1,100 dramatic works from the early eighteenth century up to the beginning of the twentieth. Includes: plays in verse, farces, melodramas, minstrel shows, realist plays, frontier plays, temperance dialogues and a range of other genres. Major dramatists include Clyde Fitch, Augustin Daly, David Belasco, James Herne and Joaquin Miller.
  • Annual Bibliography of English Language and Literature (1920-2002) - contains over 830,000 records covering monographs, periodical articles, critical editions of literary works, book reviews, collections of essays and doctoral dissertations published anywhere in the world from 1920 onwards.
  • Bibliography of American Literature - Nearly 40,000 records of the literary works of approximately 300 American writers from the period of the Revolution to 1930
  • The Bible in English - twenty-one versions of the Bible, including thirteen complete Bibles and full New Testaments in five other versions. Particular attention has been given to the Renaissance period. Texts from the Protestant, Roman Catholic and non-conformist traditions are represented.
  • Canadian Poetry - Created in partnership with the Electronic Text Centre at the University of New Brunswick Libraries. Contains the full text of more than 12,000 poems by 142 poets including Bliss Carman, Isabella Valancy Crawford and Archibald Lampman, and will soon offer a comprehensive survey of Canadian poetry from the seventeenth century to the early twentieth.
  • Early American Fiction 1789-1850 - Provides both images and text. Presently includes 440 titles by 80 authors, including first printings of works by James Fenimore Cooper, Edgar Allan Poe, Robert Montgomery Bird, Washington Irving, Catharine Sedgwick, and Nathaniel Hawthorne. Published jointly with the University of Virginia Library.
  • Early American Fiction 1789-1875 - When complete, Early American Fiction 1789-1875 will extend the coverage of the first Early American Fiction collection by twenty-five years (1851-1875) and will incorporate the full text of more than 250 additional titles and over 60 new authors, including Louisa May Alcott, Mark Twain, Herman Melville and Thomas Bailey Aldrich, as well as a host of minor writers of the period. Early American Fiction 1789-1875 will include more than 750 works of fiction by more than 130 authors.
  • Early English prose fiction - over 200 works of fictional prose from the period 1500-1700. It includes Elizabethan fiction, Jest Books, collections of short pieces and novellas, Restoration fiction and works of popular fiction.
  • Editions and Adaptations of Shakespeare - eleven major editions from the First Folio to the Cambridge Edition of 1863-6, twenty-four contemporary printings of individual plays, selected apocrypha and related works, and over 100 adaptations, sequels and burlesques.
  • Eighteenth century fiction - 77 works of English prose by writers from the British Isles published between 1700 and 1780.
  • English Drama (1280-1915) - A combination of Chadwyck-Healey�s English Verse Drama and English Prose Drama full-text databases. 4,000 plays by 1,200 authors from the late thirteenth century to the early twentieth century.
  • English poetry - 165,000 poems from the period 1100 to 1900.
  • English Poetry, Second Edition - Adds more than 20,000 poems from several new categories to the first edition, and contains more than 183,000 poems by over 2,700 poets. Covers English verse from the 8th century to the early 20th, and offers representation both of the literary heritages of Commonwealth and ex-colonial countries and of the poetic legacies of English writers who have only been brought back to scholarly attention during the last thirty years.
  • The Faber Poetry Library - A collection of some of the most influential poets of the twentieth century. The Faber list spans the seventy-year history of this major publishing house, and includes the poetry of James Joyce, Siegfried Sassoon, T.S. Eliot, Ted Hughes, Sylvia Plath and Seamus Heaney. In total The Faber Poetry Library contains 140 volumes by 50 poets.
  • Nineteenth-Century Fiction - 250 novels from the period 1782 to 1903, including works by all the major Victorian novelists such as Dickens, Thackeray, the Brontës, Eliot and Hardy, as well as the landmarks of Gothic and other fiction from the Romantic period.
  • Webster's Third New International Dictionary, Unabridged - America's premier lexicographical work, the 1993 edition is published here in electronic form for the first time. A dictionary of the English language containing 450,000 vocabulary entries.

hash.title: Literature Online
hash.databasedescription:
Literature Online is a multi-part collection containing the full text of various works in English and American poetry, drama and prose, as well as full-text literature journals and other criticism and reference resources.
This collection includes:
  • 20th Century African-American Poetry - A database of modern and contemporary African-American poetry from the early twentieth century to the present. Features 10,000 poems by around 70 of the most important African-American poets of the last century.

  • Webster's Third New International Dictionary, Unabridged - America's premier lexicographical work, the 1993 edition is published here in electronic form for the first time. A dictionary of the English language containing 450,000 vocabulary entries.

hash.name: Literature Resource Center
hash.title: Literature Resource Center
hash.databasedescription: Contains biographies, bibliographies and critical analysis of authors from every age and literary discipline, including more than 90,000 novelists, poets, essayists, journalists and other writers, with in-depth coverage of 2,000 of the most-studied authors

hash.name: MLA International Bibliography

meta.more-info: Includes access to the latest version of the MLA Directory of Periodicals.

hash.title: MLA International Bibliography
hash.databasedescription:
MLA International Bibliography (1926 to the present) covers literature in English and in other modern languages; linguistics; folklore. It includes books (and chapters in books), journal articles, conference papers, and dissertations concerning general and comparative literature, linguistics in general and of all modern languages, all modern literatures, and folklore. No abstracts are provided, and there are no listings for book reviews.


Includes access to the latest version of the MLA Directory of Periodicals.

hash.name: Eureka.cc (Newscan)
hash.title: Eureka.cc (Newscan)
hash.databasedescription:
Updated daily, NEWSCAN allows fulltext searching within a number of French- and English-language periodicals and newspapers. Searches can be done within a specific title through the Advanced Search function, limited by place or language of publication or extended to all titles through a general search. Please note that a 24-hour embargo is in effect on all daily newspapers (a one-issue embargo applies to all other sources).




The NEWSCAN interface is available in English.

hash.name: TERMIUM Plus

meta.more-info: Accessible to all federal departments and agencies on-line through the Bureau's Extranet site, TERMIUM® has become the federal government's standardization reference tool of choice. TERMIUM® also includes the following resources: Le guide du rédacteur, The Canadian Style, Chroniques de la langue, Clés du français pratique, ConjugArt, Dictionnaire des cooccurrences, Favourite Articles, Juridictionnaire, Le Bellerive, Lexique analogique and Lexique analogique.

hash.title: TERMIUM Plus
hash.databasedescription:
More than a dictionary, TERMIUM® is a linguistic database of French, English and Spanish terms. Forty full-time terminologists keep TERMIUM® current, updating it with the latest terms, trade names, statute titles, abbreviations, acronyms, and names of national and international organizations. What's more, it also provides definitions, contexts, examples and observations.


Accessible to all federal departments and agencies on-line through the Bureau's Extranet site, TERMIUM® has become the federal government's standardization reference tool of choice. TERMIUM® also includes the following resources: Le guide du rédacteur, The Canadian Style, Chroniques de la langue, Clés du français pratique, ConjugArt, Dictionnaire des cooccurrences, Favourite Articles, Juridictionnaire, Le Bellerive, Lexique analogique and Lexique analogique.

hash.name: Érudit
hash.title: Érudit
hash.databasedescription: Érudit promouvoit et diffuse des revues, des livres, des thèses et des prépublications résultant de la recherche universitaire. Elle accueille les revues universitaires quel que soit l'éditeur et le pays d'origine. Comprend un large éventail de disciplines des sciences humaines et sociales, ainsi que des sciences naturelles.

hash.name: Abstracts in Anthropology
hash.title: Abstracts in Anthropology
hash.databasedescription: Covers a broad spectrum of current anthropological topics including human speech, physiology, artifacts, history, environment, and social relations.

hash.name: Alexander Street Press Anthropology
hash.title: Alexander Street Press Anthropology
hash.databasedescription: Includes videos in Alexander Street Press's Ethnographic Video Online and Anthropology Online.

hash.name: Anthropology Plus

meta.more-info: The index offers excellent coverage of all core periodicals in the field in addition to local and lesser-known journals

hash.title: Anthropology Plus
hash.databasedescription:
Anthropology Plus contains Anthropological Literature from Harvard University and Anthropological Index, Royal Anthropological Institute from the UK. Anthropology Plus provides extensive worldwide indexing of journal articles, reports, commentaries, edited works, and obituaries in the fields of social, cultural, physical, biological, and linguistic anthropology, ethnology, archaeology, folklore, material culture, and interdisciplinary studies.
The index offers excellent coverage of all core periodicals in the field in addition to local and lesser-known journals

hash.name: AnthroSource
hash.title: AnthroSource
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to journals from the American Anthropological Association.

meta.more-info:
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation
databases:
  • Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)

databases:

hash.name: CAIRN Journals
hash.title: CAIRN Journals
hash.databasedescription: Cairn was formed in 1995 by four European publishing houses (Belin, De Boeck, La Découverte and Erès) and offers access to a comprehensive collection of French language periodicals in the social sciences and humanities disciplines.

hash.name: eHRAF Archaeology
hash.title: eHRAF Archaeology
hash.databasedescription: Cross-cultural database containing descriptive information on archaeological traditions of the world. Source documents include books, articles, and dissertations.

hash.name: Encyclopaedia Universalis
hash.title: Encyclopaedia Universalis
hash.databasedescription: Online version of the Encyclopaedia Universalis.

hash.name: Gender Studies Database

meta.more-info: Source documents include professional journals, conference papers, books, book chapters, government reports, discussion and working papers, theses & dissertations and other sources. Also includes links to selected and websites.

hash.title: Gender Studies Database
hash.databasedescription:
Combines NISC's Women's Studies International and Men's Studies databases with the coverage of sexual diversity issues. Also includes relevant contributions from NISC?s Child Development & Adolescent Studies as well as Family & Society Studies Worldwide databases.
Source documents include professional journals, conference papers, books, book chapters, government reports, discussion and working papers, theses & dissertations and other sources. Also includes links to selected and websites.

hash.name: JSTOR
hash.title: JSTOR
hash.databasedescription:
JSTOR contains fulltext academic journals in the Humanities, Social Sciences, and Sciences. JSTOR provides complete journal backruns from the
date of initial publication up to a date defined, on a publisher by publisher
basis, by a "moving wall". The moving wall is a fixed period of time ranging, in
most cases, from 2 to 5 years, that defines the gap between the most recently
published issue and the date of the most recent issues available in JSTOR.

hash.name: National Archeological Database Reports
hash.title: National Archeological Database Reports
hash.databasedescription: Bibliographic inventory of approximately 240,000 reports on archeological investigation and planning, mostly of limited circulation. This "gray literature" represents a large portion of the primary information available on archeological sites in the U.S. Searchable by state, county, worktype, cultural affiliation, keyword, material, year of publication, title, and author.

hash.name: OAISter
hash.title: OAISter
hash.databasedescription: OAIster is a union catalog of millions of records representing open archive resources that was built by harvesting from open archive collections worldwide using the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH).

hash.name: Revues.org
hash.title: Revues.org
hash.databasedescription: This database federates French humanities and social sciences reviews online. It offers access to periodicals in the humanities and social sciences according to the moving wall principle which varies for each journal.

hash.name: Social Sciences Citation Index

meta.more-info:
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation databases:
  • Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)

  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
  • Science Citation Index Expanded(TM) (1899-present)
  • Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.name: Arctic Blue Books Online
hash.title: Arctic Blue Books Online
hash.databasedescription:
Dating from 1818- 1878, the Arctic Blue Books are volumes consisting of the British Parliamentary Papers relating to arctic exploration. As well as
documenting the exploration of the Canadian Arctic, they contain material relating to topics such as native communities, living conditions on ships, expeditions, meteorological observations, the status of commercial whaling, botanical discoveries, and many other subjects.

hash.name: Early Encounters in North America: Peoples, Cultures and the Environment
hash.title: Early Encounters in North America: Peoples, Cultures and the Environment
hash.databasedescription: Contains letters, diaries, memoirs and accounts of early encounters with North American people. The collection is centered on present-day Canada and the United States with some limited coverage of Mexico.

hash.name: eHRAF World Cultures
hash.title: eHRAF World Cultures
hash.databasedescription: Cross-cultural database containing more than 350,000 pages of descriptive information on cultures and ethnic groups of the world. Source documents include books, articles, and dissertations.

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Forensic Sciences
hash.title: Encyclopedia of Forensic Sciences
hash.databasedescription: Covers medical, chemical, biological, physical and mathematical sciences as they relate to forensic practice as well as forensic jurisprudence.

hash.name: European Views of the Americas: 1493 to 1750
hash.title: European Views of the Americas: 1493 to 1750
hash.databasedescription: Indexes European works written in Europe before 1750 that relate to the Americas. Created from European Americana: A Chronological Guide to Works Printed In Europe Relating to The Americas, 1493-1750.

hash.name: Films on Demand
hash.title: Films on Demand
hash.databasedescription: Contains instructional and educational streaming videos from sources such as Films for the Humanities & Sciences and Cambridge Educational in addition to a number of news outlets such as PBS, CNBC, and National Geographic.

hash.name: Gale NewsVault
hash.title: Gale NewsVault

hash.name: GeoRef
hash.title: GeoRef
hash.databasedescription:
GeoRef (1785 to the present) includes international coverage of the
earth sciences and all aspects of geology and geophysics including archaeology,
fossils, economics, education, engineering and environmental geology,
expeditions, instruments, land use, landfills, soils, geologic hazards
(avalanches, hurricanes, sunsorts, volcanoes, etc.), maps, magnetic fields, and
medical and military geology.

hash.name: Global IDP database
hash.title: Global IDP database
hash.databasedescription: Published by the Norwegian Refugee Council, provides information on internal displacement worldwide.

hash.name: Handbook of Latin American Studies

meta.more-info: Works reviewed include books, journal articles, book chapters, and conference papers in the disciplines of Anthropology (including Archaeology, Ethnohistory and Ethnology), Art, Economics, Geography, Government and Politics, History, International Relations, Literature, Music, Philosophy, and Sociology. Starting with Volume 54, the Handbook also includes a section on Electronic Resources for Latin American Studies. In addition, some of the earlier volumes included other disciplines such as Cartography, Film, Folklore, Law, and so forth. The online indexing is usually ahead by two years of the printed volumes. The Library has the print edition. Call number: F 1410 Z9 L35, housed in Reference stack, Rutherford North 1st Floor.

hash.title: Handbook of Latin American Studies
hash.databasedescription:
The Handbook of Latin American Studies, 1935- , published annually, is a selective annotated bibliography of scholarly works on Latin America. The volumes alternate in coverage between the social sciences and the humanities.
Works reviewed include books, journal articles, book chapters, and conference papers in the disciplines of Anthropology (including Archaeology, Ethnohistory and Ethnology), Art, Economics, Geography, Government and Politics, History, International Relations, Literature, Music, Philosophy, and Sociology. Starting with Volume 54, the Handbook also includes a section on Electronic Resources for Latin American Studies. In addition, some of the earlier volumes included other disciplines such as Cartography, Film, Folklore, Law, and so forth. The online indexing is usually ahead by two years of the printed volumes. The Library has the print edition. Call number: F 1410 Z9 L35, housed in Reference stack, Rutherford North 1st Floor.

hash.name: HAPI (Hispanic American Periodicals Index) online
hash.title: HAPI (Hispanic American Periodicals Index) online
hash.databasedescription: Contains bibliographic citations to articles, book reviews, documents, original literary works, and other materials appearing in more than 400 key social science and humanities journals published throughout the world. Covers information about Central and South America, Mexico, the Caribbean basin, the United States-Mexico border region, and Hispanics in the United States.

hash.name: Historical Abstracts with Full Text
hash.title: Historical Abstracts with Full Text
hash.databasedescription: Historical Abstracts with Full Text covers world history from 1450 to the present, excluding the United States and Canada. Coverage is very broad and takes in many areas including: religion, anthropology, sociology, cultural studies, political science, the arts, law, education and geneology. Published since 1954.

hash.name: Hubert Wenger Eskimo Database
hash.title: Hubert Wenger Eskimo Database
hash.databasedescription: Wenger is a database of literature written by explorers, missionaries, ethnographers, and others who were among the first Euroamericans to travel among and write about Inuit/Eskimo peoples. It includes out-of-print and hard to find material, basic works descriptive of each Inuit/Eskimo and Aleut group, drawings, photographs, and maps.

hash.name: IBZ (International Bibliography of Periodical Literature)
hash.title: IBZ (International Bibliography of Periodical Literature)
hash.databasedescription:
IBZ, also known as "the Dietrich", is an international and interdisciplinary bibliography of academic periodical literature mainly from the Humanities, Social Sciences and Arts. While IBZ
has been published since 1896, the online version contains journal articles from 12,000 journals covering the years 1983-current.

hash.name: Index Islamicus
hash.title: Index Islamicus
hash.databasedescription: Indexes literature on Islam, the Middle East and the Muslim world. Material cited includes work written about the Middle East, as well as other main Muslim areas of Asia and Africa, and Muslim minorities elsewhere. Over 2,000 journals are monitored for inclusion in the database, together with conference proceedings, monographs, multi-authored works and book reviews. Produced by the Islamic Bibliography Unit at Cambridge University Library.

hash.name: Indigenous Peoples and Afro-descendants in Latin America and the Caribbean Data bank: PIAALC

meta.more-info: They were created on the basis of several projects developed by the democratization of information, CELADE, the Population Division of ECLAC in recent years. These projects have been made possible through the support of different United Nations organizations and with international cooperation, such as the Pan American Health Organization, the Fund for the Development of the Indigenous Peoples of Latin America and the Caribbean, the Ibero-American Youth Organization, the Inter-American Development Bank, and the Ford Foundation.

hash.title: Indigenous Peoples and Afro-descendants in Latin America and the Caribbean Data bank: PIAALC
hash.databasedescription:
This Data Bank contains different subsystems of information with indicators for indigenous and afro-descendant peoples. The subsystems are El Sistema de Indicadores Sociodemográficos de Poblaciones y Pueblos Indígenas (SISPPI), Migracion interna de los pueblos indigenas en America Latina,Indicadores de Salud a Nivel Municipal, Juventud Indigena y Afrodescendiente, and Desigualdades Territoriales de Pueblos Indigenas y Afrodescendientes.
They were created on the basis of several projects developed by the democratization of information, CELADE, the Population Division of ECLAC in recent years. These projects have been made possible through the support of different United Nations organizations and with international cooperation, such as the Pan American Health Organization, the Fund for the Development of the Indigenous Peoples of Latin America and the Caribbean, the Ibero-American Youth Organization, the Inter-American Development Bank, and the Ford Foundation.

TESL - Teaching English as a Second Language
