hash.title: Linguistics and Language Behavior Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
LLBA (1973 to the present) provides access to the world's literature in
linguistics and its various subdisciplines. It covers articles and book reviews
from over 1,500 journals, as well as conference proceedings, associations
papers, and selected dissertations. The database provides descriptive abstracts
for most records.

hash.name: Natural Medicines Comprehensive Database
hash.title: Natural Medicines Comprehensive Database
hash.databasedescription: A database of information on herbal and non-herbal natural medicines, including data on all known uses, efficacy, evidence-based safety ratings, mechanisms of action, active ingredients, adverse reactions, effects on nutrient levels, interactions, dosage and administration, and brand names.

hash.name: North American Immigrant Letters, Diaries, and Oral Histories
hash.title: North American Immigrant Letters, Diaries, and Oral Histories
hash.databasedescription: Includes contemporaneous letters and diaries, oral histories, interviews, and other personal narratives that provide a view of what it meant to immigrate to America and Canada between 1800 and 1950.

hash.name: Oral History Online
hash.title: Oral History Online
hash.databasedescription: Provides in-depth indexing to collections of Oral History in English from around the world. Also provides keyword searching of selected full-text as well as pointers to some audio and video files and bibliographic records.

hash.name: Population Index
hash.title: Population Index
hash.databasedescription:
Population Index, published since 1935, is the primary reference tool to
the world's population literature. It presents an annotated bibliography of
recently published books, journal articles, working papers, and other materials
on population topics. This website provides a searchable and browsable database
containing abstracts of demographic literature published in Population Index
from 1986 to the present.

hash.name: The Archive of the Indigenous Languages of Latin America
hash.title: The Archive of the Indigenous Languages of Latin America
hash.databasedescription: The Archive of the Indigenous Languages of Latin America (AILLA) is a digital archive of recordings and texts in and about the indigenous languages of Latin America.

hash.name: The European Library
hash.title: The European Library
hash.databasedescription: Allows searching of the resources of most of the national libraries involved in The European Library. Resources can be digital or bibliographical (books, posters, maps, sound recordings, videos, etc.).

hash.name: The Latin American Mortality Database (LAMBdA)

meta.more-info: The database covers the interval between 1848 and 2014, it includes population censuses, age-specific (five year and single year age groups) total death counts (starting in 1900), and by causes of deaths (starting in 1945). It contains over 170 years of data, including adjusted life tables and a total of about 500 life tables. Adjustments are of two types: (a) for relative completeness of death counts and (b) for adult age misstatement. The adjustment procedures were chosen from a battery of 10-12 techniques that proved to be optimal (in the sense of mean squared error reduction) in extensive simulations that reproduced known or suspected sources of errors in the data. These adjustments are applied consistently across countries and years of observation. The resulting data are optimized for intertemporal and intercountry comparability. Please read the overview and the methods section for more details about the adjustments and the data. The Latin American Mortality Database is provided free of charge to all individuals who register to the site.

hash.title: The Latin American Mortality Database (LAMBdA)
hash.databasedescription:
The Latin American Mortality Database (LAMBdA) was originally created to support the empirical study of the history of mortality trends in Latin American countries after independence. It now supports the study of very recent mortality trends and is particularly suited for the study of old age mortality during the post-WWII period.
The database covers the interval between 1848 and 2014, it includes population censuses, age-specific (five year and single year age groups) total death counts (starting in 1900), and by causes of deaths (starting in 1945). It contains over 170 years of data, including adjusted life tables and a total of about 500 life tables. Adjustments are of two types: (a) for relative completeness of death counts and (b) for adult age misstatement. The adjustment procedures were chosen from a battery of 10-12 techniques that proved to be optimal (in the sense of mean squared error reduction) in extensive simulations that reproduced known or suspected sources of errors in the data. These adjustments are applied consistently across countries and years of observation. The resulting data are optimized for intertemporal and intercountry comparability. Please read the overview and the methods section for more details about the adjustments and the data. The Latin American Mortality Database is provided free of charge to all individuals who register to the site.

hash.name: theses.fr
hash.title: theses.fr
hash.databasedescription:
theses.fr est le moteur de recherche des thèses de doctorat françaises. Il vise à donner sur le web un point d'entrée:

  • à toutes les thèses de doctorat en cours de préparation en France
  • à toutes les thèses de doctorat soutenues en France, quel que soit le support matériel de la thèse (document papier, numérique, édition commerciale?)
  • aux personnes et organismes en lien avec ces thèses

hash.name: TOCS-IN (Tables of Contents of Journals of Interest to Classicists)
hash.title: TOCS-IN (Tables of Contents of Journals of Interest to Classicists)
hash.databasedescription:
TOCS-IN (Tables of Contents of Journals of Interest to Classicists)
indexes the contents of more than 150 periodicals dealing with ancient
civilization, and archaeology. Indexing is provided by over 70 volunteers in 14
countries (1999), with the most recent citations appearing in the "New Articles"
file. This file is integrated with the main TOCS-IN index every 3-4 months.

hash.name: World Development Indicators
hash.title: World Development Indicators
hash.databasedescription: World Development Indicators Online (WDI) provides direct access to more than 800 development indicators, with time series for 209 countries and 18 country groups from 1960 to 2007, where data are available.

hash.name: World Textiles
hash.title: World Textiles
hash.databasedescription: Includes information on all aspects of the textiles industry, textile technology, and the application of textiles materials. Covers scientific, trade, patent, and economic literature in over five hundred scientific, technical and trade periodicals, books, reports, conference reports and statistical publications.

hash.name: Zoological Record
hash.title: Zoological Record
hash.databasedescription: Zoological Record (1864 to the present) covers international research in zoology, with systematic and taxonomic information for 27 animal groups including Mammalia, Aves, Reptilia, Amphibia, Pisces, Protochordata, Hemiptera, Insecta, Crustacea, and Protozoa. Topics include taxonomy, physiology, morphology, parasitology, biochemistry, biophysics, evolution, ecology, genetics, behavior, biometrics, communication, disease, habitat, histology, immunology, life cycle and development, locomotion, nomenclature, techniques, and zoogeography.

hash.name: Google Scholar
hash.title: Google Scholar
hash.databasedescription: Indexes scholarly literature, including peer-reviewed papers, theses, books, preprints, abstracts and technical reports. Also includes articles from a wide variety of academic publishers, professional societies, preprint repositories and universities, as well as scholarly articles available across the web.

hash.name: 17th & 18th Century Burney Collection Newspapers

meta.more-info: The newspapers and news pamphlets gathered by the Reverend Charles Burney (1757 - 1817) represent the largest single collection of 17th and 18th century English news media. The 700 or so bound volumes of newspapers and news pamphlets were published mostly in London, however there are also some English provincial, Irish and Scottish papers, and a few examples from the American colonies, Europe and India.

hash.title: 17th & 18th Century Burney Collection Newspapers
hash.databasedescription: The newspapers and news pamphlets gathered by the Reverend Charles Burney (1757 - 1817) represent the largest single collection of 17th and 18th century English news media. The 700 or so bound volumes of newspapers and news pamphlets were published mostly in London, however there are also some English provincial, Irish and Scottish papers, and a few examples from the American colonies, Europe and India.

hash.name: 19th Century British Newspapers

meta.more-info: Special attention was paid to include newspapers that helped lead particular political or social movements such as Reform, Chartism, and Home Rule. The penny papers aimed at the working and clerical classes are also present in the collection. This collection has been released in three parts to date, and title lists for these parts are available at http://solutions.cengage.com/Gale/Database-Title-Lists/

hash.title: 19th Century British Newspapers
hash.databasedescription:
The 19th Century British Library Newspapers collection contains full runs of newspapers specially selected by the British Library to best represent nineteenth century Britain. Includes national and regional newspapers, as well as those from both established country or university towns and the new industrial powerhouses of the manufacturing Midlands, as well as Scotland, Ireland and Wales.
Special attention was paid to include newspapers that helped lead particular political or social movements such as Reform, Chartism, and Home Rule. The penny papers aimed at the working and clerical classes are also present in the collection. This collection has been released in three parts to date, and title lists for these parts are available at http://solutions.cengage.com/Gale/Database-Title-Lists/

hash.name: 19th century masterfile

meta.more-info:
The collection is built around Poole's Index to Periodical Literature (1802-1907), and includes other indexes such as Index to Periodicals (1890-1902), Cumulative Index to a Selected List of Periodicals, Nineteenth Century Reader's Guide to Periodical Literature (1890-1899), Index Medicus (1879-1927) as well as indexes to book literature, individual journal titles, newspapers (including the New York Times), patents and government documents.
For assistance please contact:
Humanities and Social Sciences Service Desk, Rutherford North 492-5791

hash.title: 19th century masterfile
hash.databasedescription:
19th Century Masterfile is an online collection of indexes of nineteenth century literature.
The collection is built around Poole's Index to Periodical Literature (1802-1907), and includes other indexes such as Index to Periodicals (1890-1902), Cumulative Index to a Selected List of Periodicals, Nineteenth Century Reader's Guide to Periodical Literature (1890-1899), Index Medicus (1879-1927) as well as indexes to book literature, individual journal titles, newspapers (including the New York Times), patents and government documents.
For assistance please contact:
Humanities and Social Sciences Service Desk, Rutherford North 492-5791

hash.name: 19th Century UK Periodicals

meta.more-info:
For assistance please contact:
Humanities and Social Sciences Service Desk, Rutherford North 492-5791

hash.title: 19th Century UK Periodicals
hash.databasedescription:
19th Century UK Periodicals is a multi-part series that covers the events, lives, values and themes that shaped the 19th century world. Series I on New Readerships provides access to close to 100 periodicals for the study of British life in the 19th century - from women to sports and leisure, and from children to humour. It is mainly based on the repositories of the British Library and the National Library of Scotland.
For assistance please contact:
Humanities and Social Sciences Service Desk, Rutherford North 492-5791

hash.name: 19th Century US Newspapers
hash.title: 19th Century US Newspapers
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to primary source newspaper content from the 19th century from numerous newspapers from a range of urban and rural regions throughout the U.S. The collection encompasses the entire 19th century, with an emphasis on such topics as the American Civil War, African-American culture and history, Western migration and Antebellum-era life among other subjects.

hash.name: Alternative Press Index
hash.title: Alternative Press Index
hash.databasedescription: Indexes journals covering cultural, economic, political & social change.

hash.name: AP Images
hash.title: AP Images
hash.databasedescription:
AP Photo Archive is an electronic library containing the Associated
Press's current photos and a selection of pictures from their 50 million image
print and negative library.

hash.name: Ariadne Datenbank
hash.title: Ariadne Datenbank
hash.databasedescription: Index to articles published in journals and yearbooks relating to women's, feminist and gender studies. Covers 1990 to the present. Languages included: German, English, French publications. List of titles indexed is available.

hash.name: Art Full Text
hash.title: Art Full Text
hash.databasedescription: Provides comprehensive indexing of international art publications, including English-language periodicals, yearbooks and museum bulletins, as well as periodicals published in French, Italian, German, Japanese, Dutch, and Swedish. Subjects areas indexed include art, architecture, design, film, archaeology and marketing.

hash.name: Art Index Retrospective
hash.title: Art Index Retrospective
hash.databasedescription: Provides comprehensive indexing of international art publications, including English-language periodicals, yearbooks and museum bulletins, as well as periodicals published in French, Italian, German, Japanese, Dutch, and Swedish. Subjects areas indexed include art, architecture, design, film, archaeology and marketing.

hash.name: ARTbibliographies Modern

meta.more-info:
A particular emphasis is placed upon adding new and lesser-known artists and on the coverage of foreign-language literature. Approximately 13,000 new entries are added each year.


ARTbibliographies Modern covers all aspects of modern and contemporary art, including performance art and installation works, video art, computer and electronic art, body art, graffiti, artists' books, theater arts, crafts, jewelry, illustration, and more, as well as the traditional fine arts of painting, printmaking, sculpture, and drawing.

This web version of the database covers volume years 1974 to the present.

hash.title: ARTbibliographies Modern
hash.databasedescription:
ARTbibliographies Modern contains abstracts of journal articles, books, essays, exhibition catalogs, dissertations, and exhibition reviews. The scope of
ARTbibliographies Modern extends from artists and movements beginning with Impressionism in the late 19th century, up to the most recent works and trends in the late 20th century. Photography is covered from its invention in 1839 to the present.
A particular emphasis is placed upon adding new and lesser-known artists and on the coverage of foreign-language literature. Approximately 13,000 new entries are added each year.


ARTbibliographies Modern covers all aspects of modern and contemporary art, including performance art and installation works, video art, computer and electronic art, body art, graffiti, artists' books, theater arts, crafts, jewelry, illustration, and more, as well as the traditional fine arts of painting, printmaking, sculpture, and drawing.

This web version of the database covers volume years 1974 to the present.

hash.name: ARTstor

meta.more-info:
Registering for ARTstor:
  • At the first ARTstor page click on the orange "Go" icon (upper right of screen).
  • Click on "Not registered?" (upper right). Include an email address (this can be a non-UofA email address if you've already keyed in a University of Alberta CCID and password).
  • Confirm the email address, then select and confirm a password.
  • Click on "Submit."

hash.title: ARTstor
hash.databasedescription:
The ARTstor Digital Library is a collection of digital images of art, architecture and design from a number of books (notably art history survey texts), museums, archives, and slide collections.
Registering for ARTstor:
  • At the first ARTstor page click on the orange "Go" icon (upper right of screen).
  • Click on "Not registered?" (upper right). Include an email address (this can be a non-UofA email address if you've already keyed in a University of Alberta CCID and password).
  • Confirm the email address, then select and confirm a password.
  • Click on "Submit."

hash.name: ATLA Religion Database with ATLASerials
hash.title: ATLA Religion Database with ATLASerials
hash.databasedescription:
ATLA Religion Database with ATLASerials is the full-text version of the ATLA Religion Database, and is published by the American Theological Library Association. It provides international coverage of topics such as Biblical studies, world religions, Church history, and religious perspectives on social
issues.

hash.name: BHI: British Humanities Index
hash.title: BHI: British Humanities Index
hash.databasedescription: Indexes over 320 humanities journals and weekly magazines published in the UK and other English speaking countries, as well as newspapers published in the UK.

hash.name: Bibliography of the History of Art

meta.more-info:
As of April 1, 2010 the Bibliography is accessible directly from The Getty website. Note that the database search includes both BHA (covering 1990-2007) and the International Bibliography of Art (IBA), covering the years 2008 and part of 2009. The Répertoire de la litterature de l'art (RILA), one of the predecessors of BHA, with records that cover 1975–1989, will be online by May 1, 2010.

For later records, see the International Bibliography of Art.

hash.title: Bibliography of the History of Art
hash.databasedescription:
Indexes and abstracts art-related books, conference proceedings and dissertations, exhibition and dealer's catalogs, and articles from more than 2,500 periodicals. Includes and extends the coverage of its two predecessor art indexes: RAA (Répertoire d'Art et d'Archéologie) from 1973 to 1989 and RILA (Répertoire International de la Littérature de l'Art) from 1975 to 1989.


As of April 1, 2010 the Bibliography is accessible directly from The Getty website. Note that the database search includes both BHA (covering 1990-2007) and the International Bibliography of Art (IBA), covering the years 2008 and part of 2009. The Répertoire de la litterature de l'art (RILA), one of the predecessors of BHA, with records that cover 1975–1989, will be online by May 1, 2010.

For later records, see the International Bibliography of Art.

hash.name: C19: The Nineteenth Century Index

meta.more-info:
It includes records from the following sources among others:
  • Nineteenth Century Short Title Catalogue
  • The Nineteenth Century (Chadwyck-Healey’s ongoing microform project at the British Library)
  • Poole's Index to Periodical Literature
  • Wellesley Index to Victorian Periodicals (1824-1900)
  • Periodicals Index Online and Periodicals Archive Online (1790-1919)
  • American Periodicals Series (1791-1919)
  • House of Commons Parliamentary Papers (1801-1900)
  • Palmer’s Index to the Times (1790–1905)
  • U.S. Congressional Serial Set (1789-1901)

hash.title: C19: The Nineteenth Century Index
hash.databasedescription:
The Nineteenth Century Index is a growing all-inclusive bibliographic source for 19th-century research. Click on "more" below for further information.
It includes records from the following sources among others:
  • Nineteenth Century Short Title Catalogue
  • The Nineteenth Century (Chadwyck-Healey’s ongoing microform project at the British Library)
  • Poole's Index to Periodical Literature
  • Wellesley Index to Victorian Periodicals (1824-1900)
  • Periodicals Index Online and Periodicals Archive Online (1790-1919)
  • American Periodicals Series (1791-1919)
  • House of Commons Parliamentary Papers (1801-1900)
  • Palmer’s Index to the Times (1790–1905)
  • U.S. Congressional Serial Set (1789-1901)

hash.name: Catalog of Art Museum Images Online (CAMIO)
hash.title: Catalog of Art Museum Images Online (CAMIO)
hash.databasedescription: CAMIO is OCLC's Catalog of Art Museum Images Online. It contains images, text and multimedia from the collections of prominent museums world-wide.

hash.name: CRCnetBASE
hash.title: CRCnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Provides cross-searching of NetBase's book-based products.

hash.name: DART-Europe E-theses Portal
hash.title: DART-Europe E-theses Portal
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to full-text research theses from over 300 European universities.

hash.name: Design and Applied Arts Index
hash.title: Design and Applied Arts Index
hash.databasedescription: Chiefly a database of annotated citations to articles in design and crafts journals. Also contains directories for educational institutions offering courses in design and crafts, design and crafts organizations, archives and special collections, and peri odicals.

hash.name: Framing Canada: A Photographic Memory
hash.title: Framing Canada: A Photographic Memory
hash.databasedescription: Photographs from the 1840s to the mid-20th century -- a portion of the 22 million photograph collection of Library and Archives Canada.

hash.name: Guide to Research Collections in Microformat (University of Alberta)

meta.more-info:
Queries regarding the content of this Guide should be directed to the editor:
Noelle Fraser,
Rutherford Library,
University of Alberta,
492-1410,
noelle.fraser@ualberta.ca
(Noelle Fraser)

hash.title: Guide to Research Collections in Microformat (University of Alberta)
hash.databasedescription:
The Guide to Research Collections in Microformat provides descriptions of approximately three hundred research collections on microfiche, microfilm, or microprint that are located in the University of Alberta libraries. Included in the descriptions are details about the location and organization of each collection as well as information about associated guides, indexes, or bibliographies.
Queries regarding the content of this Guide should be directed to the editor:
Noelle Fraser,
Rutherford Library,
University of Alberta,
492-1410,
noelle.fraser@ualberta.ca
(Noelle Fraser)

hash.name: Historical Newspapers Online

meta.more-info:
Historical Newspapers Online consists of:
  • Palmer's Index to The Times (1790-1905). Palmer's provides access to many aspects of British life and world affairs in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, as reported in The Times. The Times is available on microfilm in Rutherford North Library - Floor 2 Micro (AN 4 L8 T58), and the years 1785-2007 are available online in The Times Digital Archive.
  • The Official Index to the Times (1906-1980).
  • The Historical Index to The New York Times (1851-1922) provides access to the first seventy years of The New York Times or The New-York Daily Times, as it was originally called. The Index is complete for the years 1863 to 1905, and 1913 to September 1922. The New York Times is available on microfilm in Rutherford North Library - Floor 2 Micro (AN 2 N5 N5), and online via
    New York Times Historical (1851-2008)     or
    New York Times (1980-current)    .

See "more" below for brief description about Historical Newspapers Online
Historical Newspapers Online consists of:
  • Palmer's Index to The Times (1790-1905). Palmer's provides access to many aspects of British life and world affairs in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, as reported in The Times. The Times is available on microfilm in Rutherford North Library - Floor 2 Micro (AN 4 L8 T58), and the years 1785-2007 are available online in The Times Digital Archive.
  • The Official Index to the Times (1906-1980).
  • The Historical Index to The New York Times (1851-1922) provides access to the first seventy years of The New York Times or The New-York Daily Times, as it was originally called. The Index is complete for the years 1863 to 1905, and 1913 to September 1922. The New York Times is available on microfilm in Rutherford North Library - Floor 2 Micro (AN 2 N5 N5), and online via
    New York Times Historical (1851-2008)     or
    New York Times (1980-current)    .

hash.name: IDZ - Index Deutschsprachiger Zeitschriften 1750 - 1815
hash.title: IDZ - Index Deutschsprachiger Zeitschriften 1750 - 1815
hash.databasedescription: The IDZ indexes approximately 100,000 articles from 195 German-language journals from 1750 to 1815. The articles are accessible through an author index and a keyword index of subjects, persons, and geographic headings. The subject headings are in German.

hash.name: Image Collections (EBSCOhost)

meta.more-info: Please note that these collections are always cross-searched with Ebscohost's Image Quick View Collection

hash.title: Image Collections (EBSCOhost)
hash.databasedescription:
Image Collections (EBSCOhost) consists of photographs from both licensed and public domain sources, images from Canadian Press, and maps from MapQuest. More information about each image can be found in the copyright statement that appears at the bottom of the page for each image.

Please note that these collections are always cross-searched with Ebscohost's Image Quick View Collection

hash.name: Image Quick View Collection (Ebscohost)
hash.title: Image Quick View Collection (Ebscohost)
hash.databasedescription: Provides direct access to images from a large number of journals and other publications that comprise the full-text content of all the Ebscohost databases the University of Alberta licenses.

hash.name: Images Canada
hash.title: Images Canada
hash.databasedescription: Images Canada is a collaborative, cross-collection search service providing access to distributed Canadian images collections on the websites of participating Canadian cultural institutions

hash.name: International Bibliography of Art

meta.more-info:
These records were created in 2008-2009, and cover scholarship up to 2009, including retrospective records for material published in previous years. ProQuest will be building on this by adding new records going forwards, ensuring unbroken coverage of indexed journals.
For earlier records, see the Bibliography of the History of Art.

hash.title: International Bibliography of Art
hash.databasedescription:
The International Bibliography of Art (IBA) is the successor to the Bibliography of the History of Art (BHA), and includes the most recent index records that were created by the Getty Research Institute as part of BHA.


These records were created in 2008-2009, and cover scholarship up to 2009, including retrospective records for material published in previous years. ProQuest will be building on this by adding new records going forwards, ensuring unbroken coverage of indexed journals.
For earlier records, see the Bibliography of the History of Art.

hash.name: Iter Bibliography
hash.title: Iter Bibliography
hash.databasedescription: Iter's bibliography includes literature pertaining to the Middle Ages and Renaissance (400-1700). Citations for books, journal material (articles, reviews, review articles, bibliographies, catalogues, abstracts and discographies) are included, as are citations for dissertation abstracts, and essays in books (including entries in conference proceedings, festschriften, encyclopedias and exhibition catalogues).

hash.name: New York Times (1980-current)
hash.title: New York Times (1980-current)
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext of the New York Times, 1980-current.

hash.name: New York Times Historical (1851-2012)
hash.title: New York Times Historical (1851-2012)
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext of the New York Times, 1851-2012.

hash.name: OCLC WorldCat

meta.more-info: Use this database in the same way you would use the NEOS Libraries' Catalogue to search for items which other libraries might have. This database is updated daily.

hash.title: OCLC WorldCat
hash.databasedescription:
Use WorldCat to search for items which are owned by libraries around the world including the University of Alberta Library System. Each record contains library holdings. Searching is by author, title, or subject. WorldCat indexes titles of books, journals, etc., but does not index book chapters, individual articles, stories in journals, magazines, or newspapers.
Use this database in the same way you would use the NEOS Libraries' Catalogue to search for items which other libraries might have. This database is updated daily.

hash.name: Oxford Art Online

meta.more-info: Comprises Benezit Dictionary of Artists, Grove Art Online, The Oxford Companion to Western Art, Encyclopedia of Aesthetics, and The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Art Terms.

hash.title: Oxford Art Online
hash.databasedescription:
Oxford Art Online contains 45,000 articles on every aspect of the
visual arts - painting, sculpture, graphic arts, architecture, decorative arts
and photography from prehistory to the present day. Compiled over a period of
15 years, it represents the work of more than 6,800 scholars from around the
world, each writing on his or her own specialist field of study.


Comprises Benezit Dictionary of Artists, Grove Art Online, The Oxford Companion to Western Art, Encyclopedia of Aesthetics, and The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Art Terms.

hash.name: Readers' Guide Retrospective
hash.title: Readers' Guide Retrospective
hash.databasedescription: Indexes English-language periodicals of general interest.

hash.name: Safari Books Online
hash.title: Safari Books Online
hash.databasedescription: Safari Tech Books Online is an online collection of computer and technical books from a number of publishers.

hash.name: Taylor & Francis eBooks
hash.title: Taylor & Francis eBooks
hash.databasedescription: eBooks from Taylor & Francis.

hash.name: The Beazley Archive

meta.more-info: The electronic Beazley Archive consists of a database of Athenian pottery, Classical gems, finger-rings and cameos, plaster casts of sculpture, and bibliographies. A dictionary provides " … illustrated explanations of names, technical terms, and other vocabulary relating to Greek history, myth, geography, art and architecture."

hash.title: The Beazley Archive
hash.databasedescription:
In its original (1970) form, the Beazley Archive at the Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford, consisted of the 250,000 photographs plus textual material of Sir John Beazley, related to Greek and Roman art.
The electronic Beazley Archive consists of a database of Athenian pottery, Classical gems, finger-rings and cameos, plaster casts of sculpture, and bibliographies. A dictionary provides " … illustrated explanations of names, technical terms, and other vocabulary relating to Greek history, myth, geography, art and architecture."

hash.name: The Canadian Art Database
hash.title: The Canadian Art Database
hash.databasedescription: Contains over 12,000 images by over 200 Canadian artists

hash.name: The Grand Tour
hash.title: The Grand Tour
hash.databasedescription: Collection of manuscript, visual and printed works related to The Grand Tour (c1550-1850) including letters; diaries and journals; account books; printed guidebooks; published travel writing; paintings and sketches; architectural drawings and maps.

hash.name: Visual Arts Data Service

meta.more-info: The original items are primarily British from 1945-1990, with more limited coverage of other countries and earlier periods. Items in the following collections are included in the database: Basic Design Collection (Bretton Hall), Design Council Archive (University of Brighton), Design Council Slide Collection (Manchester Metropolitan University), Halliwell Collection (Bretton Hall), Imperial War Museum Concise Art Collection, and the London College of Fashion College Archive.

hash.title: Visual Arts Data Service
hash.databasedescription:
The Visual Arts Data Service comprises over 6,000 images, primarily of product design but also graphic design, fashion and art.
The original items are primarily British from 1945-1990, with more limited coverage of other countries and earlier periods. Items in the following collections are included in the database: Basic Design Collection (Bretton Hall), Design Council Archive (University of Brighton), Design Council Slide Collection (Manchester Metropolitan University), Halliwell Collection (Bretton Hall), Imperial War Museum Concise Art Collection, and the London College of Fashion College Archive.

hash.name: Visual Collections: Images of Art, History and Culture
hash.title: Visual Collections: Images of Art, History and Culture
hash.databasedescription: Allows cross-searching of a number of digital image collections including more than 300,000 works from museums, universities and private collections throughout the world.

hash.name: ebrary

meta.more-info:
Includes the following collections:
  • The Canadian Electronic Library - Canadian monographic publications from commercial publishers as well as nonprofit and public-sector organizations in the following collections:
    • Canadian Health Research Collection
    • Canadian Publishers Collection
    • Canadian Public Policy Collection

  • e-Duke Scholarly Books Collection - eBooks from Duke University Press.
  • Orca Digital Collection - ebooks from Orca Book Publishers, a Western Canadian children's book publisher

hash.title: ebrary
hash.databasedescription:
Click on "more" below for brief description about ebrary
Includes the following collections:
  • The Canadian Electronic Library - Canadian monographic publications from commercial publishers as well as nonprofit and public-sector organizations in the following collections:
    • Canadian Health Research Collection
    • Canadian Publishers Collection
    • Canadian Public Policy Collection

  • e-Duke Scholarly Books Collection - eBooks from Duke University Press.
  • Orca Digital Collection - ebooks from Orca Book Publishers, a Western Canadian children's book publisher

hash.name: L'ÎLE, le Centre de documentation virtuel sur la littérature québécoise
hash.title: L'ÎLE, le Centre de documentation virtuel sur la littérature québécoise
hash.databasedescription:
Met en ligne les biographies et bibliographies de plus de 850 auteurs québécois, et quelque 170 dossiers de presse qui remontent à plus de vingt ans. Les bases de données de l'ÎLE sont mises à jour regulièrement.


Provides online access to the biographies and bibliographies of over 850 québécois authors and approximately170 press releases that date back more than twenty years. The l’ÎLE databases are updated on a regular basis.

hash.name: Eighteenth Century Collections Online
hash.title: Eighteenth Century Collections Online
hash.databasedescription: Eighteenth Century Collections Online allows searching and display of the digital images of books, pamphlets, and broadsides published during the 18th Century.

hash.name: Eighteenth Century Journals: Newspapers & Periodicals 1685-1815

meta.more-info:
Topics covered are extremely wide-ranging and include: the writings of Sir Isaac Newton; the French Revolution; reviews of literature and fashion throughout Europe; political debates; and coffee house gossip and discussion.


Eighteenth Century Journals I contains material from the Hope Collection at the Bodleian Library, Oxford, one of the finest surviving collections of eighteenth-century periodicals. Inncludes 95 rare journals printed between 1693 and 1799, combining major publications with more ephemeral works to underline the broad variety of eighteenth century print journalism.

Eighteenth Century Journals II contains materials selected from The Harry Ransom Humanities Research Center, which holds one of the finest collections of 17th and 18th century newspapers and periodicals in the world. These holdings were documented in �British Newspapers and Periodicals, 1632-1800�, compiled by Powell Stewart in 1950. More recent acquisitions have further enhanced these collections.

Eighteenth Century Journals III contains materials drawn from two sources: the British Newspaper Library at Colindale, London and Cambridge University Library. This section focuses on journals published outside of London. The inclusion of Canadian, Caribbean and Indian journals allows users to explore the ways in which major world events were reported in different areas of the globe. There are also a large number of Irish journals and British provincial publications

Eighteenth Century Journals IV consists of material sourced primarily from Chetham�s Library in Manchester. From its excellent 18th century holdings, a strong collection of rare magazines and newspapers, literary periodicals and political journals have been included to chart the transformation of Manchester during a time of rapid industrialisation and political turmoil. These varied sources are supplemented by a selection of periodicals, many European, from the Brotherton Library, University of Leeds.

Eighteenth Century Journals V includes the full run of The Lady's Magazine, 1770-1832 from the British Library, Birmingham Central Library and Cambridge University Library, along with other relevant titles that are social, cultural and literary in scope from Cambridge University Library and Liverpool John Moores University Library.

hash.title: Eighteenth Century Journals: Newspapers & Periodicals 1685-1815
hash.databasedescription:
Offers integrated access to Sections I - V of the digital project Eighteenth Century Journals. This project brings together rare journals printed between 1685 and 1815, illuminating all aspects of eighteenth-century social, political and literary life. Many are ephemeral, lasting only for a handful of issues, others run for several years.
Topics covered are extremely wide-ranging and include: the writings of Sir Isaac Newton; the French Revolution; reviews of literature and fashion throughout Europe; political debates; and coffee house gossip and discussion.


Eighteenth Century Journals I contains material from the Hope Collection at the Bodleian Library, Oxford, one of the finest surviving collections of eighteenth-century periodicals. Inncludes 95 rare journals printed between 1693 and 1799, combining major publications with more ephemeral works to underline the broad variety of eighteenth century print journalism.

Eighteenth Century Journals II contains materials selected from The Harry Ransom Humanities Research Center, which holds one of the finest collections of 17th and 18th century newspapers and periodicals in the world. These holdings were documented in �British Newspapers and Periodicals, 1632-1800�, compiled by Powell Stewart in 1950. More recent acquisitions have further enhanced these collections.

Eighteenth Century Journals III contains materials drawn from two sources: the British Newspaper Library at Colindale, London and Cambridge University Library. This section focuses on journals published outside of London. The inclusion of Canadian, Caribbean and Indian journals allows users to explore the ways in which major world events were reported in different areas of the globe. There are also a large number of Irish journals and British provincial publications

Eighteenth Century Journals IV consists of material sourced primarily from Chetham�s Library in Manchester. From its excellent 18th century holdings, a strong collection of rare magazines and newspapers, literary periodicals and political journals have been included to chart the transformation of Manchester during a time of rapid industrialisation and political turmoil. These varied sources are supplemented by a selection of periodicals, many European, from the Brotherton Library, University of Leeds.

Eighteenth Century Journals V includes the full run of The Lady's Magazine, 1770-1832 from the British Library, Birmingham Central Library and Cambridge University Library, along with other relevant titles that are social, cultural and literary in scope from Cambridge University Library and Liverpool John Moores University Library.

hash.name: Electronic Theses and Dissertations (University of Alberta)

meta.more-info: Other dissertations and theses from the University of Alberta are available through Dissertations & Theses @ University of Alberta.

hash.title: Electronic Theses and Dissertations (University of Alberta)
hash.databasedescription:
This collection contains theses and dissertations produced by University of Alberta graduate students submitted electronically directly to the Faculty of Graduate Studies and Research starting in April 2009, as well as a selection of retrospectively digitized theses from previous years. All theses and dissertations in this collection are freely downloadable to the public; the documents must be referenced if they are used for subsequent research.


Other dissertations and theses from the University of Alberta are available through Dissertations & Theses @ University of Alberta.

hash.name: ABU: la Bibliothèque Universelle
hash.title: ABU: la Bibliothèque Universelle
hash.databasedescription: This site offers you the full-text of French works. It contains as well several dictionnaries and a link to the American ClicNet, a cultural and literary francophone site which finds ressources available on the Internet for students, teachers of French as a second language and all those interested in francophone culture, arts and literature.

hash.name: ACLS Humanities E-Book
hash.title: ACLS Humanities E-Book
hash.databasedescription: The ACLS Humanities E-Book Project provides a fully searchable collection of books in the humanities, most of which are available in full text.

hash.name: ARTFL (American and French Research on the Treasury of the French Language)

meta.more-info: Genres include novels, verse, theater, journalism, essays, correspondence, and treatises. Subjects include literary criticism, biology, history, economics, and philosophy. In most cases standard scholarly editions were used in converting the text into machine-readable form,and the data contain page references to these editions.

hash.title: ARTFL (American and French Research on the Treasury of the French Language)
hash.databasedescription:
ARTFL consists of approximately 2000 texts, ranging from classic works of
French literature to various kinds of non-fiction prose and technical writing.
The eighteenth, nineteenth and twentieth centuries are about equally
represented, with a smaller selection of seventeenth century texts as well as
some medieval and Renaissance texts.


Genres include novels, verse, theater, journalism, essays, correspondence, and treatises. Subjects include literary criticism, biology, history, economics, and philosophy. In most cases standard scholarly editions were used in converting the text into machine-readable form,and the data contain page references to these editions.

hash.name: Bibliothèque Virtuelle
hash.title: Bibliothèque Virtuelle
hash.databasedescription: This site contains French-Canadian literary works digitized by the Faculté Saint-Jean.

hash.name: Bibliothèque nationale de France - Gallica : la bibliothèque numérique

meta.more-info:
On y retrouve des collections dans plusieurs disciplines comme l'histoire, la littérature, les sciences, la philosophie, le droit, l'économie et la science politique. Si les fonds numériques privilégient la culture francophone, ils offrent aussi nombre de classiques étrangers dans leur langue originale (en allemand, anglais, espagnol et italien) ou en traduction du grec, du latin, etc.
  • Tutorial: full-text searching in Gallica

The digital library catalogue of the Bibliothèque nationale de la France (Gallica) consists of 95,000 electronic documents and 250,000 fixed images, ranging from the Middle Ages through to the beginning of the XXth Century. The collections include prestigious editions, dictionaries, pictures and periodicals in several disciplines such as history, literature, the sciences, philosophy, law, economy and political science. Although the majority are in French, there are classics available in other languages (German, English, Spanish and Italian) or as translations from Greek, Latin, etc.

  • Tutoriel : la recherche plein texte dans Gallica

hash.title: Bibliothèque nationale de France - Gallica : la bibliothèque numérique
hash.databasedescription:
Le catalogue des documents numérisés de la Bibliothèque nationale de la France (Gallica) est actuellement constituée de 95 000 documents numérisés, 2 600 documents en mode texte et 250 000 images fixes, dont les ressources s'étendent du Moyen Âge au début du XXe siècle. Les collections rassemblent des éditions prestigieuses, des dictionnaires, des fonds d�images et des périodiques.
On y retrouve des collections dans plusieurs disciplines comme l'histoire, la littérature, les sciences, la philosophie, le droit, l'économie et la science politique. Si les fonds numériques privilégient la culture francophone, ils offrent aussi nombre de classiques étrangers dans leur langue originale (en allemand, anglais, espagnol et italien) ou en traduction du grec, du latin, etc.
  • Tutorial: full-text searching in Gallica

The digital library catalogue of the Bibliothèque nationale de la France (Gallica) consists of 95,000 electronic documents and 250,000 fixed images, ranging from the Middle Ages through to the beginning of the XXth Century. The collections include prestigious editions, dictionaries, pictures and periodicals in several disciplines such as history, literature, the sciences, philosophy, law, economy and political science. Although the majority are in French, there are classics available in other languages (German, English, Spanish and Italian) or as translations from Greek, Latin, etc.

  • Tutoriel : la recherche plein texte dans Gallica

hash.name: Book Index with Reviews
hash.title: Book Index with Reviews
hash.databasedescription: Book Index with Reviews (BIR) provides information on over 3.8 million book titles in a wide range of formats, including large print, books on tape, etc. Fiction and non-fiction titles for juvenile and adult audiences are included in the database, in all genres. The product contains over 800,000 full-text searchable reviews from a number of sources: Library Journal, School Library Journal, Publishers Weekly, CHOICE, and others.

hash.name: FRANCIS

meta.more-info: FRANCIS represents a wide range of materials, including serials, journal articles, books, book chapters, conference papers, French dissertations, exhibition catalogs, legislation, teaching materials, and reports.

hash.title: FRANCIS
hash.databasedescription:
FRANCIS covers a wide range of multilingual, multidisciplinary information in the humanities and social sciences, with particular strenths in religion, the history of art, psychology, and literature, with particular emphasis on current trends in European and world literature.
FRANCIS represents a wide range of materials, including serials, journal articles, books, book chapters, conference papers, French dissertations, exhibition catalogs, legislation, teaching materials, and reports.

hash.name: Linguistics Abstracts
hash.title: Linguistics Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Provides abstracts from nearly 600 linguistics journals published since 1985.

hash.name: Littérature québécoise - Auteurs
hash.title: Littérature québécoise - Auteurs
hash.databasedescription: This Web site offers biographical information in French on more than 230 Quebec authors. Searches can be made by an author's name or by literature categories (i.e. biography, essay, juvenile literature, short story, poetry, fiction, plays).

hash.name: Project Muse
hash.title: Project Muse
hash.databasedescription:
Project Muse: Online Journals from Johns
Hopkins University Press provides full text access to journals in literary
theory, classics, history and cultural studies, philosophy, film, theatre and
performing arts, political science, and mathematics.

hash.name: BioMed Central
hash.title: BioMed Central
hash.databasedescription: BioMed Central is an independent publishing house committed to providing immediate free access to peer-reviewed biomedical research. It is a new commercial publishing house designed to complement PubMed Central. BioMed Central accepts submissions of original research in all biomedical fields - from basic life sciences to clinical medicine. All published research articles are peer reviewed and made immediately and freely available through PubMed Central, as well as through BioMed Central.

hash.name: BioOne
hash.title: BioOne
hash.databasedescription:
BioOne is a collection of full-text, peer-reviewed journals and bulletins published by American Institute of Biological Sciences (AIBS) member societies and related
organizations.

hash.name: CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics
hash.title: CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics
hash.databasedescription: Coverage includes physical constants of organic compounds, properties of the elements and inorganic compounds, thermochemistry, electrochemistry and kinetics, fluid properties, biochemistry, analytical chemistry, molecular structure ,spectroscopy, atomic, molecular and optical physics, nuclear and particle physics, properties of solids, polymer properties, geophysics, astronomy, acoustics, practical laboratory data, health and safety information. Searchable by text, and by substance/property.

hash.name: e-EROS Encyclopedia of Reagents for Organic Synthesis

meta.more-info: Each entry highlights the various uses and characteristics of each reagent, with illustrative examples of its use and is preceded by valuable information concerning physical data, solubility, form supplied in, purification, and where relevant, preparative methods and with literature references to key review articles and seminal papers.

hash.title: e-EROS Encyclopedia of Reagents for Organic Synthesis
hash.databasedescription:
Offers a systematic and exhaustive coverage of reagents used in organic chemistry. Allows chemical structure, substructure and reaction searching, and is fully searchable by structure and substructure, reagent, reaction type, experimental conditions etc. and allows sophisticated full text searches.
Each entry highlights the various uses and characteristics of each reagent, with illustrative examples of its use and is preceded by valuable information concerning physical data, solubility, form supplied in, purification, and where relevant, preparative methods and with literature references to key review articles and seminal papers.

hash.name: E-print Network: Research Communications for Scientists and Engineers

meta.more-info: Access is provided to over 29,500 Web sites and databases worldwide, containing over 5 million e-prints in basic and applied sciences, primarily in physics but also including subject areas such as chemistry, biology and life sciences, materials science, nuclear sciences and engineering, energy research, computer and information technologies, and other disciplines of interest to DOE.

hash.title: E-print Network: Research Communications for Scientists and Engineers
hash.databasedescription:
An integrated network of electronic scientific and technical information created by scientists and research engineers active in their respective fields, intended for use by other scientists, engineers, and students at advanced levels.
Access is provided to over 29,500 Web sites and databases worldwide, containing over 5 million e-prints in basic and applied sciences, primarily in physics but also including subject areas such as chemistry, biology and life sciences, materials science, nuclear sciences and engineering, energy research, computer and information technologies, and other disciplines of interest to DOE.

hash.name: Kirk-Othmer Encyclopedia of Chemical Technology

meta.more-info:
Over 1000 articles by recognized experts in their areas of chemical technology, and deals with industrial products, natural materials, and processes in such fields as: agricultural chemicals, chemical engineering, coatings and inks, composite materials, cosmetics and pharmaceuticals, dyes, pigments and brighteners, ecology and industrial hygiene, energy conservation and technology, fats and waxes, fermentation and enzyme technology, fibers, textiles and leather, food and animal nutrition, fossil fuels and derivatives, glass, ceramics and cement, industrial inorganic chemicals, industrial organic chemicals, metals, metallurgy and metal alloys, plastics and elastomers, semiconductors and electronic materials, surfactants, detergents and emulsion technology, water supply, purification and reuse, wood, paper, and industrial carbohydrates.


The Encyclopedia also includes miscellaneous topics such as: instrumentation and quality control, information retrieval, maintenance, market research, material allocation and supply, legal issues, process development and design, product development and technical service, research and operations management, (systems management, networks, etc.), transportation of chemical products

hash.title: Kirk-Othmer Encyclopedia of Chemical Technology
hash.databasedescription:
Full-text articles on the latest developments in chemical technology and related fields. See "more" below for more information about this.
Over 1000 articles by recognized experts in their areas of chemical technology, and deals with industrial products, natural materials, and processes in such fields as: agricultural chemicals, chemical engineering, coatings and inks, composite materials, cosmetics and pharmaceuticals, dyes, pigments and brighteners, ecology and industrial hygiene, energy conservation and technology, fats and waxes, fermentation and enzyme technology, fibers, textiles and leather, food and animal nutrition, fossil fuels and derivatives, glass, ceramics and cement, industrial inorganic chemicals, industrial organic chemicals, metals, metallurgy and metal alloys, plastics and elastomers, semiconductors and electronic materials, surfactants, detergents and emulsion technology, water supply, purification and reuse, wood, paper, and industrial carbohydrates.


The Encyclopedia also includes miscellaneous topics such as: instrumentation and quality control, information retrieval, maintenance, market research, material allocation and supply, legal issues, process development and design, product development and technical service, research and operations management, (systems management, networks, etc.), transportation of chemical products

hash.name: Knovel

meta.more-info: Subject coverage includes: adhesives, coatings, sealants & inks, aerospace & radar technology, biochemistry, biology & biotechnology, ceramics & ceramic engineering, chemistry & chemical engineering, construction materials & engineering, electrical & power engineering, environment & environmental engineering, food science, general engineering, mechanics & mechanical engineering, metals & metallurgy, nanoscience and nanotechnology, pharmaceuticals, cosmetics & toiletries, plastics & rubbers, safety, health & hygiene, and semiconductors & electronics.

hash.title: Knovel
hash.databasedescription:
The University of Alberta currently subscribes to a selection of e-books published electronically through Knovel.
Subject coverage includes: adhesives, coatings, sealants & inks, aerospace & radar technology, biochemistry, biology & biotechnology, ceramics & ceramic engineering, chemistry & chemical engineering, construction materials & engineering, electrical & power engineering, environment & environmental engineering, food science, general engineering, mechanics & mechanical engineering, metals & metallurgy, nanoscience and nanotechnology, pharmaceuticals, cosmetics & toiletries, plastics & rubbers, safety, health & hygiene, and semiconductors & electronics.

hash.name: NCBI Bookshelf
hash.title: NCBI Bookshelf
hash.databasedescription: Collection of biomedical books adapted for the web by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) in collaboration with authors and publishers.

hash.name: SOLV-DB

meta.more-info:
Once presented, queries provide a list of physical properties such as specific gravity and boiling point, as well as links to regulatory data, environmental fate data, and health and safety data.The main page contains a how-to link that gives additional user information for this already well-designed and user-friendly resource.

The above description is taken from: Scout Report for Physical Sciences, Mar 22 2002, v1 n5

hash.title: SOLV-DB
hash.databasedescription:
The nonprofit National Center for Manufacturing Sciences (NCMS) offers an online solvent database called SOLV-DB. Users can choose to browse by eight categories: solvent name, chemical abstracts, sax number, chemical number, chemical formula, property category, matching range, and solvent synonym.
Once presented, queries provide a list of physical properties such as specific gravity and boiling point, as well as links to regulatory data, environmental fate data, and health and safety data.The main page contains a how-to link that gives additional user information for this already well-designed and user-friendly resource.

The above description is taken from: Scout Report for Physical Sciences, Mar 22 2002, v1 n5

hash.name: The Dictionary of Substances and their Effects Database
hash.title: The Dictionary of Substances and their Effects Database
hash.databasedescription: Contains data on 4123 chemicals which have been studied for environmental impact or toxicity, and provides all the required information for the assessment of risks associated with the use of those chemicals.

hash.name: Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry

meta.more-info: For each chemical substance, information on physical and chemical properties, production, applications, economic data, toxicology and occupational health is given. The chemical substances that are described in detail range from raw materials via bulk products to fine and specialty chemicals. Relevant patent information is given wherever available.

hash.title: Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry
hash.databasedescription:
Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry is a reference work detailing the state of scientific and technological knowledge in all areas of industrial chemistry. Subject areas include: Inorganic and organic chemicals, Advanced materials, Pharmaceuticals, Polymers and plastics, Metals and alloys, Biotechnology and biotechnological products, Food chemistry, Process engineering and unit operations, Analytical methods, Environmental protection, etc.
For each chemical substance, information on physical and chemical properties, production, applications, economic data, toxicology and occupational health is given. The chemical substances that are described in detail range from raw materials via bulk products to fine and specialty chemicals. Relevant patent information is given wherever available.

hash.name: Philosopher's Index with Fulltext

meta.more-info: Topics include all major fields of philosophy, including Aesthetics, Epistemology, Ethics, Logic (including mathematics), Metaphysics (including philosophy of mind, existentialism, and phenomenology), Political philosophy (including philosophy of law), Social philosophy, and the Philosophy of Education, History, Language, Science and Religion.

hash.title: Philosopher's Index with Fulltext
hash.databasedescription:
Philosopher's Index offers complete coverage of all major articles from anthologies and books written in English, Spanish, German, Italian, and French -- over 480 journals from 38 countries published since 1940.
Topics include all major fields of philosophy, including Aesthetics, Epistemology, Ethics, Logic (including mathematics), Metaphysics (including philosophy of mind, existentialism, and phenomenology), Political philosophy (including philosophy of law), Social philosophy, and the Philosophy of Education, History, Language, Science and Religion.

hash.name: American National Biography Online
hash.title: American National Biography Online
hash.databasedescription: Contains biographies of people from all eras who have influenced and shaped American history and culture. Updated quarterly.

hash.name: Web of Science

meta.more-info:
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation databases:

Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
Science Citation Index Expanded(TM) (1899-present)
Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.title: Web of Science
hash.databasedescription:
Interdisciplinary Citation Database, with citation data from 1899-present, plus conference proceedings.
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation databases:

Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
Science Citation Index Expanded(TM) (1899-present)
Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.name: AlgaeBase
hash.title: AlgaeBase
hash.databasedescription:
A searchable database of information on the algae of the world including terrestrial, marine and freshwater forms. Search by species, genera, common name, or image. The bibliography can also be searched.
References, symbols, synonyms, classification, use, and distribution may be included in the information provided.

hash.name: APIRS Online: the database of aquatic, wetland and invasive plants
hash.title: APIRS Online: the database of aquatic, wetland and invasive plants
hash.databasedescription: Produced by the University of Florida Center for Aquatic and Invasive Plants. Includes annotated citations for over 58,000 related articles, reports, and books dating from the 18th century to the present (and representing a number of languages).

hash.name: Arctic Science and Technology Information System (ASTIS)
hash.title: Arctic Science and Technology Information System (ASTIS)
hash.databasedescription:
The ASTIS database contains 46,000 abstracts of publications and research
projects about northern Canada, and is maintained by the Arctic Institute of
North America at the University of Calgary. The database includes all subjects,
and covers the period from 1978 to the present. It includes government, academic
and industry publications, as well as research project descriptions based on the
licences that all northern field researchers must obtain.

hash.name: Bibliography of Fossil Vertebrates
hash.title: Bibliography of Fossil Vertebrates
hash.databasedescription: Online eqivalent of the print Bibliography of Fossil Vertebrates (UA Cameron Flr1 SciTech Ref: QE 841 Z9 B58). A detailed description is available on the publisher's web site.

hash.name: BioOne Abstracts & Indexes
hash.title: BioOne Abstracts & Indexes
hash.databasedescription: This database is an indexed and fully-searchable collection of abstracts developed by the American Institute of Biological Sciences (AIBS), SPARC (the Scholarly Publishing and Academic Resources Coalition), the University of Kansas, the Greater Western Library Alliance and Allen Press. It provides a unique aggregation of nearly 100 high-impact bioscience research journals from around 70 publishers.

hash.name: BIOSCIENCEnetBASE
hash.title: BIOSCIENCEnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Full-text handbooks and monographs covering topics including biochemistry, bioinformatics, biomedical engineering, biostatistics, biotechnology, epidemiology, immunology, microbiology, neuroscience, pharmacology, and toxicology.

hash.name: Book Citation Index

meta.more-info:
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation
databases:
  • Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
  • Science Citation Index Expanded(TM) (1899-present)
  • Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.title: Book Citation Index
hash.databasedescription:
It is part of the Web of Science.See "more" for brief details about it.
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation
databases:

  • Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
  • Science Citation Index Expanded(TM) (1899-present)
  • Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.name: Cold Spring Harbor Protocols
hash.title: Cold Spring Harbor Protocols
hash.databasedescription: Cold Spring Harbor Protocols is a source of new and classic research techniques. The database is fully searchable by keyword and subject. It also includes features such as discussion forums and personal folders. Coverage includes cell and molecular biology, genetics, bioinformatics, protein science, and imaging. Protocols are presented step-by-step and edited in the style that has made Molecular Cloning, Antibodies, Cells and many other CSH manuals essential to the work of scientists worldwide.

hash.name: Current Protocols in Molecular Biology
hash.title: Current Protocols in Molecular Biology
hash.databasedescription: Seeks to include all recently completed and ongoing research in the United Kingdom, from large sponsored programmes to individual projects.

hash.name: DART/ETIC: Developmental and Reproductive Toxicology
hash.title: DART/ETIC: Developmental and Reproductive Toxicology
hash.databasedescription: "DART/ETIC is a bibliographic database on the National Library of Medicine's (NLM) Toxicology Data Network (TOXNET®). It covers teratology and other aspects of developmental and reproductive toxicology. It contains over 90,000 references to literature published since 1965. DART/ETIC is funded by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, the National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences, the National Center for Toxicological Research of the Food and Drug Administration, and the NLM."

hash.name: Descriptions of Fungi and Bacteria
hash.title: Descriptions of Fungi and Bacteria
hash.databasedescription: The Descriptions of Fungi and Bacteria are designed for use by plant pathologists and veterinary and medical mycologists. They provide integrated information to allow identification / confirmation of identity of significant species, along with related information on pathology or other economic significance.

hash.name: Distribution Maps of Plant Diseases
hash.title: Distribution Maps of Plant Diseases
hash.databasedescription: Maps showing the presence and extent of specific plant diseases.

hash.name: Distribution Maps of Plant Pests
hash.title: Distribution Maps of Plant Pests
hash.databasedescription: Maps showing the presence and extent of specific plant pests.

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Immunology
hash.title: Encyclopedia of Immunology
hash.databasedescription:
The Encyclopedia of Immunology covers all areas of immunology and their
applications in related disciplines.

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Polymer Science and Technology
hash.title: Encyclopedia of Polymer Science and Technology
hash.databasedescription: Covers all areas of polymer science, covering nanotechnology, new imaging and analytical techniques, new methods of controlled polymer architecture, biomimetics, and more.

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Virology
hash.title: Encyclopedia of Virology
hash.databasedescription:
The Encyclopedia of Virology provides a coverage of the basic and
practical aspects of virology for the use of both professional and interested
lay readers.

hash.name: Environment Abstracts

meta.more-info: Environment Abstracts provides access to more journals, conference papers and proceedings, special reports from international agencies, non-governmental organizations, universities, associations and private corporations. Other materials selectively indexed include significant monographs, government studies and newsletters.

hash.title: Environment Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
Environment Abstracts (formerly Environment Abstracts published by LexisNexis) encompasses all aspects of the impact of people and technology on the environment and the effectiveness of remedial policies and technologies. As of 1994, the database also provides expanded coverage of energy-related issues.


Environment Abstracts provides access to more journals, conference papers and proceedings, special reports from international agencies, non-governmental organizations, universities, associations and private corporations. Other materials selectively indexed include significant monographs, government studies and newsletters.

hash.name: Genome
hash.title: Genome
hash.databasedescription: Created to provide a practical approach to the handling of complete genomes (large and small) as well as genetic and physical maps.

hash.name: Google Books
hash.title: Google Books
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic information for included books, as well as previews of selected books and, in some cases, full-text of these books.

hash.name: Human Genome Epidemiology Network
hash.title: Human Genome Epidemiology Network
hash.databasedescription: Human Genome Epidemiology Network, or HuGENet™ is a global collaboration of individuals & organizations committed to the assessment of the impact of human genome variation on population health & how genetic information can be used to improve health & prevent disease.

hash.name: JSTOR Plant Science

meta.more-info:
JSTOR Plant Science offers access to botanical and related resources including:
  • Database of plant type specimens representing the botanical diversity of the planet.
  • Scientific research articles and other content
  • Foundational reference works and books
  • Correspondence, including Kew’s Directors' Correspondence which included hand-written letters and memorandum from the senior staff of Kew from 1841 to 1928.
  • Paintings, photographs, drawings, and other images.


A significant portion of the content available on JSTOR Plant Science has been contributed through an effort known as the Global Plants Initiative (GPI).

hash.title: JSTOR Plant Science
hash.databasedescription:
Click on "more" below for brief desription about JSTOR Plant Science
JSTOR Plant Science offers access to botanical and related resources including:
  • Database of plant type specimens representing the botanical diversity of the planet.
  • Scientific research articles and other content
  • Foundational reference works and books
  • Correspondence, including Kew’s Directors' Correspondence which included hand-written letters and memorandum from the senior staff of Kew from 1841 to 1928.
  • Paintings, photographs, drawings, and other images.


A significant portion of the content available on JSTOR Plant Science has been contributed through an effort known as the Global Plants Initiative (GPI).

hash.name: National Forestry Database
hash.title: National Forestry Database
hash.databasedescription: Data and information on forestry management in Canada, produced by the Canadian Council of Forest Ministers.

hash.name: Native American Ethnobotany
hash.title: Native American Ethnobotany
hash.databasedescription: A database of plants used as drugs, foods, dyes, fibers, and more, by native Peoples of North America.

hash.name: Nature Precedings
hash.title: Nature Precedings
hash.databasedescription: Nature Precedings is a permanent, citable pre-print server and archive for pre-publication research and preliminary findings. It is a place for researchers to share documents, including presentations, posters, white papers, technical papers, supplementary findings, and non-peer-reviewed manuscripts.

hash.name: Nucleotide
hash.title: Nucleotide
hash.databasedescription: The Entrez Nucleotides database is a collection of sequences from several sources, including GenBank, RefSeq, and PDB.

hash.name: NWT Species at Risk

meta.more-info:
Information is provided for individual species under the following categories:


  • Taxonomic
  • General Biology
  • Habitat
  • Distribution
  • Population
  • Abundance
  • NWT Status Rank

hash.title: NWT Species at Risk
hash.databasedescription:
This database presents lists of wild species prioritized according to their general status (one of nine standard categories, ranging from Secure to At Risk).This system provides information which may be used in setting conservation priorities territorially, nationally, and internationally -- especially across the circumpolar regions of the world.


Information is provided for individual species under the following categories:


  • Taxonomic
  • General Biology
  • Habitat
  • Distribution
  • Population
  • Abundance
  • NWT Status Rank

hash.name: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man
hash.title: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man
hash.databasedescription: This database is a catalog of human genes and genetic disorders authored and edited by Dr. Victor A. McKusick and his colleagues at Johns Hopkins and elsewhere, and developed for the World Wide Web by NCBI, the National Center for Biotechnology Information. The database contains textual information, pictures, and reference information. It also contains copious links to NCBI's Entrez database of MEDLINE articles and sequence information.

hash.name: Plant Information Online
hash.title: Plant Information Online
hash.databasedescription: This database lists sources in 1043 North American nurseries for 106,825 plants, and provides 373,367 citations to 139,286 plants in science and garden literature. It also links to selected websites for images and regional information about 12,163 plants, and links to information on 2438 North American seed and nursery firms.

hash.name: Plant Management Network Image Collections
hash.title: Plant Management Network Image Collections
hash.databasedescription: Searchable database of plant and agricultural images.

hash.name: Plants for a Future
hash.title: Plants for a Future
hash.databasedescription: Search by Latin names, Common names, Family ( shows classification of plants into division, order, families, etc.), Habitat (all the different habitats you can search for), Edible Uses (full list and description of edible uses), Medicinal Uses (full list and description of medicinal uses, and Other Uses (fibre, wood, etc)

hash.name: PrimateLit: A Bibliographic Database for Primatology

meta.more-info: Coverage of the database spans 1940 to present and includes all publication categories (articles, books, abstracts, technical reports, dissertations, book chapters, etc.) and many subject areas (behavior, colony management, ecology, reproduction, field studies, disease models, veterinary science, psychology, physiology, pharmacology, evolution, taxonomy, developmental and molecular biology, genetics and zoogeography).

hash.title: PrimateLit: A Bibliographic Database for Primatology
hash.databasedescription:
Provides bibliographic access to the scientific literature on nonhuman primates for the research and educational communities.
Coverage of the database spans 1940 to present and includes all publication categories (articles, books, abstracts, technical reports, dissertations, book chapters, etc.) and many subject areas (behavior, colony management, ecology, reproduction, field studies, disease models, veterinary science, psychology, physiology, pharmacology, evolution, taxonomy, developmental and molecular biology, genetics and zoogeography).

hash.name: Protein
hash.title: Protein
hash.databasedescription: The protein entries in the Entrez search and retrieval system have been compiled from a variety of sources, including SwissProt, PIR, PRF, PDB, and translations from annotated coding regions in GenBank and RefSeq.

hash.name: Structural Genomics Knowledgebase

meta.more-info: The SGKB serves as a continually updated portal to research data and other resources from the PSI. NPG provides a monthly update with synopses of important research advances, recent additions to a categorized library of research articles, as well as news and events in structural biology.

hash.title: Structural Genomics Knowledgebase
hash.databasedescription:
The Structural Genomics Knowledgebase (SGKB) is a free, comprehensive resource produced in a collaboration between the Protein Structure Initiative (PSI) and Nature Publishing Group (NPG). The site offers you an easy way of keeping abreast of developments both by the PSI and more generally in the fields of structural genomics and structural biology.
The SGKB serves as a continually updated portal to research data and other resources from the PSI. NPG provides a monthly update with synopses of important research advances, recent additions to a categorized library of research articles, as well as news and events in structural biology.

hash.name: The Encyclopedia of Materials: Science and Technology
hash.title: The Encyclopedia of Materials: Science and Technology
hash.databasedescription: Contains approximately 2,000 articles covering all aspects of materials science and technology, including: functional phenomena, fundamental core theory, structural materials, structural phenomena, polymers and materials chemistry, and functional materials. Approximately 100 new or revised articles will be added per year.

hash.name: InfoClinique
hash.title: InfoClinique
hash.databasedescription: InfoClinique est un moteur de recherche destiné aux professionnels de la santé qui facilite l'accès à des sources d'information scientifique de qualité, de langue française et anglaise, disponibles en accès libre sur le web et jugées pertinentes au domaine des soins de santé au Québec (Canada).

hash.name: IEEE Xplore: IEEE/IEE Electronic Library (IEL) Online
hash.title: IEEE Xplore: IEEE/IEE Electronic Library (IEL) Online
hash.databasedescription:
IEEE Xplore, produced by the Institute of Electrical and Electronic
Engineers, provides full-text access to IEEE and IEE transactions, journals, magazines and conference proceedings published since 1884, and all current IEEE Standards. Coverage includes electrical and electronic engineering, computer engineering and computing science.

hash.name: Inspec
hash.title: Inspec
hash.databasedescription: Inspec (1896 to the present) covers material in the field of physics, electrical engineering and electronics, computers and control engineering and information technology.
