Each record contains an English-language title and descriptive abstract, together with full bibliographic details which include the journal title, author's name and affiliation and the language of the original document

hash.name: MatWeb

meta.more-info: The database is comprised mostly of data sheets and spec sheets supplied by manufacturers and distributors. Users may search by material type, trade name, manufacturer, property and metal composition as well as material specification such as ASTM number or UNS (Unified Numbering System) number.

hash.title: MatWeb
hash.databasedescription:
MatWeb's database includes thermoplastic and thermoset polymers such as ABS, nylon, polycarbonate, polyester, and polyolefins; metals such as aluminum, cobalt, copper, lead, magnesium, nickel, steel, superalloys, titanium and zinc alloys; ceramics; plus a growing list of semiconductors, fibers, and other engineering materials.
The database is comprised mostly of data sheets and spec sheets supplied by manufacturers and distributors. Users may search by material type, trade name, manufacturer, property and metal composition as well as material specification such as ASTM number or UNS (Unified Numbering System) number.

hash.name: Regional Business News
hash.title: Regional Business News
hash.databasedescription: Provides full text coverage for regional business publications. Regional Business News incorporates coverage of 75 business journals, newspapers and newswires from all metropolitan and rural areas within the United States.

hash.name: Boardex

meta.more-info:
This is an integrating resource. Additional datasets are added every two years. These new datasets contain all previous content plus all new content. We have 2 datasets from Boardex:

  • Board Summary Reports which provide information on individual members of boards of directors (by name) including: director role & experience, committee membership, director and committee compensation. Data goes back to 1999 when available. Covers Europe, UK, North American and Rest of World (ROW) companies.
  • Director Profiles provide data on individual directors by ID number including: age, gender, education, number of boards on, achievements, board role ( current and historic) , and other activities (current and historic). Data back to 1999 when available. Covers Europe, UK, North American and Rest of World (ROW) companies.

hash.title: Boardex
hash.databasedescription:
Boardex provides in depth profiles on world business leaders that show the relationship between and amongst these individuals. Details of board structures, practices, remuneration, diversity, stability and characteristics can also be obtained.

This is an integrating resource. Additional datasets are added every two years. These new datasets contain all previous content plus all new content. We have 2 datasets from Boardex:

  • Board Summary Reports which provide information on individual members of boards of directors (by name) including: director role & experience, committee membership, director and committee compensation. Data goes back to 1999 when available. Covers Europe, UK, North American and Rest of World (ROW) companies.
  • Director Profiles provide data on individual directors by ID number including: age, gender, education, number of boards on, achievements, board role ( current and historic) , and other activities (current and historic). Data back to 1999 when available. Covers Europe, UK, North American and Rest of World (ROW) companies.

hash.name: CBCA Business
hash.title: CBCA Business
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to a broad range of Canadian business periodicals. Over 400 journals make up the collection, with file depth back to the early 1980s. Trade journals, general business publications, academic journals, topical journals, and professional publications are all included.

hash.name: Compustat Executive Compensation
hash.title: Compustat Executive Compensation
hash.databasedescription: Executive compensation data including 100 up-to-date compensation and financial items

hash.name: ESG Research
hash.title: ESG Research
hash.databasedescription: Provides ratings and analysis of 34 key ESG (environmental, social and governance) factors for 2000 global companies and enables comparison of companies within their industry sectors.

hash.name: GMI Ratings
hash.title: GMI Ratings
hash.databasedescription:
A source of comprehensive objective corporate governance, compensation, and critical company information. Information on over 4,000 U.S. companies and over 45,000 corporate executives and directors. Information includes: Corporate Board Structure and Independence, Director Positions and Committee Assignments, Executive Compensation, Director Compensation, Audit Fees, Corporate Ownership, Takeover Defenses.


Formerly titled "Corporate Library (Board Analyst)".

hash.name: ISS (Institutional Shareholder Services): Directors Data
hash.title: ISS (Institutional Shareholder Services): Directors Data
hash.databasedescription: Data on corporate directors of the S&P 1500 companies back to 1996. Data variables include: director independence, stock ownership, attendance, board committee service, primary employment category and company, and interlocking directorships.

hash.name: ISS (Institutional Shareholder Services): Governance
hash.title: ISS (Institutional Shareholder Services): Governance
hash.databasedescription: Information on takeover defense and other corporate governance provisions for major US firms.

hash.name: KLD Ratings Data
hash.title: KLD Ratings Data
hash.databasedescription: KLD created Domini 400 SocialSM Index (DS 400 Index), a socially screened, capitalization-weighted index of 400 common stocks. The DS 400 is recognized as the first social investment benchmark. As well, KLD provides social ratings for all companies in the DS 400. Data is available from 1991-current.

hash.name: Sustainalytics
hash.title: Sustainalytics
hash.databasedescription: Sustainalytics (formerly The Canadian Social Investment Database, CSID) contains social and environmental profiles of companies in the TSX Composite Index.

hash.name: British Columbia Reports
hash.title: British Columbia Reports
hash.databasedescription: This law report series, which was first published in 1884, has full text judgments dating back to 1867. The Reports contain important social and legal history of British Columbia, and chart the development of BC law. This database is an important resource for legal researchers, historians, and genealogists as it provides a collection of unique primary information on society and individuals living in BC in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

hash.name: CCH Tax Cases
hash.title: CCH Tax Cases
hash.databasedescription: CCH Tax Cases includes 3 U.K. tax law report series covering cases from 1875 to the present: British Tax Cases, British Value Added Tax Cases, and CCH Special Commissioners' Decisions.

hash.name: CriminalSource

meta.more-info:
Criminal Source also permits users to update both cases and legislation, using the KeyCiteCanada feature.In addition, access is provided to the following sources:
  • Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.
  • Family Source provides search access to Canadian primary law as it relates to the family, including case law and legislation in Canada. As
    well, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the case comments from law reports and case summaries from the Canadian
    Abridgment. Some highlights include Child Protection Law in Canada by Bernstein, Canadian Divorce Law and Practice by MacDonald and Ferrier, and Child Custody Law and Practice by McLeod. It also permits users to note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the
    KeyCiteCanada feature
  • InsolvencySource provides search access to all full text cases dealing with bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property security law in Canada. It also includes other primary law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.
  • IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.
  • LawSource provides search access to Canadian primary
    law-legislation and court decisions-from across the country.
  • SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.
  • As well, access to legal materials from the United States and United Kingdom are located under the "US Premiere Service" and "UK Law" tabs.

hash.title: CriminalSource
hash.databasedescription:
Criminal Source provides search access to criminal, constitutional,
evidence and immigration cases from all Canadian jurisdictions. Primary
sources include case law and legislation. Secondary sources include
Commentary and Annotations , WattÕs Manual of Criminal Evidence, Disclosure and Production in Criminal Cases by Segal and Canadian Criminal Code Offences by Gibson.
Criminal Source also permits users to update both cases and legislation, using the KeyCiteCanada feature.In addition, access is provided to the following sources:
  • Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.
  • Family Source provides search access to Canadian primary law as it relates to the family, including case law and legislation in Canada. As
    well, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the case comments from law reports and case summaries from the Canadian
    Abridgment. Some highlights include Child Protection Law in Canada by Bernstein, Canadian Divorce Law and Practice by MacDonald and Ferrier, and Child Custody Law and Practice by McLeod. It also permits users to note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the
    KeyCiteCanada feature
  • InsolvencySource provides search access to all full text cases dealing with bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property security law in Canada. It also includes other primary law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.
  • IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.
  • LawSource provides search access to Canadian primary
    law-legislation and court decisions-from across the country.
  • SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.
  • As well, access to legal materials from the United States and United Kingdom are located under the "US Premiere Service" and "UK Law" tabs.

hash.name: Alacra
hash.title: Alacra
hash.databasedescription: Provides information on companies, industries and products by simultaneously searching the web and a number of databases licensed to the University of Alberta.

hash.name: BMI Research

meta.more-info:
BMI Research Online Help


The following brief tutorials give information on using BMI Research:

  • Finding a Firm that has Entered a Foreign Market (2 min, 27 sec)
  • How To Find an Industry SWOT Analysis (1 min, 35 sec)

hash.title: BMI Research
hash.databasedescription:
BMI Research provides business information on global markets. The BMI database includes a range of information that covers analysis of political risk, finance, macroeconomic performance, outlook and forecasting, industry sectors and the business operating environment. Country coverage includes, North America, Western Europe, Asia, Middle East and Africa, Eastern Europe and Latin America.

BMI Research Online Help


The following brief tutorials give information on using BMI Research:

  • Finding a Firm that has Entered a Foreign Market (2 min, 27 sec)
  • How To Find an Industry SWOT Analysis (1 min, 35 sec)

hash.name: CANSIM

meta.more-info: The University of Alberta Libraries offer two different interfaces to CANSIM. The Statistics Canada version is the native CANSIM interface as provided by Statistics Canada. The CHASS version provides value-added features such as Multidimensional View, Most-Frequently-Retrieved Series, and more options for time series searching, manipulation, and retrieval.

hash.title: CANSIM
hash.databasedescription:
CANSIM (Canadian Socio-Economic Information Management System) provides access to current and historical statistical time series on a wide variety of social and economic aspects of Canadian life as collected by Statistics Canada as well as other government agencies such as the Bank of Canada. Updated daily, it contains more than 600,000 statistical time series, many of which comprise a data record spanning several decades.


The University of Alberta Libraries offer two different interfaces to CANSIM. The Statistics Canada version is the native CANSIM interface as provided by Statistics Canada. The CHASS version provides value-added features such as Multidimensional View, Most-Frequently-Retrieved Series, and more options for time series searching, manipulation, and retrieval.

hash.name: Dun & Bradstreet Industry Norms and Key Business Ratios

meta.more-info:
"Industry norms" is a concept of juxtaposing an individual company's balance sheet and income statement ratios against "norms" derived from the industry group (as per the SIC code) to which the company belongs.


Dun & Bradstreet Industry Norms and Key Business Ratios Online Help


The following are brief tutorials that describe how to find Canadian industry ratios using Dun & Bradstreet Industry Norms and Key Business Ratios:


  • Finding Canadian industry ratios (2 min, 52 sec.)(voice narrated)

  • Finding Canadian industry ratios (2 min, 52 sec.)(text only)

hash.title: Dun & Bradstreet Industry Norms and Key Business Ratios
hash.databasedescription:
This database provides users with a set of business ratios, measured as relationships between companies' balance sheet and income statement categories across industries classified as per Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) codes. These ratios are used to benchmark a company's performance in the areas of solvency, efficiency and profitability against it's industry norm. NOTE: Coverage includes 2004-2011 inclusive.


"Industry norms" is a concept of juxtaposing an individual company's balance sheet and income statement ratios against "norms" derived from the industry group (as per the SIC code) to which the company belongs.


Dun & Bradstreet Industry Norms and Key Business Ratios Online Help


The following are brief tutorials that describe how to find Canadian industry ratios using Dun & Bradstreet Industry Norms and Key Business Ratios:


  • Finding Canadian industry ratios (2 min, 52 sec.)(voice narrated)

  • Finding Canadian industry ratios (2 min, 52 sec.)(text only)

hash.name: Financial Performance Indicators for Canadian Business

meta.more-info:
Produced by Statistics Canada, this database provides financial ratios and balance sheets by industry sector.
  • Volume 1: Covers medium and large firms and covers all enterprises in all industries (financial and nonfinancial) based on 1996 sample survey data from survey of enterprise financial statements database .
  • Volume 2: Covers small and medium nonfinancial firms from 1994 corporate income tax
    return data.
  • Volume 3: Covers small and medium firms of nonfinancial industries from the 1996 corporate income tax administrative database; a limited number of data variables are available.

hash.title: Financial Performance Indicators for Canadian Business
hash.databasedescription:
Click on "more" below for brief description of Financial Performance Indicators for Canadian Business
Produced by Statistics Canada, this database provides financial ratios and balance sheets by industry sector.
  • Volume 1: Covers medium and large firms and covers all enterprises in all industries (financial and nonfinancial) based on 1996 sample survey data from survey of enterprise financial statements database .
  • Volume 2: Covers small and medium nonfinancial firms from 1994 corporate income tax
    return data.
  • Volume 3: Covers small and medium firms of nonfinancial industries from the 1996 corporate income tax administrative database; a limited number of data variables are available.

hash.name: IBISWorld
hash.title: IBISWorld
hash.databasedescription: Provides over 700 U.S. industry research reports which include industry characteristics, conditions, performance, trends, statistics etc.

hash.name: InsolvencySource

meta.more-info:
Also included are articles and court filings from the Insolvency Institute of Canada,
annotations from Canadian Bankruptcy Reports, and Houlden and Morawetz
Precedents under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act. It also permits
users to note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the
KeyCiteCanada feature

In addition, access is provided to the following sources:

CriminalSource provides search access to criminal,
constitutional, evidence, and immigration cases from all Canadian
jurisdictions.

Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.

FamilySource provides search access to Canadian primary law
as it relates to the family, including case law and legislation in
Canada. As well, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials,
such as the case comments from law reports and case summaries from the
Canadian Abridgment.

IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.

LawSource provides search access to Canadian primary
law-legislation and court decisions-from across the country

SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.

As well, access to legal materials from the United States and United
Kingdom are located under the "US Premiere Service" and "UK Law" tabs.

hash.title: InsolvencySource
hash.databasedescription:
Insolvency Source provides search access to all full text cases dealing with bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property security law in Canada. It also includes other primary law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.
Also included are articles and court filings from the Insolvency Institute of Canada,
annotations from Canadian Bankruptcy Reports, and Houlden and Morawetz
Precedents under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act. It also permits
users to note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the
KeyCiteCanada feature

In addition, access is provided to the following sources:

CriminalSource provides search access to criminal,
constitutional, evidence, and immigration cases from all Canadian
jurisdictions.

Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.

FamilySource provides search access to Canadian primary law
as it relates to the family, including case law and legislation in
Canada. As well, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials,
such as the case comments from law reports and case summaries from the
Canadian Abridgment.

IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.

LawSource provides search access to Canadian primary
law-legislation and court decisions-from across the country

SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.

As well, access to legal materials from the United States and United
Kingdom are located under the "US Premiere Service" and "UK Law" tabs.

hash.name: Globe and Mail (1844-2012)
hash.title: Globe and Mail (1844-2012)
hash.databasedescription: Electronic full-page newspaper archive of The Globe from June 1844 until 4-5 years ago. Coverage includes all the stories, plus images, advertisements, classifieds, political cartoons, births and deaths from more than 1.4 million pages of Canada's National Newspaper, dating back to the pre-confederation era.

hash.name: Criminal Justice Abstracts
hash.title: Criminal Justice Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Covers the major journals in criminology and related disciplines, books, and reports from government and nongovernmental agencies. For each document, a summary of the findings, methodology, and conclusions is provided. Topics include crime trends, prevention projects, corrections, juvenile delinquency, police, courts, offenders, victims, and sentencing.

hash.name: Index to Canadian Legal Literature (ICLL)
hash.title: Index to Canadian Legal Literature (ICLL)
hash.databasedescription:
Index to Canadian Legal Literature (1985 to the present) is a
bibliographic database which provides indexing of journals, law reports, theses,
books, book reviews, essay collections and Canadiana Forthcoming Books.

hash.name: Annotated Bibliography of Canadian Demography
hash.title: Annotated Bibliography of Canadian Demography
hash.databasedescription:
The Annotated Bibliography of Canadian Demography covers material
published in English and French on Canada's population. This database is
produced by the Population Studies Centre of the University of Western Ontario.

hash.name: Campbell Collaboration

meta.more-info: The Campbell Library includes two registers of randomized controlled trials (C2-SPECTR and C2-PROT) and a register of systematic reviews of interventions and policy evaluations (C2-RIPE).

hash.title: Campbell Collaboration
hash.databasedescription:
The objectives of the Campbell Collaboration (C2) are to prepare, maintain and disseminate systematic reviews of studies of interventions, and to acquire and promote access to information about trials of interventions. C2 builds summaries and electronic brochures of reviews and reports of trials for policy makers, practitioners, researchers and the public.
The Campbell Library includes two registers of randomized controlled trials (C2-SPECTR and C2-PROT) and a register of systematic reviews of interventions and policy evaluations (C2-RIPE).

hash.name: Canadian federal government databases available through the internet

meta.more-info: This edition contains 334 entries from the previous edition that have been reviewed and verified as well as 154 databases that have appeared since the previous edition. All databases listed were available on the Internet as of December 20th, 2008

hash.title: Canadian federal government databases available through the internet
hash.databasedescription:
This is the 4th edition of the bibliography of online Canadian federal government databases, replacing the 3rd edition published in 2005. This current edition lists 488 databases publicly accessible on Government of Canada Web sites. Some of these databases require user registration.
This edition contains 334 entries from the previous edition that have been reviewed and verified as well as 154 databases that have appeared since the previous edition. All databases listed were available on the Internet as of December 20th, 2008

hash.name: Canadian Women Film Directors Database
hash.title: Canadian Women Film Directors Database
hash.databasedescription: This bilingual research tool contains bibliographies, filmographies, quotations, and other information about Canadian women directors and their films.

hash.name: Census of Canada, 1996
hash.title: Census of Canada, 1996

hash.name: Civilization.ca / Civilisations.ca
hash.title: Civilization.ca / Civilisations.ca
hash.databasedescription: This database is a gateway to overviews and scholarship on human civilizations, with an emphasis on Canadian history and culture. Fulltext with bibliographies.

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Canadian Theatre
hash.title: Encyclopedia of Canadian Theatre
hash.databasedescription: Database of information about Canadian actors, playwrights, directors, producers, designers, theatre organizations and institutions, composers and plays. Maintained by Athabasca University as a service to the Canadian theatre community.

hash.name: Encyclopedia of Music in Canada

meta.more-info: It aims to describe Canada's musical heritage and culture in its breadth and depth: the historic and current manifestations of popular, folk, religious, concert, and other forms of music, as well as Canadian music's educational, critical, administrative, and commercial aspects. Bibliographies, lists and discographies may be more limited in this electronic format than in the original Second Edition.

hash.title: Encyclopedia of Music in Canada
hash.databasedescription:
This database is based on and will update the Second Edition of The Encyclopedia of Music in Canada (1992).
It aims to describe Canada's musical heritage and culture in its breadth and depth: the historic and current manifestations of popular, folk, religious, concert, and other forms of music, as well as Canadian music's educational, critical, administrative, and commercial aspects. Bibliographies, lists and discographies may be more limited in this electronic format than in the original Second Edition.

hash.name: Libris Canadiana
hash.title: Libris Canadiana
hash.databasedescription: The Libris Database provides word, title, author and subject access to material published in a number of Canadian periodicals of historical significance, including Maclean's Magazine, The Financial Post, The Monetary Times of Canada, Massey's Magazine, The Canadian Bookman, The Canadian Magazine, and The University Magazine.

hash.name: North American Theatre Online
hash.title: North American Theatre Online
hash.databasedescription: Covers all aspects of the Canadian and American Theatre. Includes major reference materials, together with records to plays, people, theatres, nearly productions and production companies. Also includes some images, playbills, postcards, scrapbooks and other resources.

hash.name: Our Roots: Canada's Local Histories
hash.title: Our Roots: Canada's Local Histories
hash.databasedescription: Online fulltext collection of Canadian local histories.

hash.name: Peel's Prairie Provinces
hash.title: Peel's Prairie Provinces

hash.name: Saskatchewan News Index
hash.title: Saskatchewan News Index
hash.databasedescription: Selectively indexes Saskatchewan newspapers. Created by merging print newspaper indexes compiled by a number of libraries. Names of newspapers indexed and dates of coverage is given on the site.

hash.name: The Directory of Canadian Universities
hash.title: The Directory of Canadian Universities
hash.databasedescription: Provides information on Canadian Universities. Searchable by location, field of study, and other parameters.

hash.name: Twentieth Century North American Drama
hash.title: Twentieth Century North American Drama
hash.databasedescription: Contains the full-text of plays and information on playwrights, together with detailed, fielded information on related productions, theaters, production companies, and more. The database also includes selected playbills, production photographs and other ephemera related to the plays.

hash.name: ABI Inform Complete

meta.more-info:
It comprises the following titles:
ABI Inform Dateline(http://search.proquest.com/abidateline/advanced?accountid=14474): Includes local and regional business publications, including McClatchey Tribune titles, with news about issues such as local companies, analysis, and information on local markets .
ABI Inform Global(http://search.proquest.com/abiglobal/advanced?accountid=14474):
Includes in-depth coverage for thousands of publications, most of which are available in full text.
ABI Inform Trade & Industry(http://search.proquest.com/abitrade/advanced?accountid=14474): Includes in-depth coverage of companies, products, executives, trends and other topics.

hash.title: ABI Inform Complete
hash.databasedescription:
ABI Inform Complete includes full-text journals, dissertations, working papers, key business and economics periodicals such as the Economist, country-and industry-focused reports, and downloadable data.
It comprises the following titles:
ABI Inform Dateline(http://search.proquest.com/abidateline/advanced?accountid=14474): Includes local and regional business publications, including McClatchey Tribune titles, with news about issues such as local companies, analysis, and information on local markets .
ABI Inform Global(http://search.proquest.com/abiglobal/advanced?accountid=14474):
Includes in-depth coverage for thousands of publications, most of which are available in full text.
ABI Inform Trade & Industry(http://search.proquest.com/abitrade/advanced?accountid=14474): Includes in-depth coverage of companies, products, executives, trends and other topics.

hash.name: AccessEngineering
hash.title: AccessEngineering
hash.databasedescription: AccessEngineering (formerly Digital Engineering Library) features content from McGraw-Hill engineering publications.

hash.name: CCOHS Academic Support Program

meta.more-info:
The following CCOHS (Canadian Centre for Occupational Health and Safety) databases are available through the CCOHS Academic Support Program:



  • MSDS plus CHEMINFO: For users who need safety data on specific chemical products used in their workplaces (for example, cleaners, paints, glues, laboratory chemicals). The MSDS database provides current Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDSs) directly from suppliers and manufacturers. CHEMINFO contains detailed profiles of more than 1,300 important workplace chemicals, including health, fire and reactivity hazards and safe work practices. Records are designed for use by health and safety professionals, employees working with chemicals, users and writers of Material Safety Data Sheets, firefighters, and other emergency response personnel.



  • FTSS (Fiche techniques sur la sécurité des substances): Le disque FTSS vous donne accès à fiches signalétiques de langue française à jour venant de plus de 250 fabricants et fournisseurs nord-américains.



  • RTECS® (Registry of Toxic Effects of Chemical Substances): Critical toxicity data on more than 165,000 chemical substances in the Registry of Toxic Effects of Chemicals, enhanced by CCOHS.



  • OSH References Collection includes:

    • OSHLINE provides comprehensive international coverage of documents on occupational health and safety, as well as related fields. It contains detailed summaries of over 200,000 articles, reports and publications, spanning over 100 years. OSHLINE™ complements the coverage of NIOSHTIC®, which was discontinued in mid-1998.
    • NIOSHTIC® - Covers all aspects of occupational health and safety with a strong emphasis on toxicology.
    • NIOSHTIC®-2 - Featuring NIOSH-published or sponsored reports, NIOSHTIC-2 covers 1971 to present. A portion of references ? approximately 13,000 ? related to mining date from the 1930s. Types of documents include: NIOSH criteria documents, alerts and technical reports, Health Hazard Evaluations (HETA Reports), NIOSH-authored journal articles, books & symposia.
    • HSELINE - Produced by the UK Health and Safety Executive, HSELINE provides over 184,000 citations with abstracts to worldwide literature on occupational safety and health. Coverage of all UK Health and Safety Commission and Health and Safety Executive publications as well as a wide range of periodicals, books, conference proceedings, reports, and legislation. Predominantly oriented towards safety and industrial hazards, with an emphasis on Engineering, Manufacturing, Railways, Hazardous substances, Occupational Hygiene, Offshore safety, Agriculture, Mining.
    • CISILO - Bilingual database covering international health and safety literature from diverse countries.
    • Canadiana - CCHOS database offering references related to Canada. Includes references to reports, articles, conference proceedings, monographs and unpublished or limited distribution materials. Also includes selected TOXLINE® records from the US National Library of Medicine. Canadiana (French) includes references to French-language materials.



  • IPSC INCHEM: Provides ready access to hundreds of publications about chemicals from the international organizations that cooperate with the Information Program on Chemical Safety (IPCS).



  • CHEMINDEX: Guide to information resources on over 200,000 chemicals. Each CHEMINDEX record contains identification information on a unique substance, including Chemical names and synonyms, Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) registry numbers, a listing of the CCOHS databases that contain information on that substance.



  • Fatality Reports contains information about the circumstances surrounding occupationally related fatalities. Information is extracted from reports on inquests and inquiries into occupationally related fatalities across Canada.

See "more" below for brief description about CCOHS Academics Support Program

hash.name: Engineering Case Studies Online
hash.title: Engineering Case Studies Online
hash.databasedescription:
Established in September 2008 as the Government of Alberta database for research in all areas of energy and technology development, EIPA is a portal for information contributed from 34 years of cross-ministry and department resources and research projects with industry, academia, and other partners.



EIPA is a web-accessible repository of public and private research in energy pertinent to the vast hydrocarbon resources in Alberta. There are over 52,000 documents in the collection, about half of which are publicly available. Only citations are currently in the database, but full documents will be added.

hash.name: FreeBooks4Doctors
hash.title: FreeBooks4Doctors
hash.databasedescription: Medical books available freely over the internet.

hash.name: IHS Standards Expert

meta.more-info:
Wild card or truncation capability is available using the asterisk "*". For example, searching "transmi*" will yield documents containing the words "transmission", "transmit", "transmitting", etc.

Please note: The University of Alberta subscription presently limits availability of full text to standards publications from:


  • API - American Petroleum Institute
  • ASHRAE - American Society of Heating, Refrigeration and Air-Conditioning Engineers
  • ASME - American Society of Mechanical Engineers
  • ASME BPVC - ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code (non-nuclear only)
  • ASTM International
  • AWS - American Welding Society
  • CSA - Canadian Standards Association
  • GPA - Gas Processors Association
  • IEEE - Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
  • ISA - International Society of Automation
  • ISO - International Organization for Standardization
  • NACE - National Association of Corrosion Engineers
  • NFPA - National Fire Protection Association
  • SAE J - Society of Automotive Engineers J (Ground Vehicle) Standards
  • TAPPI - Technical Association of the Pulp and Paper Industry

hash.title: IHS Standards Expert
hash.databasedescription:
IHS Standards Expert (formerly Specs and Standards) is a standards management service which incorporates a very extensive collection of industry standards. Bibliographic information on over 350,000 standards from approximately 450 standards organizations throughout the world are included. Documents can be located by searching: document number, keywords, subject terms, organization, new/revised, ANSI approved, DoD adopted, ICS classification.



Wild card or truncation capability is available using the asterisk "*". For example, searching "transmi*" will yield documents containing the words "transmission", "transmit", "transmitting", etc.

Please note: The University of Alberta subscription presently limits availability of full text to standards publications from:


  • API - American Petroleum Institute
  • ASHRAE - American Society of Heating, Refrigeration and Air-Conditioning Engineers
  • ASME - American Society of Mechanical Engineers
  • ASME BPVC - ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code (non-nuclear only)
  • ASTM International
  • AWS - American Welding Society
  • CSA - Canadian Standards Association
  • GPA - Gas Processors Association
  • IEEE - Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
  • ISA - International Society of Automation
  • ISO - International Organization for Standardization
  • NACE - National Association of Corrosion Engineers
  • NFPA - National Fire Protection Association
  • SAE J - Society of Automotive Engineers J (Ground Vehicle) Standards
  • TAPPI - Technical Association of the Pulp and Paper Industry
