meta.more-info: Records are designed for use by health and safety professionals, employees working with chemicals, users and writers of Material Safety Data Sheets, firefighters, and other emergency response personnel.

hash.title: MSDS plus CHEMINFO
hash.databasedescription:
For users who need safety data on specific chemical products used in their workplaces (for example, cleaners, paints, glues, laboratory chemicals). The MSDS database provides current Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDSs) directly from suppliers and manufacturers. CHEMINFO contains detailed profiles of more than 1,300 important workplace chemicals, including health, fire and reactivity hazards and safe work practices.
Records are designed for use by health and safety professionals, employees working with chemicals, users and writers of Material Safety Data Sheets, firefighters, and other emergency response personnel.

hash.name: NIST/TRC Web Thermo Tables (WTT)

meta.more-info:
References to experimental data sources and information and methodology related to the evaluations can be found in complementary hard-copy publications:
  • TRC Thermodynamic Tables - Hydrocarbons. Ed. M. Frenkel, National Institute of Standards and Technology, Boulder, CO, Standard Reference Data Program, Publication Series NSRDS-NIST-75 (1942-2007), Gaithersburg, MD.
  • TRC Thermodynamic Tables - Non-Hydrocarbons. Ed. M. Frenkel, National Institute of Standards and Technology, Boulder, CO, Standard Reference Data Program, Publication Series NSRDS-NIST-74 (1955-2007), Gaithersburg, MD.

hash.title: NIST/TRC Web Thermo Tables (WTT)
hash.databasedescription:
Web version of the TRC Thermodynamic Tables.Click on "more" below for further information.
References to experimental data sources and information and methodology related to the evaluations can be found in complementary hard-copy publications:
  • TRC Thermodynamic Tables - Hydrocarbons. Ed. M. Frenkel, National Institute of Standards and Technology, Boulder, CO, Standard Reference Data Program, Publication Series NSRDS-NIST-75 (1942-2007), Gaithersburg, MD.
  • TRC Thermodynamic Tables - Non-Hydrocarbons. Ed. M. Frenkel, National Institute of Standards and Technology, Boulder, CO, Standard Reference Data Program, Publication Series NSRDS-NIST-74 (1955-2007), Gaithersburg, MD.

hash.name: Oil Properties Database

meta.more-info: At least 450 oils are listed. Depending on the oil, an entry may include one or more of: API Gravity, Sulphur (weight %), Pour Point (°C), Flash Point (°C), Fire Point (°C), Kinematic Viscosity (mm²/s or cSt), Dynamic Viscosity (mPa·s or cP), Yield on Crude (weight %), Density (g/mL), Hydrocarbon Groups (weight %), Surface Tension (mN/m or dynes/cm), Oil/Salt Water Interfacial Tension (mN/m or dynes/cm), Oil/Fresh Water Interfacial Tension (mN/m or dynes/cm), Distillation (°C), Equation(s) for Predicting Evaporation, Adhesion (g/m²), Volatile Organic Compounds (ppm), Boiling Point Distribution (°C), Flammability Limits in Air (volume %), Ignition Temperature (°C), Threshold Limit Values (ppm).

hash.title: Oil Properties Database
hash.databasedescription:
Click on "more" below for brief description of Oil Properties Database
At least 450 oils are listed. Depending on the oil, an entry may include one or more of: API Gravity, Sulphur (weight %), Pour Point (°C), Flash Point (°C), Fire Point (°C), Kinematic Viscosity (mm²/s or cSt), Dynamic Viscosity (mPa·s or cP), Yield on Crude (weight %), Density (g/mL), Hydrocarbon Groups (weight %), Surface Tension (mN/m or dynes/cm), Oil/Salt Water Interfacial Tension (mN/m or dynes/cm), Oil/Fresh Water Interfacial Tension (mN/m or dynes/cm), Distillation (°C), Equation(s) for Predicting Evaporation, Adhesion (g/m²), Volatile Organic Compounds (ppm), Boiling Point Distribution (°C), Flammability Limits in Air (volume %), Ignition Temperature (°C), Threshold Limit Values (ppm).

hash.name: OnePetro

meta.more-info:
In addition, OnePetro indexes technical documents from the following organizations:
  • American Petroleum Institute (API)
  • American Rock Mechanics Association (ARMA)
  • American Society of Safety Engineers (ASSE)
  • Offshore Technology Conference (OTC)
  • NACE International (corrosion engineers)
  • Society of Petrophysicists and Well Log Analysts (SPWLA)
  • The Society of Underwater Technology (SUT)
  • World Petroleum Council (WPC)

hash.title: OnePetro
hash.databasedescription:
OnePetro (formerly SPE E-Library) provides full-text access to the Society of Petroleum Engineers Technical Papers. Coverage begins in 1927. Papers are available in PDF format.
In addition, OnePetro indexes technical documents from the following organizations:
  • American Petroleum Institute (API)
  • American Rock Mechanics Association (ARMA)
  • American Society of Safety Engineers (ASSE)
  • Offshore Technology Conference (OTC)
  • NACE International (corrosion engineers)
  • Society of Petrophysicists and Well Log Analysts (SPWLA)
  • The Society of Underwater Technology (SUT)
  • World Petroleum Council (WPC)

hash.name: Petroleum Abstracts
hash.title: Petroleum Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Provides abstracts of journal articles, technical papers and patents covering the worldwide petroleum exploration and production industry.

hash.name: Polymers: A Property Database
hash.title: Polymers: A Property Database
hash.databasedescription: Contains comprehensive scientific and commercial information on approximately 1000 polymers.

hash.name: POLYMERSnetBASE
hash.title: POLYMERSnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to three databases of polymer information: Polymeric Materials Encyclopedia, Polymers: A Property Database, and full-text handbooks and monographs on various polymer topics, including biomaterials & medical devices, coatings & thin films, composite materials, and polymers & plastics.

hash.name: Reaxys
hash.title: Reaxys
hash.databasedescription: Reaxys is the Web-based successor to the Crossfire system. It provides user-friendly access to reliable information about millions of chemical structures, reactions, and properties contained in the Beilstein and Gmelin databases and also the Patent Chemistry Database.

hash.name: TRI: Toxic Release Inventory

meta.more-info: Mandated by the Superfund legislation, TRI's data covers air, water, land, and underground injection releases, as well as transfers to waste sites, and waste treatment methods and efficiency, as reported by industrial facilities around the United States. TRI also includes data related to source reduction and recycling.

hash.title: TRI: Toxic Release Inventory
hash.databasedescription:
TRI is an annually compiled series of databases that constitute the toxic releases files on the National Library of Medicine's (NLM) Toxicology Data Network (TOXNET®). This series, 1995-1997 reporting years, contains information on the annual estimated releases of toxic chemicals to the environment and is based upon data collected by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).
Mandated by the Superfund legislation, TRI's data covers air, water, land, and underground injection releases, as well as transfers to waste sites, and waste treatment methods and efficiency, as reported by industrial facilities around the United States. TRI also includes data related to source reduction and recycling.

hash.name: Reference Module in Chemistry, Molecular Sciences and Chemical Engineering
hash.title: Reference Module in Chemistry, Molecular Sciences and Chemical Engineering
hash.databasedescription:
Provides access to a collection of reference works from Elsevier in the areas of chemistry, molecular sciences, and chemical engineering.

Conditions
Use of this product is restricted to faculty, instructors, and students teaching or enrolled in at least one course that is either offered by the Faculty of Education or eligible for credit towards a B.Ed degree. It is the responsibility of each user to ensure that he or she uses this product for individual, non-commercial educational or research purposes only, and does not systematically download or retain substantial portions of information.

Chat requires JavaScript.

hash.name: ACS Publications
hash.title: ACS Publications
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext journals from the American Chemical Society.

hash.name: Organic Syntheses

meta.more-info: Each procedure is written in considerably more detail as compared to typical experimental procedures in other journals, and each reaction and all characterization data has been carefully "checked" for reproducibility in the laboratory of a member of the Board of Editors Organic Syntheses procedures may be accessed either via the tables of contents of individual volumes ("journal mode") or by conducting structure and keyword searches ("database mode"). Specific in dividual procedures can be accessed via the table of contents for either the original annual volume or collective volume in which the procedure appeared. "Database mode" allows users to simultaneously search all volumes of Organic Syntheses by keywords or by inputting structures and substructures. Structure searching requires the ChemDraw plugin which can be downloaded according to the instructions found in the left margin. Articles from future volumes of Organic Syntheses that are not yet incorporated in the searchable database can be accessed on the "Org Syn Express" page.

hash.title: Organic Syntheses
hash.databasedescription:
Since 1921, Organic Syntheses has provided the chemistry community with annual collections of detailed, reliable, and carefully checked procedures for the synthesis of organic compounds. Some procedures describe practical methods for the preparation of specific compounds of interest, while other procedures illustrate important synthetic methods with general utility.
Each procedure is written in considerably more detail as compared to typical experimental procedures in other journals, and each reaction and all characterization data has been carefully "checked" for reproducibility in the laboratory of a member of the Board of Editors Organic Syntheses procedures may be accessed either via the tables of contents of individual volumes ("journal mode") or by conducting structure and keyword searches ("database mode"). Specific in dividual procedures can be accessed via the table of contents for either the original annual volume or collective volume in which the procedure appeared. "Database mode" allows users to simultaneously search all volumes of Organic Syntheses by keywords or by inputting structures and substructures. Structure searching requires the ChemDraw plugin which can be downloaded according to the instructions found in the left margin. Articles from future volumes of Organic Syntheses that are not yet incorporated in the searchable database can be accessed on the "Org Syn Express" page.

hash.name: Royal Society of Chemistry (RSC) Publications
hash.title: Royal Society of Chemistry (RSC) Publications
hash.databasedescription: Full-text access to the RSC's electronic journals (1841-present) and books (1968-present).

hash.name: SDBS: Integrated Spectral Data Base System for Organic Compounds
hash.title: SDBS: Integrated Spectral Data Base System for Organic Compounds
hash.databasedescription: SDBS is an integrated spectral database system for organic compounds, which includes 6 different types of spectra under a directory database of the compounds. The spectra are EI mass, 1H decoupled 13C NMR, 1H NMR pattern (90 and/or 400 MHz), 1H NMR parameter (300 MHz pattern generated), FT-IR, laser-Raman, and ESR. It contains data on over 30,000 compounds.

hash.name: CHEMLIBnetBASE
hash.title: CHEMLIBnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Complements the databases of CHEMnetBASE with dozens of resources, references, and CRC handbooks. Chemistry topics covered include: analytical, industrial and applied, inorganic, materials, medicinal, organic, physical, polymer, and surface & colloid. Also covers electrochemistry, geochemistry, fuels and petrochemicals, photochemistry, separation science/chromatography, and spectroscopy.

hash.name: CAJ Fulltext Database [Series F: Literature, History, Philosophy]
hash.title: CAJ Fulltext Database [Series F: Literature, History, Philosophy]
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext from journals and other Chinese publications. To search, please select either "China Academic Journals Full-text Database" or "Century Journals Project".

hash.name: China Data Online
hash.title: China Data Online
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to the following databases: (1) yearly China macro-economic statistics, (2) monthly macro-economic statistics, (3) monthly macro-economic reports, (4) city statistics, (5) county statistics, (6) industrial sector statistics, as well as other resources.

hash.name: Scripta Sinica
hash.title: Scripta Sinica
hash.databasedescription: Scripta Sinica is a full text database for classical Chinese studies established by the Institute of History and Philology of Academia Sinica, Taiwan. Over 460 sets of books in Chinese classics, history, philosophy and literature are included, with emphasis on historical texts.

hash.name: Airiti Library
hash.title: Airiti Library
hash.databasedescription: Scholarly journals published in Taiwan

hash.name: ASCE Research library
hash.title: ASCE Research library
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to all 30 of the ASCE's journals online, plus all ASCE Proceedings published since 1999.

hash.name: Canadian Disaster Database
hash.title: Canadian Disaster Database
hash.databasedescription: Contains detailed disaster information on natural, technological and conflict events (excluding war) which directly affected Canadians over the past century.

hash.name: Civil Engineering Database (CEDB)

meta.more-info:
Engineering subjects areas include:  aerospace engineering; architectural engineering; bridges; cold regions; computer practices; construction; earthquake engineering; education; engineering mechanics; environmental engineering; forensic engineering; geotechnical engineering; highways; hydrology; hydraulics; irrigation and drainage; management; materials engineering; structural engineering; transportation; urban planning; water resources; waterway, port, coastal and ocean engineering.


Please note that the University of Alberta Libraries house most publications from the American Society of Civil Engineers, so ordering documents directly from the ASCE is not necessary. If you find citations of interest, search for the corresponding publication in the Online Catalogue.

hash.title: Civil Engineering Database (CEDB)
hash.databasedescription:
The Civil Engineering Database (CEDB) is designed to provide easy bibliographic access to all ASCE (American Society of Civil Engineers) publications. It provides access to all the journals, conference proceedings, books, standards, manuals, magazines and newsletters.

Engineering subjects areas include:  aerospace engineering; architectural engineering; bridges; cold regions; computer practices; construction; earthquake engineering; education; engineering mechanics; environmental engineering; forensic engineering; geotechnical engineering; highways; hydrology; hydraulics; irrigation and drainage; management; materials engineering; structural engineering; transportation; urban planning; water resources; waterway, port, coastal and ocean engineering.


Please note that the University of Alberta Libraries house most publications from the American Society of Civil Engineers, so ordering documents directly from the ASCE is not necessary. If you find citations of interest, search for the corresponding publication in the Online Catalogue.

hash.name: Conference Proceedings Citation Index

meta.more-info:
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation databases:
  • Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
  • Science Citation Index Expanded(TM) (1899-present)
  • Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.title: Conference Proceedings Citation Index
hash.databasedescription:
It is part of the Web of Science. Click on"more" below for further information.
The Web of Science provides online access to the following citation databases:

  • Art & Humanities Citation Index® (1975-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Science (2005-present)
  • Book Citation Index - Social Sciences & Humanities (2005-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Science (1990-present)
  • Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Social Science & Humanities (1990-present)
  • Science Citation Index Expanded(TM) (1899-present)
  • Social Sciences Citation Index® (1898-present)

hash.name: EIS: Digests of Environmental Impact Statements
hash.title: EIS: Digests of Environmental Impact Statements
hash.databasedescription: Provides abstracts of environmental impact statements issued by the U.S. federal government. Each entry includes a description of the project, sections on positive impact and negative consequences, and legal mandates.

hash.name: Frost & Sullivan
hash.title: Frost & Sullivan
hash.databasedescription: Reports covering emerging technologies, industry analysis and market trends in aerospace and defense, energy, environment, food, chemicals, biotechnology, healthcare, telecom, information technology, transportation, electronics, and semiconductors.

hash.name: GeoScience World
hash.title: GeoScience World
hash.databasedescription:
Online publications from a number of geoscience institutions, including the American Association of Petroleum Geologists (AAPG), American Geological Institute (AGI), Geological Society of America (GSA), The Geological Society of London (GSL), Mineralogical Society of America (MSA),
Society for Sedimentary Geology (SEPM), and Society of Exploration Geophysicists (SEG).

hash.name: Hydrocarbon Impacts (HI) database
hash.title: Hydrocarbon Impacts (HI) database
hash.databasedescription: Hydrocarbon Impacts (HI) database describes 4800 publications and research projects about the environmental impacts, socio-economic effects and regulation of hydrocarbon exploration, development and transportation in northern Canada.

hash.name: ICONDA (International Construction Database)

meta.more-info:
Essential subjects are: architectural design and planning, construction of industrial, commercial,
and residential structures, structural design, material properties and testing, public works and major construction projects, regional and municipal planning, project planning, finance and management, soil mechanics and geotechniques, maintenance, restoration, and conservation techniques, construction equipment and methods, and Computer Aided Design (CAD).

hash.title: ICONDA (International Construction Database)
hash.databasedescription:
ICONDA (International Construction Database) contains references to all
aspects of planning and building from twenty two countries.
Essential subjects are: architectural design and planning, construction of industrial, commercial,
and residential structures, structural design, material properties and testing, public works and major construction projects, regional and municipal planning, project planning, finance and management, soil mechanics and geotechniques, maintenance, restoration, and conservation techniques, construction equipment and methods, and Computer Aided Design (CAD).

hash.name: Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater
hash.title: Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater
hash.databasedescription: Covers all aspects of water and wastewater analysis techniques. Standard Methods is a joint publication of the American Public Health Association (APHA), the American Water Works Association (AWWA), and the Water Environment Federation (WEF).

hash.name: TRID (Transportation Research International Documentation)
hash.title: TRID (Transportation Research International Documentation)
hash.databasedescription: TRID is a newly integrated database that combines the records from TRB's Transportation Research Information Services (TRIS) Database and the OECD's Joint Transport Research Centre's International Transport Research Documentation ITRDDatabase. TRID provides access to over 900,000 records of transportation research worldwide.

hash.name: Water Research Foundation Reports

meta.more-info: The database provides summaries of all proposed, current and completed research projects. A good source of R&D information directed at the problems of the water supply industry.

hash.title: Water Research Foundation Reports
hash.databasedescription:
Water Research Foundation (Formerly The American Water Works Association Research Foundation - AWWARF) Founded in 1989 and its mission is to advance the education of the public in science, engineering and management of water resources, infrastructure, water testing and treatment technologies, water supply, use and distribution of water, the collection, treatment and re-use of wastewaters, water quality and health effects, the water environment in general and related subjects.
The database provides summaries of all proposed, current and completed research projects. A good source of R&D information directed at the problems of the water supply industry.

hash.name: ABC-CLIO eBook Collection
hash.title: ABC-CLIO eBook Collection
hash.databasedescription: Reference collection of over 300 history titles along with numerous secondary sources.

hash.name: AIDA - Bibliography of Italian Periodical Literature
hash.title: AIDA - Bibliography of Italian Periodical Literature
hash.databasedescription: The Bibliography "Articoli italiani di periodici accademici (AIDA)" indexes articles from journals primarily from the whole spectrum of Italian academic publishing. Articles are classified using the Basis Classification in German, Italian and English.

hash.name: Aristoteles Latinus
hash.title: Aristoteles Latinus
hash.databasedescription: This database includes the complete corpus of medieval translations of the works of Aristotle. The Latin versions of these texts constituted the main tools for the study of science and philosophy in the Middle Ages. This database provides the various forms in which Aristotle?s texts came to be read in the West. They were considered to be the canonized littera to which all the commentaries on Aristotle?s works referred.

hash.name: Bibliografia nazionale italiana

meta.more-info: The online BNI covers titles listed in the CUBI (Catalogo Cumulativo del Bollettino delle pubblicazioni ricevute per diritto di stampa dalla BNCF dal 1886 al 1957) since 1886 and in the print Bibliografia Nazionale Italiana (from 1958 onwards). One can also find titles from the Fondo Magliabechiano, all the periodicals at the BNCF, geographical maps and atlases from the 16th century to the 20th, and works from the Fondo Targioni Tozzetti.

hash.title: Bibliografia nazionale italiana
hash.databasedescription:
The cumulative electronic edition of the Bibliografia nazionale italiana (BNI) is a bibliographic database of materials edited or published in Italy and received through legal deposit at the Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenze (BNCF). The types of materials include: monographs, print music, periodicals, children’s books, doctoral theses and academic titles.
The online BNI covers titles listed in the CUBI (Catalogo Cumulativo del Bollettino delle pubblicazioni ricevute per diritto di stampa dalla BNCF dal 1886 al 1957) since 1886 and in the print Bibliografia Nazionale Italiana (from 1958 onwards). One can also find titles from the Fondo Magliabechiano, all the periodicals at the BNCF, geographical maps and atlases from the 16th century to the 20th, and works from the Fondo Targioni Tozzetti.

hash.name: BNB (British National Bibliography)
hash.title: BNB (British National Bibliography)
hash.databasedescription: The British National Bibliography is a record of items published in the UK and Ireland as well as items received by the British Library on legal deposit. Pre-publication records and records created by legal deposit libraries other than the British Library are also included.

hash.name: Brill's New Pauly
hash.title: Brill's New Pauly
hash.databasedescription: Online version of Der Neue Pauly, which was published in print by Metzler Verlag This is the most complete and most authoritative modern encyclopedia of the ancient world currently available. In nearly 20,000 entries it covers two thousand years of history and culture of Greco-Roman Antiquity and the reception of this in the two thousand years that followed.

hash.name: Cambridge Companions complete collection
hash.title: Cambridge Companions complete collection
hash.databasedescription: Full text collection of titles from the Cambridge Companions series. Covers literature, classics, philosophy, religion and cultural studies.

hash.name: Cambridge Histories Online
hash.title: Cambridge Histories Online
hash.databasedescription: This unique historical reference compendium allows instant access to the renowned texts of the Cambridge Histories series. With access to the most up to date and authoritative scholarly content, Cambridge Histories Online is an invaluable resource, for undergraduates, graduates, lecturers and researchers alike. Contains 250 volumes published since 1960.

hash.name: Columbia Gazetteer of the World
hash.title: Columbia Gazetteer of the World
hash.databasedescription:
Columbia Gazetteer of the World is a database of names, descriptions, and characteristics
of places worldwide.

hash.name: The Columbia Granger's World of Poetry
hash.title: The Columbia Granger's World of Poetry
hash.databasedescription: Contains works of poetry found in anthologies, and volumes of collected works and selected works for individual poets. Includes over 400,000 poem citations, nearly 50,000 poems in full text, bibliographic information for anthologies and supplementary information including commentaries and biographies.

hash.name: CyberThèses

meta.more-info: Initié par les Presses de l'Université de Montréal et l'Université Lumière Lyon 2 avec le soutien du Fonds Francophone des Inforoutes, le "réseau CyberThèses" regroupe aujourd'hui de nombreuses institutions, francophones ou non, à travers le monde. Vous trouverez sur ce portail, l'ensemble des thèses du réseau Cyberdocs à travers le monde et l'essentiel des sites francophones qui diffusent les thèses, que ce soit en format structuré ou en format image.

hash.title: CyberThèses
hash.databasedescription:
Le portail francophone des thèses électroniques. CyberThèses est un projet francophone d'archivage et de diffusion électronique des thèses utilisant la plate-forme Cyberdocs.
Initié par les Presses de l'Université de Montréal et l'Université Lumière Lyon 2 avec le soutien du Fonds Francophone des Inforoutes, le "réseau CyberThèses" regroupe aujourd'hui de nombreuses institutions, francophones ou non, à travers le monde. Vous trouverez sur ce portail, l'ensemble des thèses du réseau Cyberdocs à travers le monde et l'essentiel des sites francophones qui diffusent les thèses, que ce soit en format structuré ou en format image.

hash.name: De Gruyter
hash.title: De Gruyter
hash.databasedescription: Includes books and journals published by De Gruyter and other publishers. Please note: The library does not subscribe to all content on this site at the present time.

hash.name: Digital Library of Dissertations
hash.title: Digital Library of Dissertations
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to the catalogue of dissertations at the Russian State Library. This collection includes copies of dissertations in all fields of knowledge except medicine and pharmacy (which are kept in the Central State Medical and Scientific Library). Around 17,000 Candidate and 8,000 Doctorate dissertations are added every year.

hash.name: EBSCO Discovery Service (EDS)
hash.title: EBSCO Discovery Service (EDS)
hash.databasedescription: EBSCO Discovery Service provides cross-searching of the NEOS catalogue as well as many of the electronic resources the Library subscribes to.

hash.name: EThOS: Electronic Theses Online Service
hash.title: EThOS: Electronic Theses Online Service
hash.databasedescription: Theses from the United Kingdom, provided by the British Library.

hash.name: History of Science, Technology, and Medicine
hash.title: History of Science, Technology, and Medicine
hash.databasedescription: Covers journal articles, conference proceedings, books, book reviews, and dissertations in the history of science, technology, and medicine and allied historical fields.

hash.name: Johns Hopkins Guide to Literary Theory and Criticism
hash.title: Johns Hopkins Guide to Literary Theory and Criticism
hash.databasedescription: Presents a comprehensive historical survey of the field's most important figures, schools, and movements. It includes entries on critics and theorists, critical schools and movements, and the critical and theoretical innovations of specific countries and historical periods.

hash.name: L'Année philologique
hash.title: L'Année philologique
hash.databasedescription: Bibliography of classical literature and modern scholarship on classical literature. Published by the Société Internationale de Bibliographie Classique.

hash.name: LIMCicon

meta.more-info: LIMCicon is not an electronic version of the Lexicon Iconographicum Mythologiae Classicae, it is an independent and complementary source of information. An ancient document can therefore be dealt with either in the database, or in the book, or in both. LIMCbiblio: LIMCbiblio is bibliographical database recently created to complement the information published in the LIMC volumes. LIMCabrev: Use LIMCabrev to find the list of articles published in the LIMC and the full titles corresponding to the bibliographical abbreviations used in the LIMC, in the ThesCRA and on this site.

hash.title: LIMCicon
hash.databasedescription:
The LIMCicon database contains the iconographical documents kept both in France and elsewhere that have been catalogued and analysed by the French LIMC team. It is regularly updated and enhanced with new documents.
LIMCicon is not an electronic version of the Lexicon Iconographicum Mythologiae Classicae, it is an independent and complementary source of information. An ancient document can therefore be dealt with either in the database, or in the book, or in both. LIMCbiblio: LIMCbiblio is bibliographical database recently created to complement the information published in the LIMC volumes. LIMCabrev: Use LIMCabrev to find the list of articles published in the LIMC and the full titles corresponding to the bibliographical abbreviations used in the LIMC, in the ThesCRA and on this site.

hash.name: Loeb Classical Library

meta.more-info:
For assistance please contact:

Humanities and Social Sciences Service Desk, Rutherford North
492-5791

hash.title: Loeb Classical Library
hash.databasedescription:
Online version of Greek and Latin texts from the LOEB Classical Library.
For assistance please contact:

Humanities and Social Sciences Service Desk, Rutherford North
492-5791

hash.name: Migne's Patrologiae Graecae
hash.title: Migne's Patrologiae Graecae
hash.databasedescription: Migne's Patrologiae Graecae contains more than 160 volumes of Greek material (with Latin translations) relevant to the study of the history of the Christian Church from its beginnings through the Council of Florence in 1439.

hash.name: MyiLibrary
hash.title: MyiLibrary
hash.databasedescription: MyiLibrary is a collection of electronic books that spans a wide variety of subject areas. Content will be added to MyiLibrary on an incremental basis.

hash.name: Nestor: bibliography of Aegean prehistory and related areas

meta.more-info: Nestor includes publications concerning the central and western Mediterranean, southeastern Europe, the eastern Mediterranean, western Asia, and other regions of archaeological research, if the specific bibliographic items contain Aegean artifacts, imitations, or influences, or make reference to Aegean comparanda. "Nestor�s chronological range is the prehistoric period in the regions covered, from the Paleolithic through the end of the Geometric period.Nestor indexes publications from 1957-present, with the exception of (approximately) the most recent 2 years.

hash.title: Nestor: bibliography of Aegean prehistory and related areas
hash.databasedescription:
Nestor is an international bibliography of Aegean studies, Homeric society, Indo-European linguistics, and related fields. The primary geographic nexus of Nestor is the Aegean, including all of Greece, Albania, and Cyprus, the southern area of Bulgaria, and the western and southern areas of Turkey.
Nestor includes publications concerning the central and western Mediterranean, southeastern Europe, the eastern Mediterranean, western Asia, and other regions of archaeological research, if the specific bibliographic items contain Aegean artifacts, imitations, or influences, or make reference to Aegean comparanda. "Nestor�s chronological range is the prehistoric period in the regions covered, from the Paleolithic through the end of the Geometric period.Nestor indexes publications from 1957-present, with the exception of (approximately) the most recent 2 years.

hash.name: Oxford Bibliographies Online
hash.title: Oxford Bibliographies Online
hash.databasedescription: OBO is a collection of disciplined-based subject guides to important and significant sources in that area of study. Each guide contains a selective list of bibliographic citations with recommendations, along with an editorial commentary to show how the cited sources are interrelated.

hash.name: Oxford Scholarship Online
hash.title: Oxford Scholarship Online
hash.databasedescription: Full text of over 900 scholarly books published by Oxford University Press.

hash.name: Patrologia Latina
hash.title: Patrologia Latina
hash.databasedescription: Contains the first edition of Jacques-Paul Migne's Patrologia Latina, published between 1844 and 1855, and the four volumes of indexes published between 1862 and 1865.

hash.name: Periodicals Index Online
hash.title: Periodicals Index Online
hash.databasedescription: Indexes periodicals in the humanities and social sciences in a variety of western languages with coverage going back over 200 years. Citations in Periodicals Index Online also contain links, when available, to the full text articles in Periodicals Archive Online which can be accessed directly here.

hash.name: Play Index
hash.title: Play Index
hash.databasedescription: Provides citations plays published individually or in collections from 1949 to the present, including plays written in English and plays translated into English.

hash.name: Projekt Dyabola

meta.more-info:
The Library has access to the following four catalogues:
  1. the German Archaeological Institute in Rome (as of June 2003, indexes articles in journals, monographs and essays in monographs, from 1956-2000; select Realkatalog DAI Rom …)
  2. subject catalogue of the Roman-Germanic Commission Library in Frankfurt (indexes articles in journals, monographs and essays in monographs, 1992-2000)
  3. Eurasia Bibliography of the German Archaeological Institute (indexes articles and monographs, 1998-?)
  4. Library of the Städelsche Art Institute in Frankfurt (indexes monographs, coverage not known).

hash.title: Projekt Dyabola
hash.databasedescription:
Dyabola is collection of over a dozen databases devoted to Ancient and Eurasian archaeology, history, and art history (the emphasis is on Ancient archaeology).
The Library has access to the following four catalogues:
  1. the German Archaeological Institute in Rome (as of June 2003, indexes articles in journals, monographs and essays in monographs, from 1956-2000; select Realkatalog DAI Rom …)
  2. subject catalogue of the Roman-Germanic Commission Library in Frankfurt (indexes articles in journals, monographs and essays in monographs, 1992-2000)
  3. Eurasia Bibliography of the German Archaeological Institute (indexes articles and monographs, 1998-?)
  4. Library of the Städelsche Art Institute in Frankfurt (indexes monographs, coverage not known).

hash.name: Thesaurus Linguae Graecae
hash.title: Thesaurus Linguae Graecae
hash.databasedescription: The Thesaurus Linguae Graecae (TLG) database contains literary Greek texts written from the time of Homer to the fall of Byzantium (AD1453) - approximately 11,000 texts by 3,500 authors.

hash.name: World History in Context
hash.title: World History in Context
hash.databasedescription: Gale Virtual Reference Library is a database of encyclopedias, almanacs, and specialized reference sources for multidisciplinary research.

hash.name: University Press Scholarship Online
hash.title: University Press Scholarship Online
hash.databasedescription: University Press Scholarship Online includes full text of books from a number of University presses.

hash.name: American Consumer Culture, 1935-1965
hash.title: American Consumer Culture, 1935-1965
hash.databasedescription: Provides insight into the American consumer boom of the mid-20th century through access to the complete market research reports of Ernest Dichter, the era?s foremost consumer analyst, market research pioneer and widely-recognised 'father' of Motivational Research.

hash.name: Berg Fashion Library
hash.title: Berg Fashion Library
hash.databasedescription: Offers fully cross-searchable access to a range of Berg content collections, including the Berg Encyclopedia of World Dress and Fashion online, e-books, reference works, images,etc.

hash.name: Textile Technology Index
hash.title: Textile Technology Index
hash.databasedescription: Originally published as Textile Technology Digest. Provides international coverage of the literature of textiles and related subjects. Coverage includes the various aspects of textile production and processing, and the automation and management systems of these operations. Coverage also includes many of the major resources of the apparel, home furnishings, flooring, and polymer industries.

hash.name: Textile Terms and Definitions
hash.title: Textile Terms and Definitions
hash.databasedescription: Database of textile terminology.

hash.name: The French Revolution Digital Archive (FRDA)
hash.title: The French Revolution Digital Archive (FRDA)
hash.databasedescription: The French Revolution Digital Archive (FRDA) is a multi-year collaboration of the Stanford University Libraries and the Bibliothèque nationale de France (BnF) to produce a digital searchable database of the key research sources of the French Revolution. The archive is based around two main resources, the Archives parlementaires and a vast corpus of images first brought together in 1989 and known as the Images de la Revolution française.

hash.name: The Vogue Archive
hash.title: The Vogue Archive
hash.databasedescription: Complete backfiles of Vogue magazine from 1892 to present.

hash.name: Global Financial Data

meta.more-info:
The library subscribes to two Global Financial Data databases:

1) US Stocks includes historical price data (back to early 1900's) on over 40,000 individual current and delisted stocks from every US exchange. The USDatabase is the most extensive collection of individual securities ever compiled including delisted stocks from National and Regional Stock exchanges such as NASDAQ, the New York, Chicago, Philadelphia or Boston Stock Market Exchange. Income statements, balance sheet, and cash flow statements are also provided.

2) GFDatabase is comprised of 10 different historical databases:

  • Asset Allocation:

    Historical Total return indices for stocks, bonds and bills for fifty countries.

  • Commodities:

    Historical data on 100 different commodities,s including foods, metals, industrial agricultural commodities, oil and other groups; series for gold and silver both go back to the 1200s. Also includes: Futures Contracts, Commodity Prices back to 1914, Spot Commodities Back to the 1800s for: (metals, Agricultural goods, energy, industrial goods)

  • Economic data:

    Data on inflation, the money supply, labor markets, production and output. Data for M1, M2 and M3 go back to the 1950s and before, while data on currency in circulation goes back to the 1800s. . Data are also included on the financial sector, such as the levels of bank reserves, credit, derivatives and other financial instruments. Inflation can be analyzed using Wholesale Price Indices, Producer Price Indices and Consumer Price Indices. Dozens of sub-categories of the price indices are provided so the sectoral factors that contribute to the overall inflation rate can be examined. Monthly inflation data for all major economies are available back to the 1920s.

  • Equity database:

    Contains over 2000 current and 2000 historical data series on more than 100 countries. Stock market indices are provided for each country as far back as data are available. For example, data for the United Kingdom that extends back to1694 and data for the United States that extends back to1791. For all other major countries data have been collected back to the 1920s. In addition to stock market indices, GFD provides data on dividend yields, PE Ratios, capitalization and volume traded.

  • Fixed Income:

    Provides complete yield curve coverage with data on Interbank Rates, Swap Rates, Treasury-Bill Yields and Long-term Government Bond Yields;current and historical markets covering 200 countries. Government bond yield data and central bank interest rates go back to the 1800s for all major economies. Also provides data on retail interest rates, providing the average rate for both deposits and loans. Deposit rates are provided for both long-term and short-term deposits, demand deposits and savings deposits for both households and corporations. Data on Prime Lending Rates, Mortgage Rates, and Corporate Lending Rates are also provided.

  • Exchange rate:

    Over 200 currencies are included in the database with cross exchange rate data going back to 1590. Included in the database are market exchange rates, official exchange rates, black market exchange rates and forward rates.

  • Government & Debt

    Provides extensive history on debt at the macro level for different countries, with this information broken down into domestic and external debt, government debt and the debt of the economy as a whole. Data on UK Revenues go back to 1168 and data on UK Government Debt goes back to 1691. Government Budget and Debt data for the US go back to 1792.

  • International Trade

    Extensive data on international trade with some data going back to the 1700s for close to 200 countries; includes: Balance of Payments, Exports and Imports, Trade Barriers, Trade Indices.

  • National Accounts

    Provides extensive data, some going back to the 1800s on GDP and its components for over 100 countries. Data on income distribution, such as GINI coefficients is included in this database as well; provided on nominal, real, and per capita GDP, changes in GDP are provided at the aggregate level ,and for many of the sub-categories and sectors of GDP; data on the Value Added provided by different sectors of the economy is provided in detail.

hash.title: Global Financial Data
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" below for brief description about Global Financial Data
