hash.name: OpenCurriculum
hash.title: OpenCurriculum
hash.databasedescription: Teacher-curated and Common Core standards-aligned sets of high-quality lessons, activities and assessments. A free sign-up is required but you can browse some content without registration.

hash.name: PIKA: Canadian Children's Literature Database
hash.title: PIKA: Canadian Children's Literature Database
hash.databasedescription: In addition to the National Library of Canada's collection of 35,000 Canadian children's books, PIKA features from high-quality sources have been added: The National Library of Canada introduced a subject headings system for works of fiction in children's literature. Next, book summaries were added to the database. The summaries first appeared in Our Choice, published by The Canadian Children's Book Centre, and in Sélections, published annually by Communication-Jeunesse.

hash.name: ProQuest Education Journals
hash.title: ProQuest Education Journals
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext of over 400 periodicals in the field of Education.

hash.name: Science Reference Center
hash.title: Science Reference Center
hash.databasedescription:
Provides access to a variety of full-text science-oriented content including science encyclopedias, reference books, periodicals, and other sources.

Topics covered include: biology, chemistry, earth & space science, environmental science, health & medicine, history of science, life science, physics, science & society, science as inquiry, scientists, technology and wildlife.

hash.name: Senior High Core Collection
hash.title: Senior High Core Collection
hash.databasedescription: Selected and recommended by specialists in library service to young adults in senior high schools and public libraries across the United States, the books listed encompass a wide variety of topics for youth, ranging from material on Native Americans and rainforest ecology to health issues. The collection also includes curriculum-related material in social studies and the sciences; drama, novels, and short story collections; biographies; and books for the librarian or media specialist.

hash.name: Smithsonian Global Sound®

meta.more-info: It includes the published recordings owned by the non-profit Smithsonian Folkways Recordings label and the archival audio collections of the legendary Folkways Records, Cook, Dyer-Bennet, Fast Folk, Monitor, Paredon and other labels. It also includes music recorded around the African continent by Dr. Hugh Tracey for the International Library of African Music (ILAM) at Rhodes University as well as material collected by recordists on the South Asian subcontinent from the Archive Research Centre for Ethnomusicology (ARCE), sponsored by the American Institute for Indian Studies.

hash.title: Smithsonian Global Sound®
hash.databasedescription:
Smithsonian Global Sound for Libraries, produced in partnership with Smithsonian Folkways Recordings, is a virtual encyclopedia of the world's musical and aural traditions. The collection provides educators, students, and interested listeners with an unprecedented variety of online resources that support the creation, continuity, and preservation of diverse musical forms.


It includes the published recordings owned by the non-profit Smithsonian Folkways Recordings label and the archival audio collections of the legendary Folkways Records, Cook, Dyer-Bennet, Fast Folk, Monitor, Paredon and other labels. It also includes music recorded around the African continent by Dr. Hugh Tracey for the International Library of African Music (ILAM) at Rhodes University as well as material collected by recordists on the South Asian subcontinent from the Archive Research Centre for Ethnomusicology (ARCE), sponsored by the American Institute for Indian Studies.

hash.name: Teacher Reference Center
hash.title: Teacher Reference Center
hash.databasedescription: Provides indexing and abstracts for teacher and administrator trade journals to assist professional educators.

hash.name: TeachingBooks.net
hash.title: TeachingBooks.net
hash.databasedescription: TeachingBooks.net provides multimedia resources on children's and young adult literature.

hash.name: The National Film Board of Canada Film Collection
hash.title: The National Film Board of Canada Film Collection
hash.databasedescription: The English catalogue contains original English productions and English versions of original French productions that have been produced, co-produced or distributed by the NFB from 1939 to the present. Of the over 10,000 films and videos in this collection, this portion of the database contains information on approximately 6,200 films. Searches are possible by title, series, subject, director, producer, cast, year of production, keyword, etc.

hash.name: The Shakespeare Collection: Featuring The Arden Shakespeare Complete Works
hash.title: The Shakespeare Collection: Featuring The Arden Shakespeare Complete Works
hash.databasedescription: Includes the most recent Arden Shakespeare editions of the complete works, as well as editions and adaptations of Shakespeare's works, other works published during Shakespeare's time, prompt books, the Gordon Crosse Theatrical Diaries, criticism, reviews, images, and references.

hash.name: International Bibliography of Theatre & Dance with Full Text
hash.title: International Bibliography of Theatre & Dance with Full Text
hash.databasedescription: Contains all of the content available in International Bibliography of Theatre & Dance as well as full text for a number of these titles, including Canadian Theatre Review, Dance Chronicle, Dance Teacher, Modern Drama, PAJ: A Journal of Performance and Art, Research in Dance Education, Research in Drama Education, Studies in Theatre and Performance, TDR: The Drama Review, Theater, and many more. Additional full text available from selected books & monographs.

hash.name: International Index to Performing Arts Full Text
hash.title: International Index to Performing Arts Full Text
hash.databasedescription: Provides indexing and abstracts from sources covering film, theatre, dance, stagecraft, television, and more. Coverage ranges from 1864 to current. Full text is available for approximately 25% of the indexed journals.

hash.name: Catalog of surveys and archive of procedures related to oral health
hash.title: Catalog of surveys and archive of procedures related to oral health
hash.databasedescription: The Catalog of Surveys and Archive of Procedures Related to Oral Health is a two-part database linking descriptions of data sources (Catalog) with descriptions of procedures (Archive) used in the data sources. The objective of the Catalog and Archive is to provide a central and up-to-date resource for detailed descriptions of oral health data sources for public health research, program planning, and policymaking.

hash.name: Thieme E-Book Library
hash.title: Thieme E-Book Library
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext of medical books published by Thieme.

hash.name: DynaMed
hash.title: DynaMed
hash.databasedescription: DynaMed is an evidence-based clinical reference tool for physicians and other health care professionals created for use primarily at the 'point-of-care'.

hash.name: HSDB: Hazardous Substance Databank

meta.more-info: All data are referenced and derived from a core set of books, government documents, technical reports and selected primary journal literature. HSDB is peer-reviewed by the Scientific Review Panel (SRP), a committee of experts in the major subject areas within the data bank's scope. HSDB is organized into individual chemical records, and contains over 4500 such records.

hash.title: HSDB: Hazardous Substance Databank
hash.databasedescription:
HSDB is a toxicology data file on the National Library of Medicine's (NLM) Toxicology Data Network (TOXNET®). It focuses on the toxicology of potentially hazardous chemicals. It is enhanced with information on human exposure, industrial hygiene, emergency handling procedures, environmental fate, regulatory requirements, and related areas.
All data are referenced and derived from a core set of books, government documents, technical reports and selected primary journal literature. HSDB is peer-reviewed by the Scientific Review Panel (SRP), a committee of experts in the major subject areas within the data bank's scope. HSDB is organized into individual chemical records, and contains over 4500 such records.

hash.name: Notifiable Diseases On-line
hash.title: Notifiable Diseases On-line
hash.databasedescription: This product contains information on the number of cases reported for several notifiable diseases as well as their rate in the population. The data are available for each province and territory for each year starting at 1986 up to the end of 1997 and will be updated as each year of new data becomes available.

hash.name: Francopresse.ca
hash.title: Francopresse.ca
hash.databasedescription: Site web de l’Association de la presse francophone (APF) qui permet l’accès au texte intégral des nouveaux articles choisis qui ont paru dans les 24 journaux membres de l’Association des communautés francophones et acadiennes du Canada. La période couverte et la mise-à-jour varient selon le titre. Des archives d’environ huit mois sont offertes pour chaque journal.

hash.name: AMICUS
hash.title: AMICUS
hash.databasedescription: Contains the holdings of 500 Canadian libraries including the National Library of Canada

hash.name: Bank of Canada - Financial Statistics
hash.title: Bank of Canada - Financial Statistics
hash.databasedescription: The Bank of Canada provides current and historical statistics on interest rates, bond yields, C.P.I., exchange rates, inflation, money market yields, and many other financial and monetary indicators.

hash.name: Dicorama

meta.more-info: Pour éviter de chercher l'information voulue à travers toutes les définitions proposées, cet annuaire classifie les dictionnaires selon leur spécialisation: droit, économie et finance, sport, traduction, informatique et Internet, humour, écologie et nature, sciences et technologies, etc. Presque tous les champs d'intérêt offrent des sous-catégories, ce qui permet de préciser encore plus votre recherche. Il suffit ensuite de vous rendre dans le dictionnaire de votre choix. Le moteur de recherche vous offre la possibilité de soumettre votre demande à tous les dictionnaires à la fois et de spécifier la langue désirée. (rf. Agence Science-Presse)

hash.title: Dicorama
hash.databasedescription:
Dicorama est un métadictionnaire qui rassemble quelque 600 dictionnaires, glossaires et lexiques, tous disponibles sur Internet.
Pour éviter de chercher l'information voulue à travers toutes les définitions proposées, cet annuaire classifie les dictionnaires selon leur spécialisation: droit, économie et finance, sport, traduction, informatique et Internet, humour, écologie et nature, sciences et technologies, etc. Presque tous les champs d'intérêt offrent des sous-catégories, ce qui permet de préciser encore plus votre recherche. Il suffit ensuite de vous rendre dans le dictionnaire de votre choix. Le moteur de recherche vous offre la possibilité de soumettre votre demande à tous les dictionnaires à la fois et de spécifier la langue désirée. (rf. Agence Science-Presse)

hash.name: Encyclopédie de l'Agora
hash.title: Encyclopédie de l'Agora
hash.databasedescription: Une encyclopédie québécoise d�envergure internationale, créée en 1998 par le philosophe Jacques Dufresne, elle comprend plus de 3 000 dossiers et plus de 2600 documents associés, abordant des sujets tels l�art, l�économie, la géographie, la politique, la société, les sciences et techniques, etc. Cette encyclopédie virtuelle s�adresse à un public averti, plus particulièrement aux personnes dans les institutions de haut savoir.

hash.name: Government of Canada DSP Publications Catalogue
hash.title: Government of Canada DSP Publications Catalogue
hash.databasedescription:
The Government of Canada DSP Publications Catalogue lists Government of
Canada publications published under its Depository Services Program (DSP) since
1991. The DSP is an arrangement under which the Government supplies libraries
across Canada with a number of its publications.

hash.name: History of the Federal Electoral Ridings since 1867
hash.title: History of the Federal Electoral Ridings since 1867
hash.databasedescription: This is a unique electronic resource that provides information on the electoral history of Canada since Confederation. Included you will find the names of all the candidates to all the federal elections as well as a description of all the ridings. Users can search by riding name, name of a candidate, political party, general election, and by-election, or even by the description of a riding.

hash.name: Index Translationum
hash.title: Index Translationum
hash.databasedescription:
Contains cumulative bibliographical information on books translated and published in about a hundred of UNESCO's Member States since 1979. Over 1,300,000 notices in all disciplines including literature, social and human sciences, natural and exact sciences, art, and history.
Updated quarterly.

hash.name: Le Trésor de la Langue Française informatisé (TLFi)

meta.more-info: Le TLFi comprend notamment un traitement exhaustif des mots des XIXe et XXe siècles. Son correcteur d'erreurs vous permet de repérer les mots dont vous ne connaissez pas l'orthographe, et il est possible d'entrer l'orthographe phonétique du mot recherché. Il est également possible de personnaliser le contenu du TLFi en créant des listes de mots par flexion.

hash.title: Le Trésor de la Langue Française informatisé (TLFi)
hash.databasedescription:
Outil faisant partie du projet ARTFL (American and French Research on the Treasury of the French Language), le TLFi contient 100 000 mots de la langue française avec leur histoire, de même que 270 000 définitions et 430 000 exemples.
Le TLFi comprend notamment un traitement exhaustif des mots des XIXe et XXe siècles. Son correcteur d'erreurs vous permet de repérer les mots dont vous ne connaissez pas l'orthographe, et il est possible d'entrer l'orthographe phonétique du mot recherché. Il est également possible de personnaliser le contenu du TLFi en créant des listes de mots par flexion.

hash.name: Les classiques des sciences sociales
hash.title: Les classiques des sciences sociales
hash.databasedescription: Une collection unique et originale dans le monde francophone développée en collaboration avec la Bibliothèque Paul-Émile-Boulet de l'Université du Québec à Chicoutimi, fondée et dirigée par Jean-Marie Tremblay, professeur de sociologie au Cégep de Chicoutimi. Vous y trouverez le texte intégral en français de plus de 150 grands classiques dans les sciences sociales par des auteurs tels que Darwin, Engels, Freud, Hobbes, etc.

hash.name: Programme de recherche en démographie historique (PRDH)

meta.more-info:
La version imprimée, qui couvre la période de 1621-1765 uniquement, est intitulée Le Répertoire des actes de baptême, mariage, sépultre et de recensements du Québec ancien en 47 volumes.

This comprehensive site of Quebec French-Canadian genealogy, demography and history before 1800, was established by the Université de Montréal from more than 710 000 certificates from parish registers and other nominative documents of the XVIIth and XVIIIth centuries.

The print version, which covers only from 1621-1765, is entitled Le Répertoire des actes de baptême, mariage, sépultre et de recensements du Québec ancien in 47 volumes.

hash.title: Programme de recherche en démographie historique (PRDH)
hash.databasedescription:
Ce site exhaustif de la généalogie, de la démographie et de l'histoire canadienne-française du Québec avant 1800, de l'Université de Montréal, repose sur plus de 710 000 actes inscrits dans les registres paroissiaux et sur quelques autres documents nominatifs des XVIIe et XVIIIe siècles.


La version imprimée, qui couvre la période de 1621-1765 uniquement, est intitulée Le Répertoire des actes de baptême, mariage, sépultre et de recensements du Québec ancien en 47 volumes.

This comprehensive site of Quebec French-Canadian genealogy, demography and history before 1800, was established by the Université de Montréal from more than 710 000 certificates from parish registers and other nominative documents of the XVIIth and XVIIIth centuries.

The print version, which covers only from 1621-1765, is entitled Le Répertoire des actes de baptême, mariage, sépultre et de recensements du Québec ancien in 47 volumes.

hash.name: Statistique Canada - Le Canada en statistiques et le Recensement de 1996

meta.more-info: Le Profil statistique des communautés canadiennes présente un profil, à partir du recensement, sur plus de 6 000 communautés canadiennes et fournit des données sur la scolarité, le revenu et le travail, les familles et les logements.Une fonction cartographique permet de voir l'emplacement de toute communauté sur l'étendue du territoire canadien.

hash.title: Statistique Canada - Le Canada en statistiques et le Recensement de 1996
hash.databasedescription:
Le Canada en statistiques de Statistique Canada comprend toutes les statistiques sur l'économie, le territoire, la société et l'état au Canada. De plus, ce site donne accès aux statistiques du recensement de 1996.
Le Profil statistique des communautés canadiennes présente un profil, à partir du recensement, sur plus de 6 000 communautés canadiennes et fournit des données sur la scolarité, le revenu et le travail, les familles et les logements.Une fonction cartographique permet de voir l'emplacement de toute communauté sur l'étendue du territoire canadien.

hash.name: Encyclopedie Hachette 2002
hash.title: Encyclopedie Hachette 2002
hash.databasedescription: Comprend: L'Encyclopédie, Le Dictionnaire de la langue française, Le Dictionnaire Hachette-Oxford bilingue anglais-français, Le Dictionnaire des synonymes et l'Atlas mondial Hachette.

hash.name: Larousse multimédia encyclopédia
hash.title: Larousse multimédia encyclopédia
hash.databasedescription: This encyclopedia consists of information organized by themes on all important subjects incorporating photos, sketches, guided tours with regular or animated illustations and combining sound. It contains as well a world atlas in which all maps can be enlarged.

hash.name: American Drama (1714-1915)
hash.title: American Drama (1714-1915)
hash.databasedescription: Contains more than 1,100 dramatic works from the early eighteenth century up to the beginning of the twentieth. Includes: plays in verse, farces, melodramas, minstrel shows, realist plays, frontier plays, temperance dialogues and a range of other genres. Major dramatists include Clyde Fitch, Augustin Daly, David Belasco, James Herne and Joaquin Miller. Includes overviews of the lives and works of featured authors.

hash.name: American Film Scripts Online
hash.title: American Film Scripts Online
hash.databasedescription: Indexes one thousand film scripts to allow searching by a variety of fields such as scene, character, and director. Most of these scripts are previously unpublished, and about half appear as facsimile images.

hash.name: Asian American Drama
hash.title: Asian American Drama
hash.databasedescription: Contains full text of Asian American plays along with detailed, fielded information on related productions, theaters, production companies, and more.

hash.name: Audio Drama: The L.A. Theatre Works Collection
hash.title: Audio Drama: The L.A. Theatre Works Collection
hash.databasedescription: Includes dramatic works in streaming audio from the curated archive of the L.A. TheatreWorks.

hash.name: BDSL: Bibliographie der deutschen Sprach- und Literaturwissenschaft
hash.title: BDSL: Bibliographie der deutschen Sprach- und Literaturwissenschaft
hash.databasedescription: An international bibliographic database of German literature, literary history and criticism, as well as language studies. It indexes books, chapters in books, periodical articles and book reviews. Coverage is from 1985 on. New records added daily, with the goal to provide access to all bibliographic entries published to date in the print version of the bibliography. To search the database, click on "Suche". The search interface is in German.

hash.name: Bibliografia de la Literatura Española
hash.title: Bibliografia de la Literatura Española
hash.databasedescription: Comprehensive bibliography of Spanish literature and related documentation published in any language published between 1980 and the present day. Covers monographs, periodical articles, critical editions of literary works, book reviews, bibliographies, congresses proceedings and other miscellaneous material.

hash.name: Bibliography of American Literature
hash.title: Bibliography of American Literature
hash.databasedescription: Includes nearly 40,000 records of the literary works of approximately 300 American writers from the period of the Revolution to 1930.

hash.name: Black Drama - 1850-present
hash.title: Black Drama - 1850-present
hash.databasedescription: Contains fulltext of plays by Black playwrights from North America, English-speaking Africa, the Caribbean, and other African diaspora countries, together with detailed, fielded information on related productions, theaters, production companies, and more.

hash.name: Book Review Digest
hash.title: Book Review Digest
hash.databasedescription: Book Review Digest Plus indexes reviews of current fiction and non-fiction, and provides review excerpts as well as a number of full text reviews. Includes Book Review Digest Retrospective, covering books reviews from 1905-1982.

hash.name: Canadian Literary Centre
hash.title: Canadian Literary Centre
hash.databasedescription: Consists of book and reference content from Essays on Canadian Writing Press (ECW Press). ECW Press also provides several individual monographs and biographies, essays and literary criticism. The database includes book reviews, essays, author biographies, and much more. Updated daily.

hash.name: Centre des auteurs dramatiques (CEAD)
hash.title: Centre des auteurs dramatiques (CEAD)
hash.databasedescription: Biographical and bibliographical database of Canadian Francophone playwrights, which is searchable by author, work title, and translations.

hash.name: Early English Books Online

meta.more-info: Materials cover research interests in English literature, history, philosophy, linguistics, theology, music, fine arts, education, mathematics, and science.

hash.title: Early English Books Online
hash.databasedescription:
Contains both plain text and digital facsimile page images of over 100,000 titles ranging from the first book published in English to the works of Shakespeare. Features titles listed in Pollard & Redgrave's Short-Title Catalogue (1475-1640) and Wing's Short-Title Catalogue (1641-1700), as well as the Thomason Tracts (1640-1661).
Materials cover research interests in English literature, history, philosophy, linguistics, theology, music, fine arts, education, mathematics, and science.

hash.name: Editions and Adaptations of Shakespeare (1591-1911)
hash.title: Editions and Adaptations of Shakespeare (1591-1911)
hash.databasedescription:
Editions and Adaptations of Shakespeare (1591-1911) contains the
full text of eleven major editions from the First Folio to the Cambridge Edition
of 1863-6, twenty-four contemporary printings of individual plays, selected
apocrypha and related works, and over 100 adaptations, sequels and burlesques.

hash.name: Electronic Literature Directory
hash.title: Electronic Literature Directory
hash.databasedescription: A searchable database listing electronic works, authors, and publishers. Covers poetry, fiction, drama, and nonfiction that makes significant use of electronic techniques or enhancements.

hash.name: English Drama (1280-1915)
hash.title: English Drama (1280-1915)
hash.databasedescription: This is a combination of Chadwyck-Healey�s English Verse Drama and English Prose Drama full-text databases. Includes 4,000 plays by 1,200 authors from the late thirteenth century to the early twentieth century. Includes overviews of the lives and works of featured authors.

hash.name: Humanities and Social Sciences Index Retrospective
hash.title: Humanities and Social Sciences Index Retrospective
hash.databasedescription: Covers the humanities and social sciences back to 1907. Coverage also includes content from H.W. Wilsons' International Index.

hash.name: Humanities International Complete
hash.title: Humanities International Complete
hash.databasedescription:
Provides cover-to-cover indexing and abstracting for over 1,700 journals as well as books and other reference sources in the humanities. Includes full text of hundreds of journals, books and other published sources from around the world.
Humanities International Index was formerly titled American Humanities Index.

hash.name: International Medieval Bibliography
hash.title: International Medieval Bibliography
hash.databasedescription: Bibliography of the European Middle Ages, covering Europe, the Middle East and North Africa in the period 400-1500. Comprises over 300,000 articles derived from regular coverage of some 4500 periodicals and 5000 miscellany volume (conference proceedings, essay collections, Festschriften and exhibition catalogues). All articles are classified with full bibliographical details and subject classifications and indexing familiar to medievalists.

hash.name: Internet Library of Early Journals
hash.title: Internet Library of Early Journals
hash.databasedescription: ILEJ aims to digitise substantial runs of 18th and 19th century journals, and make these images available on the Internet, together with their associated bibliographic data.

hash.name: Latino Literature: Poetry, Drama and Fiction
hash.title: Latino Literature: Poetry, Drama and Fiction
hash.databasedescription: Contains fulltext of plays, prose and poetry by Chicano, Cuban, Puerto Rican, Dominican and other Latin writers working in the United States.

hash.name: Literary Reference Center
hash.title: Literary Reference Center
hash.databasedescription: Full-text database that combines information from books and monographs, major literary encyclopedias and reference works, literary journals, and other unique sources. Contains detailed information on the most studied authors and their works.

hash.name: Literary Theory
hash.title: Literary Theory
hash.databasedescription: Literary Theory constitutes a fully searchable library that features major texts in the tradition of writing about literature, its rules, genres, interpretation, and scholarship.

hash.name: MLA Directory of Periodicals

meta.more-info: The entries list editorial addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, e-mail addresses, frequency of publication, descriptions of the periodicals' scopes, circulation figures, subscription prices and addresses, advertising information, and submission guidelines. The directory also provides statistics on how many articles and book reviews the periodicals publish each year, as well as how many are submitted. Fully searchable, and browsable by subject.

hash.title: MLA Directory of Periodicals
hash.databasedescription:
Contains all information available on the journals and series on the MLA International Bibliography's Master List of Periodicals.
The entries list editorial addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, e-mail addresses, frequency of publication, descriptions of the periodicals' scopes, circulation figures, subscription prices and addresses, advertising information, and submission guidelines. The directory also provides statistics on how many articles and book reviews the periodicals publish each year, as well as how many are submitted. Fully searchable, and browsable by subject.

hash.name: Nineteenth Century Collections Online
hash.title: Nineteenth Century Collections Online
hash.databasedescription: Nineteenth Century Collections Online allows searching and display of the digital images of books, pamphlets, and broadsides published during the 19th Century.

hash.name: North American Indian Drama
hash.title: North American Indian Drama
hash.databasedescription: Includes full text of more than plays written by American Indian and First Nation playwrights of the 20th century.

hash.name: North American Women's Drama
hash.title: North American Women's Drama
hash.databasedescription: Contains plays by women playwrights, together with detailed, fielded information on related productions, theaters, production companies, and more.

hash.name: Opening Night! Opera & Oratorio Premieres

meta.more-info: Browse within any category, or conduct complex searches by combining search terms with one or more of the categories in the left column. Sort results by relevance, composer, title, or year. Bookmark citations to send via email. Search words are truncated (e.g., a search for ?car? will find Card, Carlo, Carmen, etc.) Source notes provide detailed descriptions for each category, including content parameters and exceptions, and notes on forms of personal and geographical name entries.

hash.title: Opening Night! Opera & Oratorio Premieres
hash.databasedescription:
Opening Night! Is a cross-index of data for over 38,000 opera and oratorio premieres, which were originally presented in the database originally titled, "From Don to Giovanni: Opera and Oratorio Citation Database".
Browse within any category, or conduct complex searches by combining search terms with one or more of the categories in the left column. Sort results by relevance, composer, title, or year. Bookmark citations to send via email. Search words are truncated (e.g., a search for ?car? will find Card, Carlo, Carmen, etc.) Source notes provide detailed descriptions for each category, including content parameters and exceptions, and notes on forms of personal and geographical name entries.

hash.name: Opera in Video
hash.title: Opera in Video
hash.databasedescription: Opera in Video will contain 250 of the most important opera performances, captured on video through staged productions, interviews, and documentaries. Selections represent the world�s best performers, conductors, and opera houses and are based on a work�s importance to the operatic canon.

hash.name: Out of the Wings: Spanish and Spanish American Theatres in Translation

meta.more-info: The entries of individual plays are contextualised through synopsis, sample translation, production notes, critical responses and performance history, and a final section guides users towards a directory of theatre translators.

hash.title: Out of the Wings: Spanish and Spanish American Theatres in Translation
hash.databasedescription:
Users can search through a comprehensive database of Spanish-language plays (either generically under Golden Age, Modern Spanish and Spanish American or by key words, genre, type of play, number of characters, theme, etc.) to find the play or plays that are relevant to their own programming or research needs.
The entries of individual plays are contextualised through synopsis, sample translation, production notes, critical responses and performance history, and a final section guides users towards a directory of theatre translators.

hash.name: Project Gutenberg

meta.more-info: The majority of the books are not restricted by copyright, allowing for free downloading and printing.

hash.title: Project Gutenberg
hash.databasedescription:
This site acts as an electronic archives providing access to classic works of world literature from the start of this century and previous centuries. It includes works by authors like Shakespeare, Tolstoy and Goethe, as well as well-loved favorites written by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Edgar Rice Burroughs, Lewis Carroll, and thousands of others. Most works of foreign authors are in English translation, although a number of them is in the original language.
The majority of the books are not restricted by copyright, allowing for free downloading and printing.

hash.name: The Toronto Star (1894-2011)
hash.title: The Toronto Star (1894-2011)
hash.databasedescription: Contains the fulltext and images of The Toronto Star's newspaper from 1894-2011.

hash.name: Theatre in Video
hash.title: Theatre in Video
hash.databasedescription: Contains more than 250 performances of the world's leading plays, together with more than 100 film documentaries, online in streaming video.

hash.name: Ulrich's International Periodicals Directory
hash.title: Ulrich's International Periodicals Directory
hash.databasedescription:
Ulrich's International Periodicals Directory provides data on regularly
published and irregularly issued serials, as well as information on active, forthcoming, ceased, and suspended titles. Bibliographic records provide title-level details such as ISSN, publisher, electronic format availability, language, abstracting & indexing coverage, and full-text reviews.

hash.name: Women Writers Online
hash.title: Women Writers Online
hash.databasedescription:
Women Writers Online is a full-text database of pre-Victorian women's
writing including fiction, poetry, and drama plus women's contributions to
religious and political debates and to science, history, philosophy and
medicine.

hash.name: World Shakespeare Bibliography Online
hash.title: World Shakespeare Bibliography Online
hash.databasedescription: Indexes and provides annotations for material of all sorts related to Shakespeare, including books, articles, productions, reviews, audiovisual material, electronic media. Provides international coverage, and includes popular as well as scholarly material.

hash.name: AAPG Datapages Archives
hash.title: AAPG Datapages Archives
hash.databasedescription: Archive of AAPG (American Association of Petroleum Geologists) publications.

hash.name: Geographical Names of Canada

meta.more-info: This data base of names of places and geographical features is managed with ORACLE software on a SOLARIS operating system maintained by Natural Resources Canada. It is the fundamental national data base to provide official names of mapping and charting, gazetteer production, and World Wide Web reference, and other geo-referenced digital systems. Over 30 attributes may at present be stored for any name, and the data base is updated on a daily basis.

hash.title: Geographical Names of Canada
hash.databasedescription:
Contains some 500 000 records, over two-thirds of which are currently official names, as approved by the Canadian Permanent Committee on Geographical Names (CPCGN).
This data base of names of places and geographical features is managed with ORACLE software on a SOLARIS operating system maintained by Natural Resources Canada. It is the fundamental national data base to provide official names of mapping and charting, gazetteer production, and World Wide Web reference, and other geo-referenced digital systems. Over 30 attributes may at present be stored for any name, and the data base is updated on a daily basis.

hash.name: Lyell Collection

meta.more-info: The collection also features Journal of the Geological Society, Quarterly Journal of Engineering Geology and Hydrogeology and Geochemistry: Exploration, Environment, Analysis with each journal having been captured back to its original launch issue and new issues will be available online immediately after publication. The collection represents over 14,000 peer-reviewed articles, full-text archives back to 1845 and selected open-access articles.

hash.title: Lyell Collection
hash.databasedescription:
Lyell Collection (from 1845 to the present) published by the Geological Society of London includes the Geological Society's Special Publications and the book series Engineering Geology Special Publications and Geological Society Memoirs.
The collection also features Journal of the Geological Society, Quarterly Journal of Engineering Geology and Hydrogeology and Geochemistry: Exploration, Environment, Analysis with each journal having been captured back to its original launch issue and new issues will be available online immediately after publication. The collection represents over 14,000 peer-reviewed articles, full-text archives back to 1845 and selected open-access articles.

hash.name: Meteorological & Geoastrophysical Abstracts
hash.title: Meteorological & Geoastrophysical Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Covers meteorology, climatology, atmospheric chemistry and physics, astrophysics, hydrology, glaciology, physical oceanography and environmental sciences.

hash.name: SPRILIB Antarctica

meta.more-info:
Geographical areas covered: In addition to the continent itself together with
its surrounding waters and islands north to the Antarctic Convergence,
SPRILIB Antarctica includes those Peri-Antarctic islands occurring north
of the Convergence but still strongly subject to Antarctic influences (Gough
Island, the New Zealand Sub-Antarctic Islands, Iles Amsterdam and Saint- Paul,
Iles Crozet, Macquarie Island, and the Prince Edward Islands). This area
corresponds to the zone of interest of the Scientific Committee on Antarctic
Research (SCAR). Because of their long association with Antarctica, SPRILIB
Antarctica also lists many publications about the Falkland Islands and
Tristan da Cunha, focusing particularly on natural history and on historical and
political issues with an Antarctic dimension.

Historical coverage: SPRILIB Antarctica aims to offer comprehensive
coverage of all works published before 1962, on all subjects and in all
languages. After this date, all monographs should be included but not all
periodical articles and conference papers. This coverage reflects the intention
to complement rather than duplicate that of the Antarctic Bibliography
searchable on the href="http://lcweb.loc.gov/rr/scitech/coldregions/welcome.html">Cold Regions
Bibliography site at the Library of Congress. The in-depth listing of
Antarctica's early literature has only been made possible through the generous
funding by the British Antarctic Survey of SPRI Library's Historic Antarctic
Bibliography Project. Invaluable support has also been received from the British
Government and Australian Antarctic Division.

SPRILIB Antarctica is a subset of SPRILIB which is available on the href="http://www.library.ualberta.ca/library_html/databases/polarres.html">Arctic
and Antarctic Regions (AAR) database (available online from the
University of Alberta Libraries' Databases page(s)) or on the href="http://www.library.ualberta.ca/library_html/cdrom/arctic.html">NISC Arctic
and Antarctic Regions (AAR) CD-ROM (available in the Science and
Technology Library). SPRILIB Antarctica will be updated at different
intervals from AAR and present certain advantages in being focussed on more
specific regions and topics.

hash.title: SPRILIB Antarctica
hash.databasedescription:
SPRILIB Antarctica (1602 to the present) is a comprehensive collection
of publications for Antarctica and the Southern Ocean.See "more" for brief description about it.

Geographical areas covered: In addition to the continent itself together with
its surrounding waters and islands north to the Antarctic Convergence,
SPRILIB Antarctica includes those Peri-Antarctic islands occurring north
of the Convergence but still strongly subject to Antarctic influences (Gough
Island, the New Zealand Sub-Antarctic Islands, Iles Amsterdam and Saint- Paul,
Iles Crozet, Macquarie Island, and the Prince Edward Islands). This area
corresponds to the zone of interest of the Scientific Committee on Antarctic
Research (SCAR). Because of their long association with Antarctica, SPRILIB
Antarctica also lists many publications about the Falkland Islands and
Tristan da Cunha, focusing particularly on natural history and on historical and
political issues with an Antarctic dimension.

Historical coverage: SPRILIB Antarctica aims to offer comprehensive
coverage of all works published before 1962, on all subjects and in all
languages. After this date, all monographs should be included but not all
periodical articles and conference papers. This coverage reflects the intention
to complement rather than duplicate that of the Antarctic Bibliography
searchable on the href="http://lcweb.loc.gov/rr/scitech/coldregions/welcome.html">Cold Regions
Bibliography site at the Library of Congress. The in-depth listing of
Antarctica's early literature has only been made possible through the generous
funding by the British Antarctic Survey of SPRI Library's Historic Antarctic
Bibliography Project. Invaluable support has also been received from the British

SPRILIB Antarctica is a subset of SPRILIB which is available on the href="http://www.library.ualberta.ca/library_html/databases/polarres.html">Arctic

University of Alberta Libraries' Databases page(s)) or on the href="http://www.library.ualberta.ca/library_html/cdrom/arctic.html">NISC Arctic
and Antarctic Regions (AAR) CD-ROM (available in the Science and
Technology Library). SPRILIB Antarctica will be updated at different
intervals from AAR and present certain advantages in being focussed on more
specific regions and topics.

hash.name: SPRILIB Ice and Snow

meta.more-info:
It includes books, reports, conference proceedings, journal articles, conference papers and book chapters. Subjects indexed include: astronomical aspects of ice and snow, biological aspects of ice and snow, floating ice-sea, lake and river ice, frozen ground/snow and ice engineering, general glaciology, geocryology, glacial geology, glaciological aspects of meteorology, glaciological instruments and methods, land ice, glaciers and ice shelves, physics and chemistry of ice, and snow and avalanches.

SPRLIB Ice and Snow is a subset of SPRILIB which is available on the Arctic and Antarctic Regions (AAR) database, or on the NISC Arctic
and Antarctic Regions (AAR) CD-ROM.

SPRLIB Ice and Snow will be updated at different intervals from AAR and present certain advantages in being focussed on more specific regions and topics.

hash.title: SPRILIB Ice and Snow
hash.databasedescription:
SPRLIB Ice and Snow (1661 to the present) is a comprehensive collection of publications covering all aspects of snow and ice worldwide.

It includes books, reports, conference proceedings, journal articles, conference papers and book chapters. Subjects indexed include: astronomical aspects of ice and snow, biological aspects of ice and snow, floating ice-sea, lake and river ice, frozen ground/snow and ice engineering, general glaciology, geocryology, glacial geology, glaciological aspects of meteorology, glaciological instruments and methods, land ice, glaciers and ice shelves, physics and chemistry of ice, and snow and avalanches.

SPRLIB Ice and Snow is a subset of SPRILIB which is available on the Arctic and Antarctic Regions (AAR) database, or on the NISC Arctic
and Antarctic Regions (AAR) CD-ROM.

SPRLIB Ice and Snow will be updated at different intervals from AAR and present certain advantages in being focussed on more specific regions and topics.

hash.name: SPRILIB Russian North

meta.more-info: This is the library catalogue of the University of Cambridge Scott Polar Research Institute Library. Click here for search tips. When you find a resource that you want, check for the JOURNAL TITLE or BOOK TITLE in the NEOS Libraries Catalogue.

hash.title: SPRILIB Russian North
hash.databasedescription:
Indexes journal articles, pamphlets, books, etc. concerning northern Russia and Siberia. There are currently over 19,000 records covering a wide range of subject areas, including: anthropology, archaeology, botany, earth sciences, health, history, folklore, literature and language, sociology, and zoology. Material covered is mostly in English and Russian, but also includes material in French, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Icelandic, and Saami.
This is the library catalogue of the University of Cambridge Scott Polar Research Institute Library. Click here for search tips. When you find a resource that you want, check for the JOURNAL TITLE or BOOK TITLE in the NEOS Libraries Catalogue.

hash.name: Asia-Studies Full-text Online
hash.title: Asia-Studies Full-text Online
hash.databasedescription: Contains full-text reports covering over 50 countries in Asia, Australia/New Zealand, the Americas Pacific Rim countries, and the Pacific islands. Examples of subject covereage include finance, trade, environment, human resources development, best practices in government, fisheries, tourism, education and women's studies.

hash.name: Bibliography of Asian Studies
hash.title: Bibliography of Asian Studies
hash.databasedescription: Bibliography of Asian Studies references western-language monographs, articles and book chapters on all parts of Asia published since 1971.

hash.name: Center for Research Libraries Catalog

meta.more-info:
These uncatalogued collections include: dissertations from universities outside of the U.S. and Canada (700,000 titles); U.S. state publications (1.2 million volumes); U.S. and foreign college catalogues (241,000 volumes); textbooks (85,000 volumes); and foreign documents (33,000 volumes). Information on all of these collections is available in the CRL Handbook, available in the Humanities and Social Sciences Reference
area at call number Z 733 C397 1990.

As a member of the Center for Research Libraries, the University of Alberta Library System is able to offer its patrons extended interlibrary loan service from the entire CRL collection, including many items not available for loan from other institutions (e.g. newspapers). The loan period is 4 months, with the option to renew for as long as needed, subject to recall after 2 weeks if requested by another reader.

hash.title: Center for Research Libraries Catalog
hash.databasedescription:
The Center for Research Libraries' holdings of almost 5 million items
include monographs, newspapers, serials, archival materials in microform, and
microform sets. CRL also holds several significant collections for which records
do not appear in the catalogue.
These uncatalogued collections include: dissertations from universities outside of the U.S. and Canada (700,000 titles); U.S. state publications (1.2 million volumes); U.S. and foreign college catalogues (241,000 volumes); textbooks (85,000 volumes); and foreign documents (33,000 volumes). Information on all of these collections is available in the CRL Handbook, available in the Humanities and Social Sciences Reference
area at call number Z 733 C397 1990.

As a member of the Center for Research Libraries, the University of Alberta Library System is able to offer its patrons extended interlibrary loan service from the entire CRL collection, including many items not available for loan from other institutions (e.g. newspapers). The loan period is 4 months, with the option to renew for as long as needed, subject to recall after 2 weeks if requested by another reader.

hash.name: CiNii

meta.more-info: CiNii Books gives book information of books held in university libraries in Japan. It is quite a comprehensive catalogue of Japanese books.

hash.title: CiNii
hash.databasedescription:
The former GeNii database group has been replaced by CiNii Articles and CiNii Books.CiNii Articles (Citation Information by the National Institute of Informatics) provides citations and some full text of the contents of most journals published in Japan. It includes the Japan Periodicals Index. CiNii Articles also provides links to other databases such as Kaken and Jairo (listed under NII Scholarly Services).


CiNii Books gives book information of books held in university libraries in Japan. It is quite a comprehensive catalogue of Japanese books.

hash.name: Gale Virtual Reference Library
hash.title: Gale Virtual Reference Library
hash.databasedescription: Gale Virtual Reference Library is a database of encyclopedias, almanacs, and specialized reference sources for multidisciplinary research

hash.name: Global Books in Print

meta.more-info: It includes Books In Print (U.S. and Canada), Whitaker�s BookBank (U.K.), International Books In Print (Continental Europe, Africa, Asia, and Latin America) and Australian and New Zealand Books In Print (Australia, New Zealand, and the Oceanic states).

hash.title: Global Books in Print
hash.databasedescription:
Global Books in Print provides bibliographic data and price information for English-language books worldwide as well as many books in Spanish, French, German and other languages, wherever published.
It includes Books In Print (U.S. and Canada), Whitaker�s BookBank (U.K.), International Books In Print (Continental Europe, Africa, Asia, and Latin America) and Australian and New Zealand Books In Print (Australia, New Zealand, and the Oceanic states).

hash.name: Nineteenth-Century Fiction
hash.title: Nineteenth-Century Fiction
hash.databasedescription: Includes 250 novels from the period 1782 to 1903, including works by all the major Victorian novelists such as Dickens, Thackeray, the Brontës, Eliot and Hardy, as well as the landmarks of Gothic and other fiction from the Romantic period. Features brief author biographies.

hash.name: OCLC PapersFirst (via FirstSearch)
hash.title: OCLC PapersFirst (via FirstSearch)
hash.databasedescription: Use PapersFirst to search for papers in published proceedings by author, title, or subject. PapersFirst is an index to the papers included in every congress, conference, exposition, workshop, symposium, and meeting received at The British Library from October 1993 to the present. This database is updated monthly.

hash.name: Oxford Reference Online Premium
hash.title: Oxford Reference Online Premium
hash.databasedescription: Contains dictionaries and reference titles covering a variety of subjects: from General Reference and Language to Science and Medicine, and from Humanities and Social Sciences to Business and Professional.

hash.name: Year's Work in Modern Language Studies

meta.more-info: Volume chapters divide each of these fields into a section on language and one or more on literature, supported by a name index and subject index.

hash.title: Year's Work in Modern Language Studies
hash.databasedescription:
The Year's Work in Modern Language Studies was founded by the MHRA in 1930. It is a critical bibliography of work done in the following languages and literatures: Medieval Latin, Neo-Latin, French, Occitan, Spanish, Catalan, Portuguese, Latin-American, Italian, Romanian, Romance, Welsh, Breton, Irish, Scottish Gaelic, German, Dutch, Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, Czech, Slovak, Polish, Russian, Ukrainian, Belorussian, Serbo-Croat, and Bulgarian.
Volume chapters divide each of these fields into a section on language and one or more on literature, supported by a name index and subject index.

hash.name: JapanKnowledge Classic

meta.more-info:
JapanKnowledge includes:
  • Encyclopedia of Japan (English and Japanese versions)
  • Japanese-English and English-Japanese dictionaries, dictionaries of new words and scientific abbreviations, etc.
  • Who's who in Japan
  • Full text of the Japanese journals Shukan ekonomisuto (Economist) and Kaisha shiki ho (Japan Company Handbook) in Japanese
  • Images and video clips of news and historical events, audio clips of famous music, and world atlas (Java software required)
  • Full text in PDF of the 700-volume Toyo bunko series of Japanese and Chinese classics

hash.title: JapanKnowledge Classic
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for information about JapanKnowledge Classic
JapanKnowledge includes:
  • Encyclopedia of Japan (English and Japanese versions)
  • Japanese-English and English-Japanese dictionaries, dictionaries of new words and scientific abbreviations, etc.
  • Who's who in Japan
  • Full text of the Japanese journals Shukan ekonomisuto (Economist) and Kaisha shiki ho (Japan Company Handbook) in Japanese
  • Images and video clips of news and historical events, audio clips of famous music, and world atlas (Java software required)
  • Full text in PDF of the 700-volume Toyo bunko series of Japanese and Chinese classics

hash.name: Census of Canada, 2001
hash.title: Census of Canada, 2001
hash.databasedescription:
Contains socio-economic statistics from the 2001 Census of Population
conducted by Statistics Canada. A profile of Canadians is presented, providing general population information as well as statistics on
education, income, work, families, and dwellings.

hash.name: e-Data [Conference Board of Canada]

meta.more-info:
Contains 7 Conference Board databases:

  1. Canadian forecast: 5 year and 20 year forecasts of 540 economic indicators from 9 sectors of the national economy
  2. Provincial Forecast: 5 year and 20 year forecasts for each province, 1500 indicators updated quarterly
  3. Metropolitan Forecast: 5 year forecasts for 27 Canadian metropolitan areas, 1,600 indicators updated 2 to 3 times a year depending upon CMA
  4. Consumer Confidence: summarizes the responses to 4 attitudinal questions on employment, prospects, financial position and whether or not it is a good time to make a major purchase; 160 indicators, updated quarterly
  5. Business Confidence: summarizes the responses to 10 attitudinal questions designed to measure CEOs' perceptions of the current economic environment, their investment intentions and their determinants; 50 indicators, updated quarterly
  6. Canadian Industrial: 5 year forecast for 10 major industries ( aircraft and parts, auto and parts, construction, food manufacturing, information technology and communications, oil and gas, paper products, tourism, retail trade and wood products.
  7. US Forecasts: 5 year forecast for U.S. economy; 100 indicators, updated quarterly

hash.title: e-Data [Conference Board of Canada]
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for brief description about e-Data [Conference Board of Canada]

Contains 7 Conference Board databases:

  1. Canadian forecast: 5 year and 20 year forecasts of 540 economic indicators from 9 sectors of the national economy
  2. Provincial Forecast: 5 year and 20 year forecasts for each province, 1500 indicators updated quarterly
  3. Metropolitan Forecast: 5 year forecasts for 27 Canadian metropolitan areas, 1,600 indicators updated 2 to 3 times a year depending upon CMA
  4. Consumer Confidence: summarizes the responses to 4 attitudinal questions on employment, prospects, financial position and whether or not it is a good time to make a major purchase; 160 indicators, updated quarterly
  5. Business Confidence: summarizes the responses to 10 attitudinal questions designed to measure CEOs' perceptions of the current economic environment, their investment intentions and their determinants; 50 indicators, updated quarterly
  6. Canadian Industrial: 5 year forecast for 10 major industries ( aircraft and parts, auto and parts, construction, food manufacturing, information technology and communications, oil and gas, paper products, tourism, retail trade and wood products.
  7. US Forecasts: 5 year forecast for U.S. economy; 100 indicators, updated quarterly

hash.name: GEM: Global Economic Monitor
hash.title: GEM: Global Economic Monitor
hash.databasedescription: Provides daily and monthly commentary on global economic conditions along with direct access to high frequency data that is refreshed daily. Includes analysis of current economic trends, economic, financial and commodity data indicators, an extensive database including growth and commodity forecasts.

hash.name: Global Forecasting Service

meta.more-info:
It includes:
  • downloadable monthly PowerPoint presentations, summarising the main points of our global forecast, to use in your own presentations;
  • a free, monthly-updated PDF summary report covering our global forecast, which you can distribute to your colleagues;
  • data, analysis and forecasts for the global economy, plus drill-down options for the regions most important to you;
  • regular articles on the critical issues that influence economic prospects;
  • succinct analysis of the ten top risks confronting the world economy at any given time.

hash.title: Global Forecasting Service
hash.databasedescription:
The Global Forecasting Service is a forecasting tool for the world economy. It predicts and explains the key issues and trends in important developed and emerging markets, spelling out their implications for business and the world economy over the next five years.
It includes:
  • downloadable monthly PowerPoint presentations, summarising the main points of our global forecast, to use in your own presentations;
  • a free, monthly-updated PDF summary report covering our global forecast, which you can distribute to your colleagues;
  • data, analysis and forecasts for the global economy, plus drill-down options for the regions most important to you;
  • regular articles on the critical issues that influence economic prospects;
  • succinct analysis of the ten top risks confronting the world economy at any given time.

hash.name: Historical Statistics of the United States
hash.title: Historical Statistics of the United States
hash.databasedescription: Electronic version of the Millenium edition of the Historical Statistics of the United States. Includes statistics related to American history as well as introductory essays.

hash.name: IMF eLIBRARY
hash.title: IMF eLIBRARY
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to the International Monetary Fund's periodicals, books, working papers and studies, and data and statistical tools.

hash.name: IMF eLIBRARY - Data
hash.title: IMF eLIBRARY - Data
hash.databasedescription: Data and statistical tools from the International Monetary Fund.

hash.name: Penn World Tables
hash.title: Penn World Tables
hash.databasedescription: International economics statistics.

hash.name: Trade Analyser
hash.title: Trade Analyser
hash.databasedescription: This database contains extensive tables for Canadian imports and exports. Tables contain historical time series data for many topics. Each table includes a number of variables that may be selected for output.

hash.name: WRDS

meta.more-info:
List of University of Alberta subscribed databases:
  • Amadeus


    Bureau Van Dijk's Amadeus is a pan-European financial database containing information on over 10 million public and private companies from 41 countries, including all the EU countries and Eastern Europe. Up to 10 years of detailed information (consolidated statements are also provided when available) comprising 24 balance sheet items, 25 profit and loss account items and 26 ratios. The descriptive information includes: official national identification number, address, telephone, fax, website, legal form, year of incorporation, senior managers, auditors, number of employees, quoted/unquoted indicator, industry and activity codes and, when available, a trade description in the local language and English.


  • Capital IQ People Intelligence


    Covers over 4.5 million professionals and over 2.4 million people including private and public company executives, board members, and investment professionals, global coverage. Profile which can include contact details, biography, education, job functions and titles, board memberships, compensation, insider activity, and options holdings.


  • Compustat Executive Compensation (previously Execucomp)


    Executive compensation data including 100 up-to-date compensation and financial items.


  • Compustat Global


    Annual fundamental data for active and inactive companies from 1979-2014; monthly stock price and dividend history for active and inactive companies from 1988-2014;daily and monthly stock price and dividend history for active and inactive companies form 1984-2014.


  • Compustat North America


    Standard & Poor's Compustat is a database of financial, statistical, and marketing information. Compustat provides the annual and quarterly Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Statement of Cash Flows, and supplemental data items on most publicly held companies. Compustat files also contain information on aggregates, industry segments, banks, market prices, dividends, and earnings.


  • CRSP: The following CRSP products are available:



    • CRSP Survivor-Bias-Free US Mutual Fund Database


      The CRSP Survivor-Bias-Free US Mutual Fund Database includes a history of each mutual fund's name, investment style, fee structure, holdings, and asset allocation. Also included are monthly total returns, monthly total net assets, monthly/daily net asset values, and dividends. Additionally, schedules of rear and front load fees, asset class codes, and management company contact information are provided. All data items are for publicly traded open-end mutual funds (active and inactive) and begin at varying times between 1962 and 2008 depending on availability. The database is updated quarterly and distributed with a monthly lag.


    • CRSP US Stock Database


      The CRSP US Stock Database contains end-of-day and month-end prices on all listed NYSE, Amex, and NASDAQ common stocks along with basic market indices, and includes the most comprehensive distribution information available, with the most accurate total return calculations.


    • CRSP Indices database


      The CRSP Indices database contains five groups of CRSP indices: the CRSP Stock File Indices, the CRSP Cap-Based Portfolios, the CRSP Indices for the S&P 500 Universe, the CRSP Treasury and Inflation (CTI) Indices, and the CRSP Select Treasury Indices.


    • CRSP US Treasury and Inflation Series


      The CRSP US Treasury and Inflation Series contain returns and index levels on the US Government Bond Fixed Term Index Series, and the Risk Free Rates File. The US Treasury database begins in 1925 for month-end data and in 1961 for daily data. Over 1.6 million end-of-day price observations for 3,350 US Treasury bills, notes, and bonds and over 101,500 prices for 5,300 month-end issues are included in the databases.


    • CRSP/COMPUSTAT Merged Database


      The CRSP/COMPUSTAT Merged Database allows for concurrent database access to CRSP's stock data and Compustat's fundamental data



  • Dow Jones Averages


    These files contain information about daily prices (high, low, close) for the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the Dow Jones Transportation Average and the Dow Jones Utilities Average. Data for the Industrial and Transportation Averages are from 1896 to 1999. Data for the Utilities Average are from 1929 to 1999.


  • Eventus


    Eventus performs event studies that compute abnormal returns for specific corporate actions or events using data directly from the CRSP stock database.


  • FDIC


    This data set contains historical financial statistics about U.S. commercial banks, savings banks and savings and loans. The file includes details on structure and merger history, financial time series and ratios plus complex derived integers data. The information is from 1984 to 1998.


  • GMI Ratings


    A source of comprehensive objective corporate governance, compensation, and critical company information. Information on over 4,000 U.S. companies and over 45,000 corporate executives and directors. Information includes: Corporate Board Structure and Independence, Director Positions and Committee Assignments, Executive Compensation, Director Compensation, Audit Fees, Corporate Ownership, Takeover Defenses.


  • I/B/E/S


    I/B/E/S is an acronym for "Institutional Brokers' Estimate System" and it is the leading source for analysts' earnings expectations. It is generally regarded as the most comprehensive database of earnings per share (eps) projections information which is supplied by analysts who regularly make and revise forecasts for the companies they follow.


  • IRI Marketing Fact Book


    Provides data on grocery and drug stores purchases of items from 300 product categories, by a panel of households across the U.S. Data available fro 1983-1997.


  • Isis


    Bureau Van Dijk's Isis is a comprehensive database of detailed reports on public and private insurance companies around the world. ISIS contains information on 5,250 non-life companies (back to 1992), 2,400 life companies (to 1995), and 610 composites (to 1995) in over 120 different countries. Each company report typically contains the following: income statements and balance sheets, ratios, shareholder, and subsidiaries.


  • ISSM( Institute for the Study of Security Markets)


    Contains tick by tick data covering the NYSE and AMEX listed companies 1983-1992 and NASDAQ companies 1987-1992. Each year of data is divided into 2 files, one for trades and one for quotes.


  • KLD Ratings Data


    KLD created Domini 400 SocialSM Index (DS 400 Index), a socially screened, capitalization-weighted index of 400 common stocks. The DS 400 is recognized as the first social investment benchmark. As well, KLD provides social ratings for all companies in the DS 400. Data is available from 1991-current.


  • Option Metrics


    Source of historical price and implied volatility data for the US/Canadian equity and index options markets. Encompassing data from 1996, Ivy DB contains accurate historical prices of options and their associated underlying instruments, correctly calculated implied volatilities, and option sensitivities.


  • Osiris


    Bureau Van Dijk's Osiris is a database containing financial information on globally listed public companies, including banks and insurance firms from over 190 countries. The combined industrial company dataset contains standardized and as reported financials, including restated accounts, for up to 20 years on over 55,000 companies. The bank financials in OSIRIS offers up to 8 years of financial data for more than 3,350 listed banks. Insurance company financials, collected from annual reports and the NAIC and cover up to 9 years of data on over 660 listed insurance companies. OSIRIS strives to cover all publicly listed companies worldwide. In addition, it covers major non-listed companies when they are primary subsidiaries of publicly listed companies.


  • RiskMetrics Directors Data (formerly IRRC)


    Data on corporate directors of the S&P 1500 companies back to 1996. Data variables include: director independence, stock ownership, attendance, board committee service, primary employment category and company, and interlocking directorships.


  • RiskMetrics: Governance (formerly the IRRC Takeover Defense database)


    Information on takeover defense and other corporate governance provisions for major US firms.


  • RiskMetrics Shareholder Proposal Data


    Available from 1997. This includes proposals that came to a vote as well as those that did not (e.g., because they were withdrawn by the proponent or allowed to be omitted from the proxy by the SEC). Variables include the lead filer of the proposal, the meeting date, and outcome; some fields are not complete every year for every company, but the vast majority of meeting dates are present. This data set will be updated each year.


  • SEC Disclosure of Order Executions


    In November, 2000 the U.S. SEC adopted new rules aimed at improving public disclosure of order executions and routing practices. Market centers that trade national market system securities must make monthy, electronic disclosures of basic information conerning their quality of executions on a stock-by-stock basis. This file presents statistics about those disclosures.


  • TAQ (Trade and Quote)


    Contains intraday transactions data (trades and quotes) for all NYSE, AMEX, NASDAQ and Small Cap issues.


  • Thomson Reuters Insider Data


    Thomson Reuters Insider Data is the most extensive (back to 1978) collection of insider trading data as reported on SEC Forms 3, 4, 5, and 144. It covers equity and convertible trades by individuals and institutions that are classified by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) as "insiders." An insider is an officer, director, a person with a "policy-making" role, or a beneficial owner (holder of 10% or more) of a company's stock.
    SEC Forms Used to Compile Insider Information:

    • Form 3 - Initial statement which identifies holdings of registrant's securities owned by directors, officers, and 10% shareholders. A Form 3 must be filed within 10 days after the event.
    • Form 4 - Amendment to Form 3 reporting a sale or acquisition of registrant's securities. A Form 4 must be filed by the tenth say of the month following the month in which the transaction occurred.
    • Form 5 - Annual section 16 filing filed 45 days after the company's fiscal year end.
    • Form 144 - A form filed as notice of the proposed sale of restricted securities, or securities held by an affiliate of the issuer in reliance on Rule 144 when the amount to be sold during any three-month period exceeds 500 shares or has an aggregate sales price in excess of $10,000.

    Please note: Thomson Reuters Ownership data (formerly called Spectrum) is not a clean set of data. This is mostly due to reporting inconsistencies with the SEC documents from which the data is pulled. Also, this is a database of transactions (buying and selling of stock) so it is meant to be a record of changes in position, not a snapshot by quarter.


  • Thomson Reuters Institutional 13f Holdings


    Provides Institutional Common Stock Holdings and Transactions, as reported oForm 13F filed with the SEC.

hash.title: WRDS
hash.databasedescription:
WRDS (generally pronounced as "words") is an Internet-based data subscription service that is provided by the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. The data available are mainly related to business and finance and WRDS hosts the major numeric data sets used by academic researchers.
