hash.name: ABI Inform Dateline
hash.title: ABI Inform Dateline
hash.databasedescription: Includes local and regional business publications, including McClatchey Tribune titles, with news about issues such as local companies, analysis, and information on local markets.

hash.name: Columbia International Affairs Online
hash.title: Columbia International Affairs Online
hash.databasedescription: Columbia International Affairs Online (CIAO) is a comprehensive source for theory and research in international affairs. It publishes a wide range of scholarship from 1991 onward that includes working papers from university research institutes, occasional papers series from NGOs, foundation-funded research projects, proceedings from conferences, books, journals and policy briefs.

hash.name: Database ECONIS
hash.title: Database ECONIS
hash.databasedescription: ECONIS lists the holdings of the ZBW (German National Library of Economics), and includes records for business studies, economics and practice-oriented economic literature including books, articles and papers.

hash.name: Eldis Gateway to Development Information
hash.title: Eldis Gateway to Development Information
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to full-text documents and other resources related to global development.

hash.name: Energy Innovation Platform of Alberta (EIPA)

meta.more-info: EIPA is a web-accessible repository of public and private research in energy pertinent to the vast hydrocarbon resources in Alberta. There are over 52,000 documents in the collection, about half of which are publicly available. Only citations are currently in the database, but full documents will be added.

hash.title: Energy Innovation Platform of Alberta (EIPA)
hash.databasedescription:
Established in September 2008 as the Government of Alberta database for research in all areas of energy and technology development, EIPA is a portal for information contributed from 34 years of cross-ministry and department resources and research projects with industry, academia, and other partners.


EIPA is a web-accessible repository of public and private research in energy pertinent to the vast hydrocarbon resources in Alberta. There are over 52,000 documents in the collection, about half of which are publicly available. Only citations are currently in the database, but full documents will be added.

hash.name: Federal Publication Locator
hash.title: Federal Publication Locator
hash.databasedescription:
A comprehensive search tool for print and online Canadian federal government publications.
For print items, check "locations". If the U of Alberta is listed, look up the call number or title in the NEOS Libraries Catalogue to find the location of the document on campus (they are NOT all in the Cameron library as the database indicates).

hash.name: Fundata Mutual Fund Database

meta.more-info: For each fund you may also retrieve time series of data, listing changes in total net assets, NAVPS, income and capital gain dividend per share, share balance and value of investment. FUNDATAMF is updated monthly.

hash.title: Fundata Mutual Fund Database
hash.databasedescription:
The Fundata Mutual Fund Database includes information for over 4000 active funds from almost 200 sponsor companies. It includes fund status, type, RRSP indicators, sales/redemption charge, currency, dividend frequency, management fees, expense ratios, and percentage foreign invested.
For each fund you may also retrieve time series of data, listing changes in total net assets, NAVPS, income and capital gain dividend per share, share balance and value of investment. FUNDATAMF is updated monthly.

hash.name: NBER (National Bureau of Economic Research) Working Papers
hash.title: NBER (National Bureau of Economic Research) Working Papers
hash.databasedescription: Working papers (fulltext) from the National Bureau of Economic Research.

hash.name: SecuritiesSource

meta.more-info:
In addition, access is also provided to the following sources:

CriminalSource provides search access to criminal,
constitutional, evidence, and immigration cases from all Canadian
jurisdictions.

Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.

Family Source provides search access to Canadian primary law as itrelates to the family, including case law and legislation in Canada. Aswell, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the case comments from law reports and case summaries from the Canadian Abridgment. Some highlights include Child Protection Law in Canada by
Bernstein, Canadian Divorce Law and Practice by MacDonald and Ferrier,and Child Custody Law and Practice by McLeod. It also permits users tonote-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the KeyCiteCanada feature.

Insolvency Source provides search access to all full text cases dealing with bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal propertysecurity law in Canada. It also includes other primary law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports. Also included are articles and court filings from the Insolvency Institute of Canada,annotations from Canadian Bankruptcy Reports, and Houlden and Morawetz
Precedents under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act. It also permits users to note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the KeyCiteCanada feature.

IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.

LawSource provides search access to Canadian primarylaw-legislation and court decisions-from across the country.

As well, access to legal materials from the United States and UnitedKingdom are located under the "US Premiere Service" and "UK Law" tabs.

hash.title: SecuritiesSource
hash.databasedescription:
SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.


In addition, access is also provided to the following sources:

CriminalSource provides search access to criminal,
constitutional, evidence, and immigration cases from all Canadian
jurisdictions.

Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.

Family Source provides search access to Canadian primary law as itrelates to the family, including case law and legislation in Canada. Aswell, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the case comments from law reports and case summaries from the Canadian Abridgment. Some highlights include Child Protection Law in Canada by
Bernstein, Canadian Divorce Law and Practice by MacDonald and Ferrier,and Child Custody Law and Practice by McLeod. It also permits users tonote-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the KeyCiteCanada feature.

Insolvency Source provides search access to all full text cases dealing with bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal propertysecurity law in Canada. It also includes other primary law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports. Also included are articles and court filings from the Insolvency Institute of Canada,annotations from Canadian Bankruptcy Reports, and Houlden and Morawetz
Precedents under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act. It also permits users to note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the KeyCiteCanada feature.

IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.

LawSource provides search access to Canadian primarylaw-legislation and court decisions-from across the country.

As well, access to legal materials from the United States and UnitedKingdom are located under the "US Premiere Service" and "UK Law" tabs.

hash.name: Social Science Research Network

meta.more-info: Special features include "My Briefcase" functionality and RSS Author Feeds. My Briefcase allows an individual to save papers for later retrieval by clicking the Add to My Briefcase link at the bottom of the public abstract page. The RSS Author Feeds provide automatic notification of new submissions and revisions for any author in the eLibrary. You can access this feature by dragging or copying the author's RSS feed button (available on every Author Home Page) to your RSS news aggregator.

hash.title: Social Science Research Network
hash.databasedescription:
Fulltext research papers. Includes Accounting Research Network, Corporate Governance Network, Economics Research Network, Entrepreneurship Research & Policy Network, Financial Economics Research Network, Information Systems Network, Legal Scholarship Network, Management Research Network, Philosophy Network, Political Science Network, and Social Insurance Network.
Special features include "My Briefcase" functionality and RSS Author Feeds. My Briefcase allows an individual to save papers for later retrieval by clicking the Add to My Briefcase link at the bottom of the public abstract page. The RSS Author Feeds provide automatic notification of new submissions and revisions for any author in the eLibrary. You can access this feature by dragging or copying the author's RSS feed button (available on every Author Home Page) to your RSS news aggregator.

hash.name: The Economist Historical Archive (1843-2011)
hash.title: The Economist Historical Archive (1843-2011)
hash.databasedescription: Searchable copies of every issue of The Economist from 1843 to 2011.

hash.name: The Making of the Modern World: Goldsmiths'-Kress Library of Economic Literature 1450-1914
hash.title: The Making of the Modern World: Goldsmiths'-Kress Library of Economic Literature 1450-1914
hash.databasedescription: Provides digital facsimile images and full-text searching of literature on economic and business published from 1450 through 1914.

hash.name: Direction of Trade Statistics
hash.title: Direction of Trade Statistics
hash.databasedescription: The DOTS CD-ROM provides directional import/export data for approximately 180 countries from 1980 onwards. It is accompanied by the Direction of Trade Statistics Historical Database, also on CD-ROM. The Historical Database contains more than 55,000 time series of annual, quarterly, and monthly trade data for approximately 200 countries from 1948 to 1980.

hash.name: World Bank e-Library
hash.title: World Bank e-Library
hash.databasedescription: Contains World Bank publications and over 2000 Policy Research Working Papers, plus each new book and paper as they are published.

hash.name: ADOLEC
hash.title: ADOLEC
hash.databasedescription: Articles on adolescent health, in English, Spanish and Portuguese, produced by the Pan American Health Organization.

hash.name: Alberta Resources Catalogue
hash.title: Alberta Resources Catalogue
hash.databasedescription: Alberta Education resource lists in support of the Kindergarten to Grade 12 curriculum.

hash.name: British Education Index
hash.title: British Education Index
hash.databasedescription: This law report series, which was first published in 1884, has full text judgments dating back to 1867. The Reports contain important social and legal history of British Columbia, and chart the development of BC law. This database is an important resource for legal researchers, historians, and genealogists as it provides a collection of unique primary information on society and individuals living in BC in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

hash.name: Child Development & Adolescent Studies
hash.title: Child Development & Adolescent Studies
hash.databasedescription: Contains references to the current and historical literature related to the growth and development of children through the age of 21. Included are book reviews and abstracts from hundreds of journals, and a bibliography of thousands of technical reports, books, book chapters, theses and dissertations that cover the biomedical and social sciences worldwide. Over 10,000 new records added each year.

hash.name: Children's Core Collection

meta.more-info: Entries provide complete bibliographic data, price, subject headings, a descriptive annotation, and evaluative quotations from a review when available. The catalog also includes an annotated list of recommended web resources for children and professionals working with children.

hash.title: Children's Core Collection
hash.databasedescription:
Children's Core Collection covers a core collection of fiction and nonfiction works, story collections, picture books, graphic novels, and magazines recommended for readers in preschool through sixth grade. Professional literature for the children's librarian, both periodicals and books, is also covered.
Entries provide complete bibliographic data, price, subject headings, a descriptive annotation, and evaluative quotations from a review when available. The catalog also includes an annotated list of recommended web resources for children and professionals working with children.

hash.name: Current Educational Research in the United Kingdom
hash.title: Current Educational Research in the United Kingdom
hash.databasedescription: Seeks to include all recently completed and ongoing research in the United Kingdom, from large sponsored programmes to individual projects.

hash.name: Database of Education Research
hash.title: Database of Education Research
hash.databasedescription: Contains references to educational research cited in systematic reviews carried out by the EPPI-Centre and Review Groups.

hash.name: Education in Video
hash.title: Education in Video
hash.databasedescription: Online collection of streaming video developed specifically for training and developing teachers. Includes teaching demonstrations, lectures, documentaries, and primary-source footage of students and teachers in actual classrooms.

hash.name: Education Index Retrospective
hash.title: Education Index Retrospective
hash.databasedescription: Wilson's Education Index from 1929-1983. Indexes publications in education, covering areas such as adult education, homeschooling, language and linguistics, and special education.

hash.name: Education Research Complete
hash.title: Education Research Complete
hash.databasedescription: Education Complete is a bibliographic and full text database covering scholarly research and information relating to all areas of education. Topics covered include all levels of education from early childhood to higher education, and all educational specialties, such as multilingual education, health education, and testing. Education Research Complete also covers areas of curriculum instruction as well as administration, policy, funding, and related social issues.

hash.name: Educational Administration Abstracts
hash.title: Educational Administration Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to educational administration, including educational leadership, educational management, educational research, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: Educational Research Abstracts
hash.title: Educational Research Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
Educational Research Abstracts covers the current international research
in education. It includes the content of the following print publications:

  • Educational Management Abstracts
  • Educational Technology Abstracts
  • Multicultural Education Abstracts
  • Research into Higher Education Abstracts
  • Sociology of Education Abstracts
  • Special Educational Needs Abstracts
  • Technical Education & Training Abstracts

hash.name: Europa World of Learning
hash.title: Europa World of Learning
hash.databasedescription: The World of Learning is an extensive directory of academic institutions worldwide including universities, colleges, schools of art and music, libraries, learned societies, research institutes, museums and art galleries.

hash.name: Family Studies Abstracts
hash.title: Family Studies Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to family studies, including marriage, divorce, family therapy, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: International ERIC
hash.title: International ERIC
hash.databasedescription: Consists of ERIC along with the Australian Education Index. Covers all aspects of education, from preschool to post-secondary and adult education.

hash.name: LearnAlberta.ca
hash.title: LearnAlberta.ca
hash.databasedescription: LearnAlberta.ca provides high quality digital learning and teaching resources uniquely correlated to Alberta Education's Kindergarten to Grade 12 programs of study

hash.name: Observatory on Borderless Higher Education

meta.more-info: The term 'borderless education' encompasses a broad range of activities and developments which cross (or have the potential to cross) the traditional borders of higher education, be they geographical, sectoral or conceptual. So, for example, the Observatory will track developments in areas such as e-learning, growth in private and corporate education, developing markets and international collaboration.

hash.title: Observatory on Borderless Higher Education
hash.databasedescription:
The Observatory provides an environmental scanning facility for subscribers to keep abreast of borderless developments globally.
The term 'borderless education' encompasses a broad range of activities and developments which cross (or have the potential to cross) the traditional borders of higher education, be they geographical, sectoral or conceptual. So, for example, the Observatory will track developments in areas such as e-learning, growth in private and corporate education, developing markets and international collaboration.

hash.name: OmniFile Full Text (Select Edition)
hash.title: OmniFile Full Text (Select Edition)
hash.databasedescription:
Includes full text, and full text only records from the following databases:



  • Applied Science & Technology Full Text
  • Art Full Text
  • Biological & Agricultural Index Plus
  • Business Full Text
  • Education Full Text
  • General Science Full Text
  • Humanities Full Text
  • Index to Legal Periodicals Full Text
  • Library Literature & Information Science Full Text
  • Readers' Guide Full Text
  • Social Sciences Full Text

hash.name: PsycTherapy
hash.title: PsycTherapy
hash.databasedescription: Includes streaming video of psychotherapy demonstrations by therapists in North America working with participants on a variety of therapeutic topics.

hash.name: Sage Research Methods Cases
hash.title: Sage Research Methods Cases
hash.databasedescription: Collection of case studies of social research.

hash.name: WetFeet
hash.title: WetFeet

hash.name: Sage Journals Online
hash.title: Sage Journals Online
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext from a number of Sage journals.

hash.name: Taylor & Francis Online Journals
hash.title: Taylor & Francis Online Journals
hash.databasedescription: Access to the fulltext of journals published by Taylor & Francis.

hash.name: Health and Psychosocial Instruments
hash.title: Health and Psychosocial Instruments
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to information on measurement instruments in the health fields, psychosocial sciences, organizational behavior, and library and information science. identify measures needed for research studies, grant proposals, client/patient assessment, class papers/projects, theses/dissertations, and program evaluation.

hash.name: ETS TestLink
hash.title: ETS TestLink
hash.databasedescription:
Test Link is a database of 25,000 tests and other measurement devices such as surveys and questionnaires, that makes information on standardized tests and research instruments available to researchers, graduate students, and teachers.



This database should be used as an index of tests and is not a full text repository.

hash.name: Mental Measurements Yearbook with Tests in Print

meta.more-info: Tests in Print provides a bibliography to all known commercially available tests that are currently in print in the English language. Includes information such test purpose, test publisher, in-print status, price, test acronym, intended test population, administration times, publication date(s), and test author(s).

hash.title: Mental Measurements Yearbook with Tests in Print
hash.databasedescription:
Mental Measurements Yearbookcontains information about and reviews of all English-language standardized tests covering educational skills, personality, vocational aptitude, psychology, and related areas as included in the printed Mental Measurements Yearbooks.


Tests in Print provides a bibliography to all known commercially available tests that are currently in print in the English language. Includes information such test purpose, test publisher, in-print status, price, test acronym, intended test population, administration times, publication date(s), and test author(s).

hash.name: PsycBOOKS
hash.title: PsycBOOKS
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to the full text of books published by the American Psychological Association.

hash.name: PsycCRITIQUES
hash.title: PsycCRITIQUES
hash.databasedescription: PsycCRITIQUES provides full text reviews of current books and some popular films, videos, and software as well as comparative reviews of books.

hash.name: PsycEXTRA
hash.title: PsycEXTRA
hash.databasedescription: PsycEXTRA, produced by the American Psychological Association (APA), is a bibliographic and full-text companion to the scholarly PsycINFO database. The document types included in PsycEXTRA consist of technical, annual and government reports, conference papers, newsletters, magazines, newspapers, consumer brochures and more. This database complements PsycINFO and the other APA databases with extensive coverage of gray literature relating to psychology and the behavioral sciences.

hash.name: PsychiatryOnline
hash.title: PsychiatryOnline
hash.databasedescription: Books and journals from American Psychiatric Publishing, including the DSM-IV-TR Library, APA practice guidelines for the treatment of psychiatric disorders, and American Psychiatric Publishing textbook of clinical psychiatry.

hash.name: Sage Video
hash.title: Sage Video
hash.databasedescription: Streaming video collections from Sage Publishing.

hash.name: Energy Central Corporate News
hash.title: Energy Central Corporate News
hash.databasedescription:
Energy Central Corporate News provides information on energy related issues. The site
includes: current news topics, utility information, merger and acquisitions, online energy directories and plant generation information. This site covers the global energy sector and subscribers have access to reports on up-to-date industry information and a customizable energy alerting service.

hash.name: Fuel and Energy Abstracts.
hash.title: Fuel and Energy Abstracts.
hash.databasedescription: Each issue contains more than 1500 abstracts and titles from more than 800 international publications, special reports, monographs, conference proceedings, surveys and statistical analyses, dealing with all scientific, technical, economic and policy aspects of fuel and energy. Each entry, carefully selected from original sources or other information made available by collaborating organizations, gives bibliographic and reference details together with an abstract, where appropriate.

hash.name: Environment & Energy Publishing

meta.more-info:
Three major newsletters (ClimateWire, EnergyWire, Greenwire) are updated daily. E&E also produces special in-depth topical reports such as: Global Climate Debate, Pipeline Politics, Drought, Islands, Arctic Drilling, etc. This database contains the archive of these publication, and provides the ability to do key word searches across the archive. Three or four years of older issues available as archives. More extensive descirptions of newsletters below:


ClimateWire provides coverage of the debate over climate policy and its effects on business, the environment and society; covers key issues that surround the debate over climate change, including: Kyoto implementation; Post-Kyoto negotiations and nation-state positioning; International agency activities; Carbon market development; Alternative energy research and deployment; Financial community investment decisions; Corporate/multi-national response to climate concerns; Positions and lobbying by stakeholder groups; Consequences and lessons learned from GHG-reduction efforts; Latest science research and technology developments; Effects on water resources, species, ecosystems and agriculture; Trends and effects for traditional and non-traditional fossil fuel resources; Consequences for electric utilities; Economic effects; Costs to consumers; US Federal agency programs, legislation, policies and funding; State program development and implementation;


EnergyWire, launched in 2012, initially delivered deep, broad and insightful coverage of the business and political issues surrounding the rapidly expanding unconventional energy industry in the United States and around the world. In January 2014, E&E expanded EnergyWire to also cover the various developments that are transforming the electric utility industry, including the switch to natural gas, the growth of distributed energy, the need for significant infrastructure expansion and the flattening of demand. These factors and others confront the traditional utility business with significant uncertainty. Key issues covered by EnergyWire include: shale oil and gas development, liquefied natural gas (LNG), oil sands, deepwater and Arctic drilling, enhanced oil and gas recovery, and other emerging fossil energy sources; environmental concerns and the effects on water resources; the debates over regulatory authority and land and mineral rights; technology development; finance, mergers and acquisitions; pipelines, LNG terminals and other energy infrastructure; economic consequences; legislative and legal issues; global energy supply and geopolitical implications; grid stability and security; distributed generation and renewables;
renewable portfolio standards and carbon regulation; base-load fuel utilization and base-load facility retirement and replacement;


Greenwire is the leading information source for comprehensive, objective, daily coverage of environmental and energy policy, politics and markets. Greenwire's daily stories keep readers up-to-date on the energy and environmental landscape, including major U.S. regulations, legislation and court cases in play; also explains how the battle over energy policy and climate change is affecting investment trends, technology development and the capacity to deploy new fuel types, generating capacity and carbon mitigation strategies. In addition it covers a wide range of natural resource issues from endangered species to water issues.

hash.title: Environment & Energy Publishing
hash.databasedescription:
Environment & Energy Publishing (E&E) is the leading source for comprehensive, daily coverage of environmental and energy policy and markets.
Three major newsletters (ClimateWire, EnergyWire, Greenwire) are updated daily. E&E also produces special in-depth topical reports such as: Global Climate Debate, Pipeline Politics, Drought, Islands, Arctic Drilling, etc. This database contains the archive of these publication, and provides the ability to do key word searches across the archive. Key issues covered by EnergyWire include: shale oil and gas development, liquefied natural gas (LNG), oil sands, deepwater and Arctic drilling, enhanced oil and gas recovery, and other emerging fossil energy sources; environmental concerns and the effects on water resources; the debates over regulatory authority and land and mineral rights; technology development; finance, mergers and acquisitions; pipelines, LNG terminals and other energy infrastructure; economic consequences; legislative and legal issues; global energy supply and geopolitical implications; grid stability and security; distributed generation and renewables;
renewable portfolio standards and carbon regulation; base-load fuel utilization and base-load facility retirement and replacement;


Greenwire is the leading information source for comprehensive, objective, daily coverage of environmental and energy policy, politics and markets. Greenwire's daily stories keep readers up-to-date on the energy and environmental landscape, including major U.S. regulations, legislation and court cases in play; also explains how the battle over energy policy and climate change is affecting investment trends, technology development and the capacity to deploy new fuel types, generating capacity and carbon mitigation strategies. In addition it covers a wide range of natural resource issues from endangered species to water issues.

hash.name: Platts Historical Domestic & Canadian Crude Price Data

meta.more-info: Extensive coverage of American crudes ( e.g. Poseidon, Mars, WT, Eugene Island, Kern River, Long Beach, Wyoming Sweet Guernsey, Bakken blend, Thunder Horse blend, etc.)

hash.title: Platts Historical Domestic & Canadian Crude Price Data
hash.databasedescription:
Comprehensive historical daily and monthly crude price data (high, low, close and Index). Historical coverage varies by specific crude price (e.g. Koch Sour Edmonton goes back to 1999, but, Lloyd Blend starts with August 2003.) Data current to June 2012. Extensive coverage of Canadian crudes ( e.g. Bow River, Hibernia, Lloyd blend, Mixed Sweet, Hardisty, Syncrude, Cold Lake Blend, Enbridge, Condensate, Mixed sour etc.)
Extensive coverage of American crudes ( e.g. Poseidon, Mars, WT, Eugene Island, Kern River, Long Beach, Wyoming Sweet Guernsey, Bakken blend, Thunder Horse blend, etc.)

hash.name: Referex Engineering

meta.more-info:
Content ranges from broad based engineering titles to highly specialized professional reference texts, and includes handbooks, titles on technique and practice, highly specialized professional information, situational reference, how-to guides, and scholarly monographs. As of December 2005, the collection numbers 353 titles.

Referex Collections:

Chemical, Petrochemical and Process

This collection comprises leading titles in energy, chemical engineering, chemical hazards, process engineering, oil and gas engineering, and environmental engineering.

Mechanical and Materials

This wide-ranging selection of titles draws on the publishing programs of Butterworth-Heinemann, Elsevier, and Academic Press to present a unique collection of handbooks and practical guides for professional engineers across the spectrum of mechanical and materials engineering - covering automotive, aeronautical, marine, metallurgy, tribology, maintenance, quality systems, health and safety.

Electronics and Electrical

The combined strength of the Newnes imprint and Academic Press offer a collection that comprises a comprehensive range of books for electrical power engineers, electronics engineers and circuit designers, embedded systems and computer engineers, and communications engineers - professionals and students alike.

Title lists are available in .xls and .pdf formats.

hash.title: Referex Engineering
hash.databasedescription:
Referex Engineering comprises three full-text collections in chemical, petrochemical and process engineering, mechanical and materials engineering, and electronic and electrical engineering.
Content ranges from broad based engineering titles to highly specialized professional reference texts, and includes handbooks, titles on technique and practice, highly specialized professional information, situational reference, how-to guides, and scholarly monographs. As of December 2005, the collection numbers 353 titles.

Referex Collections:

Chemical, Petrochemical and Process

This collection comprises leading titles in energy, chemical engineering, chemical hazards, process engineering, oil and gas engineering, and environmental engineering.

Mechanical and Materials

This wide-ranging selection of titles draws on the publishing programs of Butterworth-Heinemann, Elsevier, and Academic Press to present a unique collection of handbooks and practical guides for professional engineers across the spectrum of mechanical and materials engineering - covering automotive, aeronautical, marine, metallurgy, tribology, maintenance, quality systems, health and safety.

Electronics and Electrical

The combined strength of the Newnes imprint and Academic Press offer a collection that comprises a comprehensive range of books for electrical power engineers, electronics engineers and circuit designers, embedded systems and computer engineers, and communications engineers - professionals and students alike.

Title lists are available in .xls and .pdf formats.

hash.name: InCites
hash.title: InCites
hash.databasedescription: InCites is a citation-based evaluation tool for analyzing institutional research productivity and benchmarking output.

hash.name: INIS Database
hash.title: INIS Database
hash.databasedescription: The International Nuclear Information System (INIS) is the leading information source for scientific and technical literature published worldwide on the peaceful applications of nuclear science and technology. INIS maintains a bibliographic database, entitled INIS Database, which currently contains over 2.7 million references with English abstracts from 1970 to the present. The Database is updated weekly.

hash.name: Jet Propulsion Laboratory Technical Report Server
hash.title: Jet Propulsion Laboratory Technical Report Server
hash.databasedescription: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory Technical Report Server is a database of abstracts, citations and full text technical reports written by and for the scientific and technical community.

hash.name: Networked Digital Library of Theses and Dissertations
hash.title: Networked Digital Library of Theses and Dissertations
hash.databasedescription: The Networked Digital Library of Theses and Dissertations is an international organization dedicated to promoting the adoption, creation, use, dissemination and preservation of electronic analogues to the traditional paper-based theses and dissertations.

hash.name: NTRS: NASA Technical Reports Server

meta.more-info:
NTRS integrates three separate information collections and enables search and retrieval of information through a common interface:
  • NACA Collection: Citations and reports from the NACA Technical Report Server (TRS), http://naca.larc.nasa.gov, are now in NTRS. The NACA TRS site is retired and no longer in service following the consolidation of citations and reports into NTRS. The NACA collection is historical information from the NACA period lasting from 1915 to 1958.
  • NASA Collection: Citations and documents created or sponsored by NASA. The NASA collection time period starts in 1958 and continues to the present.
  • NIX Collection: Citations and images, photos, movies and videos downloaded from the NASA Image eXchange and served out through NTRS. NIX is a separate system and users can go directly to the NIX to search imagery as well as through NTRS.

hash.title: NTRS: NASA Technical Reports Server
hash.databasedescription:
The NTRS provides access to NASA's current and historical aerospace research and engineering results.
NTRS integrates three separate information collections and enables search and retrieval of information through a common interface:

  • NACA Collection: Citations and reports from the NACA Technical Report Server (TRS), http://naca.larc.nasa.gov, are now in NTRS. The NACA TRS site is retired and no longer in service following the consolidation of citations and reports into NTRS. The NACA collection is historical information from the NACA period lasting from 1915 to 1958.
  • NASA Collection: Citations and documents created or sponsored by NASA. The NASA collection time period starts in 1958 and continues to the present.
  • NIX Collection: Citations and images, photos, movies and videos downloaded from the NASA Image eXchange and served out through NTRS. NIX is a separate system and users can go directly to the NIX to search imagery as well as through NTRS.

hash.name: Science Accelerator

meta.more-info: They enable you to explore significant DOE discoveries, learn about DOE Nobel Prize Winners, access and search scientific e-prints, locate science conference papers and proceedings, and more.

hash.title: Science Accelerator
hash.databasedescription:
The Science Accelerator allows users to search, via a single query, important information resources of the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE's) scientific and technical information. The Science Accelerator information resources contain the results of DOE research and development (R&D) projects and programs, major R&D accomplishments, and recent research of interest to DOE.
They enable you to explore significant DOE discoveries, learn about DOE Nobel Prize Winners, access and search scientific e-prints, locate science conference papers and proceedings, and more.

hash.name: Scitation
hash.title: Scitation
hash.databasedescription: Provides links to over one million documents from scholarly journals, magazines, conference proceedings, and other special publications from prestigious scientific, engineering societies and technical publishers. Scitation includes links to many rich sources of information, including ISI's Web of Science, MEDLINE, Chemport/Chemical Abstracts Service, SPIN database, INSPEC, EDP Sciences, X-ArkiV, SLAC-SPIRES, and other Scitation journals.

hash.name: Emerald Fulltext
hash.title: Emerald Fulltext
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext collection of original documents and essays about the British Empire.

hash.name: Institute of Physics (IOP) Electronic Journals and e-Books
hash.title: Institute of Physics (IOP) Electronic Journals and e-Books
hash.databasedescription: Provides online access to journals and a collection of e-books from the Institute of Physics. More information about this service is available here.

hash.name: 20th Century African-American Poetry
hash.title: 20th Century African-American Poetry
hash.databasedescription:
A database of modern and contemporary African-American poetry from the early twentieth century to the present. Features 9,000 poems by 62 of the most important African-American poets of the last century. Includes overviews of the lives and works of featured authors.

Search by First Line/Title of poem using keywords or phrases.
Refine poet search by selecting year, gender, and/or literary movement.
For better search results, choose search terms from the �select from a list� option to the right of the search box.
For assistance in navigating and downloading documents, select Help from within the Full Text document.
View documents online or download the Text only version for printing or saving full text.
Obtain a direct web link to the document by clicking on Durable URL for this text.
To download specific sections of the document only, click on the Table of Contents link at the top of the Full Text page. The Table of Contents opens in a popup window. Click the expand icon next to a heading to view the headings below it.
Export bibliographic details for the current work in a variety of formats by clicking the Download citation link.
Select the Literature Collections link from the Twentieth-Century African-American Poetry home page to search other literary databases in the Chadwyck-Healey Literature Collections to which the library is subscribed.
Note: Some navigation icons are only appropriate to particular databases, therefore not all icons will be available in all of the databases in the Literature Collections.

hash.name: 20th Century American Poetry
hash.title: 20th Century American Poetry
hash.databasedescription:
Includes 52,000 poems drawn from 750 volumes by over 300 poets, including Adrienne Rich, Andrei Codrescu, Ezra Pound, William Carlos Williams, Denise Levertov, Wallace Stevens, Langston Hughes, Lucille Clifton, and Cathy Song. Includes overviews of the lives and works of featured authors.
Search by First Line/Title of poem using keywords or phrases.
Refine poet search by selecting year, gender, ethnicity, and/or literary movement.
For better search results, choose search terms from the �select from a list� option to the right of the search box.
For assistance in navigating and downloading documents, select Help from within the Full Text document.
View documents online or download the Text only version for printing or saving full text.
Obtain a direct web link to the document by clicking on Durable URL for this text.
To download specific sections of the document only, click on the Table of Contents link at the top of the Full Text page. The Table of Contents opens in a popup window. Click the expand icon next to a heading to view the headings below it.
Export bibliographic details for the current work in a variety of formats by clicking the Download citation link.
Select the Literature Collections link from the Twentieth-Century American Poetry home page to search other literary databases in the Chadwyck-Healey Literature Collections to which the library is subscribed.
Note: Some navigation icons are only appropriate to particular databases, therefore not all icons will be available in all of the databases in the Literature Collections.

For assistance please contact:

Humanities and Social Sciences Service Desk, Rutherford North
492-5791

hash.name: 20th Century English Poetry
hash.title: 20th Century English Poetry
hash.databasedescription: A collection of 598 volumes of poetry by 283 poets from 1900 to the present day, including W. B. Yeats, Rudyard Kipling, Robert Graves, A. E. Housman, John Betjeman, Fleur Adcock, Tony Harrison, Benjamin Zephaniah and Carol Ann Duffy, and incorporating the poets in The Faber Poetry Library. Includes overviews of the lives and works of featured authors.

hash.name: African-American Poetry (1750-1900)
hash.title: African-American Poetry (1750-1900)
hash.databasedescription: Includes nearly 3,000 poems written by African-American poets in the late eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. Features brief author biographies.

hash.name: Alberta Folklore and Local History Collection
hash.title: Alberta Folklore and Local History Collection
hash.databasedescription: The archival collection includes many aspects of the history, tall tales, humour and stories of Alberta. Manuscripts, reminiscences, stories, plays, poems, photographs and other materials are included. The collection, which contains approximately 1,000 accessioned items, is housed in the Bruce Peel Special Collections Library. The archive was collected by the University of Alberta between 1942 and 1946 under the directorship of Robert E. Gard.

hash.name: Alexander Street Literature
hash.title: Alexander Street Literature
hash.databasedescription: Alexander Street Literature is a cross-searchable collection of full-text databases covering literatures of place, race, and gender.

hash.name: American Periodicals Series
hash.title: American Periodicals Series
hash.databasedescription: The American Periodicals Series indexes over 7 million articles from over 1,100 American magazines, newspapers, and journals from 1791-1919.

hash.name: American Poetry (1600-1900)
hash.title: American Poetry (1600-1900)
hash.databasedescription: Includes over 40,000 poems by more than 200 American poets from the Colonial Period to the early twentieth century. Features brief author biographies.

hash.name: Archives Unbound
hash.title: Archives Unbound
hash.databasedescription: Consists of topically-focused digital collections of historical documents from the Middle Ages forward.

hash.name: Artemis Literary Sources
hash.title: Artemis Literary Sources
hash.databasedescription: Artemis Literary Sources is an integrated research platform that allows searching across Gale literary source collections.

hash.name: Artemis Primary Sources
hash.title: Artemis Primary Sources
hash.databasedescription: Artemis Primary Sources is an integrated research platform that allows searching across Gale primary source collections.

hash.name: Baldwin Library of Historical Children's Literature
hash.title: Baldwin Library of Historical Children's Literature
hash.databasedescription: Includes digitized material from The Baldwin Library of Historical Children?s Literature in the Department of Special Collections at the University of Florida's George A. Smathers Libraries.

hash.name: Bibliography of English Women Writers 1500-1640
hash.title: Bibliography of English Women Writers 1500-1640
hash.databasedescription: Cites works of known and unknown women writers including not only familiar figures, but also women refugees such as the recusants, women in the colonies, Marrano women (Anusot), women translators, and English women writers in French, Greek, Latin, Spanish, Irish Gaelic, Scottish Gaelic and Welsh.

hash.name: Black Short Fiction and Folklore from Africa and the African Diaspora
hash.title: Black Short Fiction and Folklore from Africa and the African Diaspora
hash.databasedescription: Contains stories and folktales by African, African American, and Caribbean authors. When complete this collection should have approximately 8000 works of short fiction.

hash.name: Black Thought and Culture
hash.title: Black Thought and Culture
hash.databasedescription: Contains monographs, essays, articles, speeches, and interviews written by leaders within the black community in the United States from the earliest times to the present.

hash.name: Black Women Writers
hash.title: Black Women Writers
hash.databasedescription: Contains fiction, nonfiction and poetry by women from North America, Africa and the Caribbean. When complete, will also present essays by scholars and feminists about the history of feminism and genre studies in these regions.

hash.name: Bloom's Literature
hash.title: Bloom's Literature
hash.databasedescription: Contains critical essays from literary journals and scholarly and critical books, including titles published by Bloom's Literary Criticism and Facts On File. Also includes biographies, character entries, synopses of literary works, images, and videos.

hash.name: British and Irish Women's Letters and Diaries
hash.title: British and Irish Women's Letters and Diaries
hash.databasedescription: Includes the personal writings of women from England, Scotland, Ireland, and Wales, spanning more than 400 years. Researchers can explore the thoughts, observations, and experiences of both famous and ordinary women on all subjects. The collection begins in 1500 and moves through to World War II, and includes never-before-published materials from the Imperial War Museum in England.

hash.name: British Literary Manuscripts Online: 1660-1900
hash.title: British Literary Manuscripts Online: 1660-1900
hash.databasedescription: Contains facsimile images of literary manuscripts, including letters, diaries, drafts of poems, plays, novels, and other literary works and related materials.

hash.name: Cambridge History of English and American Literature
hash.title: Cambridge History of English and American Literature
hash.databasedescription: Cambridge History of English and American Literature is the complete online version of the original 18 volume set published between 1907 and 1921. It contains over 303 topics with essays ranging from poetry, fiction, drama and essays to history, theology and political writing.

hash.name: Canadian Points of View Reference Centre
hash.title: Canadian Points of View Reference Centre
hash.databasedescription:
Note: some content currently unavailable.

Includes full-text resources presenting information on key topics of interest to Canadian researchers. Each topic includes an overview (objective background/description), point (argument), counterpoint (opposing argument) and Critical Thinking Guide.

hash.name: Caribbean Literature
hash.title: Caribbean Literature
hash.databasedescription: Caribbean Literature is a searchable collection of poetry and fiction produced in the region during the 19th and 20th centuries. Among the titles are numerous rare and hard-to-find works written in English, French, Spanish, Dutch, and various Creole languages.

hash.name: Contemporary Women's Issues
hash.title: Contemporary Women's Issues
hash.databasedescription: Covers a spectrum of women’s concerns ranging from domestic violence, employment and the workplace, and gender equity to family, reproductive health and human rights.

hash.name: Defining Gender, 1450-1910
hash.title: Defining Gender, 1450-1910
hash.databasedescription: When completed, will contain over 50,000 images of fulltext documents related to Gender Studies. These documents will come from a variety of sources world-wide, including a strong core of documents from Oxford's Bodleian Library.

hash.name: Dictionary of Literary Biography Complete Online
hash.title: Dictionary of Literary Biography Complete Online
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to all volumes of Gale's reference set, Dictionary of Literary Biography as well as Dictionary of Literary Biography Documentary Series and Dictionary of Literary Biography Yearbook Series. Featuring comprehensive literary biographies written by recognized literary scholars and critics, you'll find profiles of past and present authors, historians, journalists, screenwriters, publishers, and playwrights.

hash.name: Dictionary of Old English Corpus
hash.title: Dictionary of Old English Corpus
hash.databasedescription: The Dictionary of Old English electronic corpus is a complete record of surviving Old English except for some variant manuscripts of individual texts. A catalogue of the texts included in our corpus is available in Angus Cameron's "A List of Old English Texts" in A Plan for the Dictionary of Old English, ed. R. Frank and A. Cameron (Toronto: University of Toronto Press, 1973), pp. 25-306, with additions. The full bibliographic information of each text is included with the text.

hash.name: Early American Fiction 1789-1850
hash.title: Early American Fiction 1789-1850
hash.databasedescription: Provides both images and text. Presently includes 440 titles by 80 authors, including first printings of works by James Fenimore Cooper, Edgar Allan Poe, Robert Montgomery Bird, Washington Irving, Catharine Sedgwick, and Nathaniel Hawthorne. Published jointly with the University of Virginia Library. Includes overviews of the lives and works of featured authors.

hash.name: Early American Fiction 1789-1875
hash.title: Early American Fiction 1789-1875
hash.databasedescription: When complete, Early American Fiction 1789-1875 will extend the coverage of the first Early American Fiction collection by twenty-five years (1851-1875) and will incorporate the full text of more than 250 additional titles and over 60 new authors, including Louisa May Alcott, Mark Twain, Herman Melville and Thomas Bailey Aldrich, as well as a host of minor writers of the period. Early American Fiction 1789-1875 will include more than 750 works of fiction by more than 130 authors.

hash.name: Early English Prose Fiction (1500-1700)
hash.title: Early English Prose Fiction (1500-1700)
hash.databasedescription: Early English prose fiction contains the full text of over 200 works of fictional prose from the period 1500-1700. It includes Elizabethan fiction, Jest Books, collections of short pieces and novellas, Restoration fiction and works of popular fiction. Features brief author biographies.

hash.name: Eighteenth-Century Fiction (1700-1780)
hash.title: Eighteenth-Century Fiction (1700-1780)
hash.databasedescription:
Eighteenth century fiction contains the full text of 77 works of
English prose by writers from the British Isles published between 1700 and 1780. Features brief author biographies.

hash.name: Empire Online
hash.title: Empire Online
hash.databasedescription:
Emerald Fulltext includes the fulltext of all journals published by Emerald Press with the exception of:


  • Current Awareness Abstracts of Library and Information Management Literature
  • Forthcoming International Scientific and Technical Conferences
  • International Journal of Library and Information Services

hash.name: English Poetry (600-1900)
hash.title: English Poetry (600-1900)
hash.databasedescription:
English poetry contains the full text of 165,000 poems from the
period 600 to 1900.

hash.name: English Poetry, Second Edition
hash.title: English Poetry, Second Edition
hash.databasedescription:
Adds more than 20,000 poems from several new categories to the first edition, and contains more than 183,000 poems by over 2,700 poets. Covers English verse from the 8th century to the early 20th, and offers representation both of the literary heritages of Commonwealth and ex-colonial countries and of the poetic legacies of English writers who have only been brought back to scholarly attention during the last thirty years.
Features brief author biographies.

hash.name: English Short Title Catalogue
hash.title: English Short Title Catalogue
hash.databasedescription: Describes English or English-language letterpress materials published before 1801. ESTC contains records for items of all types published in Great Britain or its colonies or in English from 1473 to 1800.

hash.name: FictionConnection
hash.title: FictionConnection
hash.databasedescription: FictionConnect can be used to find book suggestions based on books you have already read, authors you like, or topics of interest. Includes fiction and biography titles.

hash.name: Film & Television Literature Index with Full Text
hash.title: Film & Television Literature Index with Full Text
hash.databasedescription: Film & Television Literature Index is a comprehensive bibliographic database covering television and film writing. Subject coverage includes film & television theory, preservation & restoration, writing, production, cinematography, technical aspects, and reviews. Also includes full text from a number of publications.

hash.name: International Corpus of English
hash.title: International Corpus of English
hash.databasedescription: The International Corpus of English (ICE) began in 1990 with the primary aim of collecting material for comparative studies of English worldwide. Fifteen research teams around the world are preparing electronic corpora of their own national or regional variety of English. Each ICE corpus consists of one million words of spoken and written English produced after 1989. For most participating countries, the ICE project is stimulating the first systematic investigation of the national variety.

hash.name: Irish Women Poets of the Romantic Period
hash.title: Irish Women Poets of the Romantic Period
hash.databasedescription: Irish Women Poets of the Romantic Period includes more than 80 volumes of poetry by approximately 50 Irish women writing between 1768 and 1842. Compiled and edited by Stephen Behrendt of the University of Nebraska, the database also offers numerous biographical and critical essays prepared by leading scholars specifically for the project. New content is added to the collection on a regular basis. It currently contains over 10,000 pages of poetry.

hash.name: John Milton Bibliography

meta.more-info: The bibliography tries to bring together all manuscripts and editions of Milton's works and all studies and critical statements concerning Milton's life and works, all allusions and quotations, and all significant imitations during the years 1624-1799. Users can browse by century or year, or perform Boolean, keyword or phrase searches. Cross references within the bibliography are hypertext links, allowing for ease of navigation.

hash.title: John Milton Bibliography
hash.databasedescription:
This bibliography is an extensive revision and continuation of Milton: A Bibliography for the Years 1624-1700, published by Medieval & Renaissance Texts & Studies (MRTS), Binghamton, New York, in 1984, and it is the only Milton bibliography that covers the eighteenth century.
The bibliography tries to bring together all manuscripts and editions of Milton's works and all studies and critical statements concerning Milton's life and works, all allusions and quotations, and all significant imitations during the years 1624-1799. Users can browse by century or year, or perform Boolean, keyword or phrase searches. Cross references within the bibliography are hypertext links, allowing for ease of navigation.

hash.name: Latin American Women Writers
hash.title: Latin American Women Writers
hash.databasedescription: When complete, will contain approximately 100,000 pages of prose, poetry and drama by women writers from Mexico, Central, and South America. As of July, 2005, prototype version contained about 4200 pages of prose and poetry.

hash.name: LGBT Life wIth Fulltext
hash.title: LGBT Life wIth Fulltext
hash.databasedescription: Indexes worldwide literature on Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual and Transgender issues, and contains fulltext for about one quarter of the indexed titles.

hash.name: Literary Manuscripts, from the Brotherton Library, University of Leeds
hash.title: Literary Manuscripts, from the Brotherton Library, University of Leeds
hash.databasedescription: Complete facsimile images of 190 manuscripts of 17th and 18th century verse held in the celebrated Brotherton Collection at the University of Leeds.

hash.name: Literary Manuscripts: Victorian Manuscripts from the Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection

meta.more-info:
Authors represented in this collection include:
  • Matthew Arnold
  • The Brontës
  • Elizabeth Barrett Browning
  • Robert Browning
  • Wilkie Collins
  • Joseph Conrad
  • Charles Dickens
  • George Eliot
  • George Gissing
  • Thomas Hardy
  • Henry James
  • Dante Gabriel Rossetti
  • John Ruskin
  • Alfred Tennyson
  • William Makepeace Thackeray

hash.title: Literary Manuscripts: Victorian Manuscripts from the Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection
hash.databasedescription:
A broad range of authors from across the nineteenth century make this an essential research tool for all scholars and students researching Victorian literature. Most of these unique manuscripts are unavailable in any medium elsewhere. They are supplemented by some rare printed materials, including early editions annotated by the authors. Each author collection is included in its entirety, allowing users to browse and search the manuscripts as they would in the Berg Reading Room.
Authors represented in this collection include:
  • Matthew Arnold
  • The Brontës
  • Elizabeth Barrett Browning
  • Robert Browning
  • Wilkie Collins
  • Joseph Conrad
  • Charles Dickens
  • George Eliot
  • George Gissing
  • Thomas Hardy
  • Henry James
  • Dante Gabriel Rossetti
  • John Ruskin
  • Alfred Tennyson
  • William Makepeace Thackeray

hash.name: Literature, Arts, & Medicine Database
hash.title: Literature, Arts, & Medicine Database
hash.databasedescription: The Literature, Arts, & Medicine Database is an annotated bibliography of prose, poetry, film, video and art which was developed to be a dynamic, accessible, comprehensive resource in medical humanities. Revised quarterly.

hash.name: London Low Life
hash.title: London Low Life
hash.databasedescription: LLMC (Law Library Microform Consortium) Digital is a collection of digital materials that will grow over a planned ten year period beginning in 2003. The collection is of interest to researchers in law and history, comprising legal literature and government documents. The collection as of early 2005 consisted of colonial and some post-confederation Canadian (federal and provincial) statutes and cases, U.S. federal (executive, legislative and judicial) material, and U.S. military law material. Much of the Canadian material is not available elsewhere in digital format. Detailed contents descriptions are available in the database and are updated as material is added to the collection.

hash.name: Manuscriptorium
hash.title: Manuscriptorium
hash.databasedescription: The goal of the Manuscriptorium project is to create virtual research access to all digital documents related to historical book resources up to the year 1800. Content includes: manuscripts, incunabula, early print books, maps, deeds, charters and more.

hash.name: Medieval Family Life
hash.title: Medieval Family Life
hash.databasedescription: Full colour images of original medieval manuscripts from several collections of family letters along with, when available, full text searchable transcripts from the printed editions.

hash.name: Medieval Travel Writing
hash.title: Medieval Travel Writing
hash.databasedescription: European travel writing from the later medieval period.

hash.name: New Yorker
hash.title: New Yorker
hash.databasedescription: Current and archive issues of the New Yorker.

hash.name: North American Indian Thought and Culture
hash.title: North American Indian Thought and Culture
hash.databasedescription: Contains biographical information on indigenous peoples from all areas of North America. Includes biographies, autobiographies, oral histories, reference works, manuscripts, and photographs.

hash.name: North American Women's Letters and Diaries
hash.title: North American Women's Letters and Diaries
hash.databasedescription: Consists of dairies and letters written by over 1,000 North American women in the 300 year period up to 1950.

hash.name: Orlando: Women's Writing in the British Isles from the Beginnings to the Present
hash.title: Orlando: Women's Writing in the British Isles from the Beginnings to the Present
hash.databasedescription: Orlando: Women's Writing in the British Isles from the Beginnings to the Present includes biographical and writing career entries on British women writers, selected non-British or international women writers, and selected British and international men. Also includes dated items representing events and processes (in the accounts of these writers, but also in the areas of history, science, medicine, economics, the law, and other contexts).

hash.name: Oxford Dictionary of National Biography
hash.title: Oxford Dictionary of National Biography
hash.databasedescription: Provides 50,000 biographies of the men and women who shaped all aspects of the British past, from the earliest times to the end of the year 2000.

hash.name: Perdita Manuscripts: Women Writers, 1500-1700
hash.title: Perdita Manuscripts: Women Writers, 1500-1700
hash.databasedescription:
This resource is produced in association with the Perdita Project based at the University of Warwick and Nottingham Trent University.
The manuscripts in this site were written or compiled by women in the British Isles during the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries and they have been sourced from archives and libraries across the United Kingdom and the USA. One of the key attractions of Perdita Manuscripts is that it brings together little known material from widely scattered locations.

hash.name: Romanticism, Life Literature and Landscape
hash.title: Romanticism, Life Literature and Landscape
hash.databasedescription: The manuscript collections of the Wordsworth Trust includes working notebooks, verse manuscripts and correspondence of William Wordsworth and his fellow writers, including Dorothy Wordsworth, Samuel Taylor Coleridge, Thomas De Quincey and Robert Southey.

hash.name: Scottish Women Poets of the Romantic Period
hash.title: Scottish Women Poets of the Romantic Period
hash.databasedescription: Contains 60 volumes of Romantic Poetry, extensive contemporary critical reviews, as well as material specially written for this database by leading scholars.

hash.name: Short Story Index
hash.title: Short Story Index
hash.databasedescription: Indexes short stories from periodicals indexed in Readers' Guide to Periodical Literature and Humanities Index, with full text of selected stories.

hash.name: Something About The Author
hash.title: Something About The Author
hash.databasedescription: Provides online access to all volumes of Gale's reference set, Something About the Author, the main series, and Something About the Author: Autobiography Series. Includes illustrated biographical profiles of children's authors and illustrators.

hash.name: South and Southeast Asian Literature

meta.more-info: New content is uploaded on a biweekly basis, giving users immediate access to a steadily growing treasury of classic, rare, and contemporary literature. The database currently has over 45,000 pages.

hash.title: South and Southeast Asian Literature
hash.databasedescription:
South and Southeast Asian Literature is a searchable collection of fiction and poetry written in English by authors from South and Southeast Asia and their Diasporas. Focusing on works composed during the late-colonial and postcolonial eras, the collection will also feature author interviews and manuscript materials that will shed additional light on the rich literary heritage and emerging traditions of this region.
New content is uploaded on a biweekly basis, giving users immediate access to a steadily growing treasury of classic, rare, and contemporary literature. The database currently has over 45,000 pages.

hash.name: The Cambridge Edition of the Works of Ben Jonson Online
hash.title: The Cambridge Edition of the Works of Ben Jonson Online
hash.databasedescription: Collected works of Ben Jonson.

hash.name: The Faber Poetry Library
hash.title: The Faber Poetry Library
hash.databasedescription:
A collection of some of the most influential poetry of the twentieth century. The Faber list spans the seventy-year history of this major publishing house, and includes the poetry of James Joyce, Siegfried Sassoon, T.S. Eliot, Ted Hughes, Sylvia Plath and Seamus Heaney. In total, the Faber Poetry Library contains 140 volumes by 50 poets.
Features brief author biographies.

hash.name: The Literary Encyclopedia
hash.title: The Literary Encyclopedia
hash.databasedescription: Covers world literature. Includes biographies of major and minor writers, scholarly descriptions of texts written by these authors, and a variety of descriptive and critical essays on literary, cultural and historical matters to provide an understanding of the social contexts in which this writing was produced.

hash.name: The Middle English Compendium
hash.title: The Middle English Compendium
hash.databasedescription: The Middle English Compendium consists of three major Middle English electronic resources: an electronic version of the Middle English Dictionary, a HyperBibliography of Middle English prose and verse, based on the MED bibliographies, and a Corpus of Middle English Prose and Verse, as well as links to an associated network of electronic resources.

hash.name: The Sickly Taper
hash.title: The Sickly Taper
hash.databasedescription: An online bibliography of scholarship in the field of Gothic literature.

hash.name: Times Literary Supplement Historical Archive
hash.title: Times Literary Supplement Historical Archive
hash.databasedescription: Contains the fulltext archive of the Times Literary Supplement from 1902-2010.

hash.name: Travel Writing, Spectacle and World History
hash.title: Travel Writing, Spectacle and World History
hash.databasedescription: Women's Travel Diaries and Correspondence from The Schlesinger Library at the Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study, Harvard University

hash.name: Twentieth Century Advice Literature: North American Guides on Race, Sex, Gender, and the Family
hash.title: Twentieth Century Advice Literature: North American Guides on Race, Sex, Gender, and the Family
hash.databasedescription: Includes instructional, prescriptive, behavioral, and etiquette literature that defined standards of personal conduct for millions of Americans and reflected the prevailing social mores across the twentieth century. Contains handbooks, manuals, textbooks, etiquette guides, self-help books, instructional pamphlets, and how-to books.

hash.name: W.B. Yeats Collection
hash.title: W.B. Yeats Collection
hash.databasedescription: Includes W.B. Yeats's complete works in electronic form.

hash.name: Women and Social Movements in the United States 1600-2000
hash.title: Women and Social Movements in the United States 1600-2000
hash.databasedescription: This database is organized around the history of women in social movements in the U.S. between 1700 and 2000. It includes full-text documents as well as book, film and website reviews and teaching tools. It also includes content from some earlier Alexander Street Press products, including Publications on the Status of Women.

hash.name: America Latina en la Prensa Española : 1993-2002

meta.more-info: The following newspapers are indexed from 1993 to 1997: El País, El Mundo, ABC, Diario 16, La Vanguardia, El Periódico, and La Gaceta de los Negocios. From 1997 to 1998, only El Pais and El Mundo are indexed, and from 1999 onwards El País, El Mundo, ABC, and La Gaceta de los Negocios are recorded. This database is a product of the Centro de Información y Documentación Científica (CINDOC).

hash.title: America Latina en la Prensa Española : 1993-2002
hash.databasedescription:
This database indexes articles, editorials, book reviews, etc. published in Spain on topics pertaining to Latin America.
The following newspapers are indexed from 1993 to 1997: El País, El Mundo, ABC, Diario 16, La Vanguardia, El Periódico, and La Gaceta de los Negocios. From 1997 to 1998, only El Pais and El Mundo are indexed, and from 1999 onwards El País, El Mundo, ABC, and La Gaceta de los Negocios are recorded. This database is a product of the Centro de Información y Documentación Científica (CINDOC).

hash.name: Americanismo.es
hash.title: Americanismo.es
hash.databasedescription: This portal originated from the collaboration between REDIAL-España and CEEIB, two Spanish networks that are involved in scientific and academic cooperation between Spain and Latin America in terms of information, research, and teaching. The Americanismo database provides a mechanism to search for journal articles listed in LatIndex (http://www.latindex.unam.mx/) and RedAlyc (http://redalyc.uaemex.mx/), e-books, proceedings, Spanish NGOs, and virtual exhibits.

hash.name: Bases de datos Bibliográficas del CSIC
hash.title: Bases de datos Bibliográficas del CSIC
hash.databasedescription: This database contains the bibliographic references of all the books published in Spain since 1972. It contains in-print and out-of-print titles published in Spanish, Catalan, Gallego and Euskera. One can search by ISBN, author, title, subject, publisher, year, series, and place of publication.

hash.name: Corpus del Español
hash.title: Corpus del Español
hash.databasedescription: The corpus contains 100 million words of text: 20 million from the years 1200s-1400s 40 million from the years 1500s-1700s 40 million from the years 1800s-1900s. The 20,000,000 words from the 1900s are divided equally among literature, oral texts, and newspapers/encyclopedias.

hash.name: Latin America Data Base
hash.title: Latin America Data Base
hash.databasedescription: The Latin America Data Base (LADB) is source of current information on Latin America. LADB produces three weekly electronic publications (Sourcemex, NotiCen and NotiSur) and maintains an on-line searchable data base of over 24,000 articles (from back issues of LADB publications) as well as Latin American journals.

hash.name: Palabra virtual: antología de poesía hispanoamericana
hash.title: Palabra virtual: antología de poesía hispanoamericana
hash.databasedescription: Digital anthology of hispanoamerican poems. Searchable by keyword or by numerous indexes that organize the poems by poets' names (first and last), first lines of poems, title, country, century, and gender. Some of the poems are accompanied by sound.

hash.name: PEDro: The Physiotherapy Evidence Database
hash.title: PEDro: The Physiotherapy Evidence Database
hash.databasedescription: From the Centre for Evidence-Based Physiotherapy, PEDro provides access to bibliographic details and abstracts of randomised controlled trials and systematic reviews in physiotherapy. Most trials on the database have been rated for quality to help discriminate between trials that are likely to be valid and interpretable and those that are not.

hash.name: Canadian Agency for Drugs and Technologies in Health (CADTH) Database

meta.more-info: One-time registration required to view full-text documents but registration is free.

hash.title: Canadian Agency for Drugs and Technologies in Health (CADTH) Database
hash.databasedescription:
CADTH is a national body that provides Canada’s federal, provincial and territorial health care decision makers with credible, impartial advice and evidence-based information about the effectiveness and efficiency of drugs and other health technologies. CADTH provides information through three programs: Health Technology Assessment (HTA), the Common Drug Review (CDR), and the Canadian Optimal Medication Prescribing and Utilization Service (COMPUS).
One-time registration required to view full-text documents but registration is free.

hash.name: BestBETS: Best Evidence Topics
hash.title: BestBETS: Best Evidence Topics
hash.databasedescription: BETs were developed in the Emergency Department of Manchester Royal Infirmary, UK, to provide rapid evidence-based answers to real-life clinical questions, using a systematic approach to reviewing the literature.

hash.name: DUETs : Database of Uncertainties about the Effects of Treatments
hash.title: DUETs : Database of Uncertainties about the Effects of Treatments
hash.databasedescription: A resource to help prioritise new research in health care and to identify uncertainties relevant to patients and clinicians. The database can be browsed by health condition or searched with keywords. The results indicate which treatments lack strong evidence of effectiveness.

hash.name: Evidence updates from the BMJ Evidence Centre
hash.title: Evidence updates from the BMJ Evidence Centre
hash.databasedescription: Searchable database of best evidence from the medical literature, extracted from the cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews and more than 130 core medical journals, dating from 2002. Articles are rated for clinical relevance and newsworthiness.

hash.name: Health Systems Evidence

meta.more-info: Includes policy briefs, overviews of systematic reviews, systematic reviews of effects, Cochrane systematic reviews of effects, protocols for Cochrane systematic reviews, and systematic reviews addressing another type of question.

hash.title: Health Systems Evidence
hash.databasedescription:
Systematic reviews relevant to management and policy in health economics and policy analysis, covering governance, financial and delivery arrangements, selected by the Program in Policy Decision Making affiliated with McMaster University's Centre for Health Economics and Policy Analysis, and the Canadian Cochrane Network and Centre.
Includes policy briefs, overviews of systematic reviews, systematic reviews of effects, Cochrane systematic reviews of effects, protocols for Cochrane systematic reviews, and systematic reviews addressing another type of question.

hash.name: OTseeker
hash.title: OTseeker
hash.databasedescription: Contains abstracts of systematic reviews and randomised controlled trials relevant to occupational therapy. Trials have been critically appraised and rated.

hash.name: TOP: Toward Optimized Practice
hash.title: TOP: Toward Optimized Practice
hash.databasedescription: Collection of clinical practice guidelines intended to 'foster a culture of continuous quality improvement among Alberta physicians and their teams'.

hash.name: Abstracts in Social Gerontology
hash.title: Abstracts in Social Gerontology
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to social gerontology, including the psychology of aging, elder abuse, society and the elderly, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: Social Services Abstracts
hash.title: Social Services Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Provides bibliographic coverage of current research focused on social work, human services, and related areas, including social welfare, social policy, and community development. The database abstracts and indexes over 1,500 serials publications and includes abstracts of journal articles and dissertations, and citations to book reviews.

hash.name: PILOTS (Published International Literature on Traumatic Stress)
hash.title: PILOTS (Published International Literature on Traumatic Stress)
hash.databasedescription: The PILOTS bibliographic database, covering the Published International Literature On Traumatic Stress, is sponsored by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs. Its goal is to include citations to all literature on post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and other mental-health sequelae of traumatic events, without disciplinary, linguistic, or geographical limitations, and to offer both current and retrospective coverage.

hash.name: StrokEngine
hash.title: StrokEngine
hash.databasedescription: This site focuses on stroke rehabilitation and interventions. Information is derived from quality articles, websites and systematic reviews. All have been reviewed using a systematic process. The goal of the site is to bridge the gap in knowledge translation between research findings and current clinical practice. It supplies the most current information about the value of the various interventions used in stroke rehabilitation.

hash.name: BFI Film & TV Database

meta.more-info: Search over 810,000 feature films, short films, TV programmes, documentaries, newsreels and educational and training films for synopses, crew, cast, music, release and transmission information, and related events. Search the filmographies of 1.2m people and 210,000 organisations as well as biographical information and related events such as awards received. Search listings of 23,000 festivals, award ceremonies, markets, exhibitions and conferences for information about screenings and prize-winners.

hash.title: BFI Film & TV Database
hash.databasedescription:
The BFI Film & TV Database covers British and international film and television titles as well as people, music groups, organisations and events dating back to the beginning of film production.
Search over 810,000 feature films, short films, TV programmes, documentaries, newsreels and educational and training films for synopses, crew, cast, music, release and transmission information, and related events. Search the filmographies of 1.2m people and 210,000 organisations as well as biographical information and related events such as awards received. Search listings of 23,000 festivals, award ceremonies, markets, exhibitions and conferences for information about screenings and prize-winners.

hash.name: BIR Entertainment
hash.title: BIR Entertainment
hash.databasedescription: BIR Entertainment provides information on about 450,000 music titles and 200,000 DVD/video titles, with more being added regularly. Provides searching by artist, performer, or specific genre.
