hash.databasedescription: Women, War and Society 1914-18 from the Imperial War Museum, London is a fully text-searchable mixed media archive - press-cuttings, minutes, reports, correspondence and photographs - accompanied by newly commissioned themed essays for researchers and students new to digital primary source historical documents. Use this archival collection to research every aspect of British women's war effort.

hash.name: World History in Video
hash.title: World History in Video
hash.databasedescription: Collection of critically acclaimed documentaries covering human history from the earliest civilizations to the late twentieth century.

hash.name: British History Online
hash.title: British History Online
hash.databasedescription: Contains some of the core printed primary and secondary sources for the medieval and modern history of the British Isles. Created by the Institute of Historical Research and the History of Parliament Trust.

hash.name: House of Commons Parliamentary Papers - Great Britain

meta.more-info:
They fall into the following three categories:
  • Bills - drafts of legislation, to be reviewed through various parliamentary stages. If the Bill passes through these stages, it will become an Act of Parliament.
  • House Papers - documents resulting from the work of the House and its Committees.
  • Command Papers - Government papers (from Ministers) conveying information or decisions the Government wishes to draw to the attention of the House, presented �by Command of Her Majesty�.
  • Hansard - Official Report of debates in Parliament, from both the House of Commons and House of Lords, from 1803 to 2005.

HCPP does not include the House of Commons Journal, or daily business papers, such as Order papers and Votes and Proceedings. For the location of British Hansards, Journals, House of Lords documents, etc., please see the U of A Libraries Guide to British Government Publications.

hash.title: House of Commons Parliamentary Papers - Great Britain
hash.databasedescription:
Sessional papers, sometimes called �blue books�, were required for the work of the House of Commons, providing information on matters of policy and administration, and �ordered by the House to be printed�. House of Commons Parliamentary Papers (HCPP) includes digital versions of these sessional papers for the 18th century forward.
They fall into the following three categories:

  • Bills - drafts of legislation, to be reviewed through various parliamentary stages. If the Bill passes through these stages, it will become an Act of Parliament.
  • House Papers - documents resulting from the work of the House and its Committees.
  • Command Papers - Government papers (from Ministers) conveying information or decisions the Government wishes to draw to the attention of the House, presented �by Command of Her Majesty�.
  • Hansard - Official Report of debates in Parliament, from both the House of Commons and House of Lords, from 1803 to 2005.

HCPP does not include the House of Commons Journal, or daily business papers, such as Order papers and Votes and Proceedings. For the location of British Hansards, Journals, House of Lords documents, etc., please see the U of A Libraries Guide to British Government Publications.

hash.name: Royal Historical Society Bibliography
hash.title: Royal Historical Society Bibliography
hash.databasedescription: The Royal Historical Society bibliography is an authoritative guide to what has been written about British and Irish history from the Roman period to the present day. The Bibliography is hosted by the Institute of Historical Research, which is part of the University of London.

hash.name: The Times Digital Archive
hash.title: The Times Digital Archive
hash.databasedescription: The complete digital edition of The Times (London) from 1785-2009. The entire newspaper is captured, with all articles, advertisements and illustrations/photos divided into categories to facilitate searching.

hash.name: U.S. History in Context
hash.title: U.S. History in Context
hash.databasedescription: Includes primary documents, secondary reference sources, and journal articles covering all areas of U.S. history from pre-colonial times to the present day. Also includes a dozen reference sources such as Scribner's Dictionary of American History and Dictionary of American Biography.

hash.name: 19th Century British Pamphlets

meta.more-info:
This collection can be searched in two ways:
Search individual subcollections: From the "Web Access" link above, click on the title of particular subcollection.
Search across entire collection: From JSTOR's advanced search page check off the "Pamphlet" box in the "Limit To" section.

hash.title: 19th Century British Pamphlets
hash.databasedescription:
Full-texts of British pamphlets from the 19th century held in UK research libraries
This collection can be searched in two ways:
Search individual subcollections: From the "Web Access" link above, click on the title of particular subcollection.
Search across entire collection: From JSTOR's advanced search page check off the "Pamphlet" box in the "Limit To" section.

hash.name: American Antiquarian Society (AAS) Historical Periodicals Collection
hash.title: American Antiquarian Society (AAS) Historical Periodicals Collection
hash.databasedescription: The American Antiquarian Society (AAS) Historical Periodicals Collection includes the full-text of ejournals from the holdings of the American Antiquarian Society. The Library currently subscribes to Series 1 (1691-1820), Series 2 (1821-1937), Series 3 (1838-1852), Series 4 (1853-1865) and Series 5 (1866-1877).

hash.name: ATLA Historical Monographs Collection
hash.title: ATLA Historical Monographs Collection
hash.databasedescription: The American Theological Library Association (ATLA) Historical Monographs Collection (Series I & II) includes more than 29,000 titles focused on religion and theology published from the 13 century through 1923.

hash.name: Bibliography of British and Irish History Online
hash.title: Bibliography of British and Irish History Online
hash.databasedescription: Provides bibliographic data on historical writing dealing with the British Isles,the British Empire and Commonwealth, during all periods for which written documentation is available - from 55BC to the present.

hash.name: BOPCRIS: the British Official Publications Collaborative Reader Information Service
hash.title: BOPCRIS: the British Official Publications Collaborative Reader Information Service
hash.databasedescription: British Official Publications Index (selected publications 1688-1995)

hash.name: British and Irish Legal Information Institute
hash.title: British and Irish Legal Information Institute
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to freely available British and Irish Public Legal information, including British and Irish case law and legislation, European Union case law, Law Commission reports and other law-related British and Irish material.

hash.name: British Library Archival Sound Recordings
hash.title: British Library Archival Sound Recordings
hash.databasedescription: This resource provides access to selections from the extensive collections of the British Library Sound Archives. Recordings come from all over the world and include music, drama, literature, oral history, wildlife and environmental sounds.

hash.name: British Online Archives
hash.title: British Online Archives
hash.databasedescription: Archival material in the humanities and social sciences from Great Britian.

hash.name: British Periodicals
hash.title: British Periodicals
hash.databasedescription: British periodicals from the late seventeenth to the early twentieth century. Includes the journals from the UMI microform collections English Literary Periodicals and British Periodicals in the Creative Arts together with additional titles.

hash.name: Caribbean Abstracts

meta.more-info: Titles may be downloaded to your e-mail address using the option "Download".

hash.title: Caribbean Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
This catalogue contains abstracts in English of selected books and articles in the humanities and social sciences published since 1989. The publications are selected for their importance or the topicality of the subject.
Publications on Caribbean migrant communities outside the region are not included. The Caribbean includes all the islands of the Caribbean archipelago, as well as the mainland territories of Belize and the Guianas.



Titles may be downloaded to your e-mail address using the option "Download".

hash.name: Churchill Archive: A Window on History
hash.title: Churchill Archive: A Window on History
hash.databasedescription: Contains nearly 800,000 private letters, speeches, telegrams, manuscripts, government transcripts and other key historical documents from the Churchill Archives Centre in Cambridge.

hash.name: Dictionary of Irish Biography Online
hash.title: Dictionary of Irish Biography Online
hash.databasedescription: The Dictionary of Irish Biography is a collaborative project between Cambridge University Press and the Royal Irish Academy. It contains signed biographical articles which describe and assess the careers of subjects in all fields of endeavour, including politics, law, religion, literature, journalism, architecture, painting, music, the stage, science, medicine, engineering, entertainment and sport.

hash.name: Financial Times Historical Archive, 1888-2010
hash.title: Financial Times Historical Archive, 1888-2010
hash.databasedescription: Searchable full-text archive of the Financial Times.

hash.name: Foreign Office Files for China - 1919-1980
hash.title: Foreign Office Files for China - 1919-1980
hash.databasedescription: British Foreign Office Files dealing with China, Hong Kong and Taiwan.

hash.name: Global Commodities: Trade, Exploration and Cultural Exchange
hash.title: Global Commodities: Trade, Exploration and Cultural Exchange
hash.databasedescription: This resource brings together manuscript, printed and visual primary source materials for the study of global commodities in world history. The commodities featured in this resource have been transported, exchanged and consumed around the world for hundreds of years. They helped transform societies, global trading operations, habits of consumption and social practices.

hash.name: HeinOnLine

meta.more-info: HeinOnLine includes modules for legal journals, government documents, foreign and international law materials, legal classics, world trials and other legal research collections.

hash.title: HeinOnLine
hash.databasedescription:
HeinOnLine includes modules for legal journals, government documents, foreign and international law materials, legal classics, world trials and other legal research collections.
HeinOnLine includes modules for legal journals, government documents, foreign and international law materials, legal classics, world trials and other legal research collections.

hash.name: Index to the Colonial Secretary's Papers, 1788-1825
hash.title: Index to the Colonial Secretary's Papers, 1788-1825
hash.databasedescription:
This database indexes the Australia: Colonial Life and Settlement: The Colonial Secretary's Papers collection from the State Records Authority of New South Wales. The following parts of of this collection are available on microfilm in Rutherford Library North on the second floor at:
DU 177 A97 2002.



  • I. Letters Sent 1808-1825
  • II. Special bundles (topic collections), proclamations, orders and related records, 1789-1825
  • III. Letters received 1788-1825

hash.name: MacMillan Cabinet Papers, 1957-1963

meta.more-info:
Cabinet Memoranda consist of all papers circulated to members of the Cabinet and to other Ministers for information or as a basis for discussion. These classes provide a distillation of the work of all the other departments of government, ranging in subject matter from agricultural policy and trade, to nuclear policy and issues of international diplomacy. Also includes 165 files (over 16,000 pages) from the Prime Minister's Private Office (PREM 11). These provide an important supplement to Cabinet Records and cover all aspects of policy making.


Use of this product is restricted to members of the University of Alberta community and to users of the Library's physical facilities. It is the responsibility of each user to ensure that he or she uses this product for individual, non-commercial educational or research purposes only, and does not systematically download or retain substantial portions of information.

hash.title: MacMillan Cabinet Papers, 1957-1963
hash.databasedescription:
Complete coverage (nearly 12,000 pages) of the Cabinet Conclusions (Minutes) (CAB 128) and Memoranda (CAB 129), including recently released material. The Cabinet Conclusions are taken by the Secretary of the Cabinet or one of his assistants and comprise summaries of all discussions in Cabinet together with a note of decisions reached.
Cabinet Memoranda consist of all papers circulated to members of the Cabinet and to other Ministers for information or as a basis for discussion. These classes provide a distillation of the work of all the other departments of government, ranging in subject matter from agricultural policy and trade, to nuclear policy and issues of international diplomacy. Also includes 165 files (over 16,000 pages) from the Prime Minister's Private Office (PREM 11). These provide an important supplement to Cabinet Records and cover all aspects of policy making.


Use of this product is restricted to members of the University of Alberta community and to users of the Library's physical facilities. It is the responsibility of each user to ensure that he or she uses this product for individual, non-commercial educational or research purposes only, and does not systematically download or retain substantial portions of information.

hash.name: Mass Observation Online
hash.title: Mass Observation Online
hash.databasedescription: Mass Observation was a pioneering social research organisation whose papers provide insights into the cultural and social history of Britain from 1937 to 1972. Mass Observation Online contains the Archive of Mass-Observation. This digital project offers integrated access to the new online material, existing microfilm series, and the Mass-Observation Archive itself.

hash.name: Nineteenth Century Short Title Catalogue

meta.more-info: The project aims to index all printed works published in Britain, its colonies and the United States of America, all printed works in English wherever published, and all translations from English. In addition to providing an exhaustive survey of the complete spectrum of monograph publications in the period, the catalogue indexes thousands of periodicals, directories and other ephemeral publications.

hash.title: Nineteenth Century Short Title Catalogue
hash.databasedescription:
The Nineteenth-Century Short Title Catalogue (NSTC) defines the printed record of the English-speaking world from the beginning of the nineteenth century to the end of the First World War.
The project aims to index all printed works published in Britain, its colonies and the United States of America, all printed works in English wherever published, and all translations from English. In addition to providing an exhaustive survey of the complete spectrum of monograph publications in the period, the catalogue indexes thousands of periodicals, directories and other ephemeral publications.

hash.name: Picture Post Historical Archive
hash.title: Picture Post Historical Archive
hash.databasedescription: Complete archive of the Picture Post from its first issue in 1938 to its last in 1957.

hash.name: PUNCH Historical Archive 1841-1992
hash.title: PUNCH Historical Archive 1841-1992
hash.databasedescription: Punch magazine archives.

hash.name: Scottish Bibliographies Online

meta.more-info:
This database contains three separate components: to find out how to access them separately, see the search information page.


  • Bibliography of Scotland (BOS): Scotland's national bibliography brings together over 90,000 records of books, periodicals and major articles of Scottish interest published all over the world. In principle it covers the period from 1976 to the present, but most of the records currently available online date from 1987 to the present. BOS includes information on literary writing in Scots. For more information, see detailed description of Bibliography of Scotland.

  • Bibliography of Scottish Gaelic (BOSG): When completed, the Bibliography of Scottish Gaelic is intended to list books and periodicals published in Gaelic, or containing substantial Gaelic text, from the beginning of Gaelic publishing. At present it lists much, but by no means all, of the Gaelic material held in the National Library of Scotland, plus some recent periodical articles.

  • Bibliography of the Scottish Book Trade (BSBT): The Bibliography of the Scottish Book Trade (BSBT) is a flexible research tool for the study of an important aspect of intellectual and cultural life in Scotland. It records secondary materials, including monographs, essays in composite works and journal articles, in the fields of publishing, printing, bookselling, journalism, broadcasting, binding, illustration, graphic design, libraries and library history and the transmission of Scottish culture overseas

hash.title: Scottish Bibliographies Online
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" below for brief description about Scottish Bibliographies Online

This database contains three separate components: to find out how to access them separately, see the search information page.


  • Bibliography of Scotland (BOS): Scotland's national bibliography brings together over 90,000 records of books, periodicals and major articles of Scottish interest published all over the world. In principle it covers the period from 1976 to the present, but most of the records currently available online date from 1987 to the present. BOS includes information on literary writing in Scots. For more information, see detailed description of Bibliography of Scotland.

  • Bibliography of Scottish Gaelic (BOSG): When completed, the Bibliography of Scottish Gaelic is intended to list books and periodicals published in Gaelic, or containing substantial Gaelic text, from the beginning of Gaelic publishing. At present it lists much, but by no means all, of the Gaelic material held in the National Library of Scotland, plus some recent periodical articles.

  • Bibliography of the Scottish Book Trade (BSBT): The Bibliography of the Scottish Book Trade (BSBT) is a flexible research tool for the study of an important aspect of intellectual and cultural life in Scotland. It records secondary materials, including monographs, essays in composite works and journal articles, in the fields of publishing, printing, bookselling, journalism, broadcasting, binding, illustration, graphic design, libraries and library history and the transmission of Scottish culture overseas

hash.name: The Cecil Papers
hash.title: The Cecil Papers
hash.databasedescription: The Cecil Papers are a privately held archive, consisting principally of the correspondence of William Cecil, Lord Burghley (1520-1598) and his son, Robert, the 1st Earl of Salisbury (1563-1612). These two men were active in the administration of government during the reign of Elizabeth I, and the collection documents their various official roles.

hash.name: The Guardian and The Observer (1791-2003)
hash.title: The Guardian and The Observer (1791-2003)
hash.databasedescription: Backfiles of The Guardian (1821-2003) and The Observer (1791-2003). Includes full page and article images with searchable full text back to the first issue.

hash.name: The Independent Digital Archive, 1986-2012
hash.title: The Independent Digital Archive, 1986-2012
hash.databasedescription: Digital Archive of The Independent.

hash.name: The Listener Historical Archive
hash.title: The Listener Historical Archive
hash.databasedescription: Complete archive of The Listener, a weekly publication established by the BBC in 1929 as the medium for reproducing radio - and later, television - programmes in print.

hash.name: The Making of Modern Law: Foreign, Comparative and International Law, 1600-1926
hash.title: The Making of Modern Law: Foreign, Comparative and International Law, 1600-1926
hash.databasedescription: Includes pre-1926 treatises and similar monographs, sourced from the collections of the Yale, George Washington University, and Columbia law libraries, in the following areas: International Law; Comparative Law; Foreign Law; Roman Law; Islamic Law; Jewish Law; and Ancient Law.

hash.name: The Making of Modern Law: Legal Treatises 1800-1926
hash.title: The Making of Modern Law: Legal Treatises 1800-1926
hash.databasedescription: Provides digital images on every page of 22,000 legal treatises on US and British law published from 1800 through 1926.

hash.name: The Making of Modern Law: Supreme Court Records & Briefs, 1832-1978
hash.title: The Making of Modern Law: Supreme Court Records & Briefs, 1832-1978
hash.databasedescription: Concentrates on the history of the Supreme Court from the final years of the court�s fourth chief justice, John Marshall, through the first ten years of the court�s 15th chief justice, Warren Earl Burger.

hash.name: The Making of Modern Law: Trials 1600-1926

meta.more-info: Examples include trials involving Dred Scott, John Peter Zenger, Susan B. Anthony, Oscar Wilde, the Boston Massacre, Lizzie Borden, Sacco and Vanzetti, Leopold and Loeb, the impeachment of Andrew Johnson, the Bounty mutineers, Salem witchcraft, Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette, Aaron Burr, John Brown and Alfred Dreyfus. Includes full text of books and pamphlets and other documents, and subjects covered include adultery, commercial law, conspiracy, constitutional law, crimes against persons, domestic relations, dueling, elections, impeachment, international law, land, libel, military offenses, murder, slavery, theft, torts, treason and wills. In addition to works pertaining to English-speaking jurisdictions such as the United States, Britain, Ireland and Canada, English-language titles about trials in other jurisdictions such as France are included. Books encompassing multiple trials are included as well as books about a single trial. Books about general trial procedures, legal doctrines and advocacy methods are excluded, as are books about crimes not resulting in trials.

hash.title: The Making of Modern Law: Trials 1600-1926
hash.databasedescription:
Covers trials and crimes of the time period covered.See "more" for more details.
Examples include trials involving Dred Scott, John Peter Zenger, Susan B. Anthony, Oscar Wilde, the Boston Massacre, Lizzie Borden, Sacco and Vanzetti, Leopold and Loeb, the impeachment of Andrew Johnson, the Bounty mutineers, Salem witchcraft, Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette, Aaron Burr, John Brown and Alfred Dreyfus. Includes full text of books and pamphlets and other documents, and subjects covered include adultery, commercial law, conspiracy, constitutional law, crimes against persons, domestic relations, dueling, elections, impeachment, international law, land, libel, military offenses, murder, slavery, theft, torts, treason and wills. In addition to works pertaining to English-speaking jurisdictions such as the United States, Britain, Ireland and Canada, English-language titles about trials in other jurisdictions such as France are included. Books encompassing multiple trials are included as well as books about a single trial. Books about general trial procedures, legal doctrines and advocacy methods are excluded, as are books about crimes not resulting in trials.

hash.name: Times Law Reports
hash.title: Times Law Reports
hash.databasedescription: Contains every case report appearing in The Times newspaper. Includes noteworthy court decisions from jurisdictions in the British Isles and the European Union, as well as the International Court of Justice. Updated bi-weekly.

hash.name: Trading Consequences
hash.title: Trading Consequences
hash.databasedescription: Trading Consequences uses text-mining software to explore thousands of pages of historical documents related to international commodity trading in the British Empire, involving Canada in particular, during the 19th century, and its impact on the economy and environment.

hash.name: UK Official Documents
hash.title: UK Official Documents
hash.databasedescription: Search for government publications of the United Kingdom, including Command Papers (White & Green papers, Treaties, Committee Reports, etc.), House of Commons papers (Annual Reports to Parliament, Public Accounts, etc.), Departmental Papers (selected papers produced by government ministries), Reports of Government Agencies, and statistical publications. Many documents are available full text online.

hash.name: United Kingdom Parliament

meta.more-info:
Search and retreive the full texts of:
  • Hansard:
    • House of Commons Debates back to 1988
    • House of Lords Debates back to 1994
  • Commons Written Anwers back to 1988
  • Commons Order Book back to December 1997
  • Commons Votes & Proceedings from 1998
  • Lords Written Answers back to 1994
  • Standing and Select Committee Reports back to 1997

and other recent Parliamentary publications such as Bills, the Sessional Information Digest, Weekly Information Bulletin, Sessional Returns, and the Register of Interests."

hash.title: United Kingdom Parliament
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for information about United Kingdom Parliament
Search and retreive the full texts of:
  • Hansard:
    • House of Commons Debates back to 1988
    • House of Lords Debates back to 1994
  • Commons Written Anwers back to 1988
  • Commons Order Book back to December 1997
  • Commons Votes & Proceedings from 1998
  • Lords Written Answers back to 1994
  • Standing and Select Committee Reports back to 1997

and other recent Parliamentary publications such as Bills, the Sessional Information Digest, Weekly Information Bulletin, Sessional Returns, and the Register of Interests."

hash.name: Wellesley Index to Victorian Periodicals, 1824-1900
hash.title: Wellesley Index to Victorian Periodicals, 1824-1900
hash.databasedescription: Wellesley is an index to the authorship of articles, and to the articles written by each contributor, along with brief biographical and vocational details. Citations of evidence are provided to support attributions of authorship. 45 monthly and quarterly titles are included, covering the period from the beginning of the Westminster Review in 1824 to the end of the century. The exception to this is the Edinburgh Review, which is indexed from first issue, in 1802. Wellesley does not index poetry.

hash.name: Women in the National Archives
hash.title: Women in the National Archives
hash.databasedescription: Includes a finding aid to women's studies resources in The National Archives at Kew, as well as original documents on the Suffrage Question in Britain, the Empire and Colonial Territories

hash.name: World Newspaper Archive
hash.title: World Newspaper Archive
hash.databasedescription: A fully searchable collection of historical newspapers from around the globe. This uniquely comprehensive online resource was created in partnership with the Center for Research Libraries - one of the world's largest and most important newspaper repositories.

hash.name: American Memory
hash.title: American Memory
hash.databasedescription: American Memory comprises the primary source materials related to American history and culture, collected under the auspices of the Library of Congress National Digital Library Program. American Memory includes manuscripts, printed texts, sheet music, maps, motion pictures, photographs, prints, and sound recordings, drawn from the collections of the Library of Congress as well as other libraries and archives.

hash.name: Alberta Newspapers Collection
hash.title: Alberta Newspapers Collection
hash.databasedescription: The Early Alberta Newspaper collection will contain all Alberta newspapers, both dailies and non-dailies (weeklies, etc.).

hash.name: Alberta on Record

meta.more-info:
The following databases are available through the ASA's "Other databases" link:

  • Archives Network of Alberta (ANA)
  • Northwest Territories Archival Network (NWTAN)
  • Yukon Archival Union List (YAUL)

hash.title: Alberta on Record
hash.databasedescription:
The Archives Network of Alberta (ANA) database consists of over 6000
funds-level and collection-level descriptions of archival records held in Alberta's archival institutions.


The following databases are available through the ASA's "Other databases" link:


  • Archives Network of Alberta (ANA)
  • Northwest Territories Archival Network (NWTAN)
  • Yukon Archival Union List (YAUL)

hash.name: Canada Treaty Information
hash.title: Canada Treaty Information
hash.databasedescription: The Treaty Section maintains up-to-date records of all pertinent information relating to the status of treaties affecting Canada. This database contains the texts of Bilateral, Multilateral and Plurilateral treaties involving Canada as well as links to important international treaties and organizations.

hash.name: Orders in Council

meta.more-info:
Includes:
  • Registered Orders - Approved Canadian Federal Regulations, Proclamations, Ministerial Orders and Proposed Regulations. Fall 1996 to date.
  • Proclamations - January 1998 to date.
  • Military Regulations - Recent [1998-2000] changes to the Queen�s Regulations and Orders for the Canadian Forces. Note: These are NOT published in the Canada Gazette.
  • Orders in Council Recent issues, plus archival coverage, 1993 to date. The Orders in Council listing includes Ministerial Orders, 1996 to date. Orders in Council for 1993-1996 are simply listed by date, then by topic.
  • Archives - Previously-listed Registered Orders and issues of Orders in Council, plus links to full-text Orders. 1996 to date.

hash.title: Orders in Council
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" below for brief description about Orders in Council
Includes:
  • Registered Orders - Approved Canadian Federal Regulations, Proclamations, Ministerial Orders and Proposed Regulations. Fall 1996 to date.
  • Proclamations - January 1998 to date.
  • Military Regulations - Recent [1998-2000] changes to the Queen�s Regulations and Orders for the Canadian Forces. Note: These are NOT published in the Canada Gazette.
  • Orders in Council Recent issues, plus archival coverage, 1993 to date. The Orders in Council listing includes Ministerial Orders, 1996 to date. Orders in Council for 1993-1996 are simply listed by date, then by topic.
  • Archives - Previously-listed Registered Orders and issues of Orders in Council, plus links to full-text Orders. 1996 to date.

hash.name: The Gateway to Northwestern Ontario History
hash.title: The Gateway to Northwestern Ontario History
hash.databasedescription: The Gateway to Northwestern Ontario History database contains a collection of Photos, Books, Drawings and Artifacts from Libraries and Museums of Northwestern Ontario.

hash.name: AATA Online: Abstracts of International Conservation Literature
hash.title: AATA Online: Abstracts of International Conservation Literature
hash.databasedescription: The database contains back issue of the AATA (Art and Archaeology Technical Abstracts), in addition to abstracts published by the Fogg Art Museum at Harvard University (1932-1942) and by the Freer Gallery of Art of the Smithsonian Institution (1943-1952). It also includes the AATA Matte Paint supplement.

hash.name: BCIN (Bibliographic Database of the Conservation Information Network)
hash.title: BCIN (Bibliographic Database of the Conservation Information Network)
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to bibliographic citations for conservation literature. BCIN includes citations from the Art and Archaeology Technical Abstracts (prior to 1998), technical reports, conference proceedings, journal articles, books and audiovisual and unpublished materials. The database also includes previously unavailable material from private sources, as well as new information gathered by a worldwide network of contributors.

hash.name: British Pathé
hash.title: British Pathé
hash.databasedescription: British Pathé is a news and entertainment video film database archive containing footage dating back to the invention of the moving image in the 1890's. Includes documentaries, newsreels, serials and films covering historical events and changing social activity. Subject coverage ranges from fashion to warfare and sport to travel. Includes all 85,000 newsreels - 3,500 hours of filmed history.

hash.name: MATERIALSnetBASE
hash.title: MATERIALSnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Online, full-text handbooks, reference works and textbooks covering applications in materials science and engineering, including polymeric material, composites, biomaterials, corrosion, polyurethanes, material flow, and more.

hash.name: POPLINE

meta.more-info: In addition, POPLINE focuses on particular developing-country issues including demography, AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases, maternal and child health, primary health care communication, and population and environment. POPLINE citations are searchable with POPLINE keywords as well as MeSH headings. The file is produced by the Population Information Program at the Johns Hopkins School of Public Health. The database is funded primarily by the United States Agency of International Development."

hash.title: POPLINE
hash.databasedescription:
"POPLINE provides worldwide coverage of population, family planning, and related health issues, including family planning technology and programs, fertility, and population law and policy.
In addition, POPLINE focuses on particular developing-country issues including demography, AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases, maternal and child health, primary health care communication, and population and environment. POPLINE citations are searchable with POPLINE keywords as well as MeSH headings. The file is produced by the Population Information Program at the Johns Hopkins School of Public Health. The database is funded primarily by the United States Agency of International Development."

hash.name: Statistics Canada Free Internet Publications

meta.more-info: See also the list of Statistics Canada publications that has been captured by the Government of Canada Depository Services Program: Statistics Canada Downloadable Publications.

hash.title: Statistics Canada Free Internet Publications
hash.databasedescription:
This portal provides access to Statistics Canada research publications that are available on the Statistics Canada website. The publications include statistics on a wide variety of topics, such as communications, demographics, environment, health, justice, labour, manufacturing, national accounts, social conditions, trade, and much more.
See also the list of Statistics Canada publications that has been captured by the Government of Canada Depository Services Program: Statistics Canada Downloadable Publications.

hash.name: PAIS International (1915 - current)
hash.title: PAIS International (1915 - current)
hash.databasedescription: PAIS International is produced by the Public Affairs Information Service. PAIS International is a bibliographic index to the literature of public and social policy and to the social sciences in general. The database cites journal articles, both scholarly and popular, books, government documents (with an emphasis on Canada, USA and the United Nations), statistical compilations, committee reports (private and public), and directories. Also included is a directory to the publishers and periodicals cited in the database. This file now contains the PAIS International Archive of more than 1,000,000 records, originally published in the PAIS Bulletin, 1915 - 1976.

hash.name: Urban Studies Abstracts
hash.title: Urban Studies Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to urban studies, including urban affairs, community development, urban history, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: Human Resources Abstracts
hash.title: Human Resources Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to human resources, including human resource management, employee assistance, organizational behavior, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: eStatement Studies
hash.title: eStatement Studies
hash.databasedescription: Contains composite financial data from North American companies.

hash.name: First Research
hash.title: First Research
hash.databasedescription: Includes industry profiles and other business information.

hash.name: Leisure Tourism
hash.title: Leisure Tourism
hash.databasedescription: Covers the fields of leisure, tourism, hospitality, and travel. Includes citations to books, papers and other sources, as well as full-text for some of the material.

hash.name: LEGISinfo
hash.title: LEGISinfo
hash.databasedescription: Covers the fields of leisure, tourism, hospitality, and travel. Includes citations to books, papers and other sources, as well as full-text for some of the material.

hash.name: Archive of European Integration
hash.title: Archive of European Integration
hash.databasedescription: The Archive of European Integration is an electronic repository and archive for research materials on the topic of European integration and unification. It is also an archive for primary documents, including European Union publications, that are not readily available in electronic format elsewhere.

hash.name: Banca Dati Scrittori Immigrati in Lingua Italiana (BASILI)
hash.title: Banca Dati Scrittori Immigrati in Lingua Italiana (BASILI)
hash.databasedescription: This database contains information on Italian migrant and immigrant writers including references to criticism and theses regarding these authors.

hash.name: Biblioteca italiana
hash.title: Biblioteca italiana
hash.databasedescription: Biblioteca italiana is a digital library of representative cultural and literary texts from the Middle Ages to the 19th century. Texts are searchable and downloadable, and include Scrittori d'Italia Laterza, incunabula, special collections, and other digital projects.

hash.name: CLIPS: Corpora e Lessici dell’Italiano Parlato e Scritto

meta.more-info: It makes available online a wealth of written documents and audio files, which are free to use for research purposes. Users can access about 100 hours of speech from 15 different cities in Italy: Bari; Bergamo; Bologna; Cagliari; Catanzaro; Florence; Genoa; Lecce; Milan; Naples; Palermo; Parma; Perugia; Rome; and Venice. Male and female voices are equally represented. Various recordings are transcribed to read in PDF. A variety of different text typologies have been used, such as: radio and television broadcasts; interviews; dialogues; non professional speakers reading aloud; telephone conversations between 300 speakers and a hotel desk operator; read speech by a selection of professional speakers recorded in an anechoic chamber. The project has been co-ordinated by various universities and colleges in Italy and a detailed outline of its development is given by Federico Albano Leoni, the Project Director. This resource is an extremely valuable source of primary material for scholars of Italian linguistics; it would also be of use to teachers of Italian looking for new audio and printed material containing contemporary Italian for use in class.

hash.title: CLIPS: Corpora e Lessici dell’Italiano Parlato e Scritto
hash.databasedescription:
CLIPS : corpora e lessici di italiano parlato e scritto (corpus and vocabulary of spoken and written Italian) is a project hosted by the University of Naples.
It makes available online a wealth of written documents and audio files, which are free to use for research purposes. Users can access about 100 hours of speech from 15 different cities in Italy: Bari; Bergamo; Bologna; Cagliari; Catanzaro; Florence; Genoa; Lecce; Milan; Naples; Palermo; Parma; Perugia; Rome; and Venice. Male and female voices are equally represented. Various recordings are transcribed to read in PDF. A variety of different text typologies have been used, such as: radio and television broadcasts; interviews; dialogues; non professional speakers reading aloud; telephone conversations between 300 speakers and a hotel desk operator; read speech by a selection of professional speakers recorded in an anechoic chamber. The project has been co-ordinated by various universities and colleges in Italy and a detailed outline of its development is given by Federico Albano Leoni, the Project Director. This resource is an extremely valuable source of primary material for scholars of Italian linguistics; it would also be of use to teachers of Italian looking for new audio and printed material containing contemporary Italian for use in class.

hash.name: Dizionario Biografico degli Italiani
hash.title: Dizionario Biografico degli Italiani
hash.databasedescription: This database includes the full-text articles ofthe Dizionario biografico degli Italiani.

hash.name: EUR-LEX
hash.title: EUR-LEX
hash.databasedescription: EUR-LEX provides access to The Official Journal of the European Union, EU Treaties and International Agreements, EU Legislation and Preparatory Acts (including COM and SEC documents), and EU Case Law. EUR-LEX is updated daily with some texts dating back to 1951.

hash.name: International Index to Music Periodicals (IIMP)

meta.more-info:
It indexes articles and reviews from about 400 music journals, beginning with 1996 publications, providing citations and brief indicative abstracts. In addition, it includes citations for articles published 1990-1995 in about 100 of the 400 journals, and for articles from the complete backfiles of some 40 of the 400 journals, some extending back into the nineteenth century. For this retrospective material, abstracts are not provided, and no indexing has been done, so that subject retrieval is possible only to the extent that it is permitted by a search of keywords in the article titles.

IIMP Fulltext also includes the fulltext from over 50 of the journals it indexes.

hash.title: International Index to Music Periodicals (IIMP)
hash.databasedescription:
International Index to Music Periodicals (IIMP) covers music of all types, classical, popular, folk, and world; it includes both music journalism and scholarly writings.
It indexes articles and reviews from about 400 music journals, beginning with 1996 publications, providing citations and brief indicative abstracts. In addition, it includes citations for articles published 1990-1995 in about 100 of the 400 journals, and for articles from the complete backfiles of some 40 of the 400 journals, some extending back into the nineteenth century. For this retrospective material, abstracts are not provided, and no indexing has been done, so that subject retrieval is possible only to the extent that it is permitted by a search of keywords in the article titles.

IIMP Fulltext also includes the fulltext from over 50 of the journals it indexes.

hash.name: Italinemo: Periodicals of Italian Studies in the World
hash.title: Italinemo: Periodicals of Italian Studies in the World
hash.databasedescription: Iter's bibliography includes literature pertaining to the Middle Ages and Renaissance (400-1700). Citations for books, journal material (articles, reviews, review articles, bibliographies, catalogues, abstracts and discographies) are included, as are citations for dissertation abstracts, and essays in books (including entries in conference proceedings, festschriften, encyclopedias and exhibition catalogues).

hash.name: L’Emeroteca Digitale: Biblioteca Nazionale Braidense

meta.more-info: All the material that is being digitised by the Emeroteca Digitale is available online for free, apart from those journals protected by copyright. The Emeroteca is updated regularly. The catalogue can be searched alphabetically in the section "Catalogo". In the section "Ricerche" searches can be run by article, volume or by keyword via Google. In order to read the journals online, users need to install the plug-in DjVu Browser. The site is available in Italian only.

hash.title: L’Emeroteca Digitale: Biblioteca Nazionale Braidense
hash.databasedescription:
The Emeroteca Digitale Braidense (Braidense digital newspaper library) is a project promoted by the Biblioteca Nazionale Braidense (National Braidense Library) in Milan. The project aims to digitise various periodicals on Italian history and culture that have been published since the beginning of the 19th century. The periodicals are held by the Biblioteca Nazionale Braidense and by other Italian institutes and libraries participating in the project.
All the material that is being digitised by the Emeroteca Digitale is available online for free, apart from those journals protected by copyright. The Emeroteca is updated regularly. The catalogue can be searched alphabetically in the section "Catalogo". In the section "Ricerche" searches can be run by article, volume or by keyword via Google. In order to read the journals online, users need to install the plug-in DjVu Browser. The site is available in Italian only.

hash.name: The World of Dante

meta.more-info: Each illustration contains a considerable amount of contextual material. Every person, place, deity, creature, and structure present in every image and text are searchable. In addition to the Gallery, The World of Dante includes the Italian text and Allen Mandelbaum's translation of the Divine Comedy marked up in XML; an interactive timeline; an array of maps of Dante's Italy and all three realms of the afterlife; musical recordings of the liturgical chants and hymns mentioned in Purgatory and Paradise; a searchable database; and teaching resources and activities.

hash.title: The World of Dante
hash.databasedescription:
The World of Dante includes a gallery of more than 600 images and some materials which are not available on any other site which might interest art historians, two of which are Botticelli's Chart of Hell (presented in an interactive version through Flash) and illustrations from Yates Thompson 36, one of the most famous illuminated manuscripts of the Comedy. Illustrations by Botticelli, Dore', Flaxman, and other artists are also included.
Each illustration contains a considerable amount of contextual material. Every person, place, deity, creature, and structure present in every image and text are searchable. In addition to the Gallery, The World of Dante includes the Italian text and Allen Mandelbaum's translation of the Divine Comedy marked up in XML; an interactive timeline; an array of maps of Dante's Italy and all three realms of the afterlife; musical recordings of the liturgical chants and hymns mentioned in Purgatory and Paradise; a searchable database; and teaching resources and activities.

hash.name: Naver News Library
hash.title: Naver News Library
hash.databasedescription: Naver News Library is a full text database of four major Korean newspapers: Dong-A ilbo, Kyunghyang Shinmun, Maeil Business Newspaper and The Hankyoreh, providing access to archival issues from 1920 to 1999

hash.name: Oxford Latin American Economic History Database (OxLAD)
hash.title: Oxford Latin American Economic History Database (OxLAD)
hash.databasedescription: Producted by the Latin American Centre at Oxford University, this database contains statistical series for a wide range of economic and social indicators covering twenty countries in Latin America for the period 1900-2000.

hash.name: LILACS
hash.title: LILACS
hash.databasedescription: From the Latin American and Caribbean Center on Health Sciences Information, contains citations from about 670 English, Spanish and Portuguese journals, most of which are not indexed in MEDLINE and EMBASE.

hash.name: Bibliografía Mesoamericana
hash.title: Bibliografía Mesoamericana
hash.databasedescription:
Provides comprehensive bibliographic coverage of the published literature pertaining to Mesoamerica (Mexico, Belize, Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Costa Rica to the Nicoya peninsula), including archaeology, art history, ethnography, ethnohistory, linguistics, physical anthropology, and related disciplines.
Temporal coverage extends from the early sixteenth-century to the present.

hash.name: Brazilian Government Documents
hash.title: Brazilian Government Documents
hash.databasedescription: Contains executive branch serial documents issued by Brazil's national government during the period between 1821 and 1993, and by its provincial governments from the earliest available for each province to the end of the Empire in 1889.

hash.name: Caribbean Newspapers: The Caribbean Newspaper Imaging Project

meta.more-info: Currently, this project has been granted permissions to digitize current newspaper issues from The Nassau Tribune, Abaconian (Abaconian Website), Awe Mainta (Awe Mainta Website), and Justice (Justice Website).

hash.title: Caribbean Newspapers: The Caribbean Newspaper Imaging Project
hash.databasedescription:
The Caribbean Newspaper Digitization Library (CNDL) is a pilot project to develop the requirements necessary for building a Caribbean digital newspaper library, parallel to the Digital Library of the Caribbean. The CNDL will have on-going newspaper digitization, expanding the geographic, temporal, political and linguistic variety of the newspapers.
Currently, this project has been granted permissions to digitize current newspaper issues from The Nassau Tribune, Abaconian (Abaconian Website), Awe Mainta (Awe Mainta Website), and Justice (Justice Website).

hash.name: Catalog of U.S. Government Publications
hash.title: Catalog of U.S. Government Publications

hash.name: Central American Political History Database

meta.more-info: The database supplies the following searchable variables in English and in the corresponding Spanish version: Post, Paternal last name, Maternal last name, First name, Month of inauguration, Day of inauguration, Year of inauguration, Month of departure from office, Day of departure from office, Year of departure from office, Place of birth, Country of birth, Month of birth, Day of birth, Year of birth, Place of death, Country of death, Month of death, Day of death, Year of death, Party affiliation, Profession.

hash.title: Central American Political History Database
hash.databasedescription:
The bilingual Central American Political History Database at consists of the 454 heads of state(or members of ruling juntas) of the five historic Central American countries (Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras and Nicaragua) and of the old Central American Federation.
The database supplies the following searchable variables in English and in the corresponding Spanish version: Post, Paternal last name, Maternal last name, First name, Month of inauguration, Day of inauguration, Year of inauguration, Month of departure from office, Day of departure from office, Year of departure from office, Place of birth, Country of birth, Month of birth, Day of birth, Year of birth, Place of death, Country of death, Month of death, Day of death, Year of death, Party affiliation, Profession.

hash.name: CEPALSTAT
hash.title: CEPALSTAT
hash.databasedescription: CEPALSTAT is the gateway to all the statistical information of Latin America and the Caribbean countries collected, systematized and published by ECLAC.

hash.name: Colecciones Mexicanas

meta.more-info: Colecciones Mexicanas contain Mexican Franciscan manuscripts from the 14th to the 19th centuries, literary Mexican periodicals of the 19th century, Documents concerning Mexicans in the 19th century (e.g archival letters of Enrique de Olavarría y Ferrari) , E-books (e.g Visión de los vencidos, Geografía médica de la República Mexicana, Diccionario de historia de la educación en México, La guerra de 1846-1848, México: un siglo de imágenes).

hash.title: Colecciones Mexicanas
hash.databasedescription:
Colecciones Mexicanas indexes and gives access to both original and transcribed full-text documents. A search engine exists for each document set.
Colecciones Mexicanas contain Mexican Franciscan manuscripts from the 14th to the 19th centuries, literary Mexican periodicals of the 19th century, Documents concerning Mexicans in the 19th century (e.g archival letters of Enrique de Olavarría y Ferrari) , E-books (e.g Visión de los vencidos, Geografía médica de la República Mexicana, Diccionario de historia de la educación en México, La guerra de 1846-1848, México: un siglo de imágenes).

hash.name: Confidential Print: Latin America, 1833-1969
hash.title: Confidential Print: Latin America, 1833-1969
hash.databasedescription: Papers generated by the Foreign and Colonial Offices, from one page letters or telegrams to large volumes or texts of treaties. All items marked "Confidential Print" were printed and circulated immediately to leading officials in the Foreign Office, to the Cabinet, and to Heads of British missions abroad.

hash.name: Cuba Archive
hash.title: Cuba Archive
hash.databasedescription: This database lists deaths believed to have resulted from the Cuban Revolution (1952-present). Users must register here.

hash.name: Dialnet
hash.title: Dialnet
hash.databasedescription: Dialnet is a hispanic scientific production portal. Registration is required in order to receive alerts and to access other personalized options. Registered users may choose any journal and its summaries via electronic alerts, as soon as new issues are published.

hash.name: E-Textos
hash.title: E-Textos
hash.databasedescription: E-Textos is a database of free academic online texts in Spanish relating to a number of subject areas, for example anthropology, asian studies, discourse analysis, economics, education, epistemology, history, literature, neuropsychology, politics, and psychoanalysis.

hash.name: Frontera: archivo de la musica Mexicana-Americana

meta.more-info: With funding from Los Tigres del Norte Foundation the UCLA Chicano Studies Research Center has sponsored the digitization of the first section of the collection by the Arhoolie Foundation. These performances were recorded primarily in the United States and Mexico and issued on 78 rpm phonograph recordings during the first half of the twentieth century. The late-twentieth century section contains approximately fourteen thousand 45 rpm recordings dating from around 1955 to the 1990s. The last section of the collection includes approximately three thousand 33 1/3 rpm recordings from around 1955 to 1990, demonstrating the continuity of styles and regional traditions into contemporary times.

hash.title: Frontera: archivo de la musica Mexicana-Americana
hash.databasedescription:
The Arhoolie Foundation's Strachwitz Frontera Collection of commercially produced Mexican and Mexican-American recordings (the Frontera Collection) is the largest repository of Mexican and Mexican-American vernacular recordings in existence.
With funding from Los Tigres del Norte Foundation the UCLA Chicano Studies Research Center has sponsored the digitization of the first section of the collection by the Arhoolie Foundation. These performances were recorded primarily in the United States and Mexico and issued on 78 rpm phonograph recordings during the first half of the twentieth century. The late-twentieth century section contains approximately fourteen thousand 45 rpm recordings dating from around 1955 to the 1990s. The last section of the collection includes approximately three thousand 33 1/3 rpm recordings from around 1955 to 1990, demonstrating the continuity of styles and regional traditions into contemporary times.

hash.name: Gendering Latin American Independence

meta.more-info: It was compiled over five years (2001-2006) by Dr Claire Brewster (University of Newcastle). Claire consulted numerous primary and secondary sources to create an extensive online resource which gives details of women's and men's political and social participation between 1790 and 1850. The locations of the primary sources are listed under Archives and the secondary sources (books, articles, newspapers) are listed under References. Claire collated all data from these sources without further additions. Any errors therefore are attributable to the sources, and the data may be contradictory.

hash.title: Gendering Latin American Independence
hash.databasedescription:
This database is an exploration of women's participation in the Latin American wars of independence. The information focuses on the life events (biographies) of individuals, mainly women, from across Spanish America and Brazil c. 1790-1850.
It was compiled over five years (2001-2006) by Dr Claire Brewster (University of Newcastle). Claire consulted numerous primary and secondary sources to create an extensive online resource which gives details of women's and men's political and social participation between 1790 and 1850. The locations of the primary sources are listed under Archives and the secondary sources (books, articles, newspapers) are listed under References. Claire collated all data from these sources without further additions. Any errors therefore are attributable to the sources, and the data may be contradictory.

hash.name: Integrated Database of Trade Disputes for Latin America and the Caribbean
hash.title: Integrated Database of Trade Disputes for Latin America and the Caribbean
hash.databasedescription: The Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean has launched a new online database on regional trade disputes that provides access to full information and documentation on trade dispute process, from initial filing to final enactment. It includes WTO, MERCOSUR, NAFTA, CARICOM, Andean Community, CACM and provides an option for an integrated search. The database is also available in Spanish.

hash.name: Latin American Databank
hash.title: Latin American Databank
hash.databasedescription: Latin American Databank is the Roper Center's on-line catalog of public opinion studies. The catalog does not include survey results but does provide the user with descriptive and methodological information for thousands of surveys. Covers Latin American countries.

hash.name: Latin American Newsletters

meta.more-info: This database permits searching across the following platforms: Latin American Weekly Reports, Informe latinoamericano (Weekly Report in Spanish), and Latin American Regional Reports (Brazil and Southern Cone, Mexico and Nafta, Caribbean and Central America, Andean Group).

hash.title: Latin American Newsletters
hash.databasedescription:
Since 1967, Latinnews (Latin American Newsletters) has been acknowledged as the foremost source of intelligence on political and economic developments in Latin America and the Caribbean. Read by business executives, the financial services sector, government officials and leading academics alike, Latinnews’ comprehensive range of print and online resources offers subscribers a reliable, accurate and timely source of insight into key events that shape the region.
This database permits searching across the following platforms: Latin American Weekly Reports, Informe latinoamericano (Weekly Report in Spanish), and Latin American Regional Reports (Brazil and Southern Cone, Mexico and Nafta, Caribbean and Central America, Andean Group).

hash.name: Latin American Pamphlet Digital Collection

meta.more-info: These pamphlets are valuable primary resources for students and researchers working on Latin American history. They document the emergence of the Latin American colonies as independent states, and illuminate many aspects of their populations' social and cultural life. Many pamphlets are devoted to boundary disputes, territorial expansion, the description of unexplored territories and the relationship between Church and State. The Latin American Pamphlet Digital Collection contains catalog records with links to page images of the digitized pamphlets.

hash.title: Latin American Pamphlet Digital Collection
hash.databasedescription:
Harvard's Widener Library is the repository of many scarce and unique Latin American pamphlets published during the 19th and the early 20th centuries.Chile, Cuba, Bolivia and Mexico are the countries most heavily represented in this collection.
These pamphlets are valuable primary resources for students and researchers working on Latin American history. They document the emergence of the Latin American colonies as independent states, and illuminate many aspects of their populations' social and cultural life. Many pamphlets are devoted to boundary disputes, territorial expansion, the description of unexplored territories and the relationship between Church and State. The Latin American Pamphlet Digital Collection contains catalog records with links to page images of the digitized pamphlets.

hash.name: Latin American Public Opinion Project (LAPOP)
hash.title: Latin American Public Opinion Project (LAPOP)
hash.databasedescription: The Latin American Public Opinion Project (LAPOP) specializes in the development, implementation, and analysis of public opinion surveys. Furthermore, there will be unrestricted world-wide access to the AmericasBarometer surveys (2004, 2006, 2008, 2010, and 2012 once it is completed in December of this year) in the latter part of 2012.

hash.name: Latin American Social Medicine

meta.more-info: The LASM database provides important information about the social, economic, and cultural determinants of health, and the organized responses to confront the problems. Originally this information circulated mostly within professional networks and other health and community workers located in Latin America. Through this website we expect to enhance the access to this information within Latin America and other regions worldwide. By May 2006, the database contains abstracts for 25 landmark books, 50 book chapters, and 100 journal articles from the classic social medicine. It also contains almost 200 abstracts from twelve current journals. This project devotes attention in particular to the following themes in Latin American social medicine, which are emphases of the National Institutes of Health. Information in these thematic areas will prove useful for key investigators of health issues in the United States: social, environmental, and nutritional causes of infant and perinatal mortality (NICHHD); economic development, demographic change, and aging (NIA); socioeconomic barriers to cancer prevention (NCI); determinants of mental illness in race or ethnic background, social class, gender, and social violence (NIMH); and policy research on managed care, primary care innovations, and preventive services (AHCPR).

hash.title: Latin American Social Medicine
hash.databasedescription:
The Latin American Social Medicine (LASM) database provides Spanish, Portuguese, and English structured abstracts summarizing classic and contemporary works in the field of practice of LASM. The abstracts are available on this website.
The LASM database provides important information about the social, economic, and cultural determinants of health, and the organized responses to confront the problems. Originally this information circulated mostly within professional networks and other health and community workers located in Latin America. Through this website we expect to enhance the access to this information within Latin America and other regions worldwide. By May 2006, the database contains abstracts for 25 landmark books, 50 book chapters, and 100 journal articles from the classic social medicine. It also contains almost 200 abstracts from twelve current journals. This project devotes attention in particular to the following themes in Latin American social medicine, which are emphases of the National Institutes of Health. Information in these thematic areas will prove useful for key investigators of health issues in the United States: social, environmental, and nutritional causes of infant and perinatal mortality (NICHHD); economic development, demographic change, and aging (NIA); socioeconomic barriers to cancer prevention (NCI); determinants of mental illness in race or ethnic background, social class, gender, and social violence (NIMH); and policy research on managed care, primary care innovations, and preventive services (AHCPR).

hash.name: Latin Americanist Research Resources Project

meta.more-info:
Currently consists of:
  • Latin American Periodicals Tables of Contents: Provides access to tables of contents of more than 800 journals, primarily in the humanities and social sciences, published in Latin America.
  • Latin American Periodicals Open Archives Portal: Aims to improve access to social sciences grey literature produced in Latin America.
  • Presidential Messages: Digital images of presidential speeches since the early 19th century from Mexico and Argentina

hash.title: Latin Americanist Research Resources Project
hash.databasedescription:
An initiative of the Global Resources Program of the Association of Research Libraries (ARL). Click on "more" below for further information.
Currently consists of:
  • Latin American Periodicals Tables of Contents: Provides access to tables of contents of more than 800 journals, primarily in the humanities and social sciences, published in Latin America.
  • Latin American Periodicals Open Archives Portal: Aims to improve access to social sciences grey literature produced in Latin America.
  • Presidential Messages: Digital images of presidential speeches since the early 19th century from Mexico and Argentina

hash.name: Metabase: Bibliografia en red
hash.title: Metabase: Bibliografia en red
hash.databasedescription: This free database searches bibliographical resources in various libraries and databanks of Central America and Mexico.

hash.name: Nineteenth Century Adventurers in Gran Colombia
hash.title: Nineteenth Century Adventurers in Gran Colombia
hash.databasedescription: This is a research database of over 3000 British, English, Irish, Scottish, Welsh and other European Adventurers in Gran Colombia (modern day Ecuador, Colombia, Panama and Venezuela) during and after the Wars of Independence (c.1810-c.1890).

hash.name: openDemocracy
hash.title: openDemocracy
hash.databasedescription: openDemocracy delivers contemporary perspectives on current events, globalization, media, development, culture, and the arts, from writers around the world. It covers areas such as international affairs, foreign policy, political science, the media, diversity, anthropology, history, journalism, the environment, sociology, comparative cultures, religion, defense/war/peace issues, globalization, and social policy.

hash.name: PARLINE database on national parliaments
hash.title: PARLINE database on national parliaments
hash.databasedescription: The PARLINE database contains information on the structure and working methods of parliamentary chambers in all countries where a national legislature exists. It also provides access to election results and statistics for all parliamentary elections around the world, as well as historical archives back to 1967.

hash.name: Political Database of the Americas
hash.title: Political Database of the Americas
hash.databasedescription: The Political Database of the Americas is an Internet-based project that indexes reference materials, primary documents, comparative studies, and statistics for countries in the Western Hemisphere. Links to many fulltext documents are provided. More information about the database is available here.

hash.name: PRISMA (Publicaciones y Revistas Sociales y Humanísticas)

meta.more-info: Offering key titles indexed in the Hispanic American Periodicals Index (HAPI), a highly respected database produced by the Latin American Center of the University of California, Los Angeles, PRISMA features Spanish, Portuguese, and English language content.

hash.title: PRISMA (Publicaciones y Revistas Sociales y Humanísticas)
hash.databasedescription:
PRISMA (Publicaciones y Revistas Sociales y Humanísticas) is a comprehensive reference resource providing full-text scholarly journals in the social sciences and humanities for the interdisciplinary academic study of Hispanic and Latin America and the Caribbean Basin.
Offering key titles indexed in the Hispanic American Periodicals Index (HAPI), a highly respected database produced by the Latin American Center of the University of California, Los Angeles, PRISMA features Spanish, Portuguese, and English language content.

hash.name: Red ALyC: Red de revistas científicas de América Latina y el Caribe, España y Portugal
hash.title: Red ALyC: Red de revistas científicas de América Latina y el Caribe, España y Portugal
hash.databasedescription: This netwok of scientific journals provides full-text access to carefully selected journals from the Spanish and Portuguese speaking world in health sciences, social sciences, and the humanities.

hash.name: Red de Bibliotecas Virtuales de Ciencias Sociales de América Latina y el Caribe de la red de centros miembros de CLACSO
hash.title: Red de Bibliotecas Virtuales de Ciencias Sociales de América Latina y el Caribe de la red de centros miembros de CLACSO
hash.databasedescription: Collection of electronic books from Latin America.

hash.name: Sabin Americana Digital Archive
hash.title: Sabin Americana Digital Archive
hash.databasedescription: Based on Joseph Sabin's landmark bibliography, this collection contains works about the Americas published throughout the world from 1500 to the early 1900's. Included are books, pamphlets, serials and other documents that provide original accounts of exploration, trade, colonialism, slavery and abolition, the western movement, Native Americans, military actions and much more. With over 6 million pages from 29,000 works, this collection is a cornerstone in the study of the western hemisphere.

hash.name: SciELO Citation Index
hash.title: SciELO Citation Index
hash.databasedescription: Indexes scholarly literature in the sciences, social sciences, arts and humanities published in leading open access journals from Latin America, Portugal, Spain, the Caribbean and South Africa. SciELO (Scientific Electronic Library Online) is a program of the Sao Paulo Research Foundation for the cooperative publishing of open access journals on the internet.

hash.name: Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean (SEDLAC)
hash.title: Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean (SEDLAC)
hash.databasedescription: This database includes statistics on poverty and other distributional and social variables from 25 Latin American and Caribbean countries, based on microdata from households surveys.

hash.name: Tesis Europeas Sobre America Latina
hash.title: Tesis Europeas Sobre America Latina
hash.databasedescription: This resource gives access to bibliographic information relating to European doctoral theses whose research focuses on Latin America. The Red Europea de Información y Documentación sobre América Latina (REDIAL), in collaboration with the Centro de Información y Documentación Científica (CINDOC), produces and maintains this database.

hash.name: Twentieth Century Latin American Pamphlets
hash.title: Twentieth Century Latin American Pamphlets
hash.databasedescription: This database contains annotated bibliographic citations to a collection of pamphlets, grey literature and ephemera related to political, economic, and social conditions in Latin America during the twentieth century. The collection spans the period 1910 to 1995.

hash.name: UNESCO Institute for Statistics
hash.title: UNESCO Institute for Statistics
hash.databasedescription: The UNESCO Institute of Statistics website is a portal to statistical tables and online publications on global trends and issues in the areas of Education, Literacy, Culture & Communication, and Science & Technology.

hash.name: Vida Pública en la Argentina Contemporánea
hash.title: Vida Pública en la Argentina Contemporánea
hash.databasedescription: This collection presents an extensive grassroots view of Argentina and the recent social and political changes that have taken place there. It provides access to material on Argentine society and politics beginning with the year 1996 and running to the present.

hash.name: World Scholar: Latin America & the Caribbean
hash.title: World Scholar: Latin America & the Caribbean
hash.databasedescription: Primary source documents about Latin America and the Caribbean including academic journals, news feeds, reference articles, commentary, maps, statistics, audio and video.

hash.name: WTO Database of Online Public Documents

meta.more-info:
Search by document title, symbol, or number, or by keyword.
For available WTO publications, see the WTO section of the U of A Libraries' guide to International Organizations.

hash.title: WTO Database of Online Public Documents
hash.databasedescription:
Database of publicly available World Trade Organization official documents, including Official Records of WTO Bodies and Committees, Dispute Settlement, Ministerial Meetings, and Background papers. Includes WTO documents from its formation in 1995, as well as selected Uruguay Round and GATT (General Agreement on Tarrifs and Trade) documents. Updated daily.
Search by document title, symbol, or number, or by keyword.
For available WTO publications, see the WTO section of the U of A Libraries' guide to International Organizations.

hash.name: African Human Rights Case Law Analyser
hash.title: African Human Rights Case Law Analyser
hash.databasedescription: This collection, which goes back to the early 1990's, is searchable by region, country, legislation, topic and complainant.

hash.name: AGIS Plus Text
hash.title: AGIS Plus Text
hash.databasedescription: AGIS Plus Text provides both an index to articles and access to full text page images of articles on all aspects of law. Over 400 Australasian law journals and reviews are indexed, and many of these are copyright cleared for full text PDF images. Index coverage is from 1975 to date, and full text images are available from 1999 to date.

hash.name: Alberta Gazette
hash.title: Alberta Gazette
hash.databasedescription: Includes new and amending Regulations, assorted government notices, as well as private sector public notices that are required by Statute to be published.

hash.name: Alberta Law Collection
hash.title: Alberta Law Collection
hash.databasedescription: This database contains the documents that form Alberta's legislative history, including all of the Alberta Statutes up to 1990, Legislative Assembly Bills, Debates and Journals, the Alberta Gazette and the Ordinances of the Northwest Territories prior to the birth of Alberta.

hash.name: Annotated Civil Code of Quebec
hash.title: Annotated Civil Code of Quebec
hash.databasedescription: The ACCQ is the online version of the Civil Code of Quebec, searchable by section number or full text. Decisions issued from the Supreme Court of Canada, Appeal Court of Quebec, Superior Court of Quebec and Court of Quebec are linked to each section.

hash.name: Audiovisual Library of International Law

meta.more-info: The Audiovisual Library consists of three pillars: (1) the Historic Archives containing documents and audiovisual materials relating to the negotiation and adoption of significant legal instruments under the auspices of the United Nations and related agencies since 1945; (2) the Lecture Series featuring a permanent collection of lectures on virtually every subject of international law given by leading international law scholars and practitioners from different countries and legal systems; and (3) the Research Library providing an on-line international law library with links to treaties, jurisprudence, publications and documents, scholarly writings and research guides. The Audiovisual Library is available to all individuals and institutions around the world for free via the Internet.

hash.title: Audiovisual Library of International Law
hash.databasedescription:
The Audiovisual Library is a unique, multimedia resource which provides the United Nations with the unprecedented capacity to provide high quality international law training and research materials to an unlimited number of recipients on a global level.
The Audiovisual Library consists of three pillars: (1) the Historic Archives containing documents and audiovisual materials relating to the negotiation and adoption of significant legal instruments under the auspices of the United Nations and related agencies since 1945; (2) the Lecture Series featuring a permanent collection of lectures on virtually every subject of international law given by leading international law scholars and practitioners from different countries and legal systems; and (3) the Research Library providing an on-line international law library with links to treaties, jurisprudence, publications and documents, scholarly writings and research guides. The Audiovisual Library is available to all individuals and institutions around the world for free via the Internet.

hash.name: Australasian Legal Information Institute
hash.title: Australasian Legal Information Institute
hash.databasedescription: Indexes and provides access to free legal materials from Australia and New Zealand.

hash.name: bepress Legal Repository
hash.title: bepress Legal Repository
hash.databasedescription: Contains a network of law-related working papers and research materials from law schools, research units, institutes, centers, think tanks, conferences, and learned societies.

hash.name: BestCase
hash.title: BestCase
hash.databasedescription: This database covers full text case law reports from Canada Law Book, as well as unreported decisions back to 1977, and case summaries and a case citator.

hash.name: Cambridge Law Reports
hash.title: Cambridge Law Reports
hash.databasedescription: Includes decisions of international courts and arbitrators, as well as judgements of national courts.

hash.name: Canada Statute Service
hash.title: Canada Statute Service
hash.databasedescription: This database includes the consolidated 1985 Revised Statutes of Canada, plus any new Acts (excluding the Income Tax Act), with a complete amendment history for each statute; all Regulations from the 1978 consolidation, plus any new Regulations; and history and case links to the Canada Statute Citator. It also includes repealed statutes.

hash.name: Canadian Health Facilities Law Guide
hash.title: Canadian Health Facilities Law Guide
hash.databasedescription: Includes full text of statutes as well as selected regulations relating to health care facilities (hospitals, nursing homes, etc.).

hash.name: Canadian Human Rights Reporter
hash.title: Canadian Human Rights Reporter
hash.databasedescription: CHRR Online (Canadian Human Rights Reporter) is a searchable database of human rights decisions from various boards, tribunals and courts. CHRR Online covers all jurisdictions in Canada, and includes the full text of decisions from 1980 to current. Also contains the full text of Human Rights Digest, 2006-present.

hash.name: Canadian Legal Information Institute
hash.title: Canadian Legal Information Institute
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to freely available Canadian legal material.

hash.name: Children in Armed Conflict
