meta.more-info: The UNICEF Innocenti Research Centre acts as a catalyst of this Network in association with the Istituto degli Innocenti, also in Florence. The European Network facilitates, contributes to, documents and disseminates multi-disciplinary research activities on children and armed conflict underway at Europe-based research institutions. This website hosts a database of research activities by partner institutions and seeks to facilitate the highlighting of areas where research has focussed, as well as clarifying knowledge gaps and potential areas for enhanced collaborative research.

hash.title: Children in Armed Conflict
hash.databasedescription:
The European Network for the Research Agenda on Children in Armed Conflict is an output of the international research seminar, "Filling the Knowledge Gaps: a Research Agenda on the Impact of Armed Conflict on Children", convened in Florence between 2 to 4 July 2001.
The UNICEF Innocenti Research Centre acts as a catalyst of this Network in association with the Istituto degli Innocenti, also in Florence. The European Network facilitates, contributes to, documents and disseminates multi-disciplinary research activities on children and armed conflict underway at Europe-based research institutions. This website hosts a database of research activities by partner institutions and seeks to facilitate the highlighting of areas where research has focussed, as well as clarifying knowledge gaps and potential areas for enhanced collaborative research.

hash.name: Civil Justice Clearinghouse
hash.title: Civil Justice Clearinghouse
hash.databasedescription: Created by the Canadian Forum on Civil Justice. Includes over 22,000 bibliographic records of published materials such as books, conference proceedings, and articles, as well as information on unpublished (or not previously published) materials, such as conference presentations, draft reports, project descriptions, evaluations, and policies. Where possible, full text documents are also included.

hash.name: CODICES

meta.more-info: A systematic thesaurus allows for easy access by topic to the summaries, constitutions and laws.

hash.title: CODICES
hash.databasedescription:
This database regularly reports on the case law of constitutional courts and courts of equivalent jurisdiction worldwide. Case law of the European Court of Justice and the Court of Justice of the European Communities is also included. In addition to the more than 5000 summaries of decisions in English and French, CODICES contains the full texts of the judgements in the original language or in translation, court descriptions, and laws on the courts and constitutions.
A systematic thesaurus allows for easy access by topic to the summaries, constitutions and laws.

hash.name: ComLaw

meta.more-info: It contains legislation of the Commonwealth of Australia and non self-governing Territories (and related material such as Reserved Commonwealth Laws, the Commonwealth of Australia Constitution Act and the Constitution (including ancillary documents) as well as Bills, explanatory memoranda/statements, tables, indexes and other finding aids).

hash.title: ComLaw
hash.databasedescription:
ComLaw is an integral part of the Australian Law Online initiative to bring low- or no-cost access to the law for the community and is maintained by the Australian Attorney-General's Department. Comlaw incorporates the Federal Register of Legislative Instruments (FRLI).
It contains legislation of the Commonwealth of Australia and non self-governing Territories (and related material such as Reserved Commonwealth Laws, the Commonwealth of Australia Constitution Act and the Constitution (including ancillary documents) as well as Bills, explanatory memoranda/statements, tables, indexes and other finding aids).

hash.name: Droit Francophone
hash.title: Droit Francophone
hash.databasedescription: Droit francophone provides free access through the Agence intergouvernementale de la Francophonie. It includes over 3500 hyperlinks, national and regional legal collections, and a search engine.

hash.name: Employment Insurance Jurisprudence Library
hash.title: Employment Insurance Jurisprudence Library
hash.databasedescription: Employment insurance jurisprudence: CUBs (Canadian Umpire Benefits), Federal Court decisions and Supreme Court decisions as well as a growing number of related Provincial Court and Human Rights Tribunal decisions.

hash.name: EmploymentSource
hash.title: EmploymentSource
hash.databasedescription: Employment and Labour Law.

hash.name: Estates&TrustsSource

meta.more-info:
In addition, access is also provided to the following sources:

CriminalSource provides search access to criminal,
constitutional, evidence, and immigration cases from all Canadian
jurisdictions.

Family Source provides search access to Canadian primary law as it relates to the family, including case law and legislation in Canada. As
well, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the
case comments from law reports and case summaries from the Canadian
Abridgment. Some highlights include Child Protection Law in Canada by
Bernstein, Canadian Divorce Law and Practice by MacDonald and Ferrier,
and Child Custody Law and Practice by McLeod. It also permits users to
note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the
KeyCiteCanada feature.

InsolvencySource provides search access to all
full text cases dealing with bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and
personal property security law in Canada. It also includes other primary
law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as
secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.

IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.

LawSource provides search access to Canadian primary
law-legislation and court decisions-from across the country.

SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.

As well, access to legal materials from the United States and United
Kingdom are located under the "US Premiere Service" and "UK Law" tabs.

hash.title: Estates&TrustsSource
hash.databasedescription:
Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.

hash.name: Family Law Reports
hash.title: Family Law Reports
hash.databasedescription: Contains reports of English family and child law cases. Covers topics like adoption, welfare of the child, and divorce. Updated quarterly.

hash.name: FamilySource

hash.name: Fatality Reports
hash.title: Fatality Reports
hash.databasedescription: Contains information about the circumstances surrounding occupationally related fatalities. Information is extracted from reports on inquests and inquiries into occupationally related fatalities across Canada.

hash.name: Foreign & International Law Resources Database
hash.title: Foreign & International Law Resources Database
hash.databasedescription: Contains international law publications, including publications of the American Society of International Law, prominent Yearbooks from around the world, and the Hague Permanent Court of International Justice series.

hash.name: Foreign Law Guide
hash.title: Foreign Law Guide
hash.databasedescription: Guide to literature on foreign law and materials on legal systems and jurisdictions.

hash.name: Global Courts
hash.title: Global Courts
hash.databasedescription: This portal provides access to Supreme Court decisions in 129 countries, or a way of finding the decisions. The list of countries include the Supreme Courts of the Australian Territories, the Canadian Provincial Courts of Appeals, the U,S. State Supreme Courts and the U.S. Court of Appeals, the Court of Justice of the European Communities and the Judicial Committee of the Privy Council of the United Kingdom.

hash.name: Global Legal Information Network
hash.title: Global Legal Information Network
hash.databasedescription: GLIN is a public database of laws, regulations, judicial decisions, and other complementary legal sources contributed by governmental agencies and international organizations from 40 countries. Approximately half of the abstracts in GLIN provide links to the full texts of the legislation, court decisions and other documents that are abstracted.Documents go back as far as the late 1700's.

hash.name: History of International Law
hash.title: History of International Law
hash.databasedescription: Includes full-text of documents dating back to 1690 on International Law subjects such as War and Peace, the Nuremberg Trials, Law of the Sea, International Arbitration, Hague Conferences and Conventions and more.

hash.name: Hong Kong Legal Information Institute
hash.title: Hong Kong Legal Information Institute
hash.databasedescription: Provides free access to legal information in Hong Kong and China.

hash.name: ICLR (The Incorporated Council of Law Reporting for England & Wales)
hash.title: ICLR (The Incorporated Council of Law Reporting for England & Wales)
hash.databasedescription:
Law reports from England and Wales. Includes the full text of the following law report series:


  • Business Law Reports
  • Industrial Cases Reports
  • The Law Reports
  • Public & Third Sector Law Reports
  • The Weekly Law Reports

hash.name: Index to Foreign Legal Periodicals (IFLP)

meta.more-info:
IFLP indexes journal articles, congress reports, essay collections, yearbooks, and book reviews. It encompasses all languages. Materials in Greek, Cyrillic and East Asian vernacular are Romanized according to Library of Congress standards; Arabic and Hebrew titles are translated into English and French.

Coverage begins in 1985.

hash.title: Index to Foreign Legal Periodicals (IFLP)
hash.databasedescription:
Index to Foreign Legal Periodicals (1985 to the present) provides access to legal literature worldwide, covering all forms of foreign (non-Anglo-American) law. This includes comparative law and legal systems, such as Islamic law, socialist law, public and private international law, and trans-nation commercial law. It also includes British and American publications concerning foreign law.
IFLP indexes journal articles, congress reports, essay collections, yearbooks, and book reviews. It encompasses all languages. Materials in Greek, Cyrillic and East Asian vernacular are Romanized according to Library of Congress standards; Arabic and Hebrew titles are translated into English and French.

Coverage begins in 1985.

hash.name: Indian Affairs: Laws and Treaties (U.S.)
hash.title: Indian Affairs: Laws and Treaties (U.S.)
hash.databasedescription: The Indian Affairs: Laws and Treaties is a seven volume compilation of U.S. treaties, laws and executive orders pertaining to Native American Indian tribes. The volumes cover U.S. Government treaties with Native Americans from 1778-1883 (Volume II) and U.S. laws and executive orders concerning Native Americans from 1871-1970 (Volumes I, III-VII). The work was first published in 1903-04 by the U.S. Government Printing Office.

hash.name: International Center for Not-for-Profit Law Online Library
hash.title: International Center for Not-for-Profit Law Online Library
hash.databasedescription: The ICNL's Online Library is a searchable directory of legal documents, court cases, reports and other civil society resources from countries around the world. Laws are arranged by country and include tax laws, laws of association, procurement, employment and others.

hash.name: International Court of Justice
hash.title: International Court of Justice
hash.databasedescription: This is the website for the International Court of Justice and the Permanent Court of International Justice, which is the principal judicial organ of the United Nations. This database contains the full text of the ICJ and PCIJ decisions back to 1922. It also contains additional information about the functioning of the Court, its history, its members, its judges and its registry.

hash.name: Inventory of Reforms
hash.title: Inventory of Reforms
hash.databasedescription: This database contains descriptions of civil justice system reform initiatives from across Canada, each described according to a standard format that includes information on the purpose, development, implementation, and evaluation of the reform.

hash.name: IPSource

meta.more-info:
In addition, access is also provided to the following sources:

CriminalSource provides search access to criminal,
constitutional, evidence, and immigration cases from all Canadian
jurisdictions.

Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.

Family Source provides search access to Canadian primary law as it
relates to the family, including case law and legislation in Canada. As
well, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the
case comments from law reports and case summaries from the Canadian
Abridgment. Some highlights include Child Protection Law in Canada by
Bernstein, Canadian Divorce Law and Practice by MacDonald and Ferrier,
and Child Custody Law and Practice by McLeod. It also permits users to
note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the
KeyCiteCanada feature.

Insolvency Source provides search access to all full text cases dealing
with bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property
security law in Canada. It also includes other primary law sources such
as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such
as the case comments from various law reports. Also included are
articles and court filings from the Insolvency Institute of Canada,
annotations from Canadian Bankruptcy Reports, and Houlden and Morawetz
Precedents under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act. It also permits
users to note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legislation, using the
KeyCiteCanada feature.

SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.ith bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property security law in Canada. It also includes other primary
law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as
secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.

LawSource provides search access to Canadian primary
law-legislation and court decisions-from across the country.

As well, access to legal materials from the United States and United
Kingdom are located under the "US Premiere Service" and "UK Law" tabs.

IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.

hash.name: Jones and Chipman's Index to Legal Periodical Literature (1786-1922)
hash.title: Jones and Chipman's Index to Legal Periodical Literature (1786-1922)
hash.databasedescription: Indexes 590 general periodical titles, 236 legal periodical titles and 67 Law Report Titles for the period 1786-1922.

hash.name: Justis.com
hash.title: Justis.com
hash.databasedescription: The Justis suite of databases contains U.K. case law and legislation from 13th century to date.

hash.name: Kluwer Law Online
hash.title: Kluwer Law Online
hash.databasedescription: Online journals from Kluwer Law.

hash.name: LabourSource
hash.title: LabourSource
hash.databasedescription: Labour Spectrum includes the complete text of the authoritative Brown & Beatty�s treatise Canadian Labour Arbitration as well as the full text of the Labour Arbitration Cases and Canadian Labour Arbitration Summaries. Cases cited in B&B are hyper-linked to the full-text reported version in the L.A.C.s.

hash.name: LawCentral Alberta
hash.title: LawCentral Alberta
hash.databasedescription: LawNet Alberta is a portal to law-related information and educational resources on justice and legal issues of interest to Albertans.

hash.name: LawCentral Canada
hash.title: LawCentral Canada
hash.databasedescription: LawNet Canada is a portal to law-related information and educational resources on justice and legal issues of interest to Canadians.

hash.name: LawCentral Français
hash.title: LawCentral Français
hash.databasedescription: LawNet Français est un portail ou une collection de liens vers des renseignements en matière juridique ainsi que des ressources éducatives concernant la justice et les enjeux juridiques d?intérêt pour les Canadiens.

hash.name: Laws Online
hash.title: Laws Online
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to the fulltext of current Statutes and Regulations of the Province of Alberta.

hash.name: WestlawNextCanada

meta.more-info:
Our WestlawNextCanada subscription provides access to legal materials from Canada, United States and the United Kingdom.

Once you have opened WestlawNextCanada, access Canadian legal materials by clicking on LawSource. LawSource provides comprehensive coverage of Canadian primary law - legislation and court decisions - from across the country and on all legal topics, as well as secondary source commentary on all areas of law, from a variety of Canadian legal journals, books, and other sources. Complementing the broad coverage of LawSource are a number of subject-specific "Sources" that bring together relevant materials on that topic, and may include specialized sources unique to that area of law that are not available through LawSource, currently as follows:
  • CriminalSource: criminal, constitutional, evidence, and immigration cases from all Canadian jurisdictions.
  • Estates&TrustsSource: estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.
  • FamilySource: family-related law, including case law and legislation in Canada, plus comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the case comments from law reports and case summaries from the Canadian Abridgment.
  • IPSource: legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.
  • InsolvencySource: bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property security law in Canada; other primary law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.
  • SecuritiesSource: regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; relevant legislation and regulations, forms, and policy documents, as well as relevant case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions, for topics such as bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property security law in Canada. Secondary source commentary and case comments from various law reports.
Once you have opened WestlawNextCanada, access United States and United Kingdom legal materials by clicking on the "International" tab, then "Westlaw International", then look in the tabs across top of page for US Premier Service and UK Law.
  • US Premier Service provides access to federal cases, legislation, forms and rules of court. As well, it contains state cases (not legislation), law journals fulltext, and fulltext of several key American treatises.
  • UK Law provides access to cases, statutes, and secondary source commentary for United Kingdom. Good representation of older UK cases.
(Please note: WestlawNextCanada's new faceted search interface is currently in use only for the Canadian products such as LawSource. US Premier Service and UK Law will continue to use the previous Westlaw interface until further notice.)

hash.name: LegalTrac
hash.title: LegalTrac
hash.databasedescription:
LegalTrac (1980 to the present) indexes articles in all major law
reviews, law journals, specialty law and bar association journals, and legal
newspapers on U.S. Federal and State Cases, Laws and Government Regulations,
Legal Practice, and legal subjects such as Taxation and International Law.
British Commonwealth and European Union cases and law are also included. This database also includes some full-text articles.

hash.name: LLMC Digital

meta.more-info: The collection as of early 2005 consisted of colonial and some post-confederation Canadian (federal and provincial) statutes and cases, U.S. federal (executive, legislative and judicial) material, and U.S. military law material. Much of the Canadian material is not available elsewhere in digital format. Detailed contents descriptions are available in the database and are updated as material is added to the collection.

hash.title: LLMC Digital
hash.databasedescription:
LLMC (Law Library Microform Consortium) Digital is a collection of digital materials that will grow over a planned ten year period beginning in 2003. The collection is of interest to researchers in law and history, comprising legal literature and government documents.
The collection as of early 2005 consisted of colonial and some post-confederation Canadian (federal and provincial) statutes and cases, U.S. federal (executive, legislative and judicial) material, and U.S. military law material. Much of the Canadian material is not available elsewhere in digital format. Detailed contents descriptions are available in the database and are updated as material is added to the collection.

hash.name: Martin's Online Criminal Code

meta.more-info:
Martin's Archival Criminal Code includes the full text of the following:
  • all versions of the Criminal Code dating back to 1955,
  • cross-references, synopses, and annotations from Martin's Annual Criminal Code dating back to 1955,
  • forms of charges dating back to 1970, and
  • cases referred to in Martin's case law annotations.

hash.title: Martin's Online Criminal Code
hash.databasedescription:
Provides access to the Criminal Code at a particular point in time, along with the corresponding commentary. Users can browse through previous versions of Martin's Annual Criminal Code, or search for a particular section or subsection at a specific date.
Martin's Archival Criminal Code includes the full text of the following:
  • all versions of the Criminal Code dating back to 1955,
  • cross-references, synopses, and annotations from Martin's Annual Criminal Code dating back to 1955,
  • forms of charges dating back to 1970, and
  • cases referred to in Martin's case law annotations.

hash.name: Mental Health Law Reports
hash.title: Mental Health Law Reports
hash.databasedescription: The Mental Health Law Reports is a new series from the United Kingdom dealing with a complex area of law that involves a statutory regime. Few cases involving mental health issues are reported elsewhere. This series includes the full text of cases on various aspects of mental health law from the High Court, Court of Appeal, and House of Lords, as well as approximately 30 cases per year from the European Court of Human Rights. Summaries are provided and commentary may also be included.

hash.name: National Criminal Justice Reference Service (U.S.)
hash.title: National Criminal Justice Reference Service (U.S.)
hash.databasedescription: NCJRS is a federally funded resource offering justice and substance abuse information to support research, policy, and program development worldwide.

hash.name: National Criminal Justice Reference Service Abstracts

meta.more-info: The NCJRS Abstracts Database contains summaries of over 174,000 U.S. and international publications, including federal, state, and local government reports, books, research reports, journal articles, audiovisual presentations, and unpublished research. The NCJRS Abstracts Database excludes most legal decisions, opinions, and statutes. The collection has been developed to meet the needs of criminal justice professionals, researchers, policymakers, and technical and legal experts. Unique elements of the collection include agency produced documents and final grant reports of Office of Justice Programs sponsored research. Documents are either written in English or have an English-language summary.

hash.title: National Criminal Justice Reference Service Abstracts
hash.databasedescription:
Published by the Office of Justice Programs, U.S. Department of Justice's National Criminal Justice Reference Service, an information clearinghouse for people around the U.S. and the world involved with research, policy, and practice related to criminal and juvenile justice, and drug control.
The NCJRS Abstracts Database contains summaries of over 174,000 U.S. and international publications, including federal, state, and local government reports, books, research reports, journal articles, audiovisual presentations, and unpublished research. The NCJRS Abstracts Database excludes most legal decisions, opinions, and statutes. The collection has been developed to meet the needs of criminal justice professionals, researchers, policymakers, and technical and legal experts. Unique elements of the collection include agency produced documents and final grant reports of Office of Justice Programs sponsored research. Documents are either written in English or have an English-language summary.

hash.name: NATLEX (International Labour Organization)
hash.title: NATLEX (International Labour Organization)
hash.databasedescription: A bibliographic database that contains information on national laws on labour, social security and related human rights.

hash.name: New Zealand Legal Information Institute
hash.title: New Zealand Legal Information Institute
hash.databasedescription: Includes 21 databases that cover almost all significant New Zealand Courts and Tribunals, bilateral treaties, law reform reports,four law journals, and also now includes the New Zealand Acts.

hash.name: O'Brien's Encyclopedia of Forms
hash.title: O'Brien's Encyclopedia of Forms
hash.databasedescription: This database provides samples of common Canadian legal documents, forms that are legislated by statute or regulation, and also some materials that have evolved through common use to become accepted standards.

hash.name: Oxford Reports on International Law

meta.more-info:
It includes the following modules:
  • ICL (International Criminal Law)
  • IHR (International Human Rights Law) includes decisions from international courts and dispute settlement bodies, including the UN Committee Against Torture, the UN Human Rights Committee, the European Court of Human Rights, the African Commission on Human and Peoples Rights, UN Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women, and the UN Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination.
  • IIC (International Investment Claims)
  • ILDC (International Law in Domestic Courts) is a repository of domestic cases in international law from over 60 jurisdictions. The cases include expert commentary, full texts of judgments in their original language and translations of key passages of non-English judgments into English.
  • ICGJ (International Courts of General Jurisdiction) provides coverage of all contentious and advisory cases from the International Court of Justice and permanent Court of International Justice.
  • Oxford Law Citator links together materials that mention or discuss each other, and provides further information on all references within these materials to judicial and arbitral decisions, treaties and conventions, domestic legislation, instruments, and secondary materials.

hash.title: Oxford Reports on International Law
hash.databasedescription:
Oxford Reports on International Law provides coverage of international case law from international courts and tribunals, domestic courts and ad hoc tribunals.
It includes the following modules:

  • ICL (International Criminal Law)
  • IHR (International Human Rights Law) includes decisions from international courts and dispute settlement bodies, including the UN Committee Against Torture, the UN Human Rights Committee, the European Court of Human Rights, the African Commission on Human and Peoples Rights, UN Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women, and the UN Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination.
  • IIC (International Investment Claims)
  • ILDC (International Law in Domestic Courts) is a repository of domestic cases in international law from over 60 jurisdictions. The cases include expert commentary, full texts of judgments in their original language and translations of key passages of non-English judgments into English.
  • ICGJ (International Courts of General Jurisdiction) provides coverage of all contentious and advisory cases from the International Court of Justice and permanent Court of International Justice.
  • Oxford Law Citator links together materials that mention or discuss each other, and provides further information on all references within these materials to judicial and arbitral decisions, treaties and conventions, domestic legislation, instruments, and secondary materials.

hash.name: Pacific Islands Legal Information Institute
hash.title: Pacific Islands Legal Information Institute
hash.databasedescription: Provides free access to legal information in countries in the Pacific.

hash.name: QP LegalEze
hash.title: QP LegalEze
hash.databasedescription: Statutes, regulations, orders in council, bills, rules of court and the British Columbia Gazette Parts I and II are included in this B. C. Queen's Printer database.

hash.name: QP Source Professional
hash.title: QP Source Professional
hash.databasedescription: QP Source Professional is a fully searchable database of the current text of Alberta's statutes, regulations, and Rules of Court. It also includes the Alberta Gazette (1996 to present) and Orders-in-Council (1996 to present),Tables of Public and Private Statutes, and the Index of Regulations, as well as a variety of other legislative tools, e.g. annotated FOIPP.

hash.name: Quicklaw
hash.title: Quicklaw
hash.databasedescription: Quicklaw (QL) contains up-to-date case decisions and legislation from every province and territory of Canada, including unreported cases, as well as expert commentary, legal journal articles, current legal news services, and case history information.

hash.name: Southern Africa Legal Information Institute
hash.title: Southern Africa Legal Information Institute
hash.databasedescription: Provides free access to legal information in Southern Africa.

hash.name: State Trials

meta.more-info: The database is based on two two of the most authoritative series of State Trials, Howell’s/Cobbett’s State Trials (1163–1822) and the New Series (Macdonell’s) (1822–1858), as well as additional material sourced from National Collections and the English (Nominate) Reports.

hash.title: State Trials
hash.databasedescription:
British trials from 1163-1858, featuring treason, political crimes, murder and mayhem. Many of the trials feature noted historical figures, e.g., King Henry VIII’s divorce from Catherine of Aragon, the trial and dying speech of Anne Boleyn, trials of various Ministers of the Crown, etc.
The database is based on two two of the most authoritative series of State Trials, Howell’s/Cobbett’s State Trials (1163–1822) and the New Series (Macdonell’s) (1822–1858), as well as additional material sourced from National Collections and the English (Nominate) Reports.

hash.name: The Hague Academy Collected Courses Online
hash.title: The Hague Academy Collected Courses Online
hash.databasedescription: Electronic version of the longstanding book series on international law: Collected Courses of the Hague Academy of International Law.

hash.name: The Making of Modern Law: Foreign Primary Sources, 1600-1970
hash.title: The Making of Modern Law: Foreign Primary Sources, 1600-1970
hash.databasedescription: Complements the collection of treatises found in Foreign, Comparative and International Law 1600-1926. Provides an interpretive analysis with books on codes, the "primary sources" of law.

hash.name: Thomson Reuters Proview
hash.title: Thomson Reuters Proview
hash.databasedescription: Thomson Reuters Proview provides access to a number of Thomson legal publications.

hash.name: UK Statute Law Database
hash.title: UK Statute Law Database
hash.databasedescription: The UK Statute Law Database (SLD) is the official revised edition of the primary legislation of the United Kingdom made available online.

hash.name: UK Statutes and Statutory Instruments

meta.more-info:
Contents comprise:

  • Acts of Parliament (United Kingdom) from 1707 to present
  • Acts of Parliament (Scotland) from 1999 to present
  • Acts of the Northern Ireland Assembly from 2000
  • Church Assembly and General Synod Measures from 1920 to present
  • Acts of Parliament (England) from 1235 to 1706
  • Statutory instruments from 1 January 1987 to the present, including those issued by the Scottish Parliament
  • Statutory Instruments Archive contains all SIs issued prior to 1987, all modern-style SIs published since 1949, together with the legislation published in Statutory Rules & Orders and Statutory Instruments Revised to December 31, 1948, which was published by HMSO in 1950.

hash.title: UK Statutes and Statutory Instruments
hash.databasedescription:
UK Statutes and Statutory Instruments (SIs): The text of U.K. (England, Wales & Scotland) acts from 1235 forward appear as enacted, with links to amended and amending legislation. he SIs database provides full text, tables, diagrams and maps.
Contents comprise:

  • Acts of Parliament (United Kingdom) from 1707 to present
  • Acts of Parliament (Scotland) from 1999 to present
  • Acts of the Northern Ireland Assembly from 2000
  • Church Assembly and General Synod Measures from 1920 to present
  • Acts of Parliament (England) from 1235 to 1706
  • Statutory instruments from 1 January 1987 to the present, including those issued by the Scottish Parliament
  • Statutory Instruments Archive contains all SIs issued prior to 1987, all modern-style SIs published since 1949, together with the legislation published in Statutory Rules & Orders and Statutory Instruments Revised to December 31, 1948, which was published by HMSO in 1950.

hash.name: UK Treaties Online
hash.title: UK Treaties Online
hash.databasedescription: This service allows you to access details of 14,000 treaties involving the UK. Information on the treaties includes: place of signature, entry into force date, and which States or organizations participate in them. This database also contains links to the texts of Command Papers published in the Treaty Series from 1892 to 1996 inclusive.

hash.name: UNBISnet : UN Bibliographic Information System

meta.more-info: UNBISnet coverage is primarily from 1979 onward, however, more and more older documents are being added to the catalogue on a regular basis as a result of retrospective conversion and ongoing digitization efforts in the UN Dag Hammarskjöld Library. It should also be noted that UNBISnet provides instant access to a growing number of full text resources in the six official languages (Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish). Links to full text of resolutions adopted by the General Assembly, the Economic and Social Council and the Security Council, going back to 1946, are included.

hash.title: UNBISnet : UN Bibliographic Information System
hash.databasedescription:
Catalogue of United Nations documentation and publications indexed by the United Nations Dag Hammarskjöld Library and the Library of the UN Office at Geneva. Also included are commercial publications and other non-United Nations sources held in New York and Geneva's collections.
UNBISnet coverage is primarily from 1979 onward, however, more and more older documents are being added to the catalogue on a regular basis as a result of retrospective conversion and ongoing digitization efforts in the UN Dag Hammarskjöld Library. It should also be noted that UNBISnet provides instant access to a growing number of full text resources in the six official languages (Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish). Links to full text of resolutions adopted by the General Assembly, the Economic and Social Council and the Security Council, going back to 1946, are included.

hash.name: United Nations Treaty Collection
hash.title: United Nations Treaty Collection
hash.databasedescription: http://treaties.un.org/

hash.name: World Law Reform
hash.title: World Law Reform
hash.databasedescription: Previously issued on microform, World Law Reform contains law reform publications from 37 jurisdictions.

hash.name: World Legal Information Institute
hash.title: World Legal Information Institute
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to freely available world-wide legal information.

law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as
secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.

SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.ith bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property security law in Canada. It also includes other primary law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.

Our LawSource subscription also provides access to legal materials from
the United States and United Kingdom under the "US Premier Service" and
"UK Law" tabs.

hash.title: LawSource
hash.databasedescription:
LawSource provides search access to Canadian primary law - legislation and court decisions - from across the country. As well, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the case comments from law reports, the entire Canadian Encyclopedic Digest and case sum¬maries from the Canadian Abridgment.
It also permits users to note-up (i.e. update) both cases and legis¬lation, using the KeyCiteCanada feature.

In addition, access is also provided to the following sources:

CriminalSource provides search access to criminal,constitutional, evidence, and immigration cases from all Canadian jurisdictions.

Estates&TrustsSource provides search access to primary law sources for estates and trusts law, and secondary legal materials such as the leading treatises, articles, articles, case comments and newsletters.

FamilySource provides search access to Canadian primary law
as it relates to the family, including case law and legislation in Canada. As well, it contains comprehensive secondary legal materials, such as the case comments from law reports and case summaries from the Canadian Abridgment.

IPSource provides search access to legislation and regulations in the areas of intellectual property, information technology and electronic-commerce law, as well as commentary, treatises, journal articles and current awareness tools.

InsolvencySource provides search access to all full
text cases dealing with bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and
personal property security law in Canada. It also includes other primary
law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as
secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.

SecuritiesSource provides search access to regulatory material from securities commissions, stock exchanges, and other self-regulating organizations; legislation and related regulations and forms; case law, rulings and commentary from all Canadian jurisdictions.ith bankruptcy, insolvency, restructuring and personal property security law in Canada. It also includes other primary law sources such as legislation and policy documents, as well as secondary sources such as the case comments from various law reports.

Our LawSource subscription also provides access to legal materials from
the United States and United Kingdom under the "US Premier Service" and
"UK Law" tabs.

hash.name: Library & Information Science Source
hash.title: Library & Information Science Source
hash.databasedescription: Library & Information Science Source covers all aspects of librarianship and information science, and provides comprehensive coverage of the history of library studies. It includes, but is not limited to, material formerly in Library Literature & Information Science and Library, Information Science & Technology Abstracts.

hash.name: LISA: Library & Information Science Abstracts
hash.title: LISA: Library & Information Science Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Indexes and abstracts over 440 periodicals in the fields of library and information sciences.

hash.name: Cambridge Journals Online
hash.title: Cambridge Journals Online
hash.databasedescription: Contains fulltext of journals published by Cambridge University Press.

hash.name: ComDisDome
hash.title: ComDisDome
hash.databasedescription: Provides citations to books, journal articles, and web resources in the field of communication disorders.

hash.name: International Children's Digital Library
hash.title: International Children's Digital Library
hash.databasedescription: Includes thousands of contemporary and historical children's books in a large number of languages.

hash.name: Voice (Vienna-Oxford International Corpus of English)
hash.title: Voice (Vienna-Oxford International Corpus of English)
hash.databasedescription: VOICE, the Vienna-Oxford International Corpus of English, is a structured collection of language data, the first computer-readable corpus capturing spoken ELF (English as a lingua franca) interactions of this kind. VOICE Online is available as a free-of-charge resource for non-commercial research purposes in two different formats: VOICE Online and VOICE XML.

hash.name: Gale Directory Library
hash.title: Gale Directory Library
hash.databasedescription: Gale directories on companies, publishers, associations and more.

hash.name: ASM Alloy Center Online

meta.more-info:
The Alloy Center contains five content areas:

  1. Alloy Finder: Alloy designations and trade names from around the world. Find key information, including composition, producer, tensile properties, and similar alloys.
  2. Materials Property Data: Mechanical properties, physical properties, and processing characteristics for most industrially important alloys. Find data plotted over a range of temperatures.
  3. Coatings Data: Detailed information for commercial coating processes. Search by trade name, manufacturer, process type, coating type, or key words.
  4. Corrosion Data: Corrosion information for specific alloys in specific environments. Search by alloy or environment.
  5. Data Sheets & Diagrams: Thousands of documents in PDF format, including material data sheets from Alloy Digest and other ASM publications; heat treating data sheets from the Heat Treater's Guides; and time-temperature curves, creep curves, and fatigue curves from ASM atlas publications. All organized by alloy and fully searchable.

hash.title: ASM Alloy Center Online
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for brief description below about ASM Alloy Center Online
The Alloy Center contains five content areas:

  1. Alloy Finder: Alloy designations and trade names from around the world. Find key information, including composition, producer, tensile properties, and similar alloys.
  2. Materials Property Data: Mechanical properties, physical properties, and processing characteristics for most industrially important alloys. Find data plotted over a range of temperatures.
  3. Coatings Data: Detailed information for commercial coating processes. Search by trade name, manufacturer, process type, coating type, or key words.
  4. Corrosion Data: Corrosion information for specific alloys in specific environments. Search by alloy or environment.
  5. Data Sheets & Diagrams: Thousands of documents in PDF format, including material data sheets from Alloy Digest and other ASM publications; heat treating data sheets from the Heat Treater's Guides; and time-temperature curves, creep curves, and fatigue curves from ASM atlas publications. All organized by alloy and fully searchable.

hash.name: ASM Handbooks Online

meta.more-info: Access to the 21-volume set, with coverage as follows: v. 1. Properties and selection--irons, steels, and high-performance alloys -- v. 2. Properties and selection: nonferrous alloys and special purpose-materials -- v. 3. Alloy phase diagrams -- v. 4. Heat treating -- v. 5. Surface engineering -- v. 6. Welding, brazing, and soldering -- v. 7. Powder metal technologies and applications -- v. 8. Mechanical testing and evaluation -- v. 9. Metallography and microstructures -- v. 10. Materials characterization -- v. 11. Failure analysis and prevention -- v. 12. Fractography -- v. 13. Corrosion -- v. 13A: Corrosion: Fundamentals, Testing, and Protection -- v. 14. Forming and forging -- v. 15. Casting -- v. 16. Machining -- v. 17. Nondestructive evaluation and quality control -- v. 18. Friction, lubrication, and wear technology -- v. 19. Fatigue and fracture -- v. 20. Materials selection and design -- v21. Composites. Access is also include to two ASM Desk Editions: The Metals Handbook and Engineered Materials Handbook.

hash.title: ASM Handbooks Online
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for brief description below.
Access to the 21-volume set, with coverage as follows: v. 1. Properties and selection--irons, steels, and high-performance alloys -- v. 2. Properties and selection: nonferrous alloys and special purpose-materials -- v. 3. Alloy phase diagrams -- v. 4. Heat treating -- v. 5. Surface engineering -- v. 6. hash.name: ASTM Standards and Engineering Digital Library

meta.more-info: Please note: Access to ASTM Standards is available here

hash.title: ASTM Standards and Engineering Digital Library
hash.databasedescription:
The ASTM Standards and Engineering Digital Library provides access to nearly all published ASTM International books and papers. Over 1000 books and 30,000 papers are available. The Digital Library includes over 945 ASTM Special Technical Publications and >50 manuals and monographs. ASTM Standards are also accessible here.


Please note: Access to ASTM Standards is available here

hash.name: Corrosion Survey Database

meta.more-info: The database provides a cost-effective method for quickly reducing the field of choice of construction materials for particular applications, based on corrosion behavior and chemical resistance. Users can easily obtain a given material's performance for the concentration and temperature of a specified exposure medium.

hash.title: Corrosion Survey Database
hash.databasedescription:
This database is the online version of NACE COR·SUR and COR·SUR 2 for Windows databases and companion volumes, Corrosion Data Survey - Metals Section (6th ed.) and Corrosion Data Survey - Nonmetals Section (5th ed.). The data document the performance of 87 metal and nonmetal materials in over 1500 different chemical environments, under various exposure conditions.
The database provides a cost-effective method for quickly reducing the field of choice of construction materials for particular applications, based on corrosion behavior and chemical resistance. Users can easily obtain a given material's performance for the concentration and temperature of a specified exposure medium.

hash.name: MRS Online Proceedings Library
hash.title: MRS Online Proceedings Library
hash.databasedescription: Includes all proceedings published by the Materials Research Society beginning with the proceedings of the 1980 MRS Meeting.

hash.name: Phase Equilibria Diagrams Online
hash.title: Phase Equilibria Diagrams Online
hash.databasedescription: Includes evaluated phase diagrams for ceramic systems.

hash.name: SPIE Digital Library
hash.title: SPIE Digital Library
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext of journals and conference proceedings from the SPIE (International Society for Optical Engineering).

hash.name: arXiv.org
hash.title: arXiv.org
hash.databasedescription: arXiv.org is an electronic archive and distribution server for open access research papers in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Quantitative Biology and Statistics.

hash.name: Cornell University Library Historical Math Monographs
hash.title: Cornell University Library Historical Math Monographs
hash.databasedescription: Consists of over 500 books that were scanned from originals held by the Cornell University Library.

hash.name: Euclid Prime
hash.title: Euclid Prime
hash.databasedescription: Euclid Prime provides access to journals from scholarly and independent publishers in the fields of theoretical and applied mathematics and statistics.

hash.name: Lecture Notes in Mathematics
hash.title: Lecture Notes in Mathematics
hash.databasedescription:
Fulltext of electronically published titles from
Springer's Lecture Notes in Mathematics series.

hash.name: MATHnetBASE
hash.title: MATHnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Full-text handbooks and monographs topics include algebra, algebraic geometry & number theory, applied maths, combinatorics & discrete maths, differential equations & non-linearity, general and introductory maths, geometry and topology, mathematical modeling, mathematics for: biology & medicine, engineering and mathematical physics, and finance, numerical analysis & mathematical computation, probability theory & applications, and real, complex & functional analysis.

hash.name: STATSnetBASE
hash.title: STATSnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Full-text handbooks and monographs covering topics including biostatistcs, enviromental statistics, probability theory & applications, reference statistics & collected works, SPC/reliability/quality control, statistical genetics & bioinformatics, statistical theory & methods, statistics & computing, and statistics for biological sciences, business & finance, engineering and physical science, and psychology, social science & law.

hash.name: ASME (American Society for Mechanical Engineers) Conference Proceedings
hash.title: ASME (American Society for Mechanical Engineers) Conference Proceedings
hash.databasedescription: Conference proceedings and papers from the American Society of Mechanical Engineers. Coverage is from 2002-present. Capabilities include browsing by conference series and name, volume title, areas of interest, and technology/industry group, as well as comprehensive search and open access to abstract level data.

hash.name: Begell Digital Library
hash.title: Begell Digital Library
hash.databasedescription: Contains a network of law-related working papers and research materials from law schools, research units, institutes, centers, think tanks, conferences, and learned societies.

hash.name: SAE Digital Library

meta.more-info: PLEASE NOTE: Only the full-text of SAE Technical Papers is available from 1998 to the present.

hash.title: SAE Digital Library
hash.databasedescription:
The SAE Digital Library references thousands of SAE Technical Papers and SAE Standards, covering the latest advances and research in all areas of mobility engineering including ground vehicle, aerospace, off-highway, and manufacturing technology. Sample coverage includes fuels and lubricants, emissions, electronics, brakes, restraint systems, noise, engines, materials, lighting, and more.



PLEASE NOTE: Only the full-text of SAE Technical Papers is available from 1998 to the present.

hash.name: THERMOPEDIA™
hash.title: THERMOPEDIA™
hash.databasedescription: THERMOPEDIA™ is a gateway to resources and short articles on heat and mass transfer, fluid flow and thermodynamics. All THERMOPEDIA™ articles are full text and presented online in HTML with 3D Max features, animations, and films of experimental data. THERMOPEDIA™ articles are arranged by scientific and engineering areas and are interlinked to related topics. Please note that Thermopedia is still being developed, so some entries are not yet complete.

hash.name: JAMA Evidence
hash.title: JAMA Evidence
hash.databasedescription: Provides guides to the systematic consideration of the validity, importance, and applicability of claims about the assessment of health problems and the outcomes of health care.

hash.name: The Medical Letter

meta.more-info:
The Medical Letter database includes the following components:
  1. The Medical Letter on Drugs and Therapeutics, containing articles from 1988 to date, updated biweekly.
  2. Treatment Guidelines from The Medical Letter, from September 2002 to date, updated monthly
  3. Adverse Drug Interactions Program, an evidence-based proprietary database allowing searches for drug interactions between two and up to 50 drugs, with management recommendations and references to the literature, updated every six months
  4. Drugs of Choice, a handbook of articles on drugs of choice, and alternatives, for treatment of frequently-encountered illnesses
  5. Handbook of Antimicrobial Therapy, a handbook with similar content
  6. Patient Education Brochures, presenting summaries of treatment options, for use by patients

hash.title: The Medical Letter
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for brief description below
The Medical Letter database includes the following components:
  1. The Medical Letter on Drugs and Therapeutics, containing articles from 1988 to date, updated biweekly.
  2. Treatment Guidelines from The Medical Letter, from September 2002 to date, updated monthly
  3. Adverse Drug Interactions Program, an evidence-based proprietary database allowing searches for drug interactions between two and up to 50 drugs, with management recommendations and references to the literature, updated every six months
  4. Drugs of Choice, a handbook of articles on drugs of choice, and alternatives, for treatment of frequently-encountered illnesses
  5. Handbook of Antimicrobial Therapy, a handbook with similar content
  6. Patient Education Brochures, presenting summaries of treatment options, for use by patients

hash.name: AJOL: African Journals Online
hash.title: AJOL: African Journals Online
hash.databasedescription: AJOL is a database of African-published journals, publishing in a range of academic disciplines.

hash.name: African Language Materials Archive
hash.title: African Language Materials Archive
hash.databasedescription: The African Language Materials Archive (ALMA) is an initiative of The West African Research Association (WARA), the Council of American Overseas Research Centers (CAORC), Columbia University Libraries--African Studies, and the Information Society Division of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). This initiative aims at increasing dissemination of, and access to materials published in indigenous African languages through digital formats.

hash.name: African Women's Bibliographic Database
hash.title: African Women's Bibliographic Database
hash.databasedescription:
Contains over 22,000 citations from 1986 to current. This database is the outgrowth of a three volume work published in 1989 by Greenwood Press that indexed materials on African Women published
during the International Women's Decade, 1975-1985.

hash.name: AllAfrica.com
hash.title: AllAfrica.com
hash.databasedescription: Provides African news and information. Posts stories daily in English and French, and offers a diversity of multi-lingual streaming programming. Also includes a searchable archive (which includes the archive of Africa News Service dating from 1997).

hash.name: Aluka Collections
hash.title: Aluka Collections
hash.databasedescription: Aluka is an international, collaborative initiative building an online digital library of scholarly resources from and about Africa. ‘Aluka’, is derived from a Zulu word meaning ‘to weave’, reflecting Aluka’s commitment to connect resources and scholars from around the world. In 2008, Aluka united with JSTOR, a not-for-profit organization building trusted digital archives for the global scholarly community.

hash.name: American Bibliography of Slavic and East European Studies (ABSEES)
hash.title: American Bibliography of Slavic and East European Studies (ABSEES)
hash.databasedescription:
ABSEES Online is the electronic version of The American Bibliography of
Slavic and East European Studies. It covers scholarly publications on
East-Central Europe, Russia, and the former Soviet Union published in the United
States and Canada from 1990 to the present. It contains bibliographic records
for journal articles, books, book chapters, book reviews, dissertations and
selected government documents.

hash.name: Arab-Israeli Relations 1917-1970
hash.title: Arab-Israeli Relations 1917-1970
hash.databasedescription: Provides original source material from the Foreign Office, Colonial Office, War Office and Cabinet Papers from the 1917 Balfour Declaration through to the Black September war of 1970-1.

hash.name: Confidential Print : Middle East, 1839-1969
hash.title: Confidential Print : Middle East, 1839-1969
hash.databasedescription: Papers generated by the Foreign and Colonial Offices, from one page letters or telegrams to large volumes or texts of treaties. All items marked "Confidential Print" were printed and circulated immediately to leading officials in the Foreign Office, to the Cabinet, and to Heads of British missions abroad.

hash.name: Confidential Print: Africa, 1834-1966
hash.title: Confidential Print: Africa, 1834-1966
hash.databasedescription: Papers generated by the Foreign and Colonial Offices, from one page letters or telegrams to large volumes or texts of treaties. All items marked "Confidential Print" were printed and circulated immediately to leading officials in the Foreign Office, to the Cabinet, and to Heads of British missions abroad.

hash.name: European Bibliography of Slavic and East European Studies (EBSEES)

meta.more-info:
The Bibliography comprises books, journal articles, reviews and theses
in social sciences, language, literature and the arts. EBSEES is the European
equivalent of The American Bibliography of Slavic and East European Studies
(ABSEES).

hash.title: European Bibliography of Slavic and East European Studies (EBSEES)
hash.databasedescription:
The European Bibliography of Slavic and East European Studies (EBSEES)
indexes scholarly publications on Eastern Europe, Russia, and the former Soviet
Union. EBSEES covers materials published in Austria, Belgium, Finland, France,
Germany, the Netherlands, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom from 1990 to 2007.
The Bibliography comprises books, journal articles, reviews and theses
in social sciences, language, literature and the arts. EBSEES is the European
equivalent of The American Bibliography of Slavic and East European Studies
(ABSEES).

hash.name: Middle East Research Journals (MERJ) Project
hash.title: Middle East Research Journals (MERJ) Project
hash.databasedescription: Includes journals published in the Middle East.

hash.name: Middle Eastern & Central Asian Studies
hash.title: Middle Eastern & Central Asian Studies
hash.databasedescription: Middle Eastern & Central Asian Studies is a systematic and non-evaluative bibliographic index of research, policy and scholarly discourse on the countries and peoples of the Middle East, Central Asia and North Africa. Database coverage spans from 1900 and earlier to present.

hash.name: Military & Government Collection
hash.title: Military & Government Collection
hash.databasedescription: Provides full text from over 300 military and general interest publications. Designed to bring current news to all branches of the military. This database also offers indexing and abstracts for over 300 magazines. This database is updated weekly on EBSCOhost.

hash.name: OACIS for the Middle East
hash.title: OACIS for the Middle East

hash.name: Oxford Islamic Studies Online

meta.more-info: Users can refine the rich array of content to search and browse by era, topic, and geographic region, filter to view a specific type of content, and make use of a variety of search forms to set criteria for locating biographical entries, bibliographic references, primary sources, terms in the Qur'an and Concordance, and much more.

hash.title: Oxford Islamic Studies Online
hash.databasedescription:
Oxford Islamic Studies Online features reference content and commentary by scholars in areas such as global Islamic history, concepts, people, practices, politics, and culture, and will be regularly updated as new content is commissioned and approved.Encompasses A-Z reference entries, chapters from scholarly and introductory works, Qur'anic materials, primary sources, images, and timelines.
Users can refine the rich array of content to search and browse by era, topic, and geographic region, filter to view a specific type of content, and make use of a variety of search forms to set criteria for locating biographical entries, bibliographic references, primary sources, terms in the Qur'an and Concordance, and much more.

hash.name: South African National Bibliography
hash.title: South African National Bibliography
hash.databasedescription: A searchable database of the SANB, a comprehensive record of South Africa�s published documentary heritage includes monographs, pamphlets, government publications, microforms, maps, electronic media, videos, periodicals, newspapers, published conference proceedings, South African standards and specifications, etc. Select SANB from the drop down menu on the left to limit the search to the SANB. The advanced search options allow users to limit searchs by year of publication.

hash.name: API (American Petroleum Institute) Standards

meta.more-info: The API Collection includes active documents written, published and copyrighted by API. Publications include manuals, standards, specifications, recommended practices, bulletins, guidelines and technical reports. Documents with a status of inactive/revised or inactive/withdrawn are not included in this service.

hash.title: API (American Petroleum Institute) Standards
hash.databasedescription:
API (American Petroleum Institute) Publications address several key aspects of the oil and gas industry, including exploration and production; refining; fire protection and safety; petroleum measurement; and marine transportation. API documents reference equipment, materials, offshore production, drilling, transportation, structural pipe, valves, pipeline, storage tanks, nomenclature, refinery operations, inspection, health/environmental issues, and more.
The API Collection includes active documents written, published and copyrighted by API. Publications include manuals, standards, specifications, recommended practices, bulletins, guidelines and technical reports. Documents with a status of inactive/revised or inactive/withdrawn are not included in this service.

hash.name: CrossFire (Beilstein/Gmelin Handbook)

meta.more-info:
CrossFire Beilstein indexes three primary data domains: substances, reactions, and literature. The substance domain stores structural information with all associated facts and literature references, including chemical, physical, and bioactivity data. The reaction domain details the preparation of substances, enabling scientists to investigate specific reaction pathways with reaction search queries. The literature domain includes citations, titles, and abstracts, which are hyperlinked to the substance and reaction domain entries.

The CrossFire Gmelin database is the world's most comprehensive data collection in organometallic and inorganic chemistry, covering literature from the year 1772 to today.

The database contains 1.6 million compounds, 1.3 million structures, 1.3 million reactions, and 900,000 citations, including titles and abstracts from 1995. CrossFire Gmelin is fully searchable by structures, substructures, and reactions. The data are indexed from 62 journals (PDF: 129 KB). With simple queries, more than 800 chemical and physical data fields, including electric, magnetic, thermal, crystal, and physiological data can be accessed to provide relevant answer sets.

CrossFire Gmelin answers informatics needs in the material science, catalyst, and semiconductor industries. CrossFire Gmelin also complements CrossFire Beilstein with organometallic and inorganic content

hash.title: CrossFire (Beilstein/Gmelin Handbook)
hash.databasedescription:
The CrossFire Beilstein database is the world's largest compilation of chemical facts. As the cornerstone database to organic chemistry, the CrossFire Beilstein database is essential for generating new leads, planning synthetic routes (including starting materials and intermediates), determining bioactivity and physical properties, and ascertaining the environmental fates of compounds.


CrossFire Beilstein indexes three primary data domains: substances, reactions, and literature. The substance domain stores structural information with all associated facts and literature references, including chemical, physical, and bioactivity data. The reaction domain details the preparation of substances, enabling scientists to investigate specific reaction pathways with reaction search queries. The literature domain includes citations, titles, and abstracts, which are hyperlinked to the substance and reaction domain entries.

The CrossFire Gmelin database is the world's most comprehensive data collection in organometallic and inorganic chemistry, covering literature from the year 1772 to today.

The database contains 1.6 million compounds, 1.3 million structures, 1.3 million reactions, and 900,000 citations, including titles and abstracts from 1995. CrossFire Gmelin is fully searchable by structures, substructures, and reactions. The data are indexed from 62 journals (PDF: 129 KB). With simple queries, more than 800 chemical and physical data fields, including electric, magnetic, thermal, crystal, and physiological data can be accessed to provide relevant answer sets.

CrossFire Gmelin answers informatics needs in the material science, catalyst, and semiconductor industries. CrossFire Gmelin also complements CrossFire Beilstein with organometallic and inorganic content

hash.name: Data Metallogenica

meta.more-info: • Deposit summaries, deposit descriptions, typical cross-sections, map and image galleries, district overviews, and exploration case histories. University theses are also being included.

hash.title: Data Metallogenica
hash.databasedescription:
Data Metallogenica on-line is a database for global mineral deposits with image and text files containing:



  • Digital images of mini-specimens and photographs of individual samples from representative deposits.
  • Interpreted mineral reflectance (PIMA) spectra of epithermal and porphyry deposits, together with selected other deposit styles.


  • Deposit summaries, deposit descriptions, typical cross-sections, map and image galleries, district overviews, and exploration case histories. University theses are also being included.

hash.name: Music Industry Data
hash.title: Music Industry Data
hash.databasedescription: Academic Charts Online (ACO) includes popular music charts from around the world, including charts from Billboard magazine in the US going back 60 years. Analytical tools enable scholars to compare artists in time and place, and derive important research work.

hash.name: Canadian Music Periodical Index
hash.title: Canadian Music Periodical Index
hash.databasedescription: Provides bibliographic sources for information on all aspects of musical activity in Canada. Updated monthly.

hash.name: Classical Music in Video
hash.title: Classical Music in Video
hash.databasedescription: Includes performances of all forms of classical music, including orchestral performances, chamber music, oratorio, and solo performances, along with masterclasses and interviews with master teachers.

hash.name: Classical Music Reference Library
hash.title: Classical Music Reference Library
hash.databasedescription: Classical Music Reference Library brings together more than 30,000 pages of essential reference materials, spanning the entire history of Western classical music, in a unified online database. Included are the authoritative reference titles Baker's Dictionary of Music, Baker's Biographical Dictionary of Musicians, and Baker's Student Encyclopedia of Music, which are available for the first time in electronic form. This release includes 26,774 essays and images from 22 sources, over 15,001 pages.

hash.name: Classical Scores Library
hash.title: Classical Scores Library
hash.databasedescription: Classical Scores Library contains classical music scores, manuscripts, and previously unpublished material. Users can access multiple types of scores across various composers, genres, and time periods. It contains full scores, study scores, piano and vocal scores, as well as piano reductions. All opera, vocal, and choral texts are rekeyed to allow for deep searching and textual analysis.

hash.name: DRAM (Database of Recorded American Music)
hash.title: DRAM (Database of Recorded American Music)
hash.databasedescription: DRAM provides on-demand streaming access to CD-quality audio, complete original liner notes and essays from independent record labels and sound archives.

hash.name: Index to Printed Music
hash.title: Index to Printed Music
hash.databasedescription: The Index to Printed Music indexes individual pieces of music printed in standard scholarly editions. The music included is published in sets and series organized by composer (Complete works: Gesamtausgaben), geographical area (Monuments: Denkmäler), time or style period, original source (usually manuscript), and anthologies.

hash.name: International Music Score Library Project
hash.title: International Music Score Library Project
hash.databasedescription: The International Music Score Library Project is a virtual library of over 100,000 public domain music scores.

hash.name: Jazz Music Library
hash.title: Jazz Music Library
hash.databasedescription: Jazz Music Library is under development. It includes a large number of jazz artists, ensembles, albums, and genres.

hash.name: Latin American Choral Music
hash.title: Latin American Choral Music

hash.name: MetOpera On Demand
hash.title: MetOpera On Demand
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to performances of the Metropolitan Opera.

hash.name: Music Online [Alexander Street Press]
hash.title: Music Online [Alexander Street Press]
hash.databasedescription: Music Online allows users cross search all of the music databases published by Alexander Street Press.

hash.name: Oxford Music Online
hash.title: Oxford Music Online
hash.databasedescription:
Encyclopedic coverage of music and musicians.


Comprises Grove Music Online, the Oxford Dictionary of Music and the Oxford Companion to Music.

hash.name: PAMA (Performing Arts Medicine Association) Bibliography

meta.more-info: The list is mostly confined to the English language, although numerous articles in French and German are included as well. The compilers attempt to provide citations that are as complete and correct as possible. The bibliography is periodically updated, but the compilers make no claim of total comprehensiveness, nor of accuracy of citations. PAMA does not have the capability to make copies of articles in the bibliography; those interested should attempt to find the desired references through a college, university or public library, or an interlibrary loan. This project is currently a cooperative effort between the PAMA's Research Committee and the Medical and Chirurgical Faculty of Maryland.

hash.title: PAMA (Performing Arts Medicine Association) Bibliography
hash.databasedescription:
This bibliography focuses on the health problems of instrumental and vocal musicians, dancers and actors. It consists of citations from the medical, musical, and popular literature, with emphasis on clinical problems and relevant basic science in performing arts medicine. There are some references on alternative therapies, such as Alexander, Feldenkrais, etc.
The list is mostly confined to the English language, although numerous articles in French and German are included as well. The compilers attempt to provide citations that are as complete and correct as possible. The bibliography is periodically updated, but the compilers make no claim of total comprehensiveness, nor of accuracy of citations. PAMA does not have the capability to make copies of articles in the bibliography; those interested should attempt to find the desired references through a college, university or public library, or an interlibrary loan. This project is currently a cooperative effort between the PAMA's Research Committee and the Medical and Chirurgical Faculty of Maryland.

hash.name: Répertoire International d'Iconographie Musicale (RIdIM)

meta.more-info: Database records contain descriptions of visual objects featuring music and dance-related topics or content. Whenever possible, links to online images of the art artwork are included. The scope of visual documents and artifacts contained in the database encompasses a wide spectrum of techniques and media (drawings, engravings, paintings, sculpture, etc.) and the content includes depictions of instruments, musicians, performers, music patrons, music notation, performance venues and more.

hash.title: Répertoire International d'Iconographie Musicale (RIdIM)
hash.databasedescription:
The RIdIM database is designed to facilitate discovery of music iconography images by registered researchers, and the description of such images by registered cataloguers. The database is web-based and platform independent, and access will be free of charge to scholars affiliated with academic institutions, galleries, museums, etc., as well as independent researchers
Database records contain descriptions of visual objects featuring music and dance-related topics or content. Whenever possible, links to online images of the art artwork are included. The scope of visual documents and artifacts contained in the database encompasses a wide spectrum of techniques and media (drawings, engravings, paintings, sculpture, etc.) and the content includes depictions of instruments, musicians, performers, music patrons, music notation, performance venues and more.

hash.name: RILM Abstracts of Music Literature

meta.more-info: Over 500 scholarly journals are represented. Articles, books, bibliographies, catalogues, conference proceedings, discographies, dissertations, Festschriften, films, and videos are all covered by RILM. Concert reviews, recording notes, and pedagogical manuals are included if they are of scholarly interest. Includes RILM Retrospective Abstracts of Music Literature.

hash.title: RILM Abstracts of Music Literature
hash.databasedescription:
Published by Répertoire International de Littérature Musicale, New York. Contains records in over 100 languages; entries include original-language titles, title translations in English, full bibliographic information, and abstracts in English, as well as author, journal, and in-depth subject indexes.
Over 500 scholarly journals are represented. Articles, books, bibliographies, catalogues, conference proceedings, discographies, dissertations, Festschriften, films, and videos are all covered by RILM. Concert reviews, recording notes, and pedagogical manuals are included if they are of scholarly interest. Includes RILM Retrospective Abstracts of Music Literature.

hash.name: RIPM Retrospective Index to Music Periodicals
hash.title: RIPM Retrospective Index to Music Periodicals
hash.databasedescription: International coverage of the music periodical literature published from the late 18th- to mid-20th- centuries in Europe and the United States. Chronologically complements coverage available in RILM Abstracts of Music Literature

hash.name: Rock and Roll, Counterculture, Peace and Protest: Popular Culture in Britain and America, 1950-1975
hash.title: Rock and Roll, Counterculture, Peace and Protest: Popular Culture in Britain and America, 1950-1975
hash.databasedescription: Includes colour images of manuscript and rare printed material as well as photographs, ephemera and memorabilia from the period of social, political and cultural change between 1950 and 1975.

hash.name: Rock's Backpages
hash.title: Rock's Backpages
hash.databasedescription: Contains full text articles and other information on and about rock music.

hash.name: Slovak Early Music Database: Cantus Planus in Slovacia
hash.title: Slovak Early Music Database: Cantus Planus in Slovacia
hash.databasedescription: Slovak Early Music Database - Cantus Planus in Slovacia allows free and universal access to a large number of manuscripts with musical notation, written before c. 1600, kept at many different libraries and archives in Slovakia. Every manuscript is given in full-color reproduction and entered with a general description. Fragments , Selected codices with monophonic or polyphonic music are fully indexed. There are many search capabilities which are immediately available to a visitor.

hash.name: The Folk Song Index
hash.title: The Folk Song Index
hash.databasedescription: An index to traditional folk songs of the world with an emphasis on English-language songs. Each entry includes the song title, first line of chorus, first line of verse, and full bibliographic information on the source. The index contains over 62,000 entries, and, to date indexes over 2,400 anthologies.

hash.name: The Garland Encyclopedia of World Music Online
hash.title: The Garland Encyclopedia of World Music Online
hash.databasedescription: The Garland Encyclopedia of World Music Online focuses on world music, and aims to cover music of all the world's peoples. The first release of the online version includes the complete contents of the the 10 volume print set. Future releases will contain more indexing as well as links to the associated audio examples for each volume.

hash.name: The Music Index
hash.title: The Music Index
hash.databasedescription: Indexes over 655 international music periodicals offering access to historiographic, ethnographic, and musicological data. Subjects covered include past and present personalities, the history of music, forms and types of music, musical instruments from the earliest times to modern electronic instruments, plus computer produced music. In addition, book reviews, reviews of music recordings, tapes, and performances are indexed. First performances and obituaries are noted.

hash.name: medici.tv
hash.title: medici.tv
hash.databasedescription: Medici.tv is an online platform for streaming classical music videos. The catalogue consists of approximately 1500 features related to baroque, classical, romantic, modern and contemporary music. Several types of program are available: operas, concerts, ballets, archives and documentaries, as well as hundreds of events which are broadcast live. Replays are available for several weeks after each live event.

hash.name: American Song

meta.more-info:
The first release includes music from many labels, including Rounder Records, McNeil Music, Native Ground Music, Rebel Records, County Records, Smithsonian Folkways, and Document Records.
