American Song will become the definitive source for American roots music and pre-1960 American popular music. It encompasses the great American musical genres including country, folk, bluegrass, Western, old time, American Indian, blues, gospel, and shape note singing - combined with powerful recordings by artists such as Woody Guthrie, Pete Seeger, Peggy Seeger, Si Kahn, Lead Belly, Sleepy LaBeef, the New Lost City Ramblers, Otis Clay, Eddy "The Chief" Clearwater, Nanci Griffith, The Lilly Brothers, Merle Travis, and many others.


Liner notes to all the albums are included (in PDF format) as well as static URLs to each track and album in the database.

hash.title: American Song
hash.databasedescription:
American Song is a history database that will contain 50,000 tracks from America's past. The database will include songs by and about American Indians, miners, immigrants, slaves, children, pioneers, and cowboys. Included in the database are the songs of Civil Rights, political campaigns, Prohibition, the Revolutionary War, the Civil War, anti-war protests and more.


The first release includes music from many labels, including Rounder Records, McNeil Music, Native Ground Music, Rebel Records, County Records, Smithsonian Folkways, and Document Records. American Song will become the definitive source for American roots music and pre-1960 American popular music. It encompasses the great American musical genres including country, folk, bluegrass, Western, old time, American Indian, blues, gospel, and shape note singing - combined with powerful recordings by artists such as Woody Guthrie, Pete Seeger, Peggy Seeger, Si Kahn, Lead Belly, Sleepy LaBeef, the New Lost City Ramblers, Otis Clay, Eddy "The Chief" Clearwater, Nanci Griffith, The Lilly Brothers, Merle Travis, and many others.


Liner notes to all the albums are included (in PDF format) as well as static URLs to each track and album in the database.

hash.name: Classical Music Library
hash.title: Classical Music Library
hash.databasedescription: Classical Music Library provides streaming audio from a multi-label database of recordings. It is specifically designed for listening and learning in libraries.

hash.name: Doctoral Dissertations in Musicology
hash.title: Doctoral Dissertations in Musicology
hash.databasedescription: Contains bibliographic records for completed dissertations and new dissertation topics in the fields of musicology, music theory, and ethnomusicology, as well as in related musical, scientific, and humanistic disciplines. Includes contents of the earlier printed editions of Doctoral Dissertations in Musicology.

hash.name: 2001 Community Profiles
hash.title: 2001 Community Profiles
hash.databasedescription: 2001 Community Profiles contains statistical data from the 2001 Canadian Census of Population conducted by Statistics Canada. A statistical profile is presented for 6,000 Canadian communities, highlighting education, income, work, families, dwellings, and general population demographics. See also 2006 Community Profiles.

hash.name: Circumpolar Health Bibliographic Database (CHBD)
hash.title: Circumpolar Health Bibliographic Database (CHBD)
hash.databasedescription: The database, a project of the Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) Team in Circumpolar Chronic Disease Prevention, contains more than 3100 records describing publications about all aspects of human health in the circumpolar region. All types of publications, both peer-reviewed and grey literature, are included.

hash.name: Inuvialuit Settlement Region Database

meta.more-info: The Inuvialuit Settlement Region Database is a subset of the ASTIS database. The Inuvialuit Settlement Region Database covers all aspects of the ISR, including the earth sciences, the life sciences, engineering and technology, renewable and non-renewable resources, co-management, land use, people, government, economic and social conditions, archaeology, history, art and literature.

hash.title: Inuvialuit Settlement Region Database
hash.databasedescription:
The Inuvialuit Settlement Region Database contains descriptions of publications and research projects about the Inuvialuit Settlement Region (ISR).
The Inuvialuit Settlement Region Database is a subset of the ASTIS database. The Inuvialuit Settlement Region Database covers all aspects of the ISR, including the earth sciences, the life sciences, engineering and technology, renewable and non-renewable resources, co-management, land use, people, government, economic and social conditions, archaeology, history, art and literature.

hash.name: Native Health Databases

meta.more-info:
Contents:
  • Native Health History Database: Citations and abstracts for information dating from 1652 to approximately 1966.
  • Native Health Research Database: Citations and abstracts for information dating from 1966 to the present.

hash.title: Native Health Databases
hash.databasedescription:
Contains bibliographic information and abstracts of health-related articles, reports, surveys, and other resource documents pertaining to the health and health care of American Indians, Alaska Natives, and Canadian First Nations. The databases provide information for the benefit, use, and education of organizations and individuals with an interest in health-related issues, programs, and initiatives regarding North American indigenous peoples.
Contents:
  • Native Health History Database: Citations and abstracts for information dating from 1652 to approximately 1966.
  • Native Health Research Database: Citations and abstracts for information dating from 1966 to the present.

hash.name: Nunavik Bibliography
hash.title: Nunavik Bibliography
hash.databasedescription: The Nunavik Bibliography is a cooperative long-term project to build a comprehensive bibliographic database about northern Quebec.

hash.name: Nunivaat: the Nunavik Socioeconomic Database
hash.title: Nunivaat: the Nunavik Socioeconomic Database
hash.databasedescription: The objective of the Nunivaat database is to establish a permanent, public and independent databank concerning the socioeconomic situation of Nunavik. Sources Nunivaat data comes from Statistics Canada, the Institut de la statistique du Québec as well as various government databanks. Nunivaat also comprises data from special studies, most of which were carried out under the Nunivaat program. The data is accessible on the statistics page.The full studies are available on publications page.

hash.name: Prince of Wales Northern Heritage Centre Databases
hash.title: Prince of Wales Northern Heritage Centre Databases
hash.databasedescription: There are currently four databases which researchers can use to access the resources of the Division. There is a photographic database with 20,000 images, an NWT Archives database which has descriptions of most of the holdings of the Territorial Archives, a Place Names database which has information on approximately 11,000 official names for geographical features as well as populated places. Finally a sound database provides some access to the NWT Archives sound holdings.

hash.name: African American Newspapers 1827-1998
hash.title: African American Newspapers 1827-1998
hash.databasedescription: African American Newspapers published from 1827-1998.

hash.name: British Columbia Historical Newspapers
hash.title: British Columbia Historical Newspapers
hash.databasedescription: This collection features over 134 years of newspapers culled from towns large, small, and in-between from around British Columbia. Digitized by the University of British Columbia, the events covered here include logging festivals, news of new roadways, and information about international affairs.

hash.name: California Digital Newspaper Collection
hash.title: California Digital Newspaper Collection
hash.databasedescription: Several dozen California newspapers, fulltext, primarily but not exclusively from the nineteenth century.

hash.name: Daily Mail Historical Archive, 1896-2004
hash.title: Daily Mail Historical Archive, 1896-2004
hash.databasedescription: Includes archive of The Daily Mail since 1896. As well as providing access to the regular edition of this path-breaking newspaper, the archive also contains the Atlantic Editions, printed on board the transatlantic cruise liners between 1923 and 1931.

hash.name: Independent Voices: An Open Access Collection of Alternative Presses
hash.title: Independent Voices: An Open Access Collection of Alternative Presses
hash.databasedescription: Independent Voices is a four-year project to digitize magazines, journals and newspapers of the alternative press archives of participating libraries.

hash.name: Northern News Services Online
hash.title: Northern News Services Online
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to news stories from a number of newspapers in Northern Canada.

hash.name: Pravda
hash.title: Pravda
hash.databasedescription: The newspaper Pravda was the most important newspaper of the Soviet era, and it still plays a significant role in today's post-soviet Russia. The archive features full-text and full-image of the original print pages, including not only articles, but photos, cartoons, and advertisements.

hash.name: Shen Bao
hash.title: Shen Bao
hash.databasedescription: Published in Shanghai from April 1872 to May 1949, the Chinese daily newspaper Shen Bao preserves the history of the transition of China from late Qing to the republican era. This full text database provides both digitized text and the corresponding newspaper images.

hash.name: Sunday Times Digital Archive
hash.title: Sunday Times Digital Archive
hash.databasedescription: Full text of the Sunday Times newspaper.

hash.name: Ukrainian Publications (UDB-UKR)

meta.more-info:
Provides access to the eight bibliographies that constitute the Ukrainian national bibliography published by Knyzhkova palata Ukrainy (Ukrainian Book Chamber):
  • Litopys avtoreferativ dysertatsii
  • Litopys hazetnykh statei
  • Litopys knyh
  • Litopys kartografichnykh vydan'
  • Litopys not
  • Litopys obrazotvorchykh vydan'
  • Litopys retsenzii
  • Litopys zhurnal'nykh statei

hash.title: Ukrainian Publications (UDB-UKR)
hash.databasedescription:
Ukrainian publications (UDB-UKR) is a full text database of newspapers and magazines of Ukraine published in Ukrainian, English, and Russian. Also includes news wire reports and other products of Ukrainian news agencies.
Provides access to the eight bibliographies that constitute the Ukrainian national bibliography published by Knyzhkova palata Ukrainy (Ukrainian Book Chamber):
  • Litopys avtoreferativ dysertatsii
  • Litopys hazetnykh statei
  • Litopys knyh
  • Litopys kartografichnykh vydan'
  • Litopys not
  • Litopys obrazotvorchykh vydan'
  • Litopys retsenzii
  • Litopys zhurnal'nykh statei

hash.name: Vestnord
hash.title: Vestnord
hash.databasedescription: Vestnord is a digital library of newspapers and periodicals from the Faroe Islands, Greenland and Iceland from the years 1773 to 2001.

hash.name: Wall Street Journal (1889 - 1997)
hash.title: Wall Street Journal (1889 - 1997)
hash.databasedescription: The Wall Street Journal (1889-1997) includes full page and article images with searchable full text back to the first issue.

hash.name: Waterloo Directory of English Newspapers and Periodicals, 1800-1900
hash.title: Waterloo Directory of English Newspapers and Periodicals, 1800-1900
hash.databasedescription: The Waterloo Directory of English Newspapers and Periodicals, 1800-1900 is a subject-inclusive bibliography that intends to include every periodical and newspaper published on a regular basis, from daily to annually, in every language, within England from 1800-1900.

hash.name: Global Health

meta.more-info:
Global Health provides an alternative, complementary point of reference with a broad analysis of foreign language journals, books, research reports, patents and standards, dissertations, conference proceedings, annual reports, public health, developing country information, and other difficult to obtain material.

The Global Health database covers the following aspects of human health and disease:
  • communicable diseases (including HIV/AIDS)
  • tropical diseases, i.e, diseases in the tropics (including field and experimental studies)
  • parasitic diseases and parasitology - medical entomology
  • human nutrition (including food composition, food poisoning, effects of diet on health, nutritional disorders, and experimental aspects)
  • community and public health (including chronic diseases, occupational health, health status indicators, the impact of agriculture on health, and cancer epidemiology)
  • medicinal and poisonous plants (including pharmacology, tissue culture, animal studies, plant composition, allergens, and toxins)

hash.title: Global Health
hash.databasedescription:
Global Health brings together the resources of two databases - the Public Health and Tropical Medicine (PHTM) database, previously produced by the Bureau of Hygiene and Tropical Diseases (BHTD), and the human health and diseases information extracted from CAB ABSTRACTS. Coverage extends from 1910 to current.
Global Health provides an alternative, complementary point of reference with a broad analysis of foreign language journals, books, research reports, patents and standards, dissertations, conference proceedings, annual reports, public health, developing country information, and other difficult to obtain material.

The Global Health database covers the following aspects of human health and disease:
  • communicable diseases (including HIV/AIDS)
  • tropical diseases, i.e, diseases in the tropics (including field and experimental studies)
  • parasitic diseases and parasitology - medical entomology
  • human nutrition (including food composition, food poisoning, effects of diet on health, nutritional disorders, and experimental aspects)
  • community and public health (including chronic diseases, occupational health, health status indicators, the impact of agriculture on health, and cancer epidemiology)
  • medicinal and poisonous plants (including pharmacology, tissue culture, animal studies, plant composition, allergens, and toxins)

hash.name: Health Source: Consumer Edition

meta.more-info: Provides information on consumer health topics including the medical sciences, food sciences and nutrition, childcare, sports medicine and general health. Updated on a daily basis.

hash.title: Health Source: Consumer Edition
hash.databasedescription:
Provides information on consumer health topics including the medical sciences, food sciences and nutrition, childcare, sports medicine and general health. Updated on a daily basis.
Provides information on consumer health topics including the medical sciences, food sciences and nutrition, childcare, sports medicine and general health. Updated on a daily basis.

hash.name: MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations

meta.more-info:
Because of the lack of indexing in MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations, searchers will only be able to conduct text word searches of this database.


MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations is updated as information is provided to Ovid by the National Library of Medicine -- normally, on a daily basis.

Records in MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations will eventually be indexed with MeSH headings and other descriptors and be added to the MEDLINE database. MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations records are added to MEDLINE on a weekly basis.

For a description of the subject coverage of MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations and MEDLINE see MEDLINE (More Info).

hash.title: MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations
hash.databasedescription:
MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations contains in-process records that will eventually be added to MEDLINE. Records in MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations contain the bibliographic description (title, author, source, date) and the abstract (if available) of the article but MeSH headings and other descriptors (e.g. check-tags and publication type tags) will not yet have been added to the record.
Because of the lack of indexing in MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations, searchers will only be able to conduct text word searches of this database.


MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations is updated as information is provided to Ovid by the National Library of Medicine -- normally, on a daily basis.

Records in MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations will eventually be indexed with MeSH headings and other descriptors and be added to the MEDLINE database. MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations records are added to MEDLINE on a weekly basis.

For a description of the subject coverage of MEDLINE In-Process & Other Non-Indexed Citations and MEDLINE see MEDLINE (More Info).

hash.name: CCRIS: Chemical Carcinogenesis Research Information System

meta.more-info: It contains some 8000 chemical records with carcinogenicity, mutagenicity, tumor promotion, and tumor inhibition test results. Data are derived from studies cited in primary journals, current awareness tools, NCI reports, and other special sources. Test results have been reviewed by experts in carcinogenesis and mutagenesis."

hash.title: CCRIS: Chemical Carcinogenesis Research Information System
hash.databasedescription:
Fact Sheet Chemical Carcinogenesis Research Information System (CCRIS®) Defined
CCRIS is a toxicology data file of the National Library of Medicine's (NLM) Toxicology Data Network (TOXNET®). It is a scientifically evaluated and fully referenced data bank, developed and maintained by the National Cancer Institute (NCI).
It contains some 8000 chemical records with carcinogenicity, mutagenicity, tumor promotion, and tumor inhibition test results. Data are derived from studies cited in primary journals, current awareness tools, NCI reports, and other special sources. Test results have been reviewed by experts in carcinogenesis and mutagenesis."

hash.name: International Toxicity Estimates for Risk
hash.title: International Toxicity Estimates for Risk
hash.databasedescription: ITER is compiled by Toxicology Excellence for Risk Assessment (TERA), and contains data in support of human health risk assessments.

hash.name: IRIS: Integrated Risk Information System

meta.more-info: It contains data in support of human health risk assessment. It is compiled by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and contains over 500 chemical records. IRIS data, focusing on hazard identification and dose-response assessment, is reviewed by work groups of EPA scientists and represents EPA consensus. Among the key data provided in IRIS are EPA carcinogen classifications, unit risks, slope factors, oral reference doses, and inhalation reference concentrations.

hash.title: IRIS: Integrated Risk Information System
hash.databasedescription:
"IRIS is a toxicology data file on the National Library of Medicine's (NLM) Toxicology Data Network (TOXNET®)."
It contains data in support of human health risk assessment. It is compiled by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and contains over 500 chemical records. IRIS data, focusing on hazard identification and dose-response assessment, is reviewed by work groups of EPA scientists and represents EPA consensus. Among the key data provided in IRIS are EPA carcinogen classifications, unit risks, slope factors, oral reference doses, and inhalation reference concentrations.

hash.name: OSH References Collection

meta.more-info:
It contains detailed summaries of over 200,000 articles, reports and publications, spanning over 100 years. OSHLINE™ complements the coverage of NIOSHTIC®, which was discontinued in mid-1998.
  • NIOSHTIC®
  • HSELINE - Produced by the UK Health and Safety Executive, HSELINE provides over 184,000 citations with abstracts to worldwide literature on occupational safety and health. Coverage of all UK Health and Safety Commission and Health and Safety Executive publications as well as a wide range of periodicals, books, conference proceedings, reports, and legislation. Predominantly oriented towards safety and industrial hazards, with an emphasis on Engineering, Manufacturing, Railways, Hazardous substances, Occupational Hygiene, Offshore safety, Agriculture, Mining.

hash.title: OSH References Collection
hash.databasedescription:
OSHLINE provides comprehensive international coverage of documents on occupational health and safety, as well as related fields.
It contains detailed summaries of over 200,000 articles, reports and publications, spanning over 100 years. OSHLINE™ complements the coverage of NIOSHTIC®, which was discontinued in mid-1998.
  • NIOSHTIC®
  • HSELINE - Produced by the UK Health and Safety Executive, HSELINE provides over 184,000 citations with abstracts to worldwide literature on occupational safety and health. Coverage of all UK Health and Safety Commission and Health and Safety Executive publications as well as a wide range of periodicals, books, conference proceedings, reports, and legislation. Predominantly oriented towards safety and industrial hazards, with an emphasis on Engineering, Manufacturing, Railways, Hazardous substances, Occupational Hygiene, Offshore safety, Agriculture, Mining.

hash.name: RehabData

meta.more-info: The types of documents described in REHABDATA include research reports, books, journal articles, and audiovisual materials.

hash.title: RehabData
hash.databasedescription:
REHABDATA, produced by the National Rehabilitation Information Center, is the leading literature database on disability and rehabilitation. The main file, 1993-present, describes over 12,000 documents covering physical, mental, and psychiatric disabilities, independent living, vocational rehabilitation, special education, assistive technology, law, employment, and other issues as they relate to people with disabilities.
The types of documents described in REHABDATA include research reports, books, journal articles, and audiovisual materials.

hash.name: CIRRIE Database of International Rehabilitation Research
hash.title: CIRRIE Database of International Rehabilitation Research
hash.databasedescription: The CIRRIE Database covers literature on disability and rehabilitation. It includes only published materials that concern research conducted outside of the United States. For research conducted within the United States, please search NARIC's REHABDATA Literature Database.

hash.name: Health Technology Assessment Database
hash.title: Health Technology Assessment Database
hash.databasedescription: Select "HTA". Healthcare technology assessments produced by the Centre for Reviews and Dissemination (CRD) in England in collaboration with the International Network of Agencies for Health Technology Assessment (INAHTA) based in Sweden.

hash.name: NHS Economic Evaluation Database
hash.title: NHS Economic Evaluation Database
hash.databasedescription: Information on costs and cost-effectiveness of drugs, treatments and procedures, systematically identifying and describing economic evaluations, appraising their quality and highlighting their relative strengths and weaknesses.

hash.name: PsycBITE Psychological Database for Brain Impairment Treatment Efficacy
hash.title: PsycBITE Psychological Database for Brain Impairment Treatment Efficacy
hash.databasedescription: Systematic reviews and controlled trials containing empirical data about treatment efficacy for acquired brain impairment, reviewed and rated for validity and quality.

hash.name: PDQ (Physician Data Query)
hash.title: PDQ (Physician Data Query)
hash.databasedescription: PDQ (Physician Data Query) is the National Cancer Institute's comprehensive cancer database. It contains peer-reviewed summaries on cancer treatment, screening, prevention, genetics, and supportive care; a registry of approximately 1,800 open and 12,000 closed cancer clinical trials from around the world; and directories of physicians, professionals who provide genetics services, and organizations that provide cancer care.

hash.name: Atlas of Ophthalmology: Online Multimedia Database
hash.title: Atlas of Ophthalmology: Online Multimedia Database
hash.databasedescription: Searchable database of ophthalmologic images.

hash.name: Drug Product Database (DPD)

meta.more-info: It contains approximately 20,000 marketed products. Information available in the database includes Brand Name, DIN, Company, Ingredient(s), Route of Administration, Pharmaceutical Form, Package Sizes, Therapeutic Classification, Pharmaceutical Standard and Veterinary Species. TPP recently completed an enhancement to the Drug Product Database which provides for the grouping of products based on active ingredients.

hash.title: Drug Product Database (DPD)
hash.databasedescription:
The DPD contains product specific information on drugs approved for use in Canada. The database is managed by the Therapeutic Products Programme and includes human, veterinary and disinfectant products.
It contains approximately 20,000 marketed products. Information available in the database includes Brand Name, DIN, Company, Ingredient(s), Route of Administration, Pharmaceutical Form, Package Sizes, Therapeutic Classification, Pharmaceutical Standard and Veterinary Species. TPP recently completed an enhancement to the Drug Product Database which provides for the grouping of products based on active ingredients.

hash.name: DrugBank
hash.title: DrugBank
hash.databasedescription: The DrugBank database is a bioinformatics and cheminformatics resource that combines detailed drug (i.e. chemical, pharmacological and pharmaceutical) data with comprehensive drug target (i.e. sequence, structure, and pathway) information.

hash.name: Methods in Organic Synthesis Online

meta.more-info: Each monthly update to MOS Online contains over 200 items presented as reaction schemes, title and bibliographic details, and is indexed by Author, Product, Reaction, Reactant and Reagent.

hash.title: Methods in Organic Synthesis Online
hash.databasedescription:
MOS online provides quick, cost-effective access to important new developments in organic synthesis. It covers such topics as new reactions and reagents, functional group changes, the introduction of chiral centres, and enzyme and biological transformations. Items are selected for inclusion in MOS only where there is detail of novel or interesting features in organic synthetic methods so that there are no routine preparations to plough through.
Each monthly update to MOS Online contains over 200 items presented as reaction schemes, title and bibliographic details, and is indexed by Author, Product, Reaction, Reactant and Reagent.

hash.name: Lexicomp
hash.title: Lexicomp
hash.databasedescription: Lexi-Comp is a comprehensive drug information tool for use at the point of care. It contains clinical modules with information about drug interactions, identification, calculations, toxicology, and patient education. The indexes provide current generic and brand names for drugs used in the United States, Canada, and internationally for adult, paediatric, and geriatric populations. Natural product, infectious disease, and lab test information is also included.

hash.name: Parenteral Drug Manual

meta.more-info: Detailed information is found in the Parenteral Manual Usage Guidelines document. Information sources for the parenteral monographs include (but are not limited to) the CPS, manufacturers' product monographs, Pediatric Dosage Handbook (Taketomo et al.), Neofax, and Trissel's Tables - exact references are noted in each monograph at the end of the document and a detailed comprehensive reference list is provided.

hash.title: Parenteral Drug Manual
hash.databasedescription:
A convenient and accessible reference for health care professionals involved with parenteral drug administration. The Parenteral Manual provides information on drug-specific policies within Alberta Health Services - Edmonton area, dosing, administration/monitoring guidelines, indications/contraindications, and Y-site compatibility information.
Detailed information is found in the Parenteral Manual Usage Guidelines document. Information sources for the parenteral monographs include (but are not limited to) the CPS, manufacturers' product monographs, Pediatric Dosage Handbook (Taketomo et al.), Neofax, and Trissel's Tables - exact references are noted in each monograph at the end of the document and a detailed comprehensive reference list is provided.

hash.name: RxFiles
hash.title: RxFiles
hash.databasedescription: RxFiles is an academic detailing program providing objective, comparative drug information to physicians, pharmacists and allied health professionals.

hash.name: e-CPS see RxTx
hash.title: e-CPS see RxTx
hash.databasedescription: RxTx (formerly e-Therapeutics+) integrates content from CPhA's Therapeutic Choices and e-CPS (online version of Compendium of Pharmaceuticals and Specialties or CPS). It is augmented by a wide and continuously growing range of external references to create a centralized drug resource for drug therapy information.

hash.name: POIESIS: Philosophy Online Serials
hash.title: POIESIS: Philosophy Online Serials
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to the full text of a number of philosophy journals, many of which are not available electronically from any other service.

hash.name: Religion and Philosophy Collection
hash.title: Religion and Philosophy Collection
hash.databasedescription: Indexes and provides access to the full-text of a number of journals in the areas of Religion and Philosophy. Topics covered include world religions, major denominations, biblical studies, religious history, epistemology, political philosophy, philosophy of language, moral philosophy and the history of philosophy.

hash.name: Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy
hash.title: Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy
hash.databasedescription: Comprehensive encyclopedia of philosophy, including Anglo-American, ethical and political, cross-cultural, interdisciplinary, continental and contemporary philosophy.

hash.name: Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy
hash.title: Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy
hash.databasedescription: When complete, the Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy will cover all areas of philosophy.

hash.name: Intelex Past Masters
hash.title: Intelex Past Masters
hash.databasedescription: Includes full text of books and collections of texts in the humanities.

hash.name: International Philosophical Bibliography
hash.title: International Philosophical Bibliography
hash.databasedescription:
International Philosophical Bibliography is the successor of:



  1. Répertoire bibliographique de la philosophie, which has appeared quarterly since May 1934 as a supplement of the Revue néoscolastique de philosophie (renamed Revue philosophique de Louvain, in 1946), and
  2. Bibliografisch Repertorium van de Wijsbegeerte, which has appeared as part of the Tijdschrift voor Filosofie, since 1939.

hash.name: PhilPapers: Philosophical Research Online

meta.more-info:
PhilPapers is an online research hub in philosophy that combines the following four services:
  1. A publication index of philosophy journal articles, book reviews, books, and book chapters in all languages.
  2. An open access aggregator that indexes open access philosophical content found on over one thousand open access archives and three thousand personal pages maintained by professional philosophers.
  3. An open access archive that hosts the largest collection of open access philosophical material on the Internet (OAI-PMH handler here).
  4. A structured bibliography comprising nearly five thousand subcategories covering all subjects in philosophy.

hash.title: PhilPapers: Philosophical Research Online
hash.databasedescription:
PhilPapers is an online research hub in philosophy and click on "more" below for further information.
PhilPapers is an online research hub in philosophy that combines the following four services:
  1. A publication index of philosophy journal articles, book reviews, books, and book chapters in all languages.
  2. An open access aggregator that indexes open access philosophical content found on over one thousand open access archives and three thousand personal pages maintained by professional philosophers.
  3. An open access archive that hosts the largest collection of open access philosophical material on the Internet (OAI-PMH handler here).
  4. A structured bibliography comprising nearly five thousand subcategories covering all subjects in philosophy.

hash.name: healthevidence.org
hash.title: healthevidence.org
hash.databasedescription: A database of studies intended to "facilitate the adoption and implementation of effective policies/programs/interventions at the local and regional public health decision-making levels across Canada"

hash.name: Lecture Notes in Physics
hash.title: Lecture Notes in Physics
hash.databasedescription: Fulltext of electronically published titles from Springer's Lecture Notes in Physics series.

hash.name: NANOnetBASE
hash.title: NANOnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Online, full-text handbooks covering topics in nanoscience and nanotechnology.

hash.name: PHYSICSnetBASE
hash.title: PHYSICSnetBASE
hash.databasedescription: Online, full-text handbooks covering topics in physics.

hash.name: SPIN Database (Searchable Physics Information Notices)
hash.title: SPIN Database (Searchable Physics Information Notices)
hash.databasedescription: Provides indexing and abstracting of major American and Russian physics and astronomy journals. SPIN contains the abstracts of over 80 scientific journals published by the American Institute of Physics and its Member Societies since 1975, as well as selected articles from other scientific journals, totaling close to 1 million articles.

hash.name: The SAO/NASA Astrophysics Data System
hash.title: The SAO/NASA Astrophysics Data System
hash.databasedescription: The SAO/NASA Astrophysics Data System (ADS) is a Digital Library portal for researchers in Astronomy and Physics, operated by the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory (SAO) under a NASA grant. The ADS maintains three bibliographic databases containing more than 9.1 million records: Astronomy and Astrophysics, Physics, and arXiv e-prints.

hash.name: Antarctic Bibliography
hash.title: Antarctic Bibliography
hash.databasedescription: The Antarctic Bibliography covers all disciplines related to the region including biological and geological sciences, medical sciences, meteorology, oceanography, atmospheric and terrestrial physics, expeditions, logistics equipment and supplies, and tourism. The Antarctic Bibliography is produced with support from the National Science Foundation with contributions from the Scott Polar Research Institute, University of Cambridge.

hash.name: International Polar Year Publications Database

meta.more-info: The IPYPD is part of the IPY Data and Information Service (IPYDIS). The IPYPD has been created by the Arctic Science and Technology Information System (ASTIS), the Cold Regions Bibliography Project (CRBP), the Scott Polar Research Institute (SPRI) Library, the Discovery and Access of Historic Literature of the IPYs (DAHLI) project and National Information Services Corporation (NISC).

hash.title: International Polar Year Publications Database
hash.databasedescription:
The International Polar Year Publications Database (IPYPD) will attempt to identify and describe all publications that result from, or that are about, the International Polar Year (IPY) 2007-2008 and the three previous IPYs.
The IPYPD is part of the IPY Data and Information Service (IPYDIS). The IPYPD has been created by the Arctic Science and Technology Information System (ASTIS), the Cold Regions Bibliography Project (CRBP), the Scott Polar Research Institute (SPRI) Library, the Discovery and Access of Historic Literature of the IPYs (DAHLI) project and National Information Services Corporation (NISC).

hash.name: Africa Development Indicators
hash.title: Africa Development Indicators
hash.databasedescription: Africa Development Indicators (ADI) provides a detailed collection of development data on Africa.

hash.name: Chatham House Online Archive
hash.title: Chatham House Online Archive
hash.databasedescription: Includes research, publications, speeches and archives of the international affairs think tank, The Royal Institute of International Affairs, Chatham House, London.

hash.name: China : Culture and Society
hash.title: China : Culture and Society
hash.databasedescription: Includes pamphlets from Cornell University Library's Charles W. Wason Collection on East Asia from 1750-1929.

hash.name: Election Ephemera Collections
hash.title: Election Ephemera Collections
hash.databasedescription: Contains election related material to date from countries of the former Soviet Union. Includes primary source material from both presidential and parliamentary elections, such as party programs, propaganda material, collection of special editions of newspapers and literature produced by political parties or candidates.

hash.name: FirstGov

meta.more-info: To find US Federal information that has been officially submitted to the US Government Printing Office, use GPO Access (1994-present), OCLC GPO (1976-present), or the Monthly Catalog of United States Government Publications - GOV DOC US1 GP C17 (1941-present: latest 5 years at UA Rutherford North Flr 1 Indexes, earlier years in UA Rutherford North Flr 2 Reference Auxiliary).

hash.title: FirstGov
hash.databasedescription:
Search U.S. federal and state government web sites. Include keywords such as "publications" or "reports" in your search. Scroll down to find links to the Executive, Legislative, and Judicial branches of the federal government.
To find US Federal information that has been officially submitted to the US Government Printing Office, use GPO Access (1994-present), OCLC GPO (1976-present), or the Monthly Catalog of United States Government Publications - GOV DOC US1 GP C17 (1941-present: latest 5 years at UA Rutherford North Flr 1 Indexes, earlier years in UA Rutherford North Flr 2 Reference Auxiliary).

hash.name: Foreign Office Files for India, Pakistan and Afghanistan
hash.title: Foreign Office Files for India, Pakistan and Afghanistan
hash.databasedescription:
British Foreign Office Files dealing with India, Pakistan, and Afghanistan.


Includes:




  • Section I: Independence, Partition and the Nehru Era, 1947-64
  • Section II: South Asian Conflicts and Independence for Bangladesh, 1965-71
  • Section III: Afghanistan and the Cold War, Emergency Rule in India, and the Resumption of Civilian Rule in Pakistan, 1972-80

hash.name: Government of Alberta News Releases
hash.title: Government of Alberta News Releases
hash.databasedescription: Provides access to different types of news releases issued by former and current agencies of the Government of Alberta. Includes news releases, information bulletins, emergency public warnings, orders in council, photo releases, public service announcements, premier's speeches, and travellers' advisories, some back to 1995.

hash.name: Index to Federal Royal Commissions
hash.title: Index to Federal Royal Commissions
hash.databasedescription: This index provides bibliographic access to materials associated with more than 200 federal Royal Commissions that have taken place since Confederation. There are approximately 7000 items in the index that includes commission reports, briefs, submissions, evidence, and other documents. Users can search for records of interest by entering keywords, the name of the commission, the chairperson, the commissioner and other access points in either the basic or the advanced search screen.

hash.name: International Encyclopedia of the Social & Behavioral Sciences (Second Edition)
hash.title: International Encyclopedia of the Social & Behavioral Sciences (Second Edition)
hash.databasedescription: Covers all fields of the social and behavioral sciences.

hash.name: International Relations and Security Network ISN

meta.more-info: It includes grey literature of all types (daily briefings, a monthly summary, primary source material, books, and a number of journals) primarily in English language, from institutes, universities, and agencies around the world, as well as case studies and hundreds of e-learning courses. It provides extensive coverage for research in Russian and East European studies.

hash.title: International Relations and Security Network ISN
hash.databasedescription:
ISN, based at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich (ETHZ), is a database of full-text materials on international relations, area studies, international business, security and military studies, comparative studies, and human rights.
It includes grey literature of all types (daily briefings, a monthly summary, primary source material, books, and a number of journals) primarily in English language, from institutes, universities, and agencies around the world, as well as case studies and hundreds of e-learning courses. It provides extensive coverage for research in Russian and East European studies.

hash.name: Official Document System of the United Nations

meta.more-info:
The Dag Hammarskjöld Library is in the process of digitizing parliamentary documents published before 1993

The official record version of older United Nations resolutions and decisions adopted by the General Assembly, the Security Council, the Economic and Social Council and the Trusteeship Council from 1946 onwards are stored separately on ODS in the “Resolutions” database, accessible only from the advanced search screen

The ODS does not contain press releases (posted at http://www.un.org/News/Press/full.htm), UN sales publications (search in the Library Catalogue), the United Nations Treaty Series (use the United Nations Treaty Collection) or information brochures issued by the Department of Public Information.

For help finding United Nations documents, please contact the Rutherford Library Reference desk (contact information below).
- See also the University of Alberta Libraries Guide to United Nations Documents.

hash.title: Official Document System of the United Nations
hash.databasedescription:
The The Official Document System of the United Nations (ODS) comprises the full text of United Nations parliamentary documents (including resolutions and decisions) issued at United Nations Headquarters in New York and the United Nations Office in Geneva since 1993 as well as at the United Nations Office in Vienna since 1997. The number of duty stations covered by the ODS is expanding as the regional commissions have started to load documents.
The Dag Hammarskjöld Library is in the process of digitizing parliamentary documents published before 1993

The official record version of older United Nations resolutions and decisions adopted by the General Assembly, the Security Council, the Economic and Social Council and the Trusteeship Council from 1946 onwards are stored separately on ODS in the “Resolutions” database, accessible only from the advanced search screen

The ODS does not contain press releases (posted at http://www.un.org/News/Press/full.htm), UN sales publications (search in the Library Catalogue), the United Nations Treaty Series (use the United Nations Treaty Collection) or information brochures issued by the Department of Public Information.

For help finding United Nations documents, please contact the Rutherford Library Reference desk (contact information below).
- See also the University of Alberta Libraries Guide to United Nations Documents.

hash.name: Peace Research Abstracts
hash.title: Peace Research Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to peace research, including conflict resolution, international affairs, peace psychology, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: Political Science Complete
hash.title: Political Science Complete
hash.databasedescription: Indexes and abstracts journals in Political Science and povides full-text of select journals. Also includes full-text of select reference books, monographs, and conference papers.

hash.name: Slavery, Abolition and Social Justice,
hash.title: Slavery, Abolition and Social Justice,
hash.databasedescription: Brings together documents and collections covering the time period 1490 to 2007 from libraries and archives across the Atlantic world. Topics covered include the varieties of slavery, the legacy of slavery, the social justice perspective and the continued existence of slavery today.

hash.name: Soviet Samizdat Periodicals
hash.title: Soviet Samizdat Periodicals
hash.databasedescription: The Database of Soviet Samizdat Periodicals covers approximately 300 titles of uncensored periodical editions from the Soviet Union, 1956-1986. It includes notes about samizdat and dissidence and extensive bibliographies, as well as information about archival holdings.

hash.name: State Papers Online

meta.more-info: State Papers Online offers original historical materials across the widest range of government concern, from high level international politics and diplomacy to the charges against a steward for poisoning a dozen or more people. The correspondence, reports, memoranda, and parliamentary drafts from ambassadors, civil servants and provincial administrators, present a full picture of Tudor and Stuart Britain.

hash.title: State Papers Online
hash.databasedescription:
State Papers Online, 1509-1714, contains more than 3 million pages of 16th- and 17th-century British government documents.
State Papers Online offers original historical materials across the widest range of government concern, from high level international politics and diplomacy to the charges against a steward for poisoning a dozen or more people. The correspondence, reports, memoranda, and parliamentary drafts from ambassadors, civil servants and provincial administrators, present a full picture of Tudor and Stuart Britain.

hash.name: Testaments to the Holocaust
hash.title: Testaments to the Holocaust
hash.databasedescription: Collection of eyewitness accounts from the World's oldest Holocaust museum, founded by Alfred Wiener as the "Jewish Central Information Office" in 1939. The collection offers fully searchable personal accounts of life in Nazi Germany, along with photographs, propaganda materials such as school text books, limited circulation publications and rare serials.

hash.name: The Civil War

meta.more-info: Drawn from the Sabin collection and other Gale sources, the archive provides access to a wide variety of documents: personal narratives and memoirs, pamphlets and political speeches, sermons and songs, regimental histories and photograph albums, legal treatises and children's books.

hash.title: The Civil War
hash.databasedescription:
The collection examines various aspects of the America civil war; its battles and campaigns, its political and religious aspects, the experiences of its leaders and common soldiers, the home front and the military campground, from its causes to its consequences.
Drawn from the Sabin collection and other Gale sources, the archive provides access to a wide variety of documents: personal narratives and memoirs, pamphlets and political speeches, sermons and songs, regimental histories and photograph albums, legal treatises and children's books.

hash.name: The Left Index
hash.title: The Left Index
hash.databasedescription: Left Index indexes the literature of the left, with an emphasis on political, economic, social and culturally engaged scholarship inside and outside academia. Other topics covered include the labor movement, ecology & environment, race & ethnicity, social & cultural theory, sociology, art & aesthetics, philosophy, history, education, law and globalization.

hash.name: The Nixon Years, 1969-1974
hash.title: The Nixon Years, 1969-1974
hash.databasedescription: This project provides complete FCO 7 and FCO 82 files from The National Archives, Kew, for the entire period of the Nixon administration, 1969-1974. Top level Anglo-American discussions and briefing papers dominate this project. There is also a wealth of material on social conditions, domestic reforms, trade, culture and the environment.

hash.name: French Pamphlets
hash.title: French Pamphlets
hash.databasedescription: This is a descriptive database of French pamphlet collections held by libraries throughout the world. The project will focus on pamphlets from 1500-1800, covering the French Wars of Religion (1562-96) through the French Revolution (1789-1799).

hash.name: Child Abuse and Neglect Digital Library
hash.title: Child Abuse and Neglect Digital Library
hash.databasedescription: The canDL is a database of citations of works on child abuse and neglect, an ongoing project of the College of Human Ecology at Cornell University. It is created and maintained using RefWorks and is shared through RefShare. The database can be searched and records imported into UA RefWorks accounts, where the UA Get-It link will connect to our local print and online resources.

hash.name: Counseling and Therapy in Video
hash.title: Counseling and Therapy in Video
hash.databasedescription: Online collection of videos for the study of counseling, social work, psychotherapy, psychology, and psychiatric counseling.

hash.name: Hope-Lit Database

meta.more-info: Materials listed in the database are contained in the Jack Chesney Hope Library at the Hope Foundation of Alberta, and must be accessed in person at the Hope Foundation of Alberta, 11032 89 Avenue. 780-492-1222.

hash.title: Hope-Lit Database
hash.databasedescription:
This database cites over 2500 English-language articles and books specific to hope. The database is intended to be as comprehensive as possible and to support hope research and practice around the world. The database is jointly support by the Faculty of Education at the University of Alberta and the Hope Foundation of Alberta, a research and service institute affiliated with the University of Alberta.
Materials listed in the database are contained in the Jack Chesney Hope Library at the Hope Foundation of Alberta, and must be accessed in person at the Hope Foundation of Alberta, 11032 89 Avenue. 780-492-1222.

hash.name: Women's Health Matters Resource Database
hash.title: Women's Health Matters Resource Database
hash.databasedescription: Contains descriptions of books and periodicals, audiovisual and multimedia materials and websites related to women's health. It includes women's health resources in English, French and other languages. The information has a focus on Ontario and the rest of Canada, but this collection also includes information from around the world.

hash.name: Bibliomap
hash.title: Bibliomap
hash.databasedescription: EPPI-Centre’s database of health promotion research.

hash.name: European Health for All database
hash.title: European Health for All database
hash.databasedescription: Provides a wide range of basic health statistics for the 51 Member States of the WHO European Region. It was developed to support the monitoring of health trends in the Region. The database is a helpful tool for international comparison and for assessing the health situation and trends in any European country in an international context.

hash.name: Asia-Studies Humanities
hash.title: Asia-Studies Humanities
hash.databasedescription: Asia-Studies Humanities database is a companion to Asia-Studies Full-text Online database, and covers journals and working papers on Asian arts and humanities.

hash.name: Bible in English (990-1970)
hash.title: Bible in English (990-1970)
hash.databasedescription:
The Bible in English contains twenty-one versions of the Bible,
including thirteen complete Bibles and full New Testaments in five other
versions. Particular attention has been given to the Renaissance period. Texts
from the Protestant, Roman Catholic and non-conformist traditions are
represented.

hash.name: Digital Library of Classic Protestant Texts
hash.title: Digital Library of Classic Protestant Texts
hash.databasedescription: Contains seminal works from the Reformation and post-Reformation eras. With new content uploads occurring on a regular basis, the database offers a constantly growing collection of theological writings, biblical commentaries, confessional documents, and polemical treatises written by more than 300 Protestant authors.

hash.name: Encyclopaedia Judaica
hash.title: Encyclopaedia Judaica
hash.databasedescription: Provides an overview of Jewish life and knowledge from the Second Temple period to the contemporary State of Israel, from Rabbinic to modern Yiddish literature, from Kabbalah to "Americana" and from Zionism to the contribution of Jews to world cultures.

hash.name: Encyclopaedia of Islam
hash.title: Encyclopaedia of Islam
hash.databasedescription: The Encyclopaedia of Islam Online gives access to the print version of the English edition of the Encylopedia. New data will be added to the online edition as it becomes available in the print edition.

hash.name: King James Bible
hash.title: King James Bible
hash.databasedescription:
The King James Bible is now searchable as part of the Bible in
English, which contains twenty-one versions of the Bible, including thirteen
complete Bibles and full New Testaments in five other versions. Particular
attention has been given to the Renaissance period. Texts from the Protestant,
Roman Catholic and non-conformist traditions are represented.

hash.name: Old Testament Abstracts Online
hash.title: Old Testament Abstracts Online
hash.databasedescription: Old Testament Abstracts Online is a product of a partnership between ATLA and the Catholic Biblical Association. Indexes and abstracts journal articles, monographs, multi-author works, and software related to Old Testament studies. All abstracts are in English, regardless of the language of the original work. Topics covered include antiquities, archaeology, biblical theology, philology and much more. Coverage in the database dates back to 1978.

hash.name: Online Bibliography Theology and Peace
hash.title: Online Bibliography Theology and Peace
hash.databasedescription: Indexes literature related to peace ethics. While emphasis is on theology, relevant literature from philosophy, political science, peace and conflict research, international law and history is also taken into account.

hash.name: RAMBI
hash.title: RAMBI
hash.databasedescription: Index to scholarly articles in Jewish Studies. Searchable in English and Hebrew.

hash.name: Richardson's Index to Periodical Articles in Religion (1890-1899)
hash.title: Richardson's Index to Periodical Articles in Religion (1890-1899)
hash.databasedescription: Covers 600 periodicals and encyclopedia. The heading definitions often references encyclopedia articles for continued research.

hash.name: Catholic Periodical and Literature Index
hash.title: Catholic Periodical and Literature Index
hash.databasedescription: This database is the product of a partnership between the ATLA and the Catholic Library Association. The database includes indexed citations to articles published in Roman Catholic periodicals, papal documents, church promulgations, and ebooks about the Catholic faith that are authored by Catholics and/or produced by Catholic publishers.

hash.name: Church Missionary Society Periodicals
hash.title: Church Missionary Society Periodicals
hash.databasedescription: Includes publications from the Church Missionary Society and the latterly integrated South American Missionary Society. Documents missionary work from the 19th to the 21st century.

hash.name: New Testament Abstracts Online
hash.title: New Testament Abstracts Online
hash.databasedescription: New Testament Abstracts Online is a product of a partnership between ATLA and the Weston Jesuit School of Theology. It covers the New Testament and its historical milieu. Article coverage dates back to 1985.

hash.name: National Climate Data and Information Archive
hash.title: National Climate Data and Information Archive
hash.databasedescription: The National Climate Data and Information Archive, operated and maintained by Environment Canada, contains official climate and weather observations for Canada.

hash.name: Natural product updates
hash.title: Natural product updates
hash.databasedescription: Provides graphical abstracts of new developments in natural product chemistry, selected from dozens of key primary journals.

hash.name: OpenDOAR: The Directory of Open Access Repositories
hash.title: OpenDOAR: The Directory of Open Access Repositories
hash.databasedescription: OpenDOAR is an authoritative directory of academic open access repositories.

hash.name: WAVES: the catalogue of the libraries of Fisheries and Oceans Canada
hash.title: WAVES: the catalogue of the libraries of Fisheries and Oceans Canada
hash.databasedescription: Library catalogue for all locations of all Fisheries and Oceans Canada.

hash.name: Worldcat.org
hash.title: Worldcat.org
hash.databasedescription: Lists for items which are owned by libraries around the world including the University of Alberta Library System. Each record contains library holdings. Searching is by author, title, or subject. WorldCat indexes titles of books, journals, etc.but does not index book chapters, individual articles, stories in journals, magazines,or newspapers. Use this database in the same way you would use the NEOS Libraries' Catalogue to search for items.This database is updated daily.

hash.name: Composite Index for CRC Handbooks
hash.title: Composite Index for CRC Handbooks
hash.databasedescription: Located in the Science and Technology Library: contains a combined index to the 317 CRC handbooks on biomedicine and science and technology including biology, chemistry, computer science, engineering, mathematics, and physics.

hash.name: FindArticles.com
hash.title: FindArticles.com
hash.databasedescription: FindArticles.com contains the fulltext of more than 300 magazines and journals from a variety of disciplines.

hash.name: e-CPS (interface en français)
hash.title: e-CPS (interface en français)
hash.databasedescription: Compendium des produits et spécialités pharmaceutiques, version en ligne (Association des pharmaciens du Canada).

hash.name: NEI Clinical Studies Database [National Eye Institute]
hash.title: NEI Clinical Studies Database [National Eye Institute]
hash.databasedescription: Contains information on clinical studies, both ongoing and completed, that have been conducted and supported by the National Eye Institute (NEI) since 1970.

hash.name: Bibliografia narodowa

meta.more-info:
Provides access, through separate databases, to the following series of the Polish National Bibliography:

  • Bibliographies of Polish books (Bibliografie ksiazek polskich)
    • the 1st bibliography is the online equivalent of Przewodnik bibliograficzny, with coverage 1976 to the present
  • Bibliography of Polish periodicals (Bibliografie czasopism polskich)
  • Bibliography of foreign Polonica (Bibliografia poloników zagranicznych)
  • Bibliography of electronic documents (Bibliografia dokumentów elektronicznych)
  • Bibliography of articles in Polish periodicals (Bibliografia artykulów z czasopism polskich)

Every series has different chronological coverage, for example, Przewodnik bibliograficzny covers 1976 to the present. Most series are covered through more than one database.

hash.title: Bibliografia narodowa
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for detailed description below
Provides access, through separate databases, to the following series of the Polish National Bibliography:

  • Bibliographies of Polish books (Bibliografie ksiazek polskich)
    • the 1st bibliography is the online equivalent of Przewodnik bibliograficzny, with coverage 1976 to the present
  • Bibliography of Polish periodicals (Bibliografie czasopism polskich)
  • Bibliography of foreign Polonica (Bibliografia poloników zagranicznych)
  • Bibliography of electronic documents (Bibliografia dokumentów elektronicznych)
  • Bibliography of articles in Polish periodicals (Bibliografia artykulów z czasopism polskich)

Every series has different chronological coverage, for example, Przewodnik bibliograficzny covers 1976 to the present. Most series are covered through more than one database.

hash.name: Bibliografija Srbije
hash.title: Bibliografija Srbije
hash.databasedescription:
Provides access to the current national bibliography of Serbia from 2003 to the present. Includes the following series:



  • Monografske publikacije (Monographs)
  • Neknji~na građa (Non-book materials)
  • Serijske publikacije (Serials)
  • Članci i prilozi u serijskim publikacijama (Articles in serials)

hash.name: Biblioteka portala auditorium.ru
hash.title: Biblioteka portala auditorium.ru
hash.databasedescription: The Russian Ministry of Education's portal auditorium.ru provides full-text access to Russian monographic resources and reference material in PDF format.

hash.name: Current Digest of the Russian Press

meta.more-info: This Archive illuminates key events in the history, politics, and current affairs of the Soviet Union and, after its disintegration, of the Russian Federation and the independent Post-Soviet states. It is a valuable tool for gaining insight into the Soviet perspective during the Cold War era, a time when the government, culture, and peoples of the Soviet Union were almost totally inaccessible to the outside world.

hash.title: Current Digest of the Russian Press
hash.databasedescription:
The Current Digest of the (Post-) Soviet Press Digital Archive provides full-text coverage of selected Russian-language press materials translated into English. It includes the contents of the Current Digest of the Soviet Press (1949-1991) and the Current Digest of the Post-Soviet Press (1992 to the present).
This Archive illuminates key events in the history, politics, and current affairs of the Soviet Union and, after its disintegration, of the Russian Federation and the independent Post-Soviet states. It is a valuable tool for gaining insight into the Soviet perspective during the Cold War era, a time when the government, culture, and peoples of the Soviet Union were almost totally inaccessible to the outside world.

hash.name: Czech National Bibliography

meta.more-info:
The Czech National Bibliography provides access to bibliographic information concerning publications issued in the Czech Republic and to foreign Bohemica. A separate database is available for every series of the Bibliography:
  • Articles (Clánky v ?eských novinách, casopisech a sbornících)
  • Czech Imprints: Books (Ceské knihy)
  • Foreign Bohemica (Zahranicní bohemika)
  • Special Materials (Speciální dokumenty)
  • Dissertations and Abstracts (Disertace a autoreferáty)
  • Periodicals (Periodika vydaná na území CR)

hash.title: Czech National Bibliography
hash.databasedescription:
The Czech National Bibliography provides access to bibliographic information concerning publications issued in the Czech Republic and to foreign Bohemica. A separate database is available for every series of the Bibliography:
Articles (Clánky v èeských novinách, èasopisech a sbornících)
Czech Imprints: Books (Ceské knihy)
Foreign Bohemica (Zahranièní bohemika)
The Czech National Bibliography provides access to bibliographic information concerning publications issued in the Czech Republic and to foreign Bohemica. A separate database is available for every series of the Bibliography:
  • Articles (Clánky v ?eských novinách, casopisech a sbornících)
  • Czech Imprints: Books (Ceské knihy)
  • Foreign Bohemica (Zahranicní bohemika)
  • Special Materials (Speciální dokumenty)
  • Dissertations and Abstracts (Disertace a autoreferáty)
  • Periodicals (Periodika vydaná na území CR)

hash.name: Ekspresinformation About the Latest Publications Issued in Lithuania
hash.title: Ekspresinformation About the Latest Publications Issued in Lithuania
hash.databasedescription: A weekly bulletin issued by the Centre of the Bibliography and Book Science. It is prepared using the records of the National Bibliographic Data Bank (NBDB), compiled on the basis of legal deposit. „Ekspresinformacija…“ contains the basic bibliographic data. Selected records also include a short abstract. Covers 2004 to the present.

hash.name: Estonian National Bibliography
hash.title: Estonian National Bibliography
hash.databasedescription: The Estonian National Bibliography Database ERB contains both retrospective and current national bibliography data and is divided into the following national bibliography collections: books, periodicals, maps, sheet music, videorecordings, sound recordings, graphic material, ephemera, e-resources and Estonica. Coverage: books from 1525, newspapers from 1675, journals from 1700, sheet music from 1918, maps from 1802, sound recordings from 1908, and videorecordings from 1988.

hash.name: Hrvatske Bibliografije
hash.title: Hrvatske Bibliografije
hash.databasedescription:
Provides access to the individual issues of the following series of the Croatian national bibliography:




  • Niz A, Knjige (Books)
  • Niz B, Prilozi u casopisima i zbornicima (Articles in journals and proceedings)
  • Niz C, Serijske publikacije (Serials)
  • Knjige u tisku (Forthcoming books)



The beginning date of coverage varies among the series, ranging from 1998-2002 to the present.

hash.name: Hungarian National Bibliography
hash.title: Hungarian National Bibliography
hash.databasedescription:
The Hungarian National Bibliography online (Magyar nemzeti bibliográfia, MNB WWW) includes five series:




  • Könyvek (Books)
  • Új periodikumok (New periodicals)
  • Kartográfiai dokumentumok (Cartographic materials)
  • Zeneművek: Kották (Print music)
  • Zeneművek: Hangfelvételek (Music recordings)


Access is available within a series to every issue separately. Coverage: 2002 to the present.

hash.name: Natsional'na biblioteka Ukrainy imeni V. I. Vernads'koho

meta.more-info: This unique collection includes books, magazines, serials, maps, music, visual materials, manuscripts, printed books, newspapers, and multimedia. The library has the most complete collection in the country of Slavic literature and manuscripts, as well as archives and book collections of prominent figures of Ukrainian and world science and culture. Collections include the Archive of the Presidents of Ukraine, and the Archival Collection of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine.

hash.title: Natsional'na biblioteka Ukrainy imeni V. I. Vernads'koho
hash.databasedescription:
The Vernadsky Library is the largest Library in Ukraine, and the main scientific and academic information center in the country. It was founded on August 2nd (15th), 1918 as the National State Library of Ukraine. In 1988 it was named for Vernadsky. The collection currently holds about 15 million items (2013)
This unique collection includes books, magazines, serials, maps, music, visual materials, manuscripts, printed books, newspapers, and multimedia. The library has the most complete collection in the country of Slavic literature and manuscripts, as well as archives and book collections of prominent figures of Ukrainian and world science and culture. Collections include the Archive of the Presidents of Ukraine, and the Archival Collection of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine.

hash.name: Natsional'na bibliohrafiia Ukrainy. Litopys avtoreferativ dysertatsii
hash.title: Natsional'na bibliohrafiia Ukrainy. Litopys avtoreferativ dysertatsii
hash.databasedescription: This is the online version of the Ukrainian national bibliography's series that covers dissertations defended in Ukraine. One of the requirements for obtaining a PhD in Ukraine is to publish summaries or abstracts, "avtoreferati" in Ukrainian, based on the chapters of the submitted dissertation. This bibliography covers all such publications from 2001 to the present.

hash.name: Natsional'na bibliohrafiia Ukrainy. Litopys hazetnykh statei
hash.title: Natsional'na bibliohrafiia Ukrainy. Litopys hazetnykh statei
hash.databasedescription: This is the online version of the Ukrainian national bibliography's series that covers articles published in newspapers and magazines. It serves as an interdisciplinary index of these publications. Online coverage is available from 2002 to the present.

hash.name: Natsional'na bibliohrafiia Ukrainy. Litopys knyh
hash.title: Natsional'na bibliohrafiia Ukrainy. Litopys knyh
hash.databasedescription: This is the online version of the Ukrainian national bibliography's series that covers books. Online coverage is available from 2002 to the present.

hash.name: Natsional'na bibliohrafiia Ukrainy. Litopys zhurnal'nykh statei
hash.title: Natsional'na bibliohrafiia Ukrainy. Litopys zhurnal'nykh statei
hash.databasedescription: This is the online version of the Ukrainian national bibliography's series that covers journal articles. It serves as an interdisciplinary index of these publications. Online coverage is available from 2002 to the present.

hash.name: New Estonian Books
hash.title: New Estonian Books
hash.databasedescription: Since 1999, the �New Estonian Books� is published only in electronic format. The index contains Estonian literature published in Estonia and other books and brochures using the Latin alphabet. The index does not contain information on publications in the Russian language (Cyrillic alphabet).

hash.name: Russian National Bibliography

meta.more-info:
The Russian National Bibliography provides access in a database format to bibliographic information published in the following Russian bibliographies:

  • Knizhnaia letopis' (Bibliography of Russian book publications)
  • Letopis' gazetnykh statei (Index to 90 Russian newspapers)
  • Letopis' zhurnal'nykh statei (Index to 3,500 Russian periodicals, including journals, magazines, and other serial publications)
  • Letopis' avtoreferatov dissertatsii (Index to over 90,000 Russian dissertation abstracts)
  • Letopis' retsenzii (Index to Russian book reviews of both Russian and foreign books)
  • Letopis' izoizdanii (Bibliography of art albums, posters, art reproductions, prints, applied graphic art)
  • Notnaia letopis' (Index to Russian music-related publications, including musical and stage music works, folklore collections, school and methodological music publications and books)
  • Kartograficheskaia letopis' (Bibliography of cartographic and map publications produced in Russia)

hash.title: Russian National Bibliography
hash.databasedescription:
See "more" for brief description about Russian National Bibliography

The Russian National Bibliography provides access in a database format to bibliographic information published in the following Russian bibliographies:

  • Knizhnaia letopis' (Bibliography of Russian book publications)
  • Letopis' gazetnykh statei (Index to 90 Russian newspapers)
  • Letopis' zhurnal'nykh statei (Index to 3,500 Russian periodicals, including journals, magazines, and other serial publications)
  • Letopis' avtoreferatov dissertatsii (Index to over 90,000 Russian dissertation abstracts)
  • Letopis' retsenzii (Index to Russian book reviews of both Russian and foreign books)
  • Letopis' izoizdanii (Bibliography of art albums, posters, art reproductions, prints, applied graphic art)
  • Notnaia letopis' (Index to Russian music-related publications, including musical and stage music works, folklore collections, school and methodological music publications and books)
  • Kartograficheskaia letopis' (Bibliography of cartographic and map publications produced in Russia)

hash.name: Slovari i entsiklopedii na Akademike
hash.title: Slovari i entsiklopedii na Akademike
hash.databasedescription: Free Russian encyclopaedias and dictionaries, including Tolkovyi slovar' Dalia and Entsiklopedicheskii slovar' Brokgauza i Efrona.

hash.name: Slovenska Bibliografija
hash.title: Slovenska Bibliografija
hash.databasedescription: The Slovenian National Bibliography provides access to bibliographic information concerning books, journals, newspapers, articles, maps, sheetmusic, images, audio, and online resources issued in Slovenia since 1991.

hash.name: Social Sciences & Humanities Journals from Russia (UDB-EDU)

meta.more-info: It is comprised of all 31 journals of the Russian Academy of Sciences ranging from archeology to linguistics, as well as popular literary editions, and independent scholarly publications. New titles are added on a regular basis. This Universal Database grows retroactively. Full-text and full-image content of print editions is reproduced with original pagination.

hash.title: Social Sciences & Humanities Journals from Russia (UDB-EDU)
hash.databasedescription:
The goal of this database is to provide researchers with a unique opportunity to cross-search the contents of major Russian periodicals on social sciences and humanities.
It is comprised of all 31 journals of the Russian Academy of Sciences ranging from archeology to linguistics, as well as popular literary editions, and independent scholarly publications. New titles are added on a regular basis. This Universal Database grows retroactively. Full-text and full-image content of print editions is reproduced with original pagination.

hash.name: Virtual Library Eastern Europe (VifaOst: Virtuelle Fachbibliothek Osteuropa)
hash.title: Virtual Library Eastern Europe (VifaOst: Virtuelle Fachbibliothek Osteuropa)

hash.name: Zhurnal'nyi zal
hash.title: Zhurnal'nyi zal
hash.databasedescription: A gateway to Russian online literary journals. Includes full text of current and back issues of many major Russian periodicals, such as Novyi mir, Oktiabr', Neva, Zvezda, and others. Also sponsors publication of original projects.

hash.name: Public Administration Abstracts
hash.title: Public Administration Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to public administration, including public administration research, public administration theory, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: Social Care Online
hash.title: Social Care Online
hash.databasedescription: UK's most complete range of information and research on all aspects of social care and social work including research briefings, reports, government documents, journal articles, directories, good practice, circulation, legislation, policy documents, inspection reports, standards, training materials. Overlaps somewhat with Social Services Abstracts and Social Work Abstracts databases but indexes many unique titles especially relating to the UK.

hash.name: Social Theory
hash.title: Social Theory
hash.databasedescription: Social Theory offers an extensive selection of documents that explore the complexities and interpret the nature of social behavior and organization.

hash.name: Violence and Abuse Abstracts
hash.title: Violence and Abuse Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to violence and abuse, including family violence, sexual assault, emotional abuse, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: Blackwell Encyclopedia of Sociology Online
hash.title: Blackwell Encyclopedia of Sociology Online
hash.databasedescription: The Blackwell Encyclopedia of Sociology provides comprehensive coverage of sociology and related disciplines.

hash.name: Canadian Minority Media Database

meta.more-info: The Minority Media Database is comprised of two open access databases: the Canadian Minority Media Index (CMMI) and the Minority Media Scholarly Bibliography (MMSB).

hash.title: Canadian Minority Media Database
hash.databasedescription:
Minority media are a vital component of our media ecosystem and contribute greatly to our cultural diversity and heritage. However they often go unnoticed as they target specific ethnic groups and are overshadowed by majority media, whether national or transnational. The purpose of the Minority Media Database is to render minority media visible both in their operations and as the subjects of scholarly research.
The Minority Media Database is comprised of two open access databases: the Canadian Minority Media Index (CMMI) and the Minority Media Scholarly Bibliography (MMSB).

hash.name: China: Trade, Politics and Culture, 1793-1980
hash.title: China: Trade, Politics and Culture, 1793-1980
hash.databasedescription: Contains English language primary source material relating to Modern China and the West from the period 1793 to 1980. Also includes over 400 colour paintings, maps and drawings by English and Chinese artists, as well as photographs, sketches and ephemeral items.

hash.name: Chinese Cultural Revolution Database
hash.title: Chinese Cultural Revolution Database
hash.databasedescription: Contains primary sources on the Cultural Revolution in China.

hash.name: Chinese Pamphlets: Political communication and mass education in the early period of the People's Republic of China
hash.title: Chinese Pamphlets: Political communication and mass education in the early period of the People's Republic of China
hash.databasedescription: Includes mass education materials published in Hong Kong and in Mainland China, particularly Shanghai, in the years 1947-1954. These cartoon books, pamphlets, postcards and magazines, on topics such as foreign threats to Chinese security, Chinese relations with the Soviet Union, industrial and agricultural production, and marriage reform, were produced by both Kuomintang (Nationalist) and Gongchantang (Communist) supporters.

hash.name: Everyday Life & Women in America

meta.more-info: The collection is especially rich in conduct of life and domestic management literature, offering vivid insights into the daily lives of women and men, as well as emphasizing contrasts in regional, urban and rural cultures.

hash.title: Everyday Life & Women in America
hash.databasedescription:
Contains primary source material from the Sallie Bingham Center for Women’s History, Duke University and The New York Public Library. Includes thousands of fully searchable images (alongside transcriptions) of monographs, pamphlets, periodicals and broadsides addressing 19th and early 20th century political, social and gender issues, religion, race, education, employment, marriage, sexuality, home and family life, health, and pastimes.
The collection is especially rich in conduct of life and domestic management literature, offering vivid insights into the daily lives of women and men, as well as emphasizing contrasts in regional, urban and rural cultures.

hash.name: Race Relations Abstracts
hash.title: Race Relations Abstracts
hash.databasedescription: Includes bibliographic records covering essential areas related to race relations, including ethnic studies, discrimination, immigration studies, and other areas of key relevance to the discipline.

hash.name: Base De Datos De Libros Editados En España
hash.title: Base De Datos De Libros Editados En España
hash.databasedescription: This database contains the bibliographic references of all the books published in Spain since 1972. It contains in-print and out-of-print titles published in Spanish, Catalan, Gallego and Euskera. One can search by ISBN, author, title, subject, publisher, year, series, and place of publication.

hash.name: Basque Database
hash.title: Basque Database
